hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel was awesome. Everything was great and my wife and I are still talking about it months later. One of the things we always think of is the French toast. It was light and airy and just the best. A question for the hotel. What kind of bread was used for the French toast? I have been trying to recreate my experience in the US now that our big trip is over to no avail. Thank you so much,A happy customer

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is ideally located for the Senso-ji temple. Also right next to the Asakusa underground and is the end of the Ginza Line.Rooms were good and secure.Breakfast was good and they had stopped the buffet due to the Covid 19 virus and served the food separately, French toast and eggs benedict were both good.Staff could not have been more helpful and professional.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: An extremely comfortable hotel with easy access to the subway and the Senso-Ji complex. The hotel is a perfect base from which to explore the whole of Tokyo.The area is tranquil by comparison to other districts and there’s a fabulous selection of restaurants and shops close by.The staff are extremely helpful and courteous.Views from the top floor restaurant of the SkyTree and river are very pleasant.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were fortunate to spend our last two nights in Tokyo at the Gate Hotel Asakusa Kaminarimon and we were not disappointed! Our double room had luxuriously comfortable beds, the amenities were ample and impeccable customer service. The Gate Hotel in Asakusa is perfectly located to explore this historic part of Tokyo and close to two metro stations too. The breakfast is more than sufficient and the view from the balcony is stunning. We had a pleasant stay and would highly recommend this hotel for solo travellers and couples. Arigato!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location is great, close to Ginza line with elevator exit that helps us a lot for carrying luggages. Nearby we found many restaurants, drug stores and sightseeing spots. Skytree view is fantastic especially we can see from roof of hotel building. Receptionists provide quick and warm services upon my queries. Recommend!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I had originally planned to stay in one of the APA hotels in Ueno/Asakusa and decided to book The Gate after reading a review. I stayed for a night and was totally satisfied with the room and the location. 2 min walk to Sensoji temple and Asakusa station (Ginza line). Plenty of eateries nearby. Had a good night sleep and had the best shower. The only thing I didn't like was the lobby was on the top floor which was kinda weird. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Love this hotel in tourist but traditional area of tokyoGreat room in lower floor with huge balcony to relate to the people in the streetBalcony windows opens completely big suite for hanging out with familySupermarket downstairs and near subway to haneda airportI gladly return

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed at The Gate for 4 nights on our trip around Japan. We arrived direct from the airport earlier than the check in time however, our room was ready and we took advantage (after a 17hr journey). The staff were very accommodating and couldn't have been more helpful during our stay. The hotel is located a short distance from the Asakusa metro station, tourist office and Senso-ji temple (the oldest in Tokyo). Breakfast was varied (pasta, chips, french toast and traditional Japanese) and delicious and the views from the restaurant (and roof top bar) are pretty special. We loved it here.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Luxury hotel in the Asakusa area of Tokyo. Near important shrines. Friendly neighbourhood with lots of restaurants. Back streets are still a neighbourhood even in this big city. Easy introduction to Tokyo handy for the metro. Upside hotel with top floor restaurant for breakfast and rooftop bar open in the summer. We had what felt like a flatlet as the reception was on the top floor we were on the third. European and Japanese breakfasts. Can see Mount Fuji on a clear day from restaurant.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We just left Tokyo this morning. This is our 3rd visit to Tokyo. Second time stayed at this hotel. The location is great and strategic. It is very close to the tokyo metro exit and the tourist spot. There are small supermarket and japanese 药妆 just next to the hotel. The only concern is the lighting in the room is not bright enough.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Loved this hotel! The views from the 13th floor reception and rooftop bar were amazing. Could see the snow atop Mount Fuji! Excellent location. Walking distance to the temple and surrounding markets. So much to see and do! Will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location 5/5The hotel located opposite of kaminarimon.Rounded with shops,malls and restaurants, and have a supermarket at ground floor. just 2-3 min walk from asakusa station.Hotel services 5/5Very good services.I asked many question before book and the staff have a chsystal clear answer.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I really had a great time., will stay next time for sure!!Its crowded location but its very quiet in room.Its very convenient to go ,eat, and shop from here立地が大変便利です。つかず離れずのサービスも快適でした。次回もぜひ滞在しようと思っています。屋上からの眺めも素晴らしかったです。’

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It's placed at the right spot. Close to a metro station, close to some sightseeing spots. The service is good, the roof top bar is the place to be in the afternoon or night. Good-sized rooms. And above all, the staff is fabulous.
user_location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
user_name:
karanpandit
National Capital Territory of Delhi, India

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I’ve stayed at this hotel numerous times and it’s always a wonderful experience. The staff are extremely helpful and the rooms, breakfast and location are very good. Already planning the next stay at this great hotel

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had a wonderful 4 night stay at The Gate Hotel in Asakusa. The location was superb. Asakusa has a lovely authentic feel to it, thanks in large part to the beautiful nearby Shrine. The hotel is very close to a subway stop so it was easy to get to all the super-high-energy parts of Tokyo, and also nice to return to this quieter oasis at the end of each busy day. The staff was extremely helpful and we appreciated that many spoke excellent English. The hotel lounge and the roof top bar offer spectacular views of the Sky Tree and city and the umami-style popcorn in the bar is not to be missed. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed two nights in this hotel during typhoon Hagabis. Rooms are big and spacious with decent bathroom. The buffet breakfast was disappointing as not much selection. Friendly service at check in and located near shops and supermarkets. View from the lobby is impressive.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is a very nice one with a roof reception bar and restaurant. The location is excellent for daily visit of the neighborhood. The akasuka and Ginza line are few minutes walk from the hotel.Rooms were 24 SQM above average for Tokyo

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good hotel with bars and restaurant with a view. Very comfortable and, as its name suggests, close to the Kaminarimon Gate which leads to the Senso-ji temple. Popular tourist attraction with a variety of shops for souvenir hunters and hungry people. Hotel is also very close to Asakusa metro station, from where we got a direct train to Nikko for a day out. Great view of the Skytree from the top floor restaurant and the outside terrace bar. Many interesting restaurants nearby. We went to a tempura place one evening and an okonomiyaki cafe an another evening. The hotel restaurant was also nice for more cosmopolitan cuisine.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is a boutique Hotel in Asakusa , Tokyo . Nice decorated but small rooms. We had a room with a view the lower floors do not have views. The breakfast was nice and the lobby area has a great spectacular view.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: For most people the location of this hotel is what is attractive. It’s right in front of Asakusa. However it has so much more to offer. The top floor offers a great view of the night sky and Sky Tree. Several bars, one open to the public, and one reserved mainly for the guests of the hotel. The room was really nice (classy King) with a view of the Sky Tree. Everything was really clean, light switches are located on the night stands. The bathroom was spacious, and the tub and shower area had a window to the view of the sky tree which was really nice to see in the morning from the bath. Only thing we didn’t like was that self laundry is not available and had to be sent out to be done. Location and quality are spot on.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here with a friend for three nights during the Rugby World Cup and was delighted with our choice. Having spent time in Shinjuku and Roppongi, Asakusa was my favourite location in Tokyo as it's still fairly central but not quite as chaotic as Shinjuku or Shibuya.  The hotel is situated in a good location, close to the railway station and the main tourist sight (Sensoji) in the area. At first glance the hotel doesn't look much on the outside, but once you enter your opinion soon changes. You're initially greeted with a lovely smell as you enter and when you go to the reception on the top floor it's difficult not to be impressed by the view. The room itself was a reasonable size for Tokyo and the bed comfortable. The biggest plus though is the rooftop terrace where you can view cross the city towards Skytree. It was the perfect way to end a long day with a couple of drinks as you overlook the city. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Normally I don’t write reviews, but this hotel was really good. It’s a prime location with Nakamise and Senso-ji temple just across the street. The lobby and terrace have an amazing view of Tokyo sky tree and staff are very helpful. The restaurant food was delicious but pricey. Definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The amazingly helpful and courteous reception staff on 13th floor of The Gate Kaminarimon set the tone for a great stay in their modern and luxurious hotel. A haven in the business of Tokyo. The Gate is central and of easy access to Asakusa’s attractions and stations.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were booked into the Gate by our travel arranger. A Geat choice. The service and food were both outstanding. The breakfast is worth the price. Fresh squeezed orange juice and homemade marmalade. The Eggs Benedict quite good.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is a small boutique hotel in Asakusa. Very conveniently located minutes from Exit 2 on the Ginza line. We had our large bags shipped to the hotel 4 days before our arrival from Kyoto. On our arrival, our rooms were ready with our bags safely placed in our rooms. Although, we received a notice of ongoing room renovations and possible noise in the hotel, we were never bothered by noise. The room and beds were comfortable and very clean. The hotel breakfast is small with 3 main entrees to select from that is served to you, along with coffee, tea, and water. There is a small vegetable/pasta/bread/fruit bar, along with fresh squeezed orange juice to enjoy while waiting for your entree. The wait staff at breakfast were very nice, and the service on the roof-top was exceptional. On the next to the last day, I mistakenly left my wallet with my Japanese yen in the room. When I returned that evening, I could not locate the wallet even though the room had been impeccable cleaned. At check-out in the morning I mentioned my lost wallet to the front desk staff. By the time I reached home, I received a very apologetic email that my wallet had been located between cushions in the chaise, along with their apologies for not locating it before I left the hotel. I am happy to report that my wallet arrived in the mail a few days later with money, in tact. This is exceptional service in my opinion and for this reason I can recommend this hotel without reservations.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Fantastic hotel good location in the Ginza area close to metro. Rooms are very spacious and clean nice toiletries in bathroom. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful as were the restaurant staff. Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was my first time in Japan, so like many I was astonished by the photos of the hotel online. I expected space to be tight, and by my over-sized American standards, it was just that — both in the photos and in person. However, when my wife and I settled in, we realized that it was exactly everything we needed. We didn’t need a hotel room the size of a small apartment, we needed it to be functional and provide a great place to get sleep — and The Gate Hotel did both brilliantly. There was no wasted space, and the decor made it a perfect atmosphere for catching some shut eye after a long day of roaming Tokyo. The grounds of the hotel, from the lobby to the restaurant, were comfortable, relaxing, and had astonishing views of Tokyo including the Skytree Tower. Unfortunately, my wife and I didn’t go up to the terrace, but we really didn’t need to. But like the title of the review suggests, it was the staff who were the highlight. They were very kind, patient, and attentive. Honestly this is part of the charm of Japan in general, but being they were our first real interaction with the locals, it jumped out in ways that I have rarely experienced in the US. The front desk staff and the restaurant staff went above and beyond to accommodate us and help us, and also always greeted us with a smile. We never felt like a bother, even with our spotty-at-best attempts at Japanese. This kind of service alone is worth a premium.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Asakusa is a great area and a night visit to the temple is a must. This is very close to the Kaminarimon gate and is easy access from the Asaksua station on the flat. A very high quality place with excellent amenities. A wonderful view from the lobby on the 13th floor.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We always wanted t go to Japan and started here in Tokyo. Spotless well staffed and in a great location. The staff were always helpful and eager to please. Breakfast was a bit disappointing as little western food on offer. Great place to stay to see Tokyo near the metro and by the main sites.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed for a few nights at this hotel over an 18 day tour of Japan. Firstly the location of this hotel is perfect - close to the train station, underground subways, bar, shops, restaurants and the main temple tourist attraction in town. We found all of the staff to be very friendly and efficient. The check-in process was a breeze, the staff arranged a next day courier for our luggage to our next hotels effortlessly and their English was of a very good standard. We booked one of the more premium corner view rooms for the last night and wished we had booked this room for the previous nights we had stayed there - it was only £15 more expensive per night, but was a much bigger, brighter room with great views and a corner window letting in much more light than the slightly darker, boxier room we had before. It was nice to find vending machines situated on all of the floors, meaning you could grab a beer or a snack without having to travel to the 7-11. The supermarket next door was a really good place to get discounted sushi from around 5pm and all manner of other produce. We did go to the bar one night and although enjoying the views and the decor it was pretty much empty and a little soulless. However I would stay here again in a heartbeat - the air conditioning worked well, the rooms were always clean and the public areas (lobby, bar) were great to look at. All in all this hotel represents good value for money and a perfect base to explore Tokyo and beyond (we used this hotel as a departure point to Nikko which worked out very well for us). 4 and a half stars.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed there for 2 nights , had an early morning flight to Tokyo. The staffs are great in accommodating my family to an early checked in due to my wife's migraine . Staffs was always asking if she is ok and if there's anything else they can do for her. Location is great , its across the street from Asakusa Shrine and shopping center . Japanese people are very caring and helpful. I would recommend this Hotel anytime .

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here for four nights as our base in Tokyo. We had two rooms for our family of four. The booking process online was all very efficient and we reconfirmed shortly before our arrival. The welcome is friendly and efficient at reception and the rooms are comfortable and well-equipped, although the double room was a little small - tea and Nespresso capsules are provided, as well as bottled water and a decent range of toiletries and bathroom accessories are provided. You also get pyjamas and slippers. Air conditioning works pretty well. Breakfast is good and generous with a small range of about 5 cooked options and an accompanying buffet - service is good and quick. All the staff were always friendly and polite, and happy to help with all matters, e.g. arranging luggage forwarding.The rooftop bar has a great view of the skyline including the Skytree which is nearby. Hotel is in a good location in Asakusa with Sensoji temple virtually across the road and the Ginza line underground stop very close.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed here for two nights as we wanted to stay in another location other than the Shibuya area. I chose a room with a magnificent view of the Tokyo Skytree. Room was big (I chose the Classy room category) and clean.Location-wise, it's just a minute walk to the Senso-ji temple (I can even see it from my room), and loads of restaurants around. Since this location is not on the Yamanote train line, it might be a little challenge for first-timers in Tokyo. But visitors don't have to worry, it's easy enough to get here.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is our 4th stay in Asakusa and THE GATE HOTEL is our only and best choice !The location and food are great.We can travel easy through the subway with its great location nearby the station.The breakfast was also amazing with the Skytree view.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Asakusa is a an easy paced part of Tokyo with good transport links and a wide range of tourist shopping facilities, restaurants, izakayas and cultural sites. The Gate quietly and stylishly fits in. A few more fruit options on the breakfast menu would be welcome - but otherwise no complaints.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Located 2mn away from Senso-ji and Subway station with many restaurants and shops nearby .Great view from tbe rooftop terrace and the bar . Staff was very helful and friendly . Will definately go back next year

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were taking a long vacation to Japan, just the two of us trying to see as much of the country as possible. To start we arrived in Tokyo where we would spend 5 amazing nights in The Gate Hotel. When we arrived we were greeted warmly by the amazing staff at the front desk. They were extremely helpful and friendly with great English.We were shown to our room receiving help with our bags. On getting in and checking out the huge room and comfortable beds we took a long look out the window where we had a great view of the surrounding Tokyo. Not only this but we had a welcome note from the same friendly staff at reception including a little Irish for us as a very nice touch.We ate breakfast here one morning and found it incredibly tasty opting for some of there quirky options. We also had a night of sake tasting in the upstairs bar that included great information from the in house expert.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We started our holiday here. Well located - fairly accessible from the airport, easy access to the centre and some interesting local sites. Rooms were well equipped and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was a fair choice of local and western food and the freshly cooked menu options were very good. The hotel starts from the 14th floor and there is a nice bar at the top. All of the staff were very pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our tour guide (Gem Japan Tours, which I highly recommend) booked all our hotels for our 12-day trip. We felt that 2 nights in The Gate Hotel was perfect for us. The breakfast buffet is really very good: You get a choice of breakfast entree, which includes Western and Japanese choices (go for the French toast - it's incredible!) plus access to the buffet. We all enjoyed the fresh-squeezed orange juice produced by a young lady who manned the press at the buffet. We also loved the frame of honey comb that was a centerpiece of the buffet and a tasty spread for our croissants. Though the buffet is small in size, it is well stocked with Western and Japanese choices, and the quality is high. Of the several hotels and ryokan we stayed in during our tour, the Gate Hotel did the best job at breakfast, in my opinion.The Gate Hotel is in a great location. The rooms are small, but the beds are very comfortable, and there are amenities galore. It's also nice and quiet. The front desk staff broke our large yen notes down into smaller denominations for us. All the staff was friendly, attentive and very helpful.Overall, this is a nice hotel, and I would definitely book here again if I return to Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed there for two nights in May. The staff was very friendly and accommodating with competent English skills. Their location was convenient to all transit systems, our cab driver had a difficult time finding it but that was the cab drivers fault.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel makes the most of its location and views, by having reception and restaurant on the 14th floor with a roof terrace bar above. The staff were all friendly and attentive, and the rooms clean and comfortable. Asakusa is an exciting area and the hotel is less than 5 minutes from the Senso-Ji temple, metro, supermarket, Starbucks and too many fantastic restaurants and shops to list.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed for one night in a Hollywood Twin room. The hotel lobby has amazing views of the Asakusa neighborhood, Senso-ji Temple, and Tokyo Skytree, There are also two balconies on the floor above the lobby & restaurant that shouldn't be missed. Our room was large and nicely appointed. I liked the dark/rich colors used throughout the hotel. The breakfast selection was okay, the high points were the fresh squeezed orange juice and the made to order dishes. This hotel is a great choice in Tokyo!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Located in a great area in Asakusa close to the subway and Tokyo Skytree. Modern , clean, good size room. Breakfast ok with limited choice particularly of western options although restaurant a little small at busy times

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I understand that this is a smoking hotel, that means most rooms are allowed to be smoked in. I would still expect thought that the room would not smell like someone had just left having smoked in it. We arrived and after check in went to our room, which smelt horrible. It took an hour to be 'fumigated' so it then smelt like a cleaned room. Over the next 5 nights they could not offer us the same 'non smoking ' room, so each day we had to relocate to a new non smoking room. And we had to pay extra for the last two nights because supposedly it they were a better class room. A man at the reception who appeared to be a Manager was not overly pleasant about our predicament, and it seemed a chore for him to process our new rooms. We decided to dine at the restaurant one night. All the staff seemed like trainees. No basic waiter skills were evident,no offer of water, had to ask for wine list, not advised of the specials, incorrect cutlery laid down, lack of interpersonal skills, and the Manager seemed to just want to parade around the entrance, not monitoring his staff. The food was ok' but nothing special to want us to return. Overall our stay was good; but not a customer focussed experience.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Room clean, comfortable; quiet- staff were great- always very helpful Nice view from lounge. breakfast was excellent. Location near trains for both airports; close to museums. Near shopping and resturanuts

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We arrived at the Gate Hotel in Tokyo surrounded by all of our suitcases on the busy pavement outside a doorway proclaiming to be the Gate Hotel. We struggled through the door with our cases into a small vestibule containing nothing other than four lifts and a notice advising reception was on floor 13. No reception, no porters or concierge desk – we bundled our cases into a lift.Reception was a modest affair on the 13th floor with a small seating area to one side and a bar and dining room to the other side. The view of the Sky Tree was about all that was. All in all not what we were expecting! Having checked in we struggled with our cases back into the lift and went to our room on the 12th floor. Our Classy King room was anything but classy, modest would have been a better description; décor was very dark colours which made it claustrophobic. The toilet and separate shower cubicle were also quite simple affairs. It transpired that the hotel had no lounge, the roof terrace, such as it was, was mostly closed. Service was patchy and the breakfasts turned out to be in keeping with our impression of the hotel, very basic, very limited breakfast selection e.g. one juice, one cereal and patchy service, on our second morning my eggs benedict failed to arrive.We had booked our stay for three nights after which we left The Gate to travel to Hakone, leaving the majority of our baggage at The Gate and returning three days later for an overnight stay and reuniting with our luggage before joining the Queen Elizabeth for a cruise.On arrival for our second stay at The Gate at about 12:15 we were told check in was not until 2:00pm. We left our cases at reception and went for a walk and coffee at a nearby Starbucks before returning at 1:50. No our room was not ready check in is 2:00pm. At 2:00pm I tried again, ”no not ready yet come back in 10 minutes”. 2:10 “sorry no not ready 10 more minutes” At 2:20 we were not prepared to take no for an answer. We had a different Classy King room this time on the 10th floor. Whilst the room was the same dark modest room this time it featured an awful outlook over the air conditioning units of the adjacent building.On both occasions the corridors were always restricted by numerous housekeeping carts overflowing with laundry and cleaning materials – as mentioned in other Trip Advisor reviews.All in all we would categorise The Gate , whilst well located, as being a somewhat 3 star tourist hotel with limited facilities, indifferent service, poor breakfast , and indifferent service. All in all not at all what we were expecting

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: During my check-in, I asked the assistant manager more information about additional taxes that we had to pay. During our conversation, he just walked away with a disposable gesture. Unbelievable in such a high class hotel ! The next day, the manager apologized for this incident.What a pity, because the room and the breakfasts were perfect but this incident spoiled my stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was my second visit in 5 years. I was happy enough with my first visit to stay here again on a trip with my husband. I find the hotel quite nice and the view from the restaurant/bar unbeatable. I love that there is 24 hour dining, and the staff is nice. Rooms are nice but small unless one pays for a higher room category. There were almost always all the cleaning trolleys and dirty linens bins lining the hallway of our floor, which was fine, but a bit off putting that they were always there and there were so many of them. The restaurant is great, and breakfast is nice, but I would have liked more options. The hotel also lacked other amenities of those of a similar quality, such as a gym.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate is a generic western-style hotel in the busy Asakusa district. It's a convenient base to explore Tokyo, and we stayed 4 nights as the first stop on our visit to Japan. The room was nicely furnished with good bathroom facilities and spotlessly clean (as you would expect in Japan). The staff were pleasant and helpful and spoke reasonable English. So far so good.We arrived too late to start exploring so on the first night we ate in the hotel. The restaurant is on the 13th floor and nice enough, with good views of the city. Sadly, the food was disappointing and overpriced. We were expecting something a little bit special, but it wasn't brilliant. We later commented that it could have been a street food take-away presented on a plate, but at hotel prices. The breakfast wasn't brilliant either. There are western style options but we've had far better in Japan. The hotel has a top floor bar with spectacular views of the Skytree and the Tokyo skyline. It's restricted to residents only, so it's hardly used. We went for a drink after dinner and apart from another couple from Belgium, we were the only customers. The barman spoke almost no English and had absolutely no idea how to mix a cocktail - we ordered a Singapore Sling, but what we got was nothing like the real thing. Mostly ice and no fruit in sight. This bar has so much potential and should be bursting with people and atmosphere. Sadly it's completely lacking in both. If you just want a room for the night this hotel ticks the box, but the restaurant and bar let it down. Fortunately there are many restaurants and bars in Asakusa, within easy walking distance.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: On the first day, I felt that the smell of the room was not good. The empty clean machine had been opened to the strongest, and the taste was still pungent. After the second day of cleaning, the taste was still unpleasant. This second stay was disappointing to the quality of the room.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were disappointed by this hotel which we did not feel measured up to the positive reviews of other travellersThe first experience of the hotel is the reception area and restaurant which you may find yourself spending more time in than expected as our room was not available at the time they said it would be. The decor in the restaurant is third with paint chipped off the dining tables, service is very slow. The seating area in the lobby is a sun trap and becomes uncomfortable especially when lots of people are waiting to access their rooms or queueing for breakfastThe suit itself was also third there was no natural light in the bedroom, not much room to shower in an area next to the bath, lights so unfathomable that we had to resort to unplugging some of them to turn them off, and a black sticky substance on the coffee table and sofa (in several places) which was most unpleasantThe beds were very comfortableThe attitude of the reception staff was pore. When challenged about not honouring their commitments to room availability they just ignored us.The location while good for one shrine is a bit out of the way for most things although there is a metro station relatively close

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of our Japanese adventure. Found the hotel to be modern and clean with a good sized room (loved the giant egg light!). The rooms are simply and tastefully decorated and beds comfortable. We had an amazing view of the Sky Tower. I did find the room very hot and stuffy, but perhaps I just couldn’t work out how to use the air conditioner though!The open air bar on the 14th floor also gives great views of the tower and is a nice place for a drink.Breakfast slightly disappointing- a small buffet with limited options and a choice of a few hot options (all with meat so be sure to ask for it to be removed if you’re veggie). They were however happy to make plain old scrambled eggs so not all bad.Hotel is well situated for the metro just down the road, and Shinzo-Ji temple with all its bustle and life is virtually opposite. All in all a great stay In Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed at the Gate Hotel for one night. The Hotel is in a great location 2 mins from the train station (Asakusa) and almost across the road from Kaminarimon Gate Senso-ji which leads to the Sensō-ji temple. The view from the reception lounge area was amazing-looked directly at the Skytree and the private guest area on the level above gave the best panaroma views of Tokyo and the skytree. The rooms were clean and quite spacy. Overall nice hotel in a good spot.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Views of the Tokyo sky tree and asahi building with the “golden poo” sculpture. Amazing sights can’t beat the location to the asakusa line which allows access to haneda airport. Easily accessible and .1 miles from senjo ji and the marketplace for shopping. Extremely safe as people will avoid eye contact and there’s tons of restaurants and entertainment in the area. Perfect hotel for access to all of asakusa. The rooms are a touch small, but adequate. And the room smells a little musty due to the traditional Japanese style shower with seat. Has automatic toilets and the staff as in all of japan are the most hospitable people that you can imagine. Great base if you would like to stay near this more cultural and less modern district.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I try to stay in different parts of Tokyo every time I visit, and though my sojourn at The Gate was cut short by a change in flights, I'm already looking forward to spending more time there to further explore the Asakusa area. Though my three days were shortened to a brief overnight, I was pleased to at least be able to walk around the Sensoji Temple which, though closed, was lovely to see at night without the crowds. Tip: If you situate yourself right, you can see the Kaminarimon Gate while having breakfast. I highly recommend the Eggs Benedict over rice with dashi, a perfect way to transition to being in Japan.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very good hotel with excellent staff. The location is ideal for touring Tokyo. The area has plenty to see and central Tokyo is easily accessed by Metro. Loads of restaurants nearby and a Denny's for breakfast! Reasonable value but this is a high tourist area so par for the course, the rooms are compact but sufficient with everything you need. Happy to stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is located close to the Asakusa metro station and the Senso-ji Temple and surrounds, which include small bars, restaurants & souvenir shops. It is one stop from the Sky Tree.It’s small frontage can make the hotel difficult to locate. The rooms are adequate and staff are friendly. Breakfast offers a poor selection - unless you enjoy eggs benedict, curried eggs, egg with rice . There was one cereal on offer (sugar coated), one choice of fruit, one type of pastry .... There is a small bar on the rooftop for residents. Smokers are allowed, which means that non-smokers are forced outside - not ideal in winter!We were directed to the bar on the lower floor but, again, a seat at the bar meant we had to consume people’s smoke. If we chose not to smoke we were ushered into the adjoining restaurant area.Japan is at least 10 years behind with its attitude non-smokers. This hotel, however, makes non-smokers feel decidedly second class. Just make sure you ask for a non-smoking room!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We liked this hotel very much and thought it an excellent venue to be able to get around Tokyo easily as Asakusa station on the Ginza line just a few minutes walk from the hotel and many places walking distance from it e.g. Tokyo Sky Tree and the Senso-ji temple is just across the road! Staff all very friendly and helpful. Views from reception stunning! Would definitely recommend as a place to stay in Tokyo!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is a sleek looking, modern hotel, located right across from the Asakusa district in Tokyo. This is a superb location that mixes modern downtown with ancient temples and sites. The Gate’s lobby is on the 13th floor. There is an open lobby, with limited seating, reception desks and their restaurant and bar area. The rooms are compact, but functional, their bathrooms were ok (nothing to write about). We had two rooms and they had the foresight to put us together, which was nice – we didn’t need to ask as we had in several of our stops on our trip.There does seem to be a disconnect between the hotel and the restaurant. One of the reasons why we picked this place (besides the location) was based on the reviewers’ comments of their restaurant AND the hotel boasts about 24-hour service. When we checked in (around 4:30) we were ready for an early bite, since we had not taken a lunch earlier in the day. We were told that the restaurant wouldn’t be ready for dinner until 5. ? – so much for 24 hour service. We would wait and have a cocktail, but all of the tables were reserved (except one in a back room). We could, however, drink/dine on the balcony. It was cold and inclement, but we were given blankets for our laps. We asked if we would eat at the bar, and that was acceptable. They serve excellent cocktails but are a bit slow in concocting them. Once we finally placed our food order it was over 45 minutes before we got our food and by that time the place was packed. Our food was cold. We experienced another food malfunction the next day at breakfast. It looks like they have a great buffet, but we arrived a little late for the buffet so ordered off the menu. We ordered the highly recommended curried Benedict, and eggs Benedict, which came out immediately, but cold. The third order, French toast, came out 20 minutes later and was reportedly delicious. Bottom line is the restaurant needs some shaping up. Food should come out together, and should be hot, if it is expected to be hot. The curry wasn’t anything to brag about.However, if you’re not there for the food (there are some amazing restaurants nearby), the hotel is worth the stay. The staff are gracious and welcoming and certainly try to accommodate you. Some of the best views of the Asakusa area are from the roof top. It is a great location.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It’s our second time at The Gate just because it’s in such a perfect location for us. Food:Halal food is readily accessible in the vicinity from kebab to sushi to ramen to western and even North Indian food.. Nakamise dori has plenty of halal snacks and souvenirs which we kept returning to since we are right across from it... what’s not to love. (Just get the asakusa map for muslim travellers and u know what i mean) Breakfast, lunch and dinner just a walk away anytime we wanted with plenty of choices.. can’t imagine what it’s like for other muslim travellers when they’re staying somewhere else. Location:Very close to Asakusa station and it was super convenient to return to Narita. Asakusa on the ginza line leads directly to Shibuya and we were also able to get to Maihama after two quick train transfers. Just a few stops away from Ueno (if you need the main Yamanote line). Convenience:As a family, essentials are important so it is a BIG huge plus for us that a supermarket and a local drug store is just downstairs.. whatever you need just at the doorstep. Starbucks is just 5-10m away and our go-to for that daily matcha frappe, iced cocoa and tea latte after a long day of exploring. Service:Housekeeping was efficient and kept the room neat and tidy daily. Pyjamas are given so you dont even need to bring your own. We were pampered with clean PJs and towels everyday. Love it! I drink plenty of water and even though I kept asking for more bottles, they were always obliging. Even gave us two Japanese two pin plugs for us to charge our iphones and ipads. (We forgot that Japan uses a different type of plug)The only reason I hesitated on giving it a full 5 stars was because we were staying there during my birthday but the staff did not make an effort to send any birthday wish or greeting. I wasnt expecting anything complimentary but it would have been a lovely personal touch. Having said that, my husband was down with fever on one night and we did call to request for medication since the shops were already closed. They came promptly with fever medication.On the day we checked out, the staff even asked about my husband and we really appreciate this concern. Would we stay there again if we are in Tokyo again? Most definitely!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A very great hotel with very good location, 5-10 mins walk to metro station, and 3-5 mins walk to the main tourist attraction, Kaminarimon. Besides, the hotel is surrounded by many different kinds of shop and restaurant. It brought our trip many convenience. The room is clean and big enough for two persons with a small table for chilling with food and drinks. Also, the staff are very friendly and helpful. All these made our stay comfortable and pleasant.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is very conveniently located close to Kaminarimon, main gate to the old Tokyo neighborhood of Asakusa and the Senso-ji temple. It is also within a few minutes walking distance to the metro station Asakusa.Staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and speak perfect English. They will go ways to help you have a great stay, including helping out with shipping your luggage to your next hotel.Rooms are comfortable and very well appointed. Compared to other boutique hotels of the same category, the decoration comes across as a little "old-fashioned", though.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A relatively new hotel at the heart of Asakusa. Clean, comfortable and sizable (Tokyo standard). Particularly liked the roof top where you can have a breath-taking view of Tokyo (the Skytree of course) and the compactness of their all-in-one bathroom.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Arrived on a Sunday night for two nights for some business meetings. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk from a metro station and in an area with an endless amount of shopping, eating and drinking options. I booked a Double standard room and it met my regular standards. Clean, comfortable. Not overly spacious but suitable for solo traveler. It would have been tight if with someone else and another suitcase. But I will take a little small as long as clean and comfortable over large and spacious but dirty and uncomfortable any day!The rooftop bar was the gem of this stay. Amazing views all around with heaters for cool evenings. I booked a bed and breakfast rate from hotels.com for about $200 per night. The breakfasts were very good and the fresh squeezed OJ was a great way to start the day. I enjoyed walking around the small streets in the evenings looking at the bars and restaurants finding some great spots for a beer and some sushi. This will be my go to hotel for my next trip mainly based on location, but absolutely nothing to complain about!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: You enter the hotel at street level to get to the 13th floor which contains reception and the restaurant. The superb views of Tokyo include the nearby SkyTree. Staff are helpful and efficient. Check in/out was easy and the room was clean and comfortable. After I left, the staff discovered that I had left my wallet with UK currency and credit cards in the room safe. They tracked me down to my next hotel, called me to let me know and held on to the wallet until I was next in Tokyo 12 days later. Full marks.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: After spending two weeks, having fun, but getting tired. A beautiful hotel with a great room and bed. Incredible views and a restaurant to match. Rested, I will suffer through an eleven hour flight more easily.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed 3 nights at this nice hotel. It is not 5 stars but suits us fine as we spent most of our time out exploring and don’t need the hotel facilities. The rooms and bathrooms are quite big by Tokyo standards and beds comfortable. Wi-Fi is ok. We like the Asakusa area for its retro feel. There are 2 subway stations within a few minutes walk and many dining options. There’s a supermart, Starbucks and Matsumoto drugstore below the hotel. Walking past an illuminated Sensoji temple at night evokes a very different feeling, it’s almost serene without the crowd.I would like to add that I’m most impressed with the service by a Front Desk staff (sorry I forgot her name, only saw a Trainee tag..). I was given a smoking room when I checked in. Whilst I always select the non-smoking option, I’m not sure if I’d made a mistake in my haste as the booking was only done the day before (via a 3rd party provider). The hotel was full that night and could only change me to a non-smoking room the next day. Throughout the check-in process, the Front Desk staff kept apologizing for not being able to help me for the first night. She even asked housekeeping to spray air freshener to musk as much of the smell as possible. As the room was not ready by the normal check in time of 3pm, we decided to sit at the hotel cafe and she arranged complimentary coffee and hot choc while we wait. This to me, is good service delivery and human touch.Overall we’d a nice stay at the hotel. P/S: for first timers to Tokyo, I’m not sure if Asakusa is the best area to stay as it’s about 30 mins train ride from the Shinjuku/Shibuya/Harajuku tourist belts. Shinjuku is perhaps my first choice if visiting for the first time. But that’s just my view..

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location in Asakusa district across from subway station and Kaminaron Gate. Quite anonymous entrance off the street, but the impression changes when getting out of the lift (elevator for the non-Brits) at the high level reception - fantastic views over the city, dominated by the Skytree. Up-market and stylish room - aptly named 'Classy King'. Excellent breakfast. Ate a few times in the restaurant and enjoyed the food from a limited, but perfectly adequate selection. Would not hesitate to stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I made the right decision to stay here, it’s supper convenient for restaurant, shopping attractions places and train station ( for ginxa line ) even busy stop right in front of the hotel, the room is clean and reasonable size for Tokyo and you can get a good Tokyo view on the rooftop, totally forgot to take photos of the room.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel has a great location in Asakusa, across the street from the Senso-ji Temple gate and close to shopping and many restaurants. The hotel decor is dark and modern - if I were updating this hotel, I would change the hallways and interiors to light colors to open up the spaces within each floor and in the rooms.The rooms are furnished nicely though a bit small. The breakfast buffet is actually limited in choice but the cooked-to-order eggs Benedict or curry eggs are a nice touch. The buffet could benefit from more variety.Staff are efficient and try to help. We had toilet and refrigerator issues upon check-in, and they replaced the toilet but never provided a working fridge, so the support service gets a mixed score.This hotel is perfect for a couple who wants to be based in the Asakusa district - the neighborhood is pleasant, quiet and gives the vibe of old Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My husband and I just stayed at The Gate hotel for 4 nights and we enjoyed it very much. We had a twin Hollywood room. The room was spacious enough for the two of us. The bed was super comfortable, not too soft or too firm, it was just right. Bed linens were soft and comfy. The set up was actually two full size beds placed together. One side of the bed was very close to the wall and it made it a little hard to get in and out, but I guess you could get a larger room for a higher price. The pjs supplied were also very comfy. The bathroom had one area for shower and tub and a separate area for toilet and sink. Shower was great, good pressure and temperature. Shampoo, conditioner and body wash in the shower room were nice quality. The sink area had separate hand and face wash bottles. Breakfast was included in our rate, it was great! Delicious and plentiful, great coffee, fresh squeezed oj, yogurt, fresh honey (from the honeycomb), croissants and other breads, house made orange mermelaid, salad, pasta, and your choice of egg dishes made to order (there were 4 items to choose from). Service was great, they could not do enough for you. And one more thing, the location! Close to the Ginza line of the Tokyo subway station, and one block from the gate to Sensoji Shrine. Plenty of restaurants and shopping all around too. WiFi worked great. Just one piece of constructive criticism, even though the beds and bathroom were immaculately clean, we feel that the carpet and the chase lounge in the bedroom could use a scrubbing. We would definitely stay at The Gate again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is located in Asakusa . This district is familial but very lively with a lot of restaurants around the hotel . The hotel itself is very nice , very clean . We had a scenic room , very large with a superb view on the Sky Tower . It's very clean and the staff is very friendly .Please note that the lobby is on the 6th floor and the entrance of the hotel on the street is very well indicated

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: After hours of research, I only chose this hotel because it seemed to have a good view. Fantastic view from the hotel lobby on the very top floor and the breakfast area. I could also see a bit of Mountain Fuji in the restaurant because of the good weather. You can also go upstairs to the roof and see the whole view as well. The only thing I would comment is that the check-in staff didn't seem welcoming compared to other hotels/hostels I've visited. They seemed very cold.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice modern hotel, nice views from the restaurant and to rooftop terrace, good value for a nice room. The breakfast was mediocre (the worst of an overall excellent experience of three weeks in Japan) but you should be able to find a substitute in the lively neighbourhood.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We found the staff very helpful, especially when we had had an early flight. We asked for a quick breakfast, but the staff told us a proper cooked breakfast at 5.00am would not be a problem. It was one of the best breakfasts we has while in Japan.The room was comfortable with wonderful views across to the Skytree. We stayed in more expensive hotels in japan, but this one of the best.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Suggest this would be a good choice for those travelling to Japan for the first time. It’s close to the iconic Senso-ji temple and has a lot of older shopping streets nearby. There are shops where you can rent a yukata for the day and take a trip with the rickshaws and fill all those Japanese stereotypes. For those who want to spend more time shopping in Shinjuku, Shibuya or even at Tokyo station, this hotel is not that convenient. The Ginza line metro station is closeby but Asakusa is the first stop so going to Ginza takes about 20 mins and even longer to Shibuya and will require changing trains to most other destinations (eg Tsukiji Market, Harajuku, Shinjuku etc). The Narita Keisei Express does go directly to Asakusa but is on the Toei line so beware the walk is about 10 mins instead of 3 mins to the closer Ginza line. Personally, I would find it more convenient to stay at a hotel in Shinjuku or near Ginza or Tokyo station with direct limousine bus access. Having said that, the service at the Gate Hotel is nice and friendly (as with most establishments in japan) and the rooms are of a decent size (we stayed in an essential room). Not all the rooms have a view of the Tokyo Skytree nor the temple though.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is well situated in Asakusa, very close to the Ginza Line which is very convenient to explore Tokyo. Also, access is easy to both airports with the Asakusa Line.Asakusa is a very pleasant place in Tokyo, with Senso-Ji temple very close to the hotel.The view from he lobby, bar and restaurant is excellent with Tokyo Sky Tree, which is quite close to the hotel.Breakfast is very good with eggs nicely cooked (benedict / curry / on rice) or french toasts.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was the first hotel that we stayed at on arriving in Japan after the long flight. The reception is on the 13th floor with excellent views across the city to the Tokyo Skytree as well as the Senso-Ji Buddhist temple and Pagoda. The rooms are on the floors below and are comfortably appointed. The 14th floor has a roof deck area, bar and excellent views across the city and below.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Only stopped for a two day stop over, the service was awesome and looking back would have loved to stop longer. The concierge not only helped me with the usual tourist information but also recommended some amazing back street eating spots. Thoroughly enjoyed the time but was only disappointed at the size of the room, but then again I would go back

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is situated in the atmospheric Asakusa area with easy access to the metro lines. The hotel rooms and facilities are of the highest quality to ensure a relaxing stay and the staff is very friendly. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop bar with amazing views of the SkyTree.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had such a lovely time at the Gate Hotel - great location, clean, comfortable rooms, great breakfast and a great price to boot - plus an unfathomably beautiful view from the foyer and terrace. Sensational!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Fabulous hotel, the room was very clean, spacious with a nice bathroom & a fantastic view of the city & Tokyo Skytree. We traveled around Japan for a couple of weeks & this was definitely the best hotel of our trip. The staff were very helpful & couldn’t do enough for us, we even got an upgrade to a suite for my husbands birthday! We ate in the restaurant a couple of times & again fantastic. Breakfast was a choice of cooked & buffet options English & Japanese with tea & coffee served to your table.Location was great for exploring Tokyo, near to the underground stations & very close to the Kaminarimon temple. The area was quiet in the evenings.I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We booked the Gate Hotel because of the location. The corner upper floor room we booked had a fabulous view of the Sky Tower, the Shrine and the river. We were able to watch all the activity on the street below us and watch the sunrise in the morning behind the skytower. The room was extremely comfortable, Nice large bathroom with plenty of storage and a big tub and shower. The beds were really comfortable and it was nice and quiet. We tried the private bar upstairs one night for a drink, and it was very comfortable and the service was excellent as well as the drink. We also tried the bar on the lobby level one night as the one upstairs is not open until 6:00PM. The service was extremely slow and the drinks were not as good as upstairs. We found a cute place for breakfast a few blocks away called Suke 6 Diner. Fabulous food, we were looking for a good non Japanese breakfast after 3 weeks in the country and nothing but Japanese food. We did have breakfast the last morning at the hotel and it was very nice. They have several main courses to choose from, we had the eggs Benedict and french toast and both were excellent. The buffet was some fruit, vegetables and bread products, also they were making home squeezed orange juice that was amazing. The problems noted in past reviews about being hard to get a table were also an issue for us, but we just asked to sit at the bar and were seated immediately. This was a very comfortable option. The one thing we were not happy with was that the lobby is on the 13th floor, as such there is no one at the front door to help you with bags or get you up to the lobby to check in. We had to lug our bags to the street when we left and flag down a taxi on the street to get to the train station. We would definitely come back next time in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed in Gate Hotel Asakusa for 5 nights, my parents, my uncle & aunt and myself, I would say it's pretty experience.Hotel is connected directly with Asakusa line to both Haneda and Narita airport, which is really convenient and cost- effective. Besides Asakusa line, Ginza line is a few step away, and the neighborhood, there are countless nice restaurants nearby, do not hesitate to explore by yourself!Room is big, esp. the bath room is really spacious even not consider in Tokyo way... my room is facing the lovely Tokyo tree, which is really a plus. All hotel staff are friendly and kind.As there are many cafe nearby, we didn't try their breakfast but looks not bad. I would like to highlight the roof terrace with the great view, as well as the roof bar, we love this bar so much that every night after the sightseeing, a drink in the bar becomes the great treat~

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Just a few minutes from the Asakusa metro station, you take the lift to the 13th floor reception.The welcome was very warm and check in efficient and provided a great start of our trip to Japan. We had been travelling for 18 hours from London via Singapore and really appreciated this no hassle arrival.Our room was on the 9th floor and as expected was small with very little space for our luggage. The bathroom was excellent with a wet room which had a wonderful shower with extremely hot water and strong flow. Everything we needed was provided and with a firm bed we had three relaxing nights.There are a number of restaurants nearby in what is a popular area of Tokyo, but we left it too late on the second evening, so we had dinner in the restaurant which is an extension to the long, thin bar area off the main lobby. The food was mainly aimed at Western tastes but was well cooked and presented and not too expensive. Beer was reasonably priced but wine quite dear for the amount served.Breakfast was expensive and not being great fans of buffets we decided to do something we never do in the UK - go to Starbucks. There is a branch two minutes from the hotel (turn left and its on the same side of the street) and it provided all that we wanted - loads on Europeans, Americans and Australians were there together with many Japanese.The views from the lobby and roof top bar (not open when we were there due to the rain) are very impressive and give a good indication of the sprawl that is Tokyo.We had been told about the luggage forwarding service that exists in Japan and decided to make use of this on check out. We decided to send our large suitcases to the next but one destination and just took an overnight bag to the hotel we were staying at on the evening of our check out.The receptionist said that this would be easy but warned that because of the forecast typhoon there was a possibility of the bags being delayed by a day.As we were staying for a couple of days, we were happy to take the risk. However, when we arrived at our hotel in Kanazawa, the bags were waiting for us. The cost was approx. £ 24.00 and it was money well spent - just give them the address of the next hotel, pay the fee, get a receipt and (in our case just relax) - things are very efficient in Japan.Overall, I would be happy to stay here again as The Gate provided a comfortable base from which to travel easily around Tokyo using the marvellous and quite easily navigable underground system.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We love to spend our first night in Tokyo here and visit the Senso-ji next day. The view from the restaurant is fantastic, the food is good and we especially love the breakfast here. They prepare the orange juice right in front of your eyes and for sweetener there is raw honeycomb, absolutely unique. The place is clean, service excellent, just a no nonsense but fabulous in its own way hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here for seven nights with my daughter recently. What can I say....we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. It's the perfect mid-size hotel in location that is a bit more traditional without all the bright lights and blaring music. We thought the location was superb; closed to the Asakusa station, a wonderful market next to the hotel, delicious ramen and steak houses all within a 10 minute walk. The room was fully stocked with all sorts of amenities; full size shampoo, conditioner, body wash and even epsom salts for taking a long soak at the end of the day. I didn't have much interaction with the staff because the lobby is not at the main entrance to the hotel, which in a way was quite nice. You could go to/from your room as you please without having to see anyone. It was a comfortable size and I love that they provide cotton pajamas for you! If I were to go back, I would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: When we arrived at the hotel we were welcomed with a nice gift for hubby who was celebrating his birthday. Check in was quick and rooms were clean with complete amenities. Very close ti the ginza line, asakusa station , sensoji and shops. Very secure and safe. I would stay in this place again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We really enjoyed staying in this hotel. The location is fantastic with so much to do in the area. Everything is within walking distance and the trains are also super convenient. Service is top notch at the restaurant too. The morning after we landed we had to meet some people for brunch but I desperately needed a coffee and something light to eat before heading out. The breakfast menu only has the buffet, no ala carte. So we just ordered coffee and the staff kindly brought over some small pastries as well. It was really sweet of them and much appreciated!I need ear plugs to sleep (I'm a crazy light sleeper) and one night I couldn't find my set as they might have moved it during housekeeping. I rang up the front desk to see if they had any and they sent someone out at 1.30am to buy me a pair! They even kindly offered to reimburse me for my misplaced ear plugs. That's amazing service! Thankfully housekeeping managed to find my original pair and all was good. I would definitely return to this hotel and would highly recommend it! The room is also really comfortable!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Before we arrived the staff were fantastic helping me with booking restaurants, advising on the cuisine and things to do. This was our honeymoon and we are expecting so they really looked after us - so much so I nearly cried with joy (which you can partly blame the hormones for but they really did make us feel special). Rooms were a good size (larger than the other Japanese rooms for a similar price), beds comfy, toilet and shower luxury, and the breakfast was delicious. The area was great with the shrine and lots of lovely restaurants, Japanese knife shops close by and subway on your door step. The lobby, bar and roof top were all enjoyable spots to spend some time relaxing. Thank you for making it so memorable

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were very happy staying at this hotel. Great location near lots of restaurants and the metro but not too noisy. In fact room was so quiet even though overlooking the main road. The staff were very polite and helpful. Breakfast buffet choice was limited and we didn’t fancy the cooked options offered but they made scrambled and fried eggs when we asked. Would definitely return if ever in Tokyo again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We spent our first night in Tokyo in the Gates Hotel, as our plans were to take the Tobu train to Nikko the next day. What an amazing choice! Our room was so comfortable, perfect after a long flight. We were greeted warmly and enjoyed free cocktails on the outdoor deck overlooking the Sky Tree, the tallest structure in Tokyo. Our lovely room, a king on the 12th floor, also overlooked the Sky Tree. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was delicious, with a real honeycomb dripping honey for the yogurt. Along with the buffet, we were able to order off the menu. The hotel is right near the major Temple area in Asakasa, which we enjoyed in the morning. There are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby as well. We had an easy time going from Narita Airport, taking the Narita Limited Express to a station a couple of blocks from the hotel. We were also close to the subway and the Tobu station. The hotel held our luggage until we returned from sightseeing before boarding the train to Nikko. We’d love to stay at the Gates Hotel again, even if not off for Nikko in the morning. It was lovely welcome to Japan. We were unsuccessful booking through the hotel’s website, so went through one of the booking websites. A few days late, we found even lower rates and rebooked at a lower rate for a higher level room.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice hotel with profesional staff. We enjoy our stay there for 4 nights. Tthe breakfast is very good. The restaurant is also very good for the price in tokyo. Nice vue. Comfortable room. Modern. Good bed. Good night wear ( i buy one for home because so comfortable ). I will go back again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location of the hotel is very good, close to subway station, bus station, the famous tourist spot. There are 24 hours restaurant and convenient stores nearby. There is a supermarket downstairs. The room with Sky Tree view is amazing.The mattress is too soft. TV channels selection could be improved.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice new hotel just right in the middle of Asakusa.I have nothing bad to say about the hotel.Location was perfect, especially if you want to stay in Asakusa.Not too expensive, but not the cheapest one either.I would recommend based on my experience.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was our first experience of staying in a hotel in Japan and we were pleased. The service is courteous, efficient and very helpful. The room was quite small but was comfortable and clean. Air con worked well. Breakfast is not extensive but more than adequate. Great views (also from our room onto the Senso-ji). Very well located for the Asakusa area and beyond. No traffic noise.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The suite is quite large, ample space for two people. The terrace is big, too, although without any furniture. Aircon was not working properly but then was repaired quickly. The staff is very friendly and they do want to help and manage things for you. The breakfast restaurant is a pleasure of continental and fusion breakfast and the view from here is spectacular. Very good location and a good choice of public transport.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I really enjoy my 2-night stays at this lovely hotel. My room was on the 6th floor and I could view Tokyo Skytree outside my window. Also, the location of this hotel was great too. It was really near the train station, and there were plenty of restaurants around. Asakusa area was charming and rich in history, and it was nice to wander around all day, even in the morning or at night. The service at this hotel was professional and the staffs were friendly. My room was cleaned daily and well-equipped. I chose Egg Benedict twice during my stay here because it was so tasty. The exclusive rooftop bar was a great bonus too. I definitely recommend staying at this lovely hotel - a gem in Asakusa, Tokyo.
user_name:
expatolife
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed here on my last day in Tokyo and booked the Essential room.I would certainly recommend this room, it offers everything you need! Nice desk, 2 comfy chairs and a big queen size bed. Also the bathroom has a shower and a bathtub!The reception is located on the top floor, which offers a nice view of the Senso-ji temple and the surrounding area. The staff is very friendly and speaks a good level of English. I would certainly recommend booking with breakfast as the restaurant is also located on the top floor. Had a wonderful view during my breakfast! Also the breakfast offers a wide variety of foods, Western and Japanese.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed 2 days in this lovely hotel. Our room on the 10th floor was super comfortable, well equipped (even had a Nespresso machine, water, bathrobes & slippers as well as refrigerator and safe), very clean and had beautiful views of Sensoji Kannon temple and surrounds. Reception staff (on the 13th floor) were friendly & attentive (they translated some medications I needed into Japanese so I could go to the pharmacy) and the roof top restaurant & bar has fabulous views of the Tokyo Skytree and surrounding areas.You can get a direct train to the hotel from Narita via the Keisei Narita Sky Access line (about an hour) to the Asakusa Station, then a 5 minute walk. Asakusa Station also connects to other parts of Tokyo via numerous subway/metro routes. Asakusa is a quiet and interesting area, it feels more traditional than the commercial other parts of Tokyo, with lots of authentic restaurants and shops. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and the area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Spent three days here, last week. Eveything you can read on TA is true. Asakusa is an interesting district, well connected by métro to other areas in Tokyo. The hotel is modern and squeaky clean, with great views of Tokyo SkyTree from the lobby (and some of the rooms). Service is attentive and personal (special mention to staff at reception). Good breakfast, too (don't miss the eggs Benedict). Don't hesitate to mention a special occasion: they take this seriously.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A great hotel in a great location. In particular the lobby, lounge, bar and breakfast areas are beautiful with dramatic views over Tokyo. We would check in again should we revisit Tokyo. The rooms are small but well equipped.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Have been to Japan several times but stayed the first time in Asakusa; very beautiful area and feels more traditional than many other areas in Tokyo. There is plenty of restaurants and shops around the corner, from traditional Japanese to international fast food chains. Hotel was fairly easy to find from Kensei Access Express but quite a walk with suitcases especially in hot, hot weather. Lots of stairs and the only elevator was tiny (fits pretty much two people with bigger suitcases) but once you find it it's really worth it as the station is full of staircases (like all over in Japan). It takes more or less 60 minutes to Narita with Kensei Access Express - please note thou that not all trains to Narita are direct, and then more or less 10 minutes walk to the hotel.Our room was quite small and dark, we were not really impressed by it. There is a fridge in the room, the AC was not working very well at the beginning but was fixed and worked perfectly well after that. The big minus was the toilet, very bad smell (drain and moisture) in the shower area which was very dated as well. There are dark carpets in the room, the bed was pretty big and on a hard side but provided a good night sleep. Overall the hotel was very quite, no noise from the corridors or streets (we stayed at the 7th floor). Breakfast was limited but good, small selection of dishes and a choice of 4 different menu options; the ones we tried tasted delicious, and the fresh-squeezed orange juice was a great bonus!The view from the reception area was beautiful, even the one from our room. Staff friendly but some members didn't understand/speak English very well. Overall an ok experience and definitely a nice area to stay if you don't mind spending quite some time in the metros to access other famous areas like Shibuya, Harajuku, Shinjuku etc.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel was our first stop on a recent visit to Japan. The location was great, close to the station, markets, temple and shrine as well as streets lined with eateries offering a large variety of food. The hotel itself offered a great array of food including eggs benedict with curry for breakfast which was delicious and a roof top bar offering fantastic views of the city.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is in a great location it is close to everything Japan has to offer. The staff are very friendly and all speak English. Breakfast was just a treat you must try the curry benedict. A short stroll will take you to the Ginza line where you can basically get to any destination in Japan. A very enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is very well located near to a subway station. Good breakfast. Nice place to walk around without being in the heart of the city especially at night time. Good neihborhood for walking around. High standards in client service.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Really enjoyed this hotel. Clean, close and cosy. 100 metres to rail system, Asakusa has markets, good shopping and street food. Atmosphere, temples and gardens. Hotel food fabulous so we had dinner in! Good range if wine so relax and take in the city lights. Roof top bar was closed as it is too hot to sit out.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is our first time to visit your hotel. I and my family had a great experience at here that had convince location, great view, and good service. Besides, I love to run aroud the Sumida River, the hotel near the river 5 minuets.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I absolutely LOVED The Gate Hotel. The hotel was beautiful - the rooftop restaurant and bar is open 24 hours (which helped me when I was up late with jet lag) and the food was great! And the view from the restaurant is OUTSTANDING! You can also dine outside, which was great.The staff at The Gate Hotel was wonderful - very helpful and kind. I do not speak Japanese (though I wish I did!) and the front desk staff spoke English. Asakusa is a really cool neighborhood - lots of alleyways with bars and restaurants with GREAT food. Check out the Orange Street area. We also really enjoyed Thai food at Montee, across the bridge from the hotel. I liked this area as it seemed less touristy than other parts of Tokyo. It's close to 2 subway lines so it's VERY easy to get anywhere! I could go on and on, but The Gate Hotel is GREAT, especially for first-time Tokyo visitors like myself. I'd give it 10 stars if I could!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June, and everything about it was wonderful. The location in Asakusa was great – near lots of dining and shopping and subways. The interior is bright, modern and new. The room was expectedly small but very comfortable and we slept well. Loved the cotton pajamas that they provided. The front desk staff were all very helpful and patient. Bu sure to check out the city view from the lobby (which is on the upper floor rather than the ground floor) and stop into the roof top bar.
