They went above and beyond in several ways to make our stay special. First - we are vegetarian; it’s somewhat hard to find vegan/vegetarian food in Japan. But the restaurant was so very accommodating in providing meatless breakfasts for us. I was so impressed with the beautifully arranged fruit platters that they made for us, and that he took the time to point out all of the vegan options on the buffet (for example, he said that the potatoes were cooked in the same oil as the meat so we shouldn’t have them), and offered to remove the bacon from my eggs benedict. Secondly – it was my birthday and they made it special by upgrading our room, giving me a small gift, and a most beautiful hand-made origami birthday card. Even without the gifts, I would recommend this hotel and I would be happy to stay there on my next visit. Thank you!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is my fourth time in Tokyo, and I decided to choose this Hotel as it was in the centre of Asakusa and closer than Shinjuku in terms of travelling from the airport. So I chose to stay one night before transferring to Hilton. We took the express train from the airport and took a cab to the hotel as it was difficult to find at night. The receptionist was very helpful, showed us around the lobby and led us towards the elevator. As we entered our room, it was smaller than I expected but then it is Tokyo. In the next morning, it was such a good feeling to go downstairs and go straight to the temple without having to travel from Shinjuku. We walked around before the crowd quickly came which was definitely a plus! Would definitely stay here for a max 2 nights just to explore Asakusa!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I didn’t realize Asakusa was a bit out of the usual tourist routes so took longer to get to places but Asakusa is a great area. The river is there and there is a lovely path along the river to jog or walk, great market right in front of hotel and great food all around. The hotel has a great breakfast and the rooms are small but very comfortable with coffee in room and views of Asakusa outside window. Very recommended for moderate price hotel

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My wife picked up this hotel because she knows I am a photo addict. This place is so close to Sensō-ji so I can explore the area at early morning before all tourists arrive.A bonus feature in this hotel: apart from the beautiful night Tokyo view they are promoting in their website, it has also a beautiful sunrise view of Tokyo!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our family's first trip to Tokyo, very happy to select the Gate Hotel, easy access from the airport. The hotel is right in the middle of Asakusa, shopping and restaurants are all near by. Overall great experience in the hotel.
user_name:
TigerLadyNY
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our first stop in Japan and what a start great location close to transport great food both at the hotel and around the local area.The staff were brilliant nothing was to hard for them. The rooms were modern spacious and clean.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My wife knows that I am into photography, so she always choose some photographic friendly places to stay. On our annual anniversary trip, she choose this hotel where I could take sunrise pictures, and lucky enough on the last day of our trip, the sunrise was so beautiful.Stay here if you want to catch a beautiful Tokyo sunrise.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We very very pleased with our stay at the Gate Hotel in Asakusa. Our two rooms (we are a family of 5) were large, clean, and tastefully decorated. Subway Ginza Line was two minutes walk away. Recommended!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Its excellent location near both the Asakusa subway station and the Sumida river cruise ship pier and the friendly English speaking staff are the main attractions.It’s not cheap but the rooms ( for Japan) are a decent size , the bathrooms have a separate , walled – in shower and the large lobby has pleasant seating.Breakfast offers a small fruit and bread buffet and includes a single order of eggs.We’d return there.Paul + Manirat

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Really good experience for first 4 nights of a 3 week trip. The view from the lobby (11th floor) over the urban sprawl that is Tokyo was mixed with the amazing Skytree that lights up subtly at night and the nearby Shinto temple from the more traditional Edo period. Room was very comfortable with barely a whisper from traffic noise with one of those automatic loos and all mod cons. Lovely and comfortable Japanese nightwear. A rooftop bar where you can sit outside and watch the Skytree light up whilst sipping a beer from the nearby Asahi brewery.Breakfast was sumptuous with Eggs Benedict, french toast and a buffet of western style goodies and more local foodstuffs to help your palate adapt to having rice, salad, pickled vegetables and smoked fish. We only snacked for lunch! All this with the amazing view.The staff were very helpful and friendly, even to the point of bowing to the lift as you descended! Loved it!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I searched extensively for a hotel in Tokyo while arranging my first trip to Japan. It is not easy to decide which neighborhood to choose and everyone I asked had a totally different opinion. I finally decided on Asakusa because of its proximity to Narita Airport since it is serviced by direct trains and the fact that I had read it is a quieter working neighborhood. I could not be more pleased with the decision. The Gate hotel was luxurious yet relaxed. The room was perfectly and exquisitely appointed. The level of detail from the soaps to the linens was impressive. The staff was very helpful and attentive. The views from the reception on the 13th floor and from the rooftop terrace on the 14th floor are sweeping. There is great metro connections nearby as well as bus routes. Get a Pasmo card to simplify transportation payment. All you have to do is swipe the card at either end. When I go back to Tokyo I will definitely stay at The Gate Hotel again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A five minute or so walk from the Asakusa train station will get you to this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, the crisp "pajamas" and bed linens were most welcome after a long flight. Lovely views from the lobby and dining room where both American and Japanese choices are available for breakfast. We found the location convenient for exploring the city and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here for our first three nights in Japan, and it was perfect! Super easy to walk to Senso-ji and all the nearby restaurants (all the little off-streets are filled with amazing restaurants! There is a rooftop terrace, breakfast buffet with view of Tokyo, wonderful staff and nice rooms. Easy to explore around Ueno and Nippori areas too. Excellent choice for Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location is very good, the service is also very good, 2 consecutive nights stay, very clean, very happy to see the Sky Tree.The best thing is to thank the hotel for providing us with a birthday surprise and looking forward to the next visit.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It was amazing! Beautiful views from the top floor. Breakfast was delicious & easy to get around the train stations. Close to senso-ji temple, they also have near by stores around there for souvenirs. And you can pay cash at the hotel, no need to worry about credit cards.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We picked the hotel from youtube reviews and recommendations. It was perfect as expected. This is our second trip to Japan but first stay in Asakusa. Hotel is in right across the street from the famous temple and shopping street so you can go there early in the morning before the crowd. We were there during Golden week so the crowd was massive! The temples are more beautiful at night, so you can also visit after the crowd is gone. You should also try the surrounding restaurants at night with all sort of tasty foods at reasonable prices. There's also a small grocery store near the hotel where you can get fruits and drinks. We love the breakfasts at the hotel, included in the price. There are 4 options for the hot breakfast: we tried a different one every morning. I like the egg benedict the most. Also, OJ is freshly squeezed, salad and fruits are very tasty. We stayed 4 nights in Asakusa to a deeper experience of old Japan and we were not disappointed. Also everything seems to be cheaper in Asakusa vs. other areas in Tokyo. You can use this as a base if you want to save money.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: 家族の祝い事があり宿泊しました。ロケーションが最高に便利。部屋は辛うじて周りが見える９階でした。１０階以上でないと周りのビル群に囲まれて景色は望めません。しかし、宿泊者だけ利用できる屋上のテラスやバーがあります。部屋は狭すぎず、広すぎず、華美さはないものの便利なものはすべてそろっています。コーヒーメーカーもあり、気が利いています。シティホテルにしては、内装なとはビジネスホテルよりかなと思いますので、高級感はありません。今回は家族の祝い事が浅草であるため宿泊と事前に伝えておいたところ、サービスバウチャーをいただき、夜景を見に立ち寄ったバーで、思いがけずシャンパンのハーフボトルを頂戴しました。大変感謝しています。サービスは過剰でなくさりげないですが顧客を楽しませる気持ちにあふれています。ひとつだけ残念だったのはバスタブが汚れていたことです。汚れなのかとれないシミなのかはわかりませんが、気になったのでお湯をためての使用はしませんでした。浅草の新たな癒しスポットです。海外居住ですのでまた一時帰国の際には泊まりたいです。Stayed for family happy event. I love the contrast of old and new in Asakusa and The Gate hotel has the best location for visiting the temple, small shops, good restaurants, Sushi and izakayas. The room is very conveniently designed and equipped. Those who want view should stay over 10th floor, higher is better for view. You can also use the top floor terrace for relaxing and for drinks with the view of Skytree and centre of Asakusa...Night view is better.Service is not too much but comfortably well with personal touch if you inform your need in advance.I would recommend the Gate for its convenience and comfortable stay in the heart of Asakusa. I would love to go back and enjoy the old town!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location is great, near the subway station, the temple and the supermarket.The bed is soft and comfortable. Good sleep quality.We can see the tokyo skytree just through our room window.The view at the roof is great, too.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel rooms look into Skytree tower, the golden flaming heart sculpture atop the golden bear building and best of all onto Kengo Kuma's 6 story tilted floors Asakusa Tourist building which is only a block away. Location location. Hotel is scarce in the modernist style. Black and quirky design. I loved it. Breakfast buffet is 'curated ' with style and surprises. Outstanding. This is a small boutique hotel. No tour groups. The service staff is all young and smart and beautiful. Don't be put off by having lobby on top floor. That's where the view is. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The best location: right in front of the beautiful Senso-ji temple and SkyTree. Lots of stores and things to do near by. Comfortable room, good breakfast and the view from the rooms and from the rooftop is amazing!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It was very pleasant stay. Staffs were so kind and room was clean. The room was big enough for two people as I stayed at Hollywood style room. I recommend it for couple, since it was really nice place to stay and enjoy lovely time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed 2 nights at The Gate to experience another location of Tokyo. Good location wise to transport and several tourist locations as well as ample restaurants of all cuisines outside the door. Rooms are reasonably large by Japanese standards and pleasingly the hotel is smoke free. The lobby and restaurant are in the top floor to maximise the vista. Bathrooms are again a good size as well as having a rainwater style shower head. Only critique was the restaurant at breakfast. Not a large number of seats and the waiting staff almost outnumber the customers so there is a certain amount of “hovering” trying to provide service when I could have used some space. Breakfast is also a hybrid serviced/buffet style which can be confusing. Not a large selection of items to choose from...4 hot dishes, 1 cereal, no toast or toaster for example. But, rooms are quiet, bed is comfy, bathrooms good.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My husband and I spent 2 nights at this hotel and found our stay to be excellent. From Narita Airport, it took about 1 hour via direct train and about a 5-7 minute walk once you exit the Asakusa train station. We reserved Style E, which was a double bed. The room was quite small by American standards (there was only enough space to open one carry on suitcase at a time). Despite the small size, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom area was spacious. I also appreciated the complimentary bottled water and the Nespresso machine. I would recommend a larger room category if you have a suitcase larger than a carry on. Our stay came with free breakfast, which was quite excellent and included a buffet of hot/cold items (Japanese and Western selections) as well as a cook to order selection of hot items. I would allow extra time for breakfast if you are pressed for time. We arrived at 6:40AM (breakfast starts at 6:30) and had to wait roughly 10 minutes before we were seated. I imagine the wait time must be much longer at a later hour. Staff at the front desk as well as the restaurant were both very efficient and prompt and all spoke very good to excellent English. As others mentioned, the location is walking distance to the shrine as well as plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is also 5-10 minutes walk to the pier, where you can take a Tokyo cruise to Tsukiji area and a subway stop away from the Skytree and Sumida Aquarium. This was a great hotel. I would stay here again, but most likely in a larger room category.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed at The Gate Hotel for 4 nights in a twin room. Room was modern, clean with excellent shower and Nespresso machine, also located on the 9th floor with a view of the sky towerGreat location across the road from Senso-Ji temple and the Asakusa station. Make sure you walk around this area for shopping and good food. It’s also a short walk to Asahi Beer Hall and a bit further to the sky tower. Be wary the breakfast is very limited and you may have to wait up to 40 minutes to get a seat as it’s a very small restaurant. We gave up on the last day as had a train to catch and ate at the station.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We started our Japan trip here staying for four nights in a classy room. The location was perfect. The room was lovely, with beautiful views. We especially loved the little touches like the bath salts, and the comfy pyjamas! The rooftop bar was fabulous, and the breakfasts were really good (the best orange juice I have ever had!). The staff were always nice and thoughtful. We had requested some nice restaurant recommendations in advance of our stay as we were celebrating our anniversary, and they booked some really amazing meals for us - I strongly recommend anyone staying here does the same. They also left us a beautiful handmade card and gift in our room ❤️We would stay here again - perfect x

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: PROS: Hotel is near restaurants, metro, ATM, market, Senso-ji temple and shopping streets. Great view of Sky Tree Tower. Lobby and rooftop terrace have great views. Nice bathroom. Good service. CONS: Room had a slightly funky smell, toilet smelled a bit of urine (but bathroom looked clean), AC was iffy so we left the windows open the whole time. If you come in summer and don’t like the heat I’d reconsider. Small room typical of Japanese hotels. Overall though a pretty good stay, mostly because of location and staff service.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Right in the middle of bustling Asakusa, the views from the 13th and 14th floor are truly amazing and well worth the stay. The rooms are small (hey, it is Japan) but well equipped. The restaurant has received a couple of awards but we only tried it for breakfast - well made, but a bit too special for our taste. We would rather go the the nearest ramen joint instead - more authentic Japanese (and cheaper, too)

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel looks very unassuming from the outside but is simply great from the inside. The lobby is on the 13th floor and boasts a wonderful view over Tokio and the Skytree Tower. The rooms were large and comfortable, the bathroom generous for Japanese Standards. There is a fridge which can be used to chill one's own drinks and every other amenitiy one could expect in a good hotel is available here. The brekfast area is too small for the amount of rooms and so from 7.00 to 8.30 one has to wait...up to half an hour in the worst case scenario. We were told however that we were there at the very highest season ( Cherry Blossom Time) so maybe it is better later on in the year. There are only four things to order from the menu which are made fresh and otherwise the buffet definitely caters for the Japanese and not the European palate. The hotel is perfectly situated for exploring Tokio, the train station only 5 minutes walk away and the Asakusa Kannon Temple is equally close. This hotel can be warmly recommended

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Excellent service and nice, clean rooms in a wonderful location just a short walk away from the Sensoji temple. The view from the rooftop bar of the Tokyo Sky Tree was awesome. I highly recommend the breakfast, too.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room size is generous compared to Japan standards. The location is great, as it is only within walking distance to the famous temple, there are lots of restaurants around and shops. Only minor complain is the internet can be a little slow at times.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed at the Gate Hotel in Asakusa for five nights in late December 2017. We booked online a few months prior and received great follow up service from staff confirming our booking closer to the date and checking if we needed assistance with reservations. Once we arrived, we were very impressed by the quality of the room, service and location. The neighbourhood is both traditional (the hotel is across the road from the Nakamise-dōri market and Sensō-ji temple complex) and modern (lots of shops, restaurants and public transport within an easy walking distance). The hotel itself is clean, quiet and modern. Check-in was very impressive; the lobby is located on one of the top floors of the building and offers amazing views of the area. We stayed in a Hollywood Twin room, which was fairly spacious (we were expecting tiny rooms in Japan) and had a large bathroom/wet room. Unfortunately the room wasn't big enough for a cot but our toddler could easily sleep in our very large bed between us. The bathroom had a separate wet room with a shower and (small) bathtub. It was great, though, because there was so much room to have your shower, and also amazing toiletries (best shampoo, conditioner and shower gel I've used in ages, I had to track down the boutique when we got to Osaka to get some!) The bathroom also had a full-service bidet toilet and plenty of room to store your toiletries around the sink. The staff were helpful with recommendations for places to go and to eat. On my daughter's 2nd birthday, we came back to our room to find a birthday gift for her on the table: a card and a cute little Hello Kitty purse that she was so excited about - completely unexpected and such a sweet thing for them to do on her special day. The location was perfect for our family because everything was in close walking distance, including the convenient Asakusa subway line and the famous Nakamise-dōri market (great for souvenirs!) There's also a bank/ATM, supermarket and Starbucks on the same block. The only negative was the hotel breakfast which was sub par compared to other hotels we've stayed at. The options are very limited (only four à la carte options on the menu) and the portion sizes were quite small. The buffet that was included as part of the breakfast had a _very_ limited number of Japanese-style breakfast dishes. We only had breakfast at the hotel once as a result, but it's hardly a deal breaker as we had so much to do during our trip and looked for outside breakfast options anyway. There is also no room service available. Overall, we were extremely happy during our stay and we'd gladly stay at the Gate Hotel again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is a well run beautiful hotel very close to Sensoji temple and shops. Great linens (though only one towel per person) and big comfortable bed, and our one bedroom suite had a balcony, mini fridge ( not mini bar), coffee and tea kettle. I wanted a high floor so we could have a view but the suite is on the third floor. This was not made clear to me until we arrived and saw the layout. So, be aware— it seems a suite with a balcony (no chairs to sit out) is going to be on a low floor. Staff speaks English with adequate proficiency, but of course very polite. One oversight (and they are not unusual in this, but I will mention it in every hotel review I do)- no shaving/makeup mirror! This could be an easy fix, I hope they heed this review! The rooftop outdoor patio was great for an evening hot sake and Tokyo tower views. Highly recommended! I also liked that they had a little solar energy generation information downstairs ( not that much generated and probably more for PR, but still).

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Always wanted this and the experience is truly magical. When checked the location of the hotel on the map of Tokyo I was disappointed that the hotel was not more centrally located.Not worries the location is exceptionally good. At the begging for/ end of one of the most important metro lines is very easy to get about. In Asakusa’s heart the sightseeing is splendid. Tokyo tree is just an easy walk distance if required and the Hotel itself has some astonishing viewsThe b’fast is good if monotonous, but with enough variation for a short stay.The rooms are spacious, at least ours. And well stocked with nice bedding and other things needed.Certainly a great contender on a holiday bstay

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A modern hotel in the middle of Asakusa, a short walk to the famous Sensō-ji/Asakusa Shrine/Hōzōmon gate. Fairly large rooms for Japan, and a nice breakfast section on the 13th floor, with a wonderful roof terrasse a couple of flights up.The Asakusa line conveniently nearby, comnecting to all city sights and possible connections.And price not crazy either.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Couldn’t have been happier except for one thing. Great location because when you walk out of the hotel you’re in a neighborhood with shops of all kind, restaurants, a Shrine, near public transportation. Hotel rooms are floors 7 to 12, so off street noise mostly. Very friendly, helpful staff. Only complaint: occasional cigaret smell wafting in through vents ( but one can open windows to get rid of that)...
user_name:
Patrick D
Stevenson Ranch, California, United States

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is a fabulous hotel just a minute walk from the Asakusa Metro Station. It’s close to the Senso-ji temple, the Asakusa Pagoda, across the road from Orange St shopping area and surrounded by amazing restaurants.The rooms are top class with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms and the reception floor has amazing views of the Tokyo cityscape and The Skytree Tower.Staff are super friendly too.We’ll be back!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The rooms were spacious & had everything you need. It was a fantastic location for the metro & the Asakusa temple. Also good for skytree tower. The bar at the top was really cool with an amazing view. Our deal didn’t include breakfast which to add on was very expensive!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location , just a few mins walk to train station. Excellent breakfast but most of all outstanding service from all the staffs! I would like to thank Miss Ayako Ishida for the great arrangements made by her and her prompt reply with excellent command of English. I will most definitely book this hotel again If i were to visit Tokyo!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location a few minutes' walk from the Asakusa metro station. The SkyTree was right outside our window.There's got a supermarket right downstairs, while other eateries and shops abound in the area nearby. The Kaminarimon and the Asakusa Temple are just a stone's throw away.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice hotel in the heart of Asakusa with a beautiful view. Very closed to the Sensoji temple. The double room was a little bit small. Reception on the top floor with a nice terrace. Overall a good value

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room is a little small but very comfortable, bedding is a welcome site after a day in Tokyo. The staff speaks very good English, and very helpful. The surrounding of the hotel is full of little shop and, very delicious restaurant. But the hotel as one bar restaurant, and a bar on top of the building with a beautiful view of the city. The hotel is located from a short walk from the metro line "G" Ginza line

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is in a great location to one of Tokyo's oldest areas - Asakusa. The hotel is ideally situated in an area where geisha frequent and has a market place where any tourist can buy the Japanese souvenirs. Like anywhere in Tokyo, it is close to the Tokyo Metro (once you have decoded Subway maps showing the confusing labrynth network)

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was the first hotel we stayed in during our trip to Japan. The hotel is easy to find, only 5 mins to the subway and ~ 45 mins from Haneda airport. Reception is on the 13th floor and has a large lounge with a bar and fantastic views. There’s also a residents bar a few floors further up which is equally impressive. The room we stayed in was a decent size (at least by Japan standards). Whilst the room was very quiet, unfortunately we didn’t have the best nights sleep whilst we were there (although I think a large part of this was due to the 9 hour time difference). We did find our room pretty warm during our stay and a little stuffy. We struggled to get the aircon on to work so left the window open on the 3rd night.There’s some nightlife and bars within a 10 min walk, although when we visited we found it pretty quiet in the evening so if you’re looking for this then you might be better placed in shinjuku / shibuya which is easy to get to but does involve a couple of subway connections (40+ mins)Overall however the hotel is competitively priced for the rooms on offer and views.We didn’t have breakfast included in our deal but if you see this as an option when booking then I’d say it’s worth the extra over.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Easy to get to (tube station couple minutes away) located in the old part of Tokio The Gate Hotel was a perfect base location for exploring the city. The hotel room was clean and spacious, equipped with all necessary toiletries starting from shampoo/conditioner/face wash/razors etc to pajamas and slippers. Nespresso coffee machine and fridge in the room. There was a room on our floor with vending machines for cold/hot drinks (also beer), ice was also available. Bed are hard but comfortable and we love them like that so it was a bonus for us. Top roof bar was very cozy, stunning views during the day and at night. Reception was very helpful, great service from all of the staff. Lots of shops and restaurants near by. Asakusa is colourful and lively by day and very calm at night, we loved it!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location was amazing as it was close by to a lot of the attractions in Asakusa such as the Senso-ji Temple and the local markets with lots of historical shops.The staff was very friendly and helpful especially Masami. She was able to help me translate with the bus station staff over the phone due to communication issues on filing a lost item at Tokyo station. My room was nice and cozy. The amenities were great and I love the rain shower!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The reception at the 13. floor and the bar at the 14. floor offer fantastic view over the Tokyo Skytree and the surrounding areas. The hotel is a short walk from Asakusa line where trains to both Haneda and Narita airport. They serve very nice breakfasts and the rooms comes with complementary toiletries.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate reminded me of typical Icelandic hotels- stark, simply laid out, clean, functional- but with little charm.The location IS great, across from Senso-ji and a 3 minute walk to Ginza line and Express train to NRT. Zillions of shops, restaurants in vicinity, and if one heads west a few blocks, toward the Asakusa View Hotel into the little alleyways beyond, there is another whole different Japan awaiting. Watch out for the overpriced kitsch shops, and the temple can get very busy, so come early or late for that. Rooftop bar/viewing area are spectacular.Room I was in was small, bed pushed into a corner. TV setup and desk not the best but who really cares. The bathroom, again snug, had state of the art fixtures and nice unobtrusive tiling.I paid 13,000 Yen, which to me is a very good value just after Foundation Day holiday.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Everything about this hotel felt 5* and it was the perfect end to our trip. Our room was huge with a lounge area, bar, king bed and INCREDIBLE skytree view from both the room and even from the bath! The staff were friendly and helpful, and we couldn't fault them at all. The bathroom was also huge with a separate bath and shower. Toiletries were provided and were wonderful, and the towels and provided pyjamas were soft! We loved having cocktails at the rooftop bar and there is an extensive cocktail and drink menu. The location is very close to some major tourist attractions and has easy access to multiple train stations. We would stay here again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to anyone. Thank you for a wonderful trip!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We spent 8 nights at The Gate Hotel January 2018, we chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and the price point. There was communication issues with the staff about children being included for breakfast but they compromised on a solution we were happy with. We found the breakfast buffet to be disappointing in general but I'm a breakfast person and have high standards. Our primary complaint is that the room was on a non-smoking floor (10th) but periodically the smell of cigarette smoke would come in through the ventilation. This is a no-go for me and I wish I had known before booking.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The views from the foyer, rooftop bar and room here were amazing. Our room was huge, including a bar, sofa and king size bed as well as bathroom with rainfall shower, bath and skytree views. The bed was very comfortable and the pyjamas provided were the best thing I have ever slept in! The breakfast was average with limited continental options. The staff were super helpful in extending our stay for one night and moving us to a smaller, cheaper room just to have a rest and shower before our flight.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed for 3 days, didn't opt to have the breakfast.The usual 5 rating requirements, service, cleanliness, maintenance was all there. The lowest tier room which was what I rented was great and modern, sometimes the traditional hotel bathroom can be a bit cramped and uncomfortable, but the gate was very comfortable place. sleep quality was excellent.I cannot find any faults.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Well, there are many good things to say about this hotel but I am trying to put everything in one sentence. It was the best hotel ever. Best Location and Best view. Especially if you are planning to visit the Tokyo as a tourist, (meaning the first trip to Tokyo, Japan or only a few time experienced traveler) I strongly recommend this location because everything is so convenient to explore Tokyo especially Asakusa!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Thank you very much for The Gate Hotel’s excellent high quality service for us during our stay on 30 Dec 2017 -1 Jan 2018!We enjoyed a lot at your hotel every arrangement and staff nice attitude and smiling every where!Thanks for the New Year countdown ceremony, 1 Jan sun rising , osetsuryori on the morning breakfast! We will come back again to stay at the Gate hotel in future.Mr. And Mrs Choi, 30Dec2017-1Jan2018

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed two nights in its hollywood twin on 6/F. Definitely a top pick if u wanna stay nearby the Asakusa station. Location: Around 3 mins walk from Asakusa metro exit. Right opposite the temple. Lots of eateries around.Take around 60mins to Asakusa from Narita airport via Keisei access (without transfer). A local supermarket is located right next to the hotel which is a big plus. The only drawback is Asakusa a bit far away from Shinjuku/Shibuya.Room: decent sized (~25 sqm), comfy bed and pillows. There is a Nespresso machine with 4 free capsules everyday.Toilet with separate bathtub/shower area, plus nice shampoo/bath gel. But would be nice if there is some quality body lotion.We are on 6\f. But no view from window (even our room is facing the skytree).I also love their air con system which allows to switch between cold and warm air mode.Service: Check in counter is located on 13/F. Staff speaks fluent English. You can walk up to 14/F (where a bar is located) to see great view of Skytree and asakusa area.The hotel also offers express check-out service, which means "make a call to front desk and leave your room cards inside the room" (if you have already paid the room charges beforehand)Would definitely recommend for those who wanna stay in Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is a good base for exploring Asakusa; it is located less than 100m away from Senso-Ji and there are many options for convenience marts, restaurants and shops nearby. I liked the modern decor of the hotel and the water pressure of the shower was just right. Room was not too small and loved the view of the Tokyo Skytree. Do check out the rooftop bar too; beautiful at night.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Quite a nice hotel. Located near the sensoji temple and Sky tree. Can also catch direct local train to Narita from Asakusa station.Rooms are quite big for Tokyo, for a reasonable rate. Nice lobby and roof top bar, with pretty nice views. Décor a bit daggy, but overall a nice stay

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Can't find any fault with this hotel, since the first we book (by email only) very fast respond and easy to communicate with. The room is a bit small but very comfortable, clean and has anything we need for our 2 nights stay. We are 2 adults and 2 kids (10 and 5 years old) so it's rare a hotel could accommodate all of us in the existing bed but this hotel is an exception. The essential room (make sure you book the holywood twin room so the beds are put together side by side) has 2 single beds (120cm width) so it's okay for us to sleep altogether. The mattress are comfy -- not as hard as other hotels we stay. Location wise is superb, very near to Gate Kaminarimon and the metro station, a lot of shops nearby so foods are not a problem. We stayed at Shinjuku area after this hotel and regret since this hotel's location and ambience is far better. We even got free breakfast (complimentary) as it is our anniversary, really appreciate it. Breakfast is provided with 3 optional menu to choose from (eggs benedict / curry rice / french toast) but juice and cereal and fruit is provided in the buffet table.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: With the help of a 'best of blog' I found The Gate Hotel, and it lived up to all expectations.Tokyo can be daunting for the first time traveller, and even the experienced find the language and pace challenging. Landing at Narita Airport after 7pm (from Brisbane) it is an hour's journey into the city and then on to your hotel. The staff here provided clear instructions on how to manage that journey - we chose the train, alighted at Ueno and took a taxi to the hotel - super easy and no lugging of bags. Superbly situated - close to the Senso-ji temple and Asakusa shopping area, we were able to grab a late-night meal of sushi and tempura, just a few blocks away from the hotel. We were also close by a convenience store for our breakfast [two of us have specific food requirements]. The hotel itself is tucked up in modern tower with a rooftop bar and views of the Tokyo Spire from reception. We walked our feet off around Tokyo but always there was our safe haven to return to. We stayed two nights before taking the Shinkansen to Kanazawa, had the train tickets and mobile wifi delivered to the hotel, not a hitch. Well done The Gate, we will be back.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: just completed our stay in this hotel for 4 nights. Superb location with easy access to great food, renowned pastries, great rail network and airport by rail for both Haneda and Narita airports. Staff are generally very helpful although language can be a little challenging. Only complaint if I have to name one is that the room is a little too dim especially if u need to do some desk-bound work or serious packing.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Tokyo is such a huge city, with thousands of hotels, so how does one choose? I thought Asakusa sounded like a safe bet, and it turned out to be an excellent choice, with loads to see and do. I also thought a rooftop bar sounded cool, so with that one requirement, ended up booking 5 nights at the Gate. Good hotel, with a reception that has the best views, run by staff that are a cut above the normal. Special shout out for Yuki! Getting from the metro to the hotel, use Asakusa line, find elevator, walk. If you use Ginza, it’s nearer but there is no elevator, and hauling a suitcase up a thousand steps isn’t fun.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is at great location where near to many famous and good restaurants, famous spot, pharmacies and Asakusa station. The kid enjoy the stay very much as after a day of tired walking, they can easily reach the room in a short distance from subway. The hotel provide an extra mile service that they helped us to look after our luggage for 6 days prior our stay, when we travel to disneyland, hakone and kawaguchiko. The luggage is already moved to our room upon our return to checkin. Thumbs up to the service. Coin laundry service will be more valuable if it can be available in the future. Overall, I would recommend to this hotel if you would consider to stay at Asakusa area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel locates at a very convenient place with direct train from the airport. Only 3 minutes walk you may reach the hotel. The lobby at 13th floor could see the beautiful view of Tokyo. I lived in the 8th floor, there is vending machine in the same floor. If you go to 14th floor bar in the evening, you may also enjoy the night view with a nice glass of wine. Outside of the hotel, you may find all kinds of Japanese restaurants. The only slight issue is that the breakfast has only four choices, if you live a little longer it might not be little simple. I would recommend my friends to go here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel in Asakusa, Tokyo is a great place to base yourself in Tokyo if you are spending a few days there. The hotel is well situated near the Asakusa metro station where you can catch a fairly fast train to Narita airport as well as linking to the Ginza line. It is almost opposite the wonderful Sentoji Temple with quite a good shopping area nearby. There is an excellent Information centre a few doors away, and a couple of supermarkets close. The rooms are small but adequate, and there is a great shower in the bathroom. Breakfast was good with freshly squeezed orange juice and honey from the comb.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights (no breakfast). Hotel is in a great location - very easy to get to from Narita airport and close to Tokyo metro lines (3 minute walk). The room I had was small but well laid out and it had everything you need - would have been too small for a couple.Location is close to the shrine (which is so beautiful first thing in the morning or later at night) and lots of good restaurants and food options within easy walking distance.View from rooftop is wonderful (albeit chilly in late November). I just put my coat on and enjoyed the view. I'd stay there again - safe, good and comfortable accommodation in a great location

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is simply awesome. First of all, the lobby is on the 13th floor and has sweeping views of Asakusa and the Tokyo Skytree. The 14th floor has a rooftop bar (indoor and outdoor with heaters for cold nights) and views to Mt. Fuji on a clear day from the other deck (see photo).The room decor is very cool, and everyone got a kick out of the egg lamps. Our room had a view of the Skytree and included a Nespresso machine, kettle and refrigerator. Asakusa is a lively neighborhood with something for everyone. If you enjoy photography it is nice to visit Senso-ji before the busloads of tourists arrive at 10:00 am or after they leave at 5:00 pm. The subway stop is nearby but be sure to try the water bus (especially the ultra-modern Hotoluna or Himiko) to Hamarikyu Gardens, Odaiba, or Hinode Pier. The Nakamise shopping street to the temple is loaded with souvenir shops and lots of interesting shops can be found on other nearby streets incuding Kappabashi (the kitchen supply area). Restaurants of all types and price ranges are nearby and there is a market on the main floor of the building.One of our favorite experiences in Japan was Ninja training at Ninja Samurai Dojo, a couple of doors down from this hotel. For Y6,000 my son was dressed as a ninja and learned various ninja skills including meditation, star shuriken, shuriken sticks, ninja blowgun, basic ninja sword technique and more. There are options starting at Y1,000 and all ages are welcome. We just walked in but I'm sure the helpful hotel staff can book you an appointment.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: very good location. I can take the train from Narita airport directly to the Asakusa station which is very near THE GATE HOTEL. There are many good restaurants near this hotel. They also have very good breakfast !!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Just recently stayed at The Gate Hotel. Fantastic location and very nice hotel. All staff were very friendly and went above and beyond for us on our visit. The hotel bar was great for a couple of drinks in the evening and even in the cold the roof terrace offers spectacular views of Tokyo (plus it had heaters)Rooms were decent size and very well equipped. Nespresso machine was a nice touch.Breakfast was set menu with some buffet foods. Overall the breakfast offered plenty of option and was very tasty.Would highly recommend The Gate Hotel for anyone visiting Tokyo

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Though the rooms were beautiful, the beds great, the location just beside the Sensoji Temple, one of Tokyo's grandest-looking temples, with its big, bold red gate, imposing temple buildings, and five-story pagoda.But more the breathtaking view every morning from the breakfast restaurang is worth the price. Just beside the Tokyo radio tower in the midth of Asakusa.Recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate hotel is a great value for your money. The rooms are large for Tokyo. The room is very clean and the accommodations are very nice. Our view of the SkyTree on the 9th floor was excellent. The beds were very comfortable. The location was great and close to the train that gets you anywhere in Tokyo. It was very nice to stay in a quiet and traditional neighborhood. The only knock I'd give the hotel is that the bar is lacking ambiance...... However, the service was good.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is in a fabulous location in Asukasa. Close to the subway stop, temple, restaurants & shopping. The staff is helpful, friendly & made us feel very welcome. Breakfast is lovely & very convenient.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Definitely one of the best value for money hotels in Tokyo. A good location and as mentioned an amazing guest-only rooftop bar offering an excellent choice of Japanese whiskies.Rooms are spacious for Tokyo-standards and very clean.Unless you are fluent in Japanese don’t bother turning on the tv as no foreign channels are broadcasted. Wifi is also a bit slow, something you would never expect such a technologically advanced country...

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel location is just across the street from the Asakusa Kaminarimon. There are a variety of shopping and eateries in the area. During the day there are a lot of tourist in the area, so its quite busy but not overly crowded; but it quiets down dramatically at night time, which is what we loved. Location wise, there is a subway stop just two blocks away, but the Asakusa line does need some train changing to get to the busy districts (ie.: Tokyo Station or Shinjuku). Its also just two stops away from the Skytree, which were visited.The check-in was quick and smooth. The staff was quite helpful with giving us directions, and had helped made of lunch reservations. There was an upper deck, one flight up from the reception with a beautiful of the Skytree.  We had the Twin Room, which was huge for Tokyo standard. All decorations and the bathroom was quite new, the beds were very comfortable.Overall a very pleasant stay! Will definitely return when visiting Tokyo!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It was my first time visiting The Gate Hotel after hearing a lot about it through sites. Great accommodation, comfortable specially the bed is super cosy! Thank you so much for your warm welcome. Would love to recommend family and friends.Nalinna

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: From even before we stepped into the hotel, the concierge service that was provided to us was amazing. In total I had exchanged more than 60 emails with the hotel, arranging everything from the room to tickets to an event, to obtaining information about the available trains from Narita and even making reservations at obscure but highly recommended sushiyas. The staff are highly conversant in English (at least) and are dedicated and proactive in helping to make the arrangements that you might need as a non-Japanese speaking foreign tourist with an over-ambitious holiday agenda. I sincerely doubt if you will find better service at the top branded hotels.The hotel itself is compact and throughly well-maintained.There's a very nice bar with a fantastic view and the lounge restaurant stays open and serves food till 3am. The hotel is also well-located with many very decent 24hr eateries within easy walking distance. Of course, the Asakusa train station is also very close by and connects to various key lines. The universal room is serviceable, with beds that are of a suitable height, unlike with many other hotels where the beds are just ludicrously high. The bathroom though is a little small because the bathtub has been retained, as is the practice with most universal rooms in Japan. Ask for photos if you need the the universal room, just to be sure.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My mum and I stayed here 2 nights on her arrival to Japan. I wanted her to have the best possible experience of Tokyo on her first ever trip here. Situated right in the hub of Asakusa looking out over Kaminarimon gate and famous Senso-ji. Our room had a spectacular view of Skytree.Rooms were not huge but spacious enough. Bathroom facilities were very nice and another great view of Tokyo station area from the bathroom, that can be seen off into the distance. The amenities supplied, such as pajamas, bathbombs, slippers were a real treat.The Hotel lobby is located on the 13th floor with a full view of the Asakusa shopping area. Mum and I had a drink at the hotel bar with a fantastic view of Skytree. There is a rooftop bar also with even better views of the Asakusa area. However when we went up there was some super intimidating official meeting going on (even though there was sign saying the bar should have been open) that was disappointing as mum and I would have loved a drink in the rooftop bar. Asakusa is insanely busy during the day! It’s very touristy and most of the shops are very gimicky. This may be attractive so some travelers. Me on the other hand, I’m not so much. However Asakusa at night becomes my favorite part of the city and a time where you can really feel the spirituality of the temple. I highly recommend! I know when mum comes to visit me in Japan again, we will probably stay again, we enjoyed it that much.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Cozy room (despite some smoking smell), easy to reach, walking distance to shopping and dining area. Top floor restaurant offer great view of Asakusa. However, due to metro subway renovation, going up and down the station requires some muscle, or walking to nearest elevator (2-3 blocks)

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Fantastic view on Tokyo skytree from our 12th floor spacious room. Quality bedding.Great breakfast buffet with quality products.Location is very convenient, close to several subway lines and 5 minutes train from Ueno station.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This boutique hotel was exactly what we were looking for during our recent visit to Japan. Very well maintained, with modern, contemporary furnishings and decor. The room we had was typical of Tokyo hotel rooms, not too small and not lavish but very comfortable and clean. One of the best things about this hotel, aside from it's central Asakusa location is the check-in floor and viewing deck, which overlooks Asakusa Temple with views of Tokyo Skytree. Well worth a visit even after you check in! As for location, it is right across the street essentially from one of the most visited temples in Tokyo, yet far enough (1/2 block) away that it doesn't feel touristy. There are locals who frequent the grocery store attached to the hotel and families that work and play in the area, so it gives you the best of everything. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: stayed here for our last night in tokyo and we werent disappointed , the reception on the 13th floor has views towards the tower and on the 14th they have a bar with happy hour where you can sit with a glass of bubbles and take in the view, staff are super friendly , room although expensive was very nice , location is great. I would stay again in a heart beat

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: When I traveled to Japan, I will try to stay at this hotel. But it always sold out quickly. The location is great, easy to get to and from both airports and Tokyo Metro. Of course you are across street from the famous Kaminarimon at Senso ji. The roof top bar gives you the best view of the city and sky tree. Starbucks and super market are down stair near by. The room is clean and modern, some might said on a smaller size. Again, it is the location. I enjoy my stay here and I am looking forward to my next trip already.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Spent 3 nights here and we were very pleased with location,service and quality of food. Stunning views towards the Skytree from reception and also great views from the bar and restaurant. Food and drinks are normall hotel prices and staff,as you would expect,very very helpful. My only slight grumble was our room on the 9th floor,could'nt get aircon below 19degrees,bit stuffy. Maybe a glitch but otherwise great.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My partner and I only stayed 2 nights, but it was an enjoyable stay. The staff were friendly and seemed to all speak English. The location is great, about a 5 min walk to the train station and shrine. The food at the restaurant was nice and the room was bigger than we expected. :) :) :)

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel doesn't have an incredible street presence, and we walked past it on more than one occasion when not paying attention, but it's what's inside that really makes this place spectacular.When you walk in off the street your only choice is one of three elevators, and the only floor you can access without a key is the lobby on the penultimate floor. This allows for some incredible views whilst waiting in the lobby and also whilst dining in the restaurant for either breakfast or dinner (limited outdoor balcony seating available - highly recommend if the weather is mild enough).The staff speak perfect English and they are able to help with everything from dinner suggestions to Takuhaibin (luggage forwarding).The top floor is home to an indoor bar, and outdoor balcony with stunning views of Tokyo Skytree (especially at night). To the rear is a smaller balcony for smokers.The bedroom was a reasonable size with a good, solid double bed. The bedside unit came with an easy to use built in alarm clock along with the usual master controls for lights. Air conditioning was barely audible and incredibly responsive; we felt a noticeable change in temperature almost immediately. Our room also came equipped with a humidifier which we had total control over.The Gate Hotel is a stone's throw from the Thunder Gate leading to Senso-Ji temple (via Nakamise shopping street). The main gate is currently covered for reconstruction, but they appeared to be taking some of the scaffolding down as we were leaving so I believe that the majority of the work may be coming to an end shortly.
user_name:
joyvwhite
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel is well located to visit local attractions such as Sensoji Temple and the Sky Tower. The Asakusa area was a really nice area of the city with lots of good restaurants nearby. The hotel offered great service throughout, the rooms were of a high standard. A particular highlight was the bar terrace on the top floor. When the weather is not so good there is also a cosy bar on this floor which offers a fantastic choice of cocktails. We ate in the restaurant one of the nights and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend this hotel, as a great base for anyone visiting Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Spent 3 nights in The Gate hotel, nice spacious rooms, good service and best of all, excellent location, loads nice restaurants near by, room over looked the temple and sky tower. Highly recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Really liked this hotel. Stayed 4 nights & it was a great location for starting our visit to Japan and Tokyo. Literally 3 minutes walk to metro. Reception team were happy to take delivery of wifi pack in advance of our arrival & helpfully arranged luggage forwarding for us too. Didn't eat in restaurant at hotel as lots of other good options nearby in streets off Orange St. Coffee shops for breakfast suited us better & lots of 7-11 stores within few minutes' walk for snacks. Nice rooftop bar with great views. Room size & bathroom was great & Nespresso machine & fridge were handy. It was a great choice of hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Loved this hotel. The staff, our room and location were perfect. Room with a great view and close to Sensoji Temple, Sky Tower and easy access to Asakusa Metro. Our first visit to Japan and first hotel and this really set the standard for the rest of our holiday. To cap it all there is a super roof terrace and bar with great views across Tokyo and the Sky Tower.
user_name:
Phil G
Leamington Spa, United Kingdom

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed at The Gate for 6 nights and our experience was a bit of a mixed bag! The rooms are clean with a good selection of toiletry items. The beds are comfortable enough however if you don’t like very soft pillows you will struggle! The Restaurant has a nice selection of food, although a little pricey. When ordering meals don’t expect all meals to come out together, it’s seems quite common throughout Japan that when the meals are cooked they come to the table. We had one experience where two others had eaten their meals before the third meal came. Whilst the staff appeared embarrassed the wait time was not explained to us prior to ordering. The staff are also extremely slow at clearing tables. Breakfast was a good selection of cooked eggs, anyway you like them, plus Japanese breakfast foods. A couple of mornings we had to wait for a table so if on time restrictions allow extra if hotel is busy. Lovely roof top bar with a great view of the Sky Tree. If the bar here is not open you can order from the bar downstairs and they will bring the drinks up to you. Here is where we encountered a few issues. Every night there was an issue with our bill and it was quite common to run out of a particular wine. So remember what you order and check the bill. We used the luggage forwarding service from here to Kyoto, (2 night stay in Hakone) an easy process and inexpensive. Our luggage arrived safely to our Kyoto Hotel.Location is great, so close to Sensoji Temple and the subway. Plenty of Restaurants however quite a few close early. We went to a great Japanese BBQ Restaurant right near the River Boat Cruise Office, and of course the walk from here to Asahi Beer Hall for a night cap is only ten minutes, great views. We also travelled the subway to Disneyland from here. Had an early morning start and encountered peak hour on the trains, a little daunting at first but once you get passed being packed like sardines, it’s a good 60 min trip – Asakusa / Ningyocho / Hatchobori / keiyo Line / MaihamaMost of the staff speak reasonable English, enough to get by with, I just feel they could be a little happier in delivering Customer Service. Overall a good hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great Hotel, stunning views from Reception and Roof top bar. Friendly Staff. Close to public transport. Lots of places to eat and drink close by. Grocery store next door and Starbucks ( if you like that). Large comfortable room with 2 twin beds. Overall great stay!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I have stayed here for 4 nights. Location is very great. But cleanliness is not so good as i heard from here. Hair was found between two pillows when i got in the room. Next day, the used teaspoons were still placed on the table after room makeup. Never throw away empty bottles. Because i stayed on lower level so i got lower level of service? I should ask for higher level next time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is better than my expectation. We have a big double room with space for a small sofa. It come with spacious toilet with nice shower room. Maybe more hanging places for coat or jacket around the room will be even better The triple room was small as my friends does not have any space left for the luggage after the 3rd bed is in place. Overall the hotel was very convenient and near to all the restaurants. It was just 2 Min walk to the famous Kaminarimon gate. It had awesome Tokyo night view at their 13 floor rooftop. We enjoyed our stay there.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed for a few nights at this property. The location is great, almost in front of the Kaminarimon gate. Being so close to the senso-ji temple gives you some unfair advantages - visiting the temple well before the crowds get started, and if you would like to spend some time in the evening after you are done with your day's sightseeing, that is also easy.The rooms were comfortable. Spacious for Tokyo standards. Staff was helpful and courteous.We did not have breakfast or any other food/drinks at the restaurant, hence cannot comment on those. There are many restaurants and fast-food joints within walk-able distance from this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights. Room was spotless. Good sized room for Tokyo. Had desk and single lounge chairs. We were lucky to have a corner room which gave a nice outlook over the street. Side rooms would be looking into the building next door. Small quibbles, lack of draws if you wanted to unpack and powdered milk instead UHT milk. Great views from roof top terrace. Ate at restaurant. Meals were nice but mains were brought out before we had finished entrees. Location was very handy for Asakusa district.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had a.classy room on the 10th floor with a great view of tower. Quiet. Staff is helpful and friendly. They really helped with questions beforehand, I emailed them numerous times and they replied quickly and were very reassuring. I was concerned that they didn't take my credit card when I made the reservation, but they said if we made the reservation through their website, it is not their policy to collect it beforehand. I also had tickets and a mifi delivered there and they emailed me when they received them. Also, when we left to transfer to another hotel due to our tour, they provided excellent taxi service. Bath is great...shower with rain shower head and handheld as well, a large tub. Robes, pjs, and slippers are provided. We weren't nuts about shampoo and soap. Refrigerator in room and safe. Good lighting. Bed is very hard, and loveseat was not great for extended sitting. Breakfast is nice. Choice of eggs Benedict, French toast, or scrambled eggs. Plus buffet of fruit, yogurt, cereal, and awesome orange juice and orange marmalade plus some cooked food. We waited a long time the first day, but after that it was quick to get the breakfast. Excellent cappuccino. Beautiful view from the rooftop bar. Please note if you are traveling with large suitcase from Narita, it is better to take the Skyliner to Ueno and then a taxi to hotel. The Lobby is on the 13th floor. Location is excellent for exploring Asukusa and Ueno.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: An excellent choice across the street from Senso-ji. The rooftop terrace bar and 13th floor lobby offer spectacular views of Tokyo Skytree, as do rooms on higher floors.I also liked the experience of staying in a more "low-rise" hotel rather than the high-rise properties I've selected (and enjoyed) on prior trips. It was convenient to be able to hit the ground for sight seeing or run out for a quick errand before bedtime a bit more quickly. What I most appreciated was the staff. From booking to checking out, they were kind and thoughtful. It was surprising to receive a personal phone call from Yuki to reassure my email query regarding my booking after the hotel response by email couldn't get past my security. For those reviewers who have complaints about language barriers or reserve (which is characteristic), maybe try to learn a bit of Japanese before your next trip. Or, do some research on your own. Also, just try to get this level of service in Paris or New York at any price, in any language. Yeah, good luck with that. Breakfast was abundant with Western egg dishes cooked to order as well as a buffet spread. The Eggs Benedict were especially well prepared. And, it's delivered fast, which is great unless you're in Japan just to eat breakfast all day. The location is very convenient with Senso-ji across the street and other attractions like Kappabashi less than 10 minutes by foot. Asakusa station is one block away, with 3 stops to Ueno or 6 stops to Ginza. Both are transfer points to other major subway lines and Shinkansen. Speaking of prices, the hotel is surprisingly affordable. Basic rooms are a bit small so I would encourage visitors to upgrade to a Scenic or Classy room for a bit more space.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: For a small space, the room is well designed, you don't feel cramped. Our room had a desk, bench space & comfortable couch. As we were on the 12th floor, amazing views too! As other reviewers have said, perfect position to access railway, some great restaurants virtually across the road. We didn't have such a good experience as others with the food in hotel restaurant however. For dinner there was not one Japanese dish offered on the menu. It was "Italian" - Pasta, carpaccio, etc. The deep fried soft shelled crab was oily and burnt. My dish of raw, julienned vegetable(noodle) encased in tofu skin on a thin tomato sauce was luke warm and very tasteless. We were very impressed that the chef personally came to hear our complaint. The breakfast was also very westernised (we like to eat the food of the country we're in) although beautiful fresh orange juice, delicious pineapple and excellent espresso..

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We have been guests at this property 3 times and have always enjoyed our stays! Modern, stylish and spacious. Designed to allow you to have a very restful stay from a very comfortable bed, to a fantastic shower! Great views on the higher floors, and a perfect bar!
user_name:
FHSNYC
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here for two nights during our stay in Tokyo, before moving on to other Japanese cities. The hotel rooms are located on the upper floors of a 13 storey building close to Asakusa station and the bustling shopping/ eating/ temple area. It really is a calm oasis in the middle of all of that bustle. From the moment of arrival, the service is personal, friendly and just excellent. The rooms are a good size and have a number of nice touches (for example, the heated bathroom mirror, to avoid it steaming up). They are also very clean. The hotel has a lovely roof top bar, with both an indoor and outdoor area. Be warned, however, that the outside area can be very windy at times! The selection of Japanese whiskies is extensive! We would definitely stay here again! Great value too!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was out last stop in Japan before heading back home. This was chosen strictly due to location. Other factors came into my research as usual: cleanliness, safety, and price. Lets start with the obvious. This is an affordable clean hotel that is just a minute from the Asakusa Station on the Ginza Line. It is close to the Asakusa Line which gets you to Haneda airport, NRT airport, and Disney Resorts Tokyo.The hotel check in desk is situation on the 13th floor. It also has an open air lookout on the 14th floor which looks directly at Tokyo Skytree (beautiful). The hotel is clean and does has a little modern contemporary feel. All food services are served through the 13th floor restaurant which is 24/7.Room 5/5: The room itself was very small, but that’s to be expected. It was modern, clean, had plenty of amenities, and the bathroom was very spacious relative to other hotels. The room décor was quite dark on the colour palate as I prefer something brighter, but that’s me simply sharing this info for those that like bright places to stay. The view I had was towards Senso-ji temple, it was beautiful.Location 5/5: Fantastic location. You are across the street to all of the main attractions in Asakusa, minutes away from the train station that takes you to Tokyo Skytree or into central Tokyo, and minutes away from the Senso-ji temple. And I mean less than 10 minutes. The area itself is very safe and has many convenience stores should you ever need a quick meal, snack, or anything at all.Service 4/5: As expected, the service is great. I would like to mentioned that my personal experience wasn’t really wow-ed. They were polite and courteous as all other hotel staff in Japan were, but they were just ‘doing’. I can’t explain it in another word. I didn’t feel the warm fuzzy hospitality as I felt in other hotels. Please note that I have very high expectations of the hospitality from hotels in Japan; therefore, this is why this is still a 4 out of 5 because they were still great. They didn’t exceed expectations, that’s all.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Second time I stayed this hotel. Strongly I recommend this hotel. Location is only 3 mints from Asakusa station and close to Kaminarimon, skytree. specially i love lobby area and Roof top bar & inside bar is amazing skytree view. Roop top bar only can access in house guests not much people and can enjoy and cill out. in this time from my room bath could see beautiful skytree. also I love Breakfast here. so nice atmosphere and good taste. perfect stay in Asakusa!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Breakfasts are ratherJapanese influenced. But you can still enjoy if you ask for eggs well done or sauce on the side for florentine eggs.Evening dinners are great. Within walking distance to 3 train stations and a street down from the Information centre. A 20 minute walk to the sky tree, you can pay more being a tourist and skip a queue but it is only 10minutes wait unless you have a problem with waiting. We met lovely students while we waited, they were thrilled we were from Austrealia.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Arriving after the long trip from the east coast of the USA this was a perfect hotel for myself and my family. The decor is contemporary but very comfortable. The amenities such as pajamas laid out for us and bath salts made my families transition to Japan fantastic. My husband and I were traveling with our 2 children in their early twenties. We had connecting rooms which was great. The staff was friendly and incredibly service oriented. There is a spectacular view of Tokyo from the lobby which is located upstairs. The small buffet breakfast had both western and eastern choices, which was a great way to start our day. The hotel is close to the subway station making it very easy to get around.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My boyfriend and I enjoyed 2 nights in a room facing the Tokyo Sky Tree and it was perfect — the best nights of our 10 day trip. Our sleep was very comfortable. All staff at The Gate Hotel spoke great English and were incredibly hospitable and cheerful. The breakfast buffet setting has an unobstructed 180 degree view of the cityscape of Asakusa.The neighbourhood feels peaceful and very safe even late at night and is just a street away from the train station which was very convenient.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The staffs have been very helpful, from the beginning of my reservation until the end of my stay. I went with 2 young kids and the staffs kindly suggested the best room at the best price to me. The room was definitely comfortable for a family of 4 in Tokyo standard. My kid was sick during the stay and the staffs offered help immediately and were extremely helpful.I really have to thank the staffs for giving my family an enjoyable stay! Will certainly go back there next time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Enjoyed 3 nights here and really appreciated the beauty and comfort of the hotel as well as its excellent location. The Gate Hotel is a close walking distance to temples, a tourist information center, and the Ginza and Asakusa metro lines. There's also a market right under the hotel. We arranged luggage delivery here without a problem and got a lot check out for a small fee. The breakfast buffet is not a typical Japanese buffet, but really high quality food. This hotel has an elegant and classy atmosphere and one night we enjoyed drinks on the top viewing deck which was a quiet place with a great view. I slept so well here. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great view and great location, right on the Kaminari-mon street. Many restaurants and shops within walking distance. Close to the subway station (and rickshaws!) too. Fourteenth floor terrace has a great view of the Skytree, Asakusa and beyond. I could see the Ferris wheel in Yokohama. There's little bar by the terrace, and you can order from there. There's a larger bar/restaurant on the 13th floor right next to the front desk and the lobby (again, great view!). Nice ambiance, food and drinks! The rooms are nice too. Loved the Japanese style (has a washing area outside of the tub) bathroom. Triple room had the toilet separate from the bathroom, so that was nice. They have a Nespresso coffee maker and an air purifier in each room.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel has good location near subways and have amaizing views at lobby.It's next to Asakusa Temple.There are many convinence store and restaurants.There is one 24h Donki Quixote the distance of walking for 10 minutes.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had a very nice stay in this hotel. The staff were lovely and very accomodating. We really enjoyed that we could open the window. The room was a bit small for us, as we had to do some computer work in the room, but for most people they would be fine. Smaller room then what we would be used to in Australia. The location was great as we wanted to explore Asakusa and district and the view from level 14 was lovely. We arrived on the 4th July and were treated with a beer and a snack to celebrate American Independence Day. The restaurant looked very popular, but I didn't eat there. The hotel is located right in the middle of everything, so many restaurants and shops all around you. The security to the each level was very good. The supermarket straight underneath was so convenient too and stayed open until 9pm. The hotel is located just a short distance from the train station too.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We've stayed at the Gate hotel for 5 nights on our holiday in Tokyo. Love the hotel, the location is great just a few mimutes walk to the temple and subway stations in Asakusa. There are so many restaurants in the area to choose. The hotel is very nice and modern. The reception is on the 13th floor which you will get the great view of the Tokyo Skytree. Make sure to visit the hotel roof top terrace where you will get the fantastic view of Tokyo. Our room was very nice, clean and modern with a walk in shower and bathtub. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Will certainly stay at the Gate hotel Asakusa again on our next visit to Tokyo. Highly recommended !!!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Value for money and perfectly located in the center of Asakusa. 2 minute walk to kaminarimon and 3 minute walk to metro. Room size is bigger than usual Tokyo hotels. A relax 30 minute walk to Tokyo sky tree.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was a great place to stay. The location was terrific (interesting Asakusa, grocery store next door, a few minutes from the subway and the train from Haneda). The view from the top floor lobby and restaurant and from the roof terrace was fantastic. (Not much view from our room, so we went upstairs to lounge). The beds were indeed very comfortable (the Hollywood twin beds are larger than a US twin) and there was even space for a small sofa although closet and shelf space was limited. (Getting a luggage rack helped.) And I was delighted that the bathroom had shelves for toiletries. Our rate included the excellent breakfast. On 3 mornings we were seated right away; we waited (10 minutes) for a table on Sunday. Pressed for time, we had lunch at the hotel our last day and thoroughly enjoyed the fusion salmon. The climate controls were a bit mysterious until we asked and the front desk gave us a printed sheet with English translations. The one downside was that the internet was very slow. I'd happily stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Amidst the hustle and bustle of the lively Asakusa area you find your oasis at the Gate Hotel. The lobby on the 13th floor has floor to ceiling windows offering a super view of the city that you enjoy also from the restaurant where breakfast is served. I recommend getting the breakfast in your package.
