You can also enjoy the view from the 14th floor terrace (warning only accessible by stairs) that is open for guests only and no one bothers you if you do not want a drink - if you just want to chill and enjoy the view. The rooms are tight but well appointed and the bathroom is super (who does not love a Japanese toilet!). You also get pajamas and the cleaners do a great job. The location could not be beat - near the subway and JR for access to the rest of Tokyo and the Asakusa area is full of restaurants and shops. For those Americas who cannot live without Starbucks, there is one just a few doors down. I have to thank the staff that heard me say it was our wedding anniversary (just happened to be) and left us some little toiletries and a sweet note. Thank you! All the staff were very polite and professional.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed for 4 nights in a single room for around 12,800 JPY per night including breakfast. The hotel is located in Asakusa with excellent transport connections and close to the Senso-Ji temple. The room was small but comfortable with good quality ameneties. The internet connection was fast and reliable. Breakfast was delicious, especially the freshly squeezed orange juice! The terrace offers wonderful views of the Tokyo Skytree but it was a little cold to spend too long outside in March. The staff were professional and courteous, as to be expected in a modern Japanese hotel.I think this is a superb location for a visit to Tokyo, particularly if flying in to Narita. For food, there is a supermarket close by which has reasonably priced options for lunch. There is also the sushi restaurant which other reviewers have mentioned but you only have to go a little further to find great options for restaurants.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Located just about 250m from Asakusa Station, The Gate Hotel is near many eateries and bars. You can have supper at the popular Ichiran before heading to A.S.A.B (a quaint and cozy bar) for drinks. If you're up for a louder and more vibrant kind of bar, pop by Hub Jazz Bar for live performances and mingle with the crowd! If you prefer to drink in the hotel, The Gate has got you covered with their private bar that is exclusive to hotel guests. Knock back a couple of cocktails as you revel in a splendid view of the iconic Skytree.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel design is modern & minimalist Location is convinience, surrounding by places to eat, shops, temple, next to train station.Front Office members able to speak English and helpful.Recommended hotel

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed for 7 nights in a Hollywood twin room and would return in a heartbeat, we really loved this hotel. As compared to many old and poorly maintained mid-range hotels in Tokyo, this hotel is beautiful and modern, despite a weird green and brown colour scheme. The view from the lobby and many rooms is simply breathtaking, with full views of the Tokyo skyline and the Skytree. There is also a lovely rooftop bar with a good happy hour special and amazing views. The rooms were modern, spotlessly clean and quite spacious for Tokyo (approx 25 sq metres). We were comfortable with two suitcases. The bathroom, whilst small, was very thoughtfully designed with an excellent shower with high water pressure, and even a heated mirror so it didn't fog up after you use the shower. The Japanese toilet was fun too. The location couldn't be better, literally across the road from both the Kaminarimon Gate and Senso-ji temple, and the Asakusa subway station on the Asakusa and Ginza lines, providing easy access across the city. There are innumerable restaurants, cafes, coffee shops and takeaways within minutes of the front door. The staff were really friendly and helpful, and even brought us an iron to the room when we asked for one, and a lady went out of her way to sort out a mess of my own making with tickets for the Ghibli Museum. Wifi was fast and worked well. I would recommend this place to anyone coming to Tokyo and planning on staying at a hotel in the mid-range price bracket, and will return here next time I am in Tokyo. My only criticism is no English TV channel at all - BBC news or similar would be appreciated.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel in Asakusa is a modern stylish and comfortable Hotel with convenient access to many of the great sights of Tokyo. Our room looked out on the magnificent Skytree tower but with easy walking access to Kaminarimon ,Senso-Ji temple , Ueno and dozens of great restaurants . Plus easy access to the extensive Tokyo subway system.Our essential twin room was very comfortable with a separate walk in shower and bath. Staff were extremely helpful with all of our queries. We will definitely be staying at the Gate Hotel next time we visit Tokyo

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: You usually hear horrid stories of Tokyo hotel room sizes but this one is generously big. The location is fantastic - close to the metro station lines and close to the Senso-ji shrine. If you pick the 12th floor, pick the side facing the Sky tree, the view is stunning. The rooms are very family friendly. There are several restaurants and coffee shops downstairs. And there's a supermarket in case you want to pick up some fresh fruits.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good1. Nice location, closed metro station & water bus station2. Nice view of skytree, when you stand at lobby or top floor3. Very closed Kaminarimon, only walk 2 mins4. Nice and kindly staff5. Room with bathtub, relax your body after shopping all dayBad1. Use email booking room, respond time very slow, each replied email you will may wait to next day

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My friend and I stayed here for our last leg of our two week trip around Japan. We found the lobby and rooftop deck to be a nice refuge from the busy, busy streets near the senso-Ji temple. They have a great happy hour on the rooftop. The location is close to the metro and nearby to the river and senso-Ji temple. The only reason that I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 stars is because we ended up with a smoking room instead of a non-smoking room. Make sure to note non-smoking room when making the reservation.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here. We had a Scenic room on the 10th floor and it actually was scenic, with a great view of Skytree and a glimpse of Senso-ji. It was also really nice-sized and the beds were super comfortable. The folks at the front desk were friendly and helpful. We ate breakfast at the restaurant one morning and dinner one night and while it was fine it seemed too expensive for what you received. However there were a lot of other great options close by. The location was great: easy train ride from Narita; we walked to Skytree to see more of the area; Asakusa Station is just a few blocks away and was a great jumping off point. It was quite reasonably priced and I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is a short walk from the Asakusa station on the Ginza subway line (Exit 2), and a great launching point for anything in Asakusa. If you don't mind a subway transfer for I think 110 yen, or a little walking (I think maybe a , it's very easy to get to Ueno Station (train), which opens up pretty much all of Japan.The hotel itself was roomy for Japan. The beds are very comfortable. The views are generally nice, although the best view is from the lobby (it's a fantastic view of the Tokyo Sky Tree). The bathroom isn't cramped, but if you have a lot of toiletries, there is not a lot of space to lay things out. The bathroom has heated mirrors so they're fog-resistant. That's a nice touch. The hotel staff is very polite, professional, and helpful. On check-in, our clerk wrote out maps and instructions for our two taxi caravan to take us to Tsukiji the next morning, complete with highlights. Working the climate control is a little challenging if you don't understand the language. Our unit made a little weird water trickle sound, but it wasn't troublesome. The rooms are pretty soundproofed from each other, but you can hear hallway noise (which isn't a surprise). If you want to do your own laundry, there's a laundromat directly east down Kaminarimon Street about a half mile (the road jigs slightly right at Kokusai). 300 yen wash (it auto-supplied detergent), and 100 yen for 10 minutes of dry (2 cycles should do). You're welcome!
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
EliN691
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate is a wonderful little hotel right near the Senso-ji temple and minutes from both the subway and the lovely river. Our rooms were spacious and included a nespresso maker and fabulous Toto toilet. A lot of fun. The shower was in a small room within the bathroom that also contained the tub. This was common in Japan. Our beds were extremely comfortable. We had street views from the room, but the reception/bar/restaurant floor and guest-only roof bar had wonderful skyline views. Fresh off the plane, we awoke early enough every morning to be first in line for breakfast, which was good. By the time we were leaving for the day, there was a line to get into the small restaurant. There was a small buffet and then hot items made to order. The food was tasty--as was the sake offering at dinner. The staff was unbelievably friendly. I had received a gift of flowers in my room from a friend and they were in perfect shape when it was time for us to leave. I gave them to the front desk to enjoy and they subsequently found me to deliver a thank you note and small gift in return. Lovely gesture. Although Asakusa is a bit of a hike from many of the other parts of Tokyo you are likely to visit, it was a very nice base for a few days.
user_name:

New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The mirrors is colorfulNice view on top floor The lamp always like eggThe receptionist friendlySo,it is a beautiful and comfortable hotelIt located near metro Asakasa stationYou can find it easier

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: just a Little hard to find the exit a2b (asakusa line) if there is an picture map showing on websitethat will be perfect. after all me and my family had enjoy so much that we believe is such a right choice for staying her.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate is located in the heart of vibrant Asakusa, virtually opposite the lanes leading up to the Senso-ji temple. The area is thus very lively day and night and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants available for a meal a snack or a drink.The hotel comprises the upper floors of a modern block and features a (nearly) rooftop restaurant and roof-top bar with superb views over Tokyo.Rooms were comfortable, clean, modern and big enough, but not luxuriously so.Staff were helpful, friendly and the breakfast perfectly adequate (very good croissants!).The only downside is the location. It's perfect for exploring Asakusa and neighbouring wards but if you are exploring Tokyo as a whole something more central or close to a transport hub might suit better.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Right in the middle of Asakusa. Great location.So easy to get there from Narita airport. Get the Keisei electric train to Asakusa station and then it's a 2 minute walk to the hotel. Room wasn't ready so we had a quick lunch in the hotel restaurant. It's open 24 hours so handy for a drink before bedtime. Room was big, especially for Japan. Absolutely perfect. Only criticism is the decor. Carpets and doors throughout the place are a cheap green. There's a roof terrace with a bar. Nice setting in the evening.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Chose the hotel because of location and rates. Direct subway line from Haneda to Asakusa. You can get to some attractions on foot, the rest is easy accessible by subway. Supermarket is in the same building. Room was bigger than expected, bed super comfy. You have a fridge, nice bathroom and everything is super clean. Rooftopbar gives u a great view and last but not least the staff is great.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great views and good location makes it a great choice to enjoy a wonderful area of tokyo.I think staying there for the whole time in tokyo is wrong as there are more interesting areas but it is a great place to stay for a night or two and get to enjoy the area :)Rooms are really nice and the bathroom was super big :)

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We recently stayed there and could not fault this fabulous place . Wonderful and friendly staff . It is in a great location and reasonable prices for Japan.Our room was very spacious with a walk in shower .Close to the hub of activities . I be back . Thank you.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We chose The Gate Hotel for its location and we were mostly pleased with our choice. We travelled from Narita by Skyliner which terminates at Ueno just 3 stops from Asakusa station which itself is just a few steps from the hotel. Reception (on the 13th floor) was fast, friendly and helpful, the room, a beautiful corner room on the 9th floor, was comfortable, clean and also spacious for Tokyo. The bathroom quite functional with a great shower and the beds were perfectly comfortable. We can't fault it for comfort and convenience and quality of sleep. Our room had a great view along Kaminarimon Street to the Tokyo Skytree. One reason we chose this hotel was the proximity of lots of little sidestreets and alleys which we knew to be full of little cafés and restaurants. In this respect though we were disappointed since most of them don't open until 10 or even 11 am and also close early at 6 pm, so we were forced to look elsewhere for meals. On one day we chose to eat the Hotel's breakfast and in this we were disappointed again. A meagre buffet breakfast supported by a few à la carte entrées did not really set us up for the day as we had hoped. On a bright note, the bar on the 13th floor has an excellent lady bartender who mixes probably the best Dry Martini we have enjoyed anywhere. Sadly on the dates of our return to Tokyo from Kyoto, The Gate Hotel is fully booked and so we have to go elsewhere, otherwise we would happily return.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My sister and I stay here in May. WOW what a great place to stay.The staff here were really great in helping if you need to go somewhere. The room were really clean and we had a great view from the 7 floor. The rooftop view is OUT OF THIS WORLD.and it great way to enjoy a drink day or night.We eat at the restaurant for dinner and what can i say the food we had was bloody amazing.To get to this hotel was easy coming from Tokyo Station it 1stop get off at Kanda then go to the Ginza Line you got to buy a ticket to ASAKUSA that where the train stop .find exit 2 or 4 and it a 5 min walk to the Hotel. All i can say is a great place to base yourself here easy to get around .cheers

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: above all, thank you so much about my clothes.actually i missed my clothes, when i packed my luggage to leave there.so i requested to you that you send me it and you got my problem with kindness.i got back my clothes thanks to you.Thanks you soso much.i want go there again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This boutique hotel is conveniently located a few meters from Asakusa Subway station and opposite Senso-ji temple and the adjoining cute open market of Nakamise dori. The view of Tokyo Skytree tower from the bar is magnificent (and just a short walk away). The friendly and very helpful staff, the well appointed rooms, the excellent beds, all contribute to a nice experience. I could have done with a few more 'western' breakfast options but all in my group of six friends found it adequateThe only drawback I could see is that every restaurant, shop, bar etc around this area is closed by 10pm. If one wanted night entertainment they would have to go to a different district

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good location and nice staff. Good view at the rooftop. Curry for the breakfast is really delicious, you cannot miss to try it. The pillow is very comfortable (it's very important for a nice sleep during the travel). Everything is good.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Enjoyed our stay here very much. Breakfast choices/buffet were excellent. Room was clean. If you're a sensitive anti-smoker and if you're slightly bothered by maybe a faint, lingering smell of cigarettes, there's a room spray available. Will definitely stay here again. Location is tops for sightseeing and shopping. From the restaurant, you get a fantastic view of the Skytree Tower. Don't forget to go up the terrace to enjoy the breathtakingly beautiful views of Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed one night at The Gate Hotel before returning to the States. They were very nice and the restaurant was fancy. They even had a cute apple tea display with apples when we arrived because it was April Fool's Day and it had something to do with apples way back when. They really impressed us after we left. We arrived back home to discover that we had left our son's Samurai Mickey Mouse in the room. He was sooo sad. I emailed the hotel, they found it and would not even let me pay to have it mailed back. They mailed it back so quickly, too. Very kind and thoughtful of them. They saved the day!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our group of three well-traveled 55+ year old adults from the USA were extremely pleased with the accommodations, amenities and service at this property in Asakusa district of Tokyo. Our review starts well before arriving with friendly and prompt responses from Ayako Ishida to our endless number of pre-planning questions. Advise and instructions were spot-on and we arrived via train from Haneda Intl Airport without a problem (Ayako directed us to the best station exit with an elevator to manage our luggage). We arranged for a portable wifi from PuPuRu which was delivered prior to our arrival and waiting for us in our room. We booked two corner rooms for 8 nights from April 7 to 15 - just in time for the Cherry Blossoms to erupt in the city. Both rooms were large with two twin beds, desk, seating area, TV, wifi, alarm/radio, safe, small closet, refrigerator, tub, shower and yes, one of those crazy electronic toilets. Amenities included Nespresso coffee maker and 4 coffee pods (daily), hot water kettle, cups and supplies; shampoo, conditioner and body wash; and hair shower cap, toothbrush, combs, face wash, hand foam, and pajamas. The rooms have central air conditioning and heating - although we did have to ask for help in setting our systems. Corner rooms have floor to ceiling windows that overlook the Sensoji Temple and we loved the view especially at night. Unlike most USA hotels the lobby, restaurant and bar are located on the top 13th floor with the rooms located below - so the entry is a bit unwelcoming with only elevators. Once you arrive at reception - all of your initial fears quickly melt away. The views are stunning in all directions, finishes are beautiful and reception staff attentive and helpful. Our room rate included breakfast which consisted of menu items (scrambled eggs, over-easy eggs or pancakes) and buffet items (salad, pasta, yogurt, cereal, potatoes and more). They pride themselves with hand-pressed fresh orange juice and honey from freshly harvested bee hives. An outside lounge and bar are upstairs from reception and the views are not to be missed (guest only). The hotel is close to all major systems of transport - trains from the airport, trains to escape the city, metro and subway lines. You can even take a rickshaw to tour the Asakusa precinct. A well stocked grocery store is conveniently located next to the hotel entry if you need any special items or stock up snacks. We loved staying in Asakusa and found it to be a more traditional and quieter part of Tokyo. We highly recommend this property.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The neighborhood is very nice, quieter than other Tokyo neighborhoods, but with many restaurants. If you are looking for nightlife maybe this is not the ideal, but if , after dinner , you do not look for nightlife, if you want to stay in a nice place this is perect for you! The near temple , the river!With the metro ginza line, without changing, you arrive almost anywhere, from Narita you reach the hotel directly without any train or subway change! Great for our first stay. The English speaking staff is very nice! The view from the lobby and bar is spectacular! The room we had was very large, impeccable cleanliness, huge bathroom! The best breakfast made in 14 days in japan, I still remember the benedict eggs , the granola, the honey, the orange juice they make fresh!I recommend it and hope to get back soon

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Arrived at this hotel after staying in a very average hotel in Kyoto. What a gem The Gate Hotel is! Very reasonable tariffs for downtown Tokyo $210/night for twin share room. Fabulous in-room amenities and beautifully appointed - comfy beds and pillows and Nespresso machine (v happy to find this after exp with coffee in Kyoto!) Rooftop bar is a must and restaurant serves good mix of western and eastern style food at moderate prices. No room service or mini bar but restaurant and bar open 24/7. View from reception on 13th floor is stunning. Highly recommend

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great Hotel with an amazing view. Rooms were clean. Terrace on the top of the hotel was incredible. Asakusa is not on the JR line so if you have a pass - you should go to Ueno Station and then take the metro in Asakusa. A few blocks down the road you can take a cruise for about $10 which was excellent. The restaurant is overpriced so do yourself a favor and find a place to eat in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights and was able to settle in and really enjoy my stay. The rooms are spacious and well decorated with a super comfy bed. The staff are really friend and helpful and the view from the 13th floor restaurant is fabulous. The hotel is in a great location, close to transport links and great restaurants. All in all it's great value.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My wife and I stayed at The Gate Hotel for 4 nights in April, 2017. We loved our stay and would definitely stay here again. The location is in Asakusa, one block from the Sensoji Temple. We liked this area better than the busier shopping areas of Shinjuku, Shibuya, and Gion. It is a convenient 2 block walk to the Asakusa Station where other areas of Tokyo can be reached easily.We stayed in a 12th floor Classy King Double Room (Style C) with an excellent view of the Tokyo Skytree. You can also see the Kaminarimon Gate, entry to the walking street leading to the Sensoji Temple. The Classy King Double is spacious at 397 sq ft and has a couch in the sitting area. The room is tastefully decorated. The bathroom area is modern with the toilet in its own separate room.The reception as well as breakfast room are located on the 13th floor. Both areas have scenic views of Asakusa. All the staff were pleasant, courteous, and spoke good English. We enjoyed the excellent breakfast every morning. You get a choice of one main dish (scrambled eggs, French toast, eggs Benedict, or a curry dish). In addition, there is a breakfast buffet with fresh squeezed orange juice, various breads, salads, cooked vegetables, fruits, cereal, and yogurt.Pros:- Large Style C Classy King Double room: modern and tastefully decorated- View from our room and lobby on 12th floor of Tokyo Skytree and Kaminarimon Gate- Staff provided excellent service- Perfect neighborhood in older and quieter Asakusa- Conveniently located: 1 block to Sensoji Temple, 2 blocks to Asakusa Station, 1/2 block to food market, many restaurants nearby- Good breakfast buffet with choice of main dish- Small in-room refrigerator- 2 complementary bottles of water every dayCons:- Internet can get very slow during morning and evening busy hours. At times it was unusable so we used our Mi-Fi instead.Tips:- Food market almost directly downstairs from the hotel for fresh fruits- Breakfast starts at 6:30am. Go at this time before the tour groups arrive.- When taking the metro at Asakusa Station, use Exit 1, the closest to the hotel- If your budget allows, pay extra for a larger room on a higher floor- From Haneda airport, take the easy Keikyu train directly to Asakusa Station. Take the Exit A2b elevator if you have luggage that you don't want to carry up lots of stairs.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was am amazing hotel for the price (we got a good deal on an Orbitz package with flight). The room had plenty of space, was very clean and nicely appointed. The best shower I've ever had in a hotel! The view from the reception - floor 13 - was amazing. This is the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in. We wouldn't have known there were other guests if we hadn't seen them in the elevator. But the best thing is the location. Right across the street from the main gate of the shopping street leading to Sensoji temple and a block from the Asakusa Station subway stop. I think it is the perfect central location for a Tokyo vacation.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved staying here several years ago and made it a point to stay here again on our most recent trip back. As a surprise, they put us in the same wonderful well-appointed jewel-box of a room that we had previously. The artwork and paint had been changed, but the room still had the same great bathing and toilet facilities, refrigerator and views of Asakusa and Kaminarimon Gates. As before, the employees were very helpful and this trip it seemed the staff we encountered were more confident in their English, just as we were more confident in our pitiful smattering of Japanese. It is a joy to stay here.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at the gate hotel visiting for he first time the city of Tokyo .The is in great area of the city and very easy to get any place using the subway .The service is excellent .The hotel was s very quite and have a wonderful view from the lobby and a great baron the roof .

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed there twice in ten days, same room upper floor. Excellent location, helpful staff for checking in and checking out. Very good breakfast, fresh squeezed orange juice is a great bonus. View from lobby and roof top are excellent.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I like a lot of people ummed and arhed over where to stay in Tokyo. I am so glad that we choose this hotel. If you want direct access to the shopping malls etc this isn't for you. But if you want peace and quiet and an amazing view choose the Gate Hotel with a Tokyo Tower view. The view is really worth the extra money, it was amazing to watch the skyline in a thunder storm and see the city waking up in the mornings. The subway is within a 5 minute walk and it was easy to access all areas of the city. Shibuya is about 40 mins on the subway. It was also great to be able to see this older part of the city at night with no other tourists. We departed from Tokyo Narita Airport and we got a cab to Uneo Keisei station and then a direct train to Narita, The cab dropped us at the back of the station so no heaving of heavy luggage required and it was on one level at the other end. Just as an aside we stayed the night in Narita which is a really lovely town with a beautiful temple (larger, more beautiful and a lot quieter than Tokyo).We ate outside of the hotel and there is masses to choose from traditional sweets (always a queue for that shop) to Burger King in walking distance. There is also a great supermarket on the ground floor. It plays western music on loop including Sam Fox I want to feel your body, took me right back to the 80s.Rooms are dark wood and modern with very comfortable beds and the best shower I have ever experienced. There was also a small seating area with a comfy sofa. The reception is on the top floor with a bar and restaurant and then a viewing place a little higher. To access your room you use your key card and then it lets you out at that floor, added security. Staff spoke good English and were really helpful. Sky Tree, Cook's town and a beautiful park lit at night to view cherry blosom all within walking distance.We posted our cases to Tokyo, cost £21 and they were waiting in out room for us when we arrived.Highly recommend.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A good place to stay. this hotel locates at Asakusa with a few minutes walks to metro Ginza and Asakusa Lines. It has a very nice upper floor lobby and terrace to view the city and sky tree tower. The staff at front desk and bar are very friendly to help from booking to check-out, including reminding emails and assisting restaurant bookings. The breakfast I had were very good and its quality was above the average of similar hotels in Tokyo. The room is sort of small for a four-star hotel (comparing to that in USA or UK) but is tidy, clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Close to the subway and good facilities this hotel was our base in our final leg of our Japan tour. Close to Haneda airport we enjoyed our stay here. Bad points were poor wifi speed, poor air conditioning, smallish room and empty mini bar, but the bar is open 24 hours.Good points are good location, good bathroom and the restaurant offers good reasonably price food.Finally, didn't think the breakfast was very good. Poor selection from the buffet. Given the choice I would pay less at eat elsewhere

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is a small boutique hotel with a lovely reception area that looks right out on Tokyo Tower. The room was a good size with all the amenities you need. The breakfast was nice with freshly squeezed orange juice and western breakfast options as well as Japanese breakfast.The location of the hotel is in a lovely, relatively quiet area with a train station nearby. This station is not a JR station so you will have to change trains to use the JR line. Also be aware there is no direct JR train route from the airport. We decided to pay for the express train from Narita airport to Uneo station and change to Asakusa.We found it easy to navigate the subway so it was nice to return from our sightseeing to this neighbourhood and the convenience of the hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Exceeded expectations! The Gate is a lovely, modern, chic hotel right in the heart of Asakusa, which is the nicer, older part of Tokyo. Lovely rooms, comfy bed. Rooftop bar has the wow factor & has seating inside as well as out with heaters! Great value for money compared to other hotels of similar standard in Tokyo. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel is nice, rooms "big" to be in Japan, with decent shower. Staff competent and very useful. Very lovely view from the reception at the 13th floor and above terrasse open to the city, 360 ° view (including Mt Fuji). Nice to spend time in sofas at the lobby (where you can use the restaurant) and enjoy the view. Take a room with a view to the Tower. Double beds room mean that you can accommodate 2 (small) adults and one child.No-smoking room was a real no-smoking room. Cleaning can be improved though.Well located, by a metro station which is essential to move throughout the city, and by one of the nicest Shrine in town. Asakusa is a good starting point to visit the rest of the city, more peaceful and packed of of Japanese restaurants in the market surrounding the temple. It is nice from the hotel to have the chance to get good restaurants in walking distance.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is located in Asakusa just a block away from the Kaminarimon Gate and a ten minute walk to the Senso-ji Shrine. We found this to be a nice area to rest in since it was quiet even though these two sites were close by. The staff at the hotel were very accommodating. Checking in and out were easy. The rooms were a good size with a modern, well stocked bathroom. Electric Tea kettle, k-cup coffee maker and mini-refrigerators were also included in every room. Wifi was also free and worked well throughout the hotel.The lobby is on the 13th floor which is just a bit unusual but you get use to it. Our rate included breakfast which had several western options (scrambled eggs, French toast, Eggs benedict) but not a lot of choices for breads or cereals. It got a bit boring for a stay of 8 nights. But the food was always fresh and the staff very attentive.Access to public transportation was also excellent from this hotel including a metro and the JR rail-lines. We took a limited express from Haneda airport to the Asakusa station, found the elevator to the ground level and were less than 5 minutes to the hotel.There is also a supermarket in the same building as the hotel which we found very convenient. We recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I spent two nights in one of their "Modest" rooms and had an absolutely wonderful stay. Although this is the smallest room size which is designed for (mainly) single use, it was a lot more spacious than I expected or most of the ones I've been to in both Japan and other Asian countries. The room was nice and quiet, even though Asakusa is a relatively busy area. The nearest subway station is about five minutes away, and there are a couple of supermarkets / 7-elevens near the entrance, which was definitely a bonus. Getting to the airport was also relatively quick and easy - there are direct trains running between Asakusa station and both Haneda and Narita Airport. (Getting to Narita took me about an hour or so) The breakfast was great, the made-to-order menu was a nice addition to the usual buffet table!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Being the start of our tour of Honshu Island, Japan, itinerary arranged by the very inspired "Inside Japan Tours", which I can't praise strongly enough.The hotel is in a relatively narrow block, but does afford good views of the city and Sky Tree, from it's 13th floor restaurant and lobby. Our bedroom was rather austere, darkly decorated with anthracite grey walls.The air conditioning directed the cold air straight onto the beds.The bathroom was adequate with a shower/mini bath in a wet room. The breakfasts were reasonable, although the staff tended to pounce on you with the menu and deliver your choice of eggs rapidly, rather than having the time to enjoy the buffet.Overall I would say an adequate base but fairly basic.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I chose this hotel based on TA reviews but mixed feelings about it. I liked Asakusa where the hotel is located. More normal pace of ordinary life in Tokyo that still bears old charm. It was a nice retreat to a bit of slower pace after a hectic day. When we first walked in, I felt the lobby was a bit odd, very scarcely furnished. Yes, it has a nice view to Tokyo Sky Tree but that's about it. Our room was small but that's expected in Japan. I liked the combo of bathtub and shower stall in one section which I've seen more commonly in Japan. The Nespresso coffee machine was nice to make quality coffee in the room. The breakfast room was nice. You order a dish from the menu along with decent spread of salad, fruits, pastry, coffee, juice. The best part for me, the freshly squeezed orange juice. All in all, the hotel was good in most aspects but there was something missing about it for grant 4 stars
user_name:
Eun L
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here two nights and thought it was a great hotel. I received a really warm welcome when I checked in, and the service continued to be excellent. I needed to post a letter and when I enquired about the nearest post box the staff offered to post this for me rather than me having to go out into the pouring rain. I thought this was a lovely offer. I stayed in a comfy room for single occupancy as travelling alone, which I found perfectly adequate for a single person (soft pillows were really welcome after two weeks of the more common hard pillows in other hotels on my trip). The views from the hotel lobby are great particularly at night, I was excited to see Mt Fuji from the hotel restaurant when having breakfast.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Everything was great expect of the cleanliness. The tea mark near the window never erased from the day I check in were there after three days they were still there. Did not add some supplement that we used.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: the 2nd time choose this hotel but not that comfortable with all. the light in the room is super dark, and outside the window is only able to see another building, can't see the tower as what they mentioned on the website. very disappointed for this stay

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is located in a great spot near the Asakusa temple, to get to the metro you have to walk about 5 minutes, and there are great places to eat as well. We stayed 6 nights in a twin room with a great view on the Skytree. The breakfast is European style and quite good as well. If you are moving to another city by bullet train, and you have luggage, then just ask the Receptionist, tell him the day of you're arrival at you're next hotel and show the reservation. They will send it for you in no time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The gate hotel is well located opposite the Senjosi Temple. The rooms are small but clean and nice. We had a view of the Tokyo sky tree even though the view was slightly spoilt by unsightly old dirty buildings beside our hotel. Breakfast was good. Supermarket downstairs was a plus point. Airport access via direct train was a 100m walk away.I have no complaints. Only drawback is the price. Rather expensive.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our first trip to Asia and we were slightly apprehensive. Tokyo was our first stop and after a long haul flight required we required a very comfortable hotel to stay in for a few days to recover & then sight-see. We read the reviews and the Gate Hotel seemed the perfect place to stay.We were not disappointed. This is a refurbished, modern hotel with spacious rooms ( a rarity in Tokyo), large, well equipped bathrooms and very comfortable beds. The reception area is actually on the highest point of the hotel ( the 14th floor I seem to remember) so do not be confused when checking in! Once reception is reached the views are spectacular- wall to ceiling glass, with beautiful views across the Tokyo skyline and, in particular, the Tokyo Sky Tree which looms large.The restaurant and bar are on the same level- wonderful views and also, excellent quality food that, for a hotel, was not overpriced. A great way to end a day of sightseeing- a glass of Sake while absorbing views over Tokyo. Also, there is a ' residents only' bar one floor up- a very small area but with outdoor viewing platforms ( easy on the Sake!).The staff were wonderful- no exceptions. In particular, the receptionists were incredibly helpful & most courteous and the bar staff were extremely friendly & professional. All staff should be mentioned though- they made us feel so welcome in a rather different culture than we have been used to.I should also mention location- Asakusa is a great place to stay - it is one of the oldest districts of Tokyo, home of several temples , including the beautiful Senso-Ji Buddhist temple. It really is 'old' Japan, away from the rather brash, bright lights of Tokyo central. Subways are very nearby, very convenient. The Sky Tree is an easy 2 stop ride away. Plenty of very good, local restaurants. A couple of tips, head to the Temples prior to around 10am ( just a few minutes walk). We noticed large tour groups arriving after that time & the whole temple area gets very crowded. Also, request a higher level hotel room - it looks like views will be blocked by lower rooms.A wonderful hotel, incredibly comfortable with a great location. The staff were outstanding.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel provides excellent service, they actually email me 1 week before my travel to ask if we need anything or help. I stayed many hotels and such pre stay email is quite rare. Location is great, just 3min from asakusa metro station, and just walk across the road to visit the famous temple. There's also a supermarket next to hotel and 711 that you can do tax free purchase too. Lobby at 13floor which is special and great view from lobby day and night, if time permit, visit the rooftop bar too. Room is good size. If fact much better than many hotels in Tokyo. Great amenities as well. Nespresso machine on each room and if you need drink, there is also vending machine on each floor. Highly recommended if you intend to stay in Asakusa area

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I loved the Asakusa neighborhood. We went running along the river each morning, and strolled to Senso-ji and through the stall shopping during the afternoon and evening. The neighborhood is a web of alleyways filled with bustling restuarants. It was hard to figure out which one to try - there were so many to choose from. I highly recommend trying the taiyaki, a fish-shaped pastry filled with red bean paste or sweet potato, on nearby Orange Street. Two subway lines, Ginza and Asakusa, within blocks of the hotel made it very easy to get around the city. The view from the lobby, on the 13th floor, is quite breathtaking. The staff were very helpful. We needed help reserving a dance show in another city, and they helped us do it. Room was small but cozy and comfortable. Nespresso machine in the room was a nice amenity.We accidentally booked a smoking room, and there was a bit of lingering smell. The hotel kindly installed a ventilation machine that removed most of it, but I would choose a non-smoking room next time.
user_name:
KBG101010
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel worths staying at Tokyo. We spent four nights (2 adults + 1 child) at the hotel. We can enjoy the view of the Sky Tree through the window. Hotel location is convenice from/to either Narita airport (Sky Access) or Haneda Airport (Keikyu Line) via Asakusa station which 2 metro lines intersect. Personally, I think the matress and pillow are a bit soft. Overall, this hotel is recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Conveniently located just a block from Asakusa Station and Senso-ji, this near-boutique hotel is stylish, well-run, quiet, and quite reasonably priced. We spent a bit more than planned to stay here, but came away convinced we'd made the right. choice. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our first visit to Tokyo & I was completely overwhelmed by the options of hotels & of neighbourhoods to choose from. We could not have been happier with our choice on both counts. Really easy to get to from Narita Airport - the direct train is just under an hour & a short walk from Asakusa station. Everywhere else is really easy to access on the metro & the area itself is one of the oldest & more attractive parts of the city. The Senji so temple is really close & there is an abundance of lively shopping streets & great local restaurants. Skytree is one metro stop away & worth a visit tooThe hotel itself has more of a large boutique hotel vibe with a stunning reception on the 13th floor with a view to impress even the weariest traveller. Our first room was on the 12th floor with an equally impressive view of Skytree tower. On our return visit we were on the 5th floor with a rather drab view of ugly buildings. There is a bar with a roof top open area on the 14th floor which is worth taking a visit to as well although the interior can be smoky - a not uncommon issue in Japan. On a fine day you can see Mt Fuji from the terrace hereThe hotel has a 24 hr restaurant on the 13th floor too. Our package didn't include breakfast but we took the simple buffet option each day which was reasonable value just for the freshly squeezed orange juice & expresso coffees alone. We found the dinner menu which was more French bistro style to be fairly uninspiring & over priced & would definitely recommend heading out to eat locally. The 24 hr sushi joint right next door was excellent after a late arrival.The rooms were well appointed with nice modern design features. Clean,tasteful, Nespresso machine, fridge, plenty of hanging space & water bottles replenished everyday.Staff had enough English to communicate & were friendly & helpful. I would definitely stay here again if I was visiting Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here for a night. It was decent but honestly this is not the best area to stay in Tokyo if it is your first time. I stayed here because some people suggested it may be good to stay here since it's closer to the airport transportation. It was fine for me for one night but I wouldn't recommend it. Also note that JR pass only works on JR lines which are not sufficient in the city. There is a separate metro and subway system on which you can't use JR. I mistakenly thought my entire transportation would be covered by JR. Hopefully this helps with your trip planning some.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My wife and I spent 4 lovely nights at this modern, comfortable and chic hotel conveniently located with views to Kaminarimon Gate and Tokyo Skytree. Very friendly staff (English speaking) who were always eager to please and ensure our stay was welcome. I'm looking forward to returning and wholeheartedly recommend it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel that is very well managed. I was satisfied with my room, but was amazed by the level of friendliness, professionalism and attentiveness by all the staff I came into contact with during my nine night stay.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located near Tokyo Asakusa Station and the temple itself ! It's about 5 min walk to either one of them. The hotel lobby has an impressive contemporary setting with view of Tokyo Tower in the background. However, room is pretty small as one might expect but clean and tastefully decorated! The hotel restaurant serves excellent Western (Italian and French) and Japanese dishes (curry)! Staffs were friendly and professional. Highly recommended for a centrally located hotel in Tokyo!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed in the Scenic Twin Room for the trip. The room is relatively spacious (including the toilet) if comparing with other Japan hotels. You can see the Tokyo Skytree directly from the room. The hotel is just few minutes walk from the Exit 2 of Asakusa Station (Tokyo Metro) and opposite to famous sight seeing spot - The Kaminarimon. Many good restaurants and shops nearby. Overall, the experience is good for the stay.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had a triple room, essential-type - the most common room size in the hotel. First room we were given was very musty smelling and had dirty carpet, with obvious footprint stains, etc. near the door. which was rather disappointing. We asked if this was the norm and were given a second room. Just as stuffy, but clean carpet. The bathroom appeared newly renovated and was well appointed. The room was basic. Probably an ok size for 2 people, but very tight for 3. Not really anywhere to put our cases. Good location for this part of town with a supermarket next door and two nearby metro lines (5 minutes' walk tops).Nice lobby, bar, restaurant and pleasant helpful staff - as we struck everywhere. We began our trip in Shinjuku (Keio Plaza Hotel) and having been south were ending our trip here on a two-night stay. Room size aside, the only real bother was the lack of outside air making the rooms very stuffy - even the second room on entry smelt strongly musty as if it had been locked up for some time. The windows opened to a degree fortunately, and with these left open we managed to keep the place aired out.I'd definitely recommend going for one of the larger rooms if they're available. Can't fault the staff, and the public areas were all very pleasant.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Top choice! This is an elegant boutique hotel in the buzzling part of Tokyol Close to Kaminarimon and all public transport access. This hotel is in Asakusa, the older part of Tokyo, which is ideal for people who wants the cultural part of Tokyo rather than modernised suburb. There are lots good eatery close by, dont be fooled by its look, many were with Michelin recommendation. The best part is the roof top bar! What a wonderful surprise to see the Skytree. Unobscured view from level 14! Will come back!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel would be fine if you were travelling with 2 people. We booked an E room for 2 adults and a child and could barely move. There was no where to put bags and an oversized bathroom took space from the room. We don't think the hotel should book these rooms for 3 people - they just don't fit. They do have bigger rooms, so book one of these if travelling with more than 2 people. Otherwise, the staff were friendly and the hotel was as advertised ... a relatively bland western style hotel in a touristy area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We chose this hotel because of its location in the old part of Tokyo - perfect for a low-key introduction to the city for our family of five.The hotel was perfect - stunning views from reception, lovely, spacious rooms (well priced for Tokyo), very comfortable beds, excellent email communications. Couple of minutes walk from historic part of Tokyo, fascinating temples, street life and excellent, well-priced local restaurants. Easy commute to all the touristy spots.The two things that made this a five-star stay for us occurred at the start and end of our stay and were in fact outside of the hotel's responsibility - not that they seemed to mind.So, we arrived after a 12 hour flight, and I was tired and grumpy about having been ripped off by my taxi driver (we needed two taxis to accommodate our family of five). I may have been tired and new to the currency but when you give someone 10,000 whatevers to pay for a ride that costs 1200 whatevers you can work out what your change should look like! My driver shortchanged me 5000 Y - around $US45 or $4 NZ million (kidding). Anyway, I tried arguing with the driver three times but I didn't speak Japanese, he didn't speak English and he insisted that the change he gave me correct.Turned up to reception, they started checking us in and I said: "Look I'm sorry to interrupt but can you check my change because I'm pretty sure the driver didn't give me the correct change." She checked my receipt, my change, and confirmed that I had been short-changed 5000 yen. She excused herself, returned a few minutes later to inform me that she had spoken to someone at the taxi company who had spoken to the driver, who said that I gave him only 5000 yen. My heart sank. I was tired, I had travelled far. Perhaps I had made a mistake. Then my kids saved me. "No way!!! You gave him 10,000 mum!" My husband confirmed that he had only received 10,000 Y notes from the cash machine. OK. The receptionist informed us that all taxis have a camera. Would we like the company to check the camera? Yes we would. We finished our check-in, grabbed a meal and a very comfortable sleep and the next morning we were greeted with an envelope at reception containing our 5000 Y and an apology from the taxi driver, who had "made a mistake". Not bad huh?So, three wonderful days later we left Tokyo after a very comfortable stay thinking that we would definitely return to this hotel - not realising we had left half our stuff behind! We arrived in Germany to discover that our youngest boys' snow boots and another pair of shoes had been left in the hotel room. Expensive and annoying. I emailed the hotel and asked them to courier them to us in Europe and bill us for the cost. They did so immediately but insisted that they would meet the cost. The boots arrived a couple of days later.A mishap with a taxi and being careless about leaving stuff behind - neither of these things were the responsibility of the Gate Hotel but they took a service approach to their clients and really looked after us. Thank you so much!I must add that I have NEVER heard of anyone being ripped off in Japan - Tokyo feels safer than any major international city I have ever visited. We just had bad luck - but in the end, no harm done!Bravo Gate Hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Enjoyed our stay in an essential twin room with views of the Tokyo Skytree. Modern, compact and clean with comfortable beds. Bathroom was unexpectedly spacious, which was great! Staff were professional and well-presented. From Narita airport, we caught the Skyliner train to Ueno station, then a short taxi ride (900 yen) to hotel. Location is very convenient and safe, within a 5 minute stroll to Asakusa subway and Asakusa Tobu train stations. The Senso-ji Temple is nearby, and we were literally walking pass the Thunder Gate every day. We had breakfast daily at the hotel, which included a small continental buffet selection and a choice of one hot dish cooked on order. Food was organic and also had a distinctively local touch which we liked e.g. eggs benedict with Japanese curry. Many local restaurants nearby, plus a supermarket, pharmacy and Starbucks on the same block. If you're interested in the Asakusa area, we highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Fantastic location. Most comfortable beds I've slept in at a hotel. Fabulous PJ's (my husband purchased a pair to take home) Lots of really good places to eat nearby - we were a bit spoilt as our son speaks Japanese so we braved places we probably otherwise wouldn't have found - be brave and trust the signs! Hotel staff are very helpful and the roof top bar is gorgeous. By Japanese hotel standards the rooms are huge!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: 'You are staying at Asakusa?' is the incredulous response I get from Japanese business colleagues. Normally on business you stay in the city centre generally in tiny functional rooms three minutes from the office. 'Well, yes' I reply. I am in a traditional part of the City In a hotel situated opposite beautiful temples with unparalleled views from its lobby bar terrace and room and moreover it only takes me 15 minutes on the smoothly running Asakusa line to the city centre. I stumbled open this hidden gem of a hotel whilst comparing traditional options. It was tagged as a boutique hotel a title I'm normally wary of as it has been misused over the years. I'm glad I booked as it really is a boutique hotel and priced very reasonably. There is a train line from the airport that takes you to the nearest station literally three minutes away from the hotel. On the way to the hotel you pass the temple and also a tourist information centre. The hotel entrance is understated and elegant you could easily miss it. Subtle rippling water effects are projected on the entrance walls. The lobby bar terrace and restaurant are on the 13/14 floors with similar light displays and art works. The lift goes directly to those floors so non guests can visit the restaurant and sample the views. Once you have your room card you can go directly from the ground floor to your room without the normal arrangement of access through the lobby. A great arrangement that gives you the feeling of having your own apartment and privacy. The room I stayed in was a twin it was the only one available. A good size with everything thought through in design terms. They even provide an ioniser. The single bed was large and the mattress sumptuous. Lovely Pyjamas beautiful bathroom products including large bottles of quality shampoo and conditioner, tooth brushes and sundries. The feeling of generosity is the hallmark of this place. The understated atmosphere a sign of a confidence after five years of opening the know a guests needs will be met. Breakfast is served to jazz, Astrud Gilberto a favourite. The buffet includes a honeycomb dripping fresh honey fresh marmalade made on the premises and a Lady squeezing fresh orange juice. There is an assortment of vegetables and pasta and freshly baked mini croissants and raisin bread. Butter on the table is from France. The restaurant is open 24/7 and a welcome retreat after a busy work day. The food is excellent and inspired by French cuisine, once again finely prepared with great attention to detail. It is guaranteed quality and I must admit I have been a little bit lazy in sampling outside restaurants due to the assurance of what I order will be great. The roof terrace has great views and a nice place to sit with a cocktail wrapped in a blanket for the January cold. The bar is only accessible to guests also has great views and is a warm intimate space unfortunately smoking inside has not been banned in Japan and it can occasionally be overwhelming for the non smoker. My night cap generally is taken in the restaurant bar with a Cosmo expertly prepared and packing a real punch by Riki Warigai who has been here since the hotel opened. She makes me feel very welcome and chats with me about my days activities. Nice when you are a women in business and alone. Nothing is too much for the staff who after a few days predict what I am going to order and smile warmly as they serve. They all wear subtly tucked away ear pieces so I suspect there is a real organised approach underlying everything. Front of house at reception are helpful if a little shy. It's the weekend now and there are many people waiting for brunch- a testimony to the place. I look forward to walking around the City knowing that I have my little oasis hideaway to come back to at the end of the day. Wonder if they do long term bookings?

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our accommodation for our last night in Japan. Typical good hotel, friendly attentive staff, comfortable with all the amenities you'd expect. Bar and restaurant open twenty four hours. About five minute walk, with suitcases to station for train direct to Narita.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: i stayed at this hotel for two nightscompare to the view they have at their lobby, room didn't have quite good view.bed was ok but the room smell wasn't very good. felt kind of stuffing while staying the room.the good thing about this hotel is that their lobby is pretty and pretty hall way and card-secured floorchecked out their rooftop bar also but too small and didn't have enough seats so i had to stand there and watch.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: All the service facilities are very good, but the special price of a little higher corner house does not see the sky tower, a little disappointed. Next time will stay will choose parity room, because the relationship between privacy can not pull the curtains.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Serious hard to fault this place for a tourist stay in Tokyo. Incredible access, with the subway station of Asakusa only a couple minutes walk away and literally right across the road from the entrance to the Sensoji temple area. Heaps of options for eating, shopping and sight seeing. The room was very spacious (for Japan), and had very luxurious finishes all around. The staff were also very accomodating, even going above and beyond to locate a doctors clinic on our last day for my partner who fell ill as we were checking out. Hands down, after staying in Shinjuku and Ueno on past visits, this would be my pick of hotel to stay again for location, price and accessibility.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed in a double on the tenth floor facing Sky Tree. Stunning views of Asakusa from 15th floor lobby and rooftop patio. Modern, tasteful decor with killer bathroom/shower/tub. Professional, friendly staff welcomes large number of foreigners. Western breakfast is a choice of prepared plates with some sides available on the buffet.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room was about what you'd expect from a 4-star hotel. The pajamas provided were very comfortable, as was the bed. Location-wise it was very convenient. The hotel is located about a block or two from Sensō-ji (Kaminarimon) and the Asakusa station for the Tokyo metro. This allowed easy access to stops like Akihabara and Tsukiji, as well as an almost direct route to Tokyo station. It's also worth noting that you can ride directly from Haneda Airport to Asakusa without needing to switch trains, which is good news for tired travelers with late arrival times.The restaurant was quite frankly one of the best dining experiences I've had at a hotel. I grabbed a seat at the bar and ordered an excellent beef cheek braised in red wine sauce, following up my meal with a bit of sake from the well-stocked bar. In addition to being able to watch the bartender prepare ice for other customers drinks, I had the pleasure of listening to a spectacularly talented pianist/singer playing during a good portion of my time there.For breakfast I returned to the restaurant for some eggs benedict. On the whole, the food was a bit pricey, but I think the taste (combined with the experience) were well worth it and I'd do it again without hesitation.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very comfortable design hotel, with great views of the Tokyo Skytree and Kaminarimon. Staff were friendly and efficient. Very convenient for tourists, with easy access to the Tokyo Metro and the famed Asakusa Temple -- I think both were less than a minute's walk from the hotel. Rooms were small but sufficient, with standing shower including toiletries (shampoo, lotion, soap, toothbrush, brush/comb, hair elastic), hair dryer, and pajama set. Free Wifi was great. There is a bar/restaurant with terrace on the rooftop (only accessible to hotel guests) with a GREAT view of the surrounding area. Also a bunch of convenience stores and restaurants around the hotel (including 24 hour sushi places!). Highly recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed at The Gate Hotel in November 2016 and had a lovely stay. The rooms were clean and tidy and staff are friendly. The most stand out feature of the hotel is the view from the lobby on the top floor. You can even go up a level and outside to the roof top terrace to see a lovely view of the Skytree. Unfortunately there are no pool and spa facilities, however the location is very central so there are many activities within walking distance or a short subway or bike ride away.Food is standard fare, continental buffet + a cooked egg option if you like. Fresh orange juice is squeezed for guests every morning. Lovely stay, would recommend if you want a comfortable hotel in a good area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The rooms were very quiet and comfortable and the breakfast buffet really delicious. The lounge, rooftop bar and terrace had great views. We enjoyed happy hour beers. The staff were friendly and spoke English well.
user_name:
Sally M
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I visited the Hotel in December this year for 2 days and loved everything about it. The locations is just steps from the famous Kaminarimon gate and super convenient connected to Tokyo's metro system. From the lobby and the two terraces on the top your get views overlooking the area and you can even see Mount Fuji on a clear day. All the hotel staff was amazing, super friendly and a great help. We felt very well cared of and would definitely stay there again.Thanks!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Tokyo hotels are generally quite expensive, but The Gate Hotel is a good value for money. Great location with a spectacular rooftop view of Tokyo Skytree. My room, booked last minute with a bargain, is small but comfortable. The cool thing is that the hotel staff received and delivered my Amazon orders to the room even prior to my arrival! Would like to stay again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel was located with easy access to the Ginza line subway. Clean modern hotel with views of Mt Fuji!! Rooms and bathroom was a bit small for the price paid. Staff were friendly but spoke little English.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were recommended this hotel by my uncle who came recently with his family. We booked the hollywood twin room (meaning 2 twin beds park together making it a huge king bed). The room was small but above average for Tokyo standard. We arrived early and was not able to check in until 2pm. So we left our luggage and went down for a walk. The location was excellent. A decent grocer to your right where you can get fresh fruits, cheap Haagen Dazs ice cream and etc etc and to your left is a pharmacy where you can get diapers & other baby stuff, medicine, cosmetics, etc Food is never a problem, you will be spoilt for choices.A coin laundry within walking distance, Not easy to find but i emailed the hotel earlier and they recommended this place. Very small laundromat but believe me, it's not easy to find laundromat in Tokyo.Also there's a Starbucks and the end of the block. I love the variety they hv here compared to what we hv bc at home.And this hotel is right in front of the famous Kaminarimon & Senso-ji. There r few train stations within walking distance as well. Ok bc to the hotel~as i hv mentioned room is small but above average, the bathroom is very clean, lovely toiletries (they supply bath cubes, i didn't hv time to use so i took it home ;)), and the PJs they provide is so so comfortable. You have one thing less to pack if you stay here! They also hv a room/clothes freshener in the closet. Pls use it. Smells wonderful!No pool in the hotel, but who has time for pool when you r in Tokyo rite!The hotel staff was very courteous but we didn't really get to communicate much, only at check in and out.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is just nearby Asakusa Station and opposite the Sensoji Shrine/Shopping Street. There is also a mini market downstairs and many restaurants surrounding the area. A slow walk to Skytree Tower only took us 20-25 minutes.Room is spacious. We booked 2 Queen Rooms for 4 and each room came with 2 Queen beds that can also fit for 3 pax.You can get a clear distance view of the Skytree Tower from their lobby or at the observatory deck one more level up. The pleasant surprise was that the hotel made good effort in preparing breakfast. It is a semi buffet that guests can choose their mains from a menu of 4 choices. Freshly squeezed orange juice was also available instead of providing bottled juice like many hotels do these days.I will definitely stay here again if I visit this area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel is new style of hotel which I personally like over traditional Japanese business hotel. Staff is very friendly and speaks English well. Having a 24-hour open cafe is really convenient for some nice Western style food. Though there are also local Japanese restaurants nearby which opened very late as well.Location is definitely near the famous tourist spot, Kaminarimon. It really depends on how you like to be crowded with tourists nearby. Personally I prefer some less tourist like spots, but I learnt this hotel has very good ratings and thus worth a try.My room is on the 7/F and thus no view at all which is something I found a bit disappointed, especially when you learnt that the hotel can offer magnificent view of Tokyo Sky Tree from the lobby (13/F) and the Terrance Area (14/F).One thing worth to mention is that the hotel is very near Asakusa station, 2 minutes walk from A4 exit. However, Asakusa station is very old, and therefore, no escalator available. I am a traveler with big luggage and thus found it extremely difficult to climb 50+ stairs with my luggage.Overall I enjoyed my stay, but thinking about my luggage issue, I have hesitation to return

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Reception was on the 18th floor which had nice floor to ceiling windows with magnificent city views. Restaurant is also on this level where guests can sit out on the terrace area. Furthermore there is a rooftop bar. The rooms were very chic and comfortable.They provide Nespresso machines but no cups that actually fit in the machine.Complimentary buffet was quite good though I had to pay full price for children.The area is fantastic, so much to shop and eat and just across the road from the Shinjuku temple. A supermarket is right next door and there is tourist information centre a few minutes walk away. Nearby Asakusa station takes you to Tokyo Skytree in minutes. There is a nearby line that goes straight to Narita with no change required (Toei Subway Asakusa)Definitely stay again if need to be in this side of town.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Awesome location. Everything perfect. Loves the location so much. Room, hotel service, anything excellent. Surely go back here. Train station so near. Restaurant everywhere. Its also good for family. Hotels is surrounding by shopping area, very recommended. A bit dissappointed with the room in the smoking floor. Smells like tobacco so badly.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time adventuring and sight seeing in Asakusa, all thanks to The Gate Hotel's extremely convenient location, knowledgeable staff, and exquisite dining at their lounge. You get a great view of the Tokyo Skytree atop their rooftop terrace, although it was windy and chilly up there. The hotel is also right across the street from Nakamise-Dori and Orange Street, where you can enjoy snacks from street vendors and also pick up a few omiyage for your buddies at home. The actual rooms were posh and while we really only used the room for sleeping, it was clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were also spacious, so no complaints there.We also had a chance to eat lunch and breakfast in their lounge, which offered cuisine with French techniques and a Japanese twist. They were very balanced meals and beautifully arranged. I'd have to say the highlight of my meals were the fresh-baked breads served during breakfast alongside raw honey, collected straight from a honeycomb for all to see.In summary, the stay at The Gate Hotel was memorable and I recommend this venue, especially if you are planning on exploring Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Located in a prime spot walking distance to Orange Street and Nakamise-dori Street, this fabulous hotel not only has a perfect location but boasts amazing views of the Skytree Tower and the surrounding city! The lobby was decked out with holiday decor and wow'ed us as we arrived for check in.Tip for those visiting but perhaps not staying at the hotel - you're welcome to head to the 13th floor and enjoy these breathtaking views from their restaurant or floor-to-ceiling glass walls in the lobby. Our room on the 9th floor also provided a great view from a slightly different vantage point. The rooftop terrace above the 13th floor lobby is reserved for guests only and provides the best view of Tokyo accompanied by a full bar with happy hour.Our room was cozy, clean, and perfect for two. I tend to always judge a place by their shower and water pressure, and this place gets five stars for sure in that area!We were lucky to have tried both the breakfast and lunch at the hotel restaurant and the food was ON POINT. The ingredients were all so fresh (something that definitely stood out in the salmon salad) and the presentation was gorgeous, too. Breakfast was served with a buffet of stir-fried cabbage, baked potato wedges, salads, breads, and the best honey I've ever tasted (honestly!) dripping from a real honeycomb.There is no better service and respect from any culture other than the Japanese, and the staff at The Gate Hotel definitely exceeded my expectations in every way.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC (the name is a handful!) was our home base for our recent stay in Tokyo, and I can say it’s a great spot to be in Tokyo’s Asakusa neighborhood. We were in Tokyo for only a few days and wanted somewhere central, close to the airports (both Haneda and Narita), and a place that made us feel at home in a unique neighborhood but still had an “it” factor, luxury vibe, and was unique and well-placed enough to make a 2-day stay effortless and worthwhile. We found that The Gate Hotel.As a member of the Design Hotels group, The Gate has its own look and feel, simplistic but design-oriented from lobby to bedroom — from the entrance, with the water-reflected light effects, to the “egg” in the room, to the incredible lobby views. Oh yes, the lobby – what a view. The highlight of the hotel, in our view, is the chic lobby with its long elegant sofas and wide view over Asakusa, and Japan looking towards the Sky Tree tower. You’ll want to hang out here at least once. We loved the understated exterior look of the hotel – at one point, returning in the evening after a walk through Asakusa shopping district, we gazed down the street searching for our hotel and realized we were standing right in front of it!Located in Asakusa area, a great locale, quiet enough but right in a vibrant neighborhood and well connected to everywhere else. Located in the humble but busy Asakusa neighborhood, near the Kaminarimon Gate leading to Sensoji Temple (a must-visit temple in the city), with an area full of shopping and restaurants, and near some cool attractions like Kirin Beer’s headquarters, the Tokyo Skytree (views of which were spectacular from the hotel), and close to a water ferry stop.The rooms are simple but smartly designed; I loved the Nespresso machine, comfortable beds, the futuristic toilet, amazing toiletries (loving the toothbrush to this day), and a really nice shower made for a luxurious and comfortable feel. Some rooms had a view to the Tokyo Skytree and the surrounding area. The room had enough space for the two of us with plenty of luggage, unlike some tiny spaces in Tokyo.We loved the 14th-floor private bar with terrace (only open to hotel guests and their guests), which offered a great view both day and night. There is an outside seating area, complete with heaters for cold days, and an inside bar (I must say, the bartender must’ve been quite bored as we didn’t see any people up here). There is a restaurant in the hotel, offering all meals. We didn’t try the restaurant for lunch or dinner, but it was open 24-7 (to guests) and the breakfast, although rather pricey, was very nice (although very Western!). I thought the Curry Eggs Benedict was sensational and I had to have it two mornings in a row; accompanying buffet offerings were good, but the honey display was a sweet sight to see. Breakfast is expensive (¥2,160, about $25 CAD) but worth trying once.In summary, we really liked the design and modern feel, the location and transport/ airport links, the view from the 13th-floor lobby, and the 14th private bar (only open to hotel guests, thus probably empty) and terrace with great views. We loved the vibe in the area, shopping and eating in the Asakusa area, walking around the temples and the old-style Tokyo neighborhood. The hotel is not a budget option but isn’t overly expensive for Tokyo either (likely due to its location which is considered on the outskirts of Tokyo, but still well connected, in our opinion), running around $200-$250 per night (CAD). It's a good value for Tokyo. Give it a go!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: If you're a tourist doing a bit of sight seeing and shopping and wanting to avoid the hustle bustle, this is the place you'd want to be in. The Gate Hotel is so centrally located with access to major metro lines of Tokyo within walking distance - 30m away. The same metro station that connects you with Narita or Haneda Airport.The area is surrounded by many of the Japanese temples and hundreds of restaurants. The room we had was excellent, with typical Japanese efficiency in service. Everything works in the room. And super clean!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here for one night. The room was a decent size, with space enough to do some stretches in the morning. Decor was a bit on the dark side, a bit dated. But the fundamentals were fine - the bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The shower was great and the bathroom had toothbrushes (seems usual for Japan) and all the toiletries.
