The view from the breakfast bar was fantastic. My only gripe was that breakfast was expensive at 2,100 Yen, and it wasn't great either in terms of variety or in terms of quality. Fresh orange juice was a nice touch. Staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. Location-wise the hotel is a short walk from the metro, and right on the doorstep of the shrines and the riverside. Note that the reception is on the top floor and the rooms are on the floors below - although you need key card to access them from the lift. Also the wifi access was not as simple as in most hotels where you just put in the provided password. You had to enter various SSids and my macbook didn't ever get the dialogue box to connect, so ended up only having a connection on my phone. Another minor issue really.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Reception resides on the 13th floor - and provides some of the nicest views of the SkyTree you're likely to find in Tokyo. Rooms were of a great size, comfortable beds and well specified bathrooms were a particular treat. The location is well considered - A subway station is within a short stroll, and it is nearby many of Asakusa's treats and tourist destinations. The restaurant serves reasonable quality food and the view while dining was excellent. Wifi connections were strong and speeds were good.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My husband and I spent one night at The Gate and wish we could have spent more. It is not super high end, but value for money could not be better. The location is fantastic - right across from the gate to all the attractions in Asakusa. We both like to walk and jog. The proximity to the path/park along the river is excellent. Additionally, the lounge/bar has a lovely terrace w great views. Upon checkout I left my coat behind in the closet of our room. Ayumi and Ayako of the front desk team assisted me by having it sent to the hotel where we were staying on our last night in Tokyo (after a brief trip to Hokkaido). Overall, an excellent stay. We will return!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was our first visit to Japan and The Gate our first hotel there and it proved a good start to our trip. We had a Classy King room which was very spacious with a nice seating area and a great view of the Tokyo Skytree. The location was excellent and we found it easy to move around the city using the nearby Asakusa metro station. We also used the nearby Tobu Asakusa station to get to Nikko. As others have mentioned, it is opposite the Kaminarimon Gate leading to Senso-ji Temple. There are lots of restaurants around and we loved Kappabashi dori ('cooktown' ) which isn't far away.The reception staff were very helpful and we enjoyed the eggs benedict for breakfast.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Just a step away from the river and the Sensoji temple this hotel has a lot to offer. With a killer view on the Asahi brewery and the Skytree the Tokyo experience starts here. The bar/restaurant is open 24/7 which is very convenient. Rooms are small but well equipped. In the end this is a very dense city so that is something you need to take into account. The room does have a nespresso machine and there is vending machine on the floor where you can find cold drinks. Service was very good and the staff is extremely friendly and speaks English. Go and explore Asakusa and if you want to see the rest of Tokyo the metro is only 200m away (Ginza line) and the Asakusa train station like 400m

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We booked one twin room and one triple room on 17 Nov from the hotel website.The hotel is located in a building with a supermarket on its left and some other shops on its right. I came to the hotel via a chartered vehicle from Haneda airport so I am not sure how convenient it is to travel by train from the airport.The hotel lobby is on the 13th floor with an impressive sky tree view. The front desk staff spoke good English and were friendly. There is a restaurant located on 13th floor as well.There is also a rooftop terrace on the 14th floor with an impressive sky tree view. As the bar is also located on the 14th floor so you could order drinks to be served at the rooftop terrace. The triple room size is a bit tight for 3 luggages but the bathroom is spacious. There is a bathtub and a shower area with a stool provided. The shower gel,shampoo and hair conditioner are quite good quality and I preferred this hotel toiletries compared to Tokyu stay Shinjuku where I stay for the first 4 nights of my trip. Night wear are provided but the material is a bit thick and my husband finds it a bit warm. Bottles of water are also provided.There are many restaurants opposite the hotel and a few of the restaurants seem to specialise in tempura. Tobu line train to skytree is only a 5-minute walk from the hotel. You will pass by the kaminarimon and nakamise street when walking to tobu line station.There are a few convenience stores near the hotel. I went to a 7 eleven store that is one street from the hotel , and found that there are Tokyo banana on sale. I think this is the first time that I see Tokyo banana on sale in a convenience store.Overall the hotel is clean, quiet, modern and cozy. The deco is more of zen style where the corridor are in dark Brown tone.As I have stayed in Tokyu stay Shinjuku for the first 4 nights and The Gate hotel is on my last night in Tokyo , my preference is the Neighbourhood of Tokyu stay Shinjuku as there are many modern restaurants and bars and departmental stores.Asakusa area has a different atmosphere and more of an older Neighbourhood.However please note that Tokyu stay Shinjuku does't have triple room.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is well-situated in the Asakusa neighborhood of Tokyo with direct lines to both airports. Senso-ji temple is across the street and the area is filled with interesting market stalls & food options. The metro stations are convenient for getting to central Tokyo. The hotel has modern, compact rooms and is immaculate. The rooftop terrace offers a stunning view over the vast metropolis of Tokyo & the restaurant is definitely worth a try (for those skipping breakfast, there is a Starbucks nearby).First trip to Japan & would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Diagonally across the road from Kaminarimon Gate and only a couple of minutes walk from Asakusa subway (follow the signs to Sensoji exits, there are a couple), this hotel was perfectly located and really easy to find. The reception area on level 13 is stunning. All of the staff spoke English and were very friendly. It's in a very safe area - my daughter and I strolled around Sensoji temple and the surrounding neighbourhood late at night. There is a supermarket on the ground floor of the building and a Starbucks next door. The view from the rooftop area is fantastic and there is a bar up there as well for hotel guests only. Stayed in a Hollywood Twin A room which was compact yet modern and comfortable. Beds may be a little too firm for some, but the bedding was super soft, pillows very comfortable too. The Nespresso machine in the room was a nice inclusion. Breakfast is 2160 yen which includes a choice of one cooked dish and the buffet. The French toast was very good, however the potato wedges served with my scrambled eggs appeared to have been reheated. The buffet was limited, mainly salads or bread so a little overpriced if you prefer more variety. Would recommend as a good base for visiting Tokyo due to easy access on the Ginza line.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I wish we will come back one day.the food is very delicious.the service is very friendly and professional.the location is very convenient.the lobby view is great.I strongly recommend the hotel.Great!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It's not our first stay but the Gate is definitively a great hotel ...to spend a few days..Easy to reach from Narita or Haneda airports, the metro is just round the corner..The staff very professional and friendly..Very modern rooms , good dimensions, a very pleasant terrasse on the 14 th floor with a bar and a view of the Fuji san whenever the sky is clear.A pleasant and good restaurant on the 13th floor beside the reception..The great tourist information , a local shop just down , ..small but excellent restaurants all within reach,the Senso-ji temple and Nakamise dori just a few steps..away..Well hope you're convinced...that'/ the way to stay for your next stop in Tokyo..

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I very much enjoyed this stayGreat views, great location, gracious service and very tasty breakfastThe next time you come back to Asakusa, your hotel will be one of my accommodation optionsThank you very much for your hospitality

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: So close to Toranomon and the station.A beautiful outdoor bar area with wonderful city views.The rooms are nicely appointed and sufficiently spacious.The bathrooms are very nice.And of course, service is at its fine Japanese standard.Free wi-fi :)This is one of the best value for money hotels I ever stayed in.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great hotel right next to kaminarimon gate (we could see the gate across the road from our room), which was great for our purposes as we easily headed back to the room in the afternoon for siesta (kids). Also, its 5 minutes walk from metro, tobu sky tree line (if u want to go Nikko) and Tokyo river cruise (alternative way to get to odaiba). Modern rooms (looks new) and clean, which are pretty spacious by Tokyo standards. Ours was a corner room on 5th floor, so only got to see the gate. If u want to see sky tree, u probably should book one of the higher levels (the rooftop has great views).Good communication b4 arriving and even arranged a cot for us. Would also be ideal for couples in my opinion.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here on return to Tokyo after travelling in Japan for three weeks and were very happy. Previously stayed in Ginza, which was good. Both well located and good access to rail. Restraunt and staff here win hands down for service and helpfulness. The room here is also better size by Japan standards. Our room was right near lift a put of and you need to go to 12 or 4 floor for ice.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I first stayed in Ginza area and then moved to The Gate in Asakusa - a wonderful boutique hotel with a great restaurant with views over the city. Perfectly sited in a quieter area of Tokyo with many amenities and comforts including 24 hour service. And all very reasonable for Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel provides a full experience within itself. A check in lobby on 13F that doubles as a luxurious lounge. Fantastic view of the Skytree from the corner Scenic room. An open air terrace and a rooftop bar where you can just lounge the night away with a drink and a view. It has a great location near Asakusa station and surrounded by convenience stores and many good restaurants. I already know where I'm staying on my next trip!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great hotel. Just book the hotel. Don't even stress over other places.Location was fantastic. Great view of the Skytree. Helpful staff. Clean rooms. Happy hour in 14th floor terrace. What more can you ask for.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved this hotel. The location in an older part of the city, close to subway lines and great food and other shopping was on your doorstep. But what made our stay even better was the fantastic staff who were some of the best we have ever encountered.Booked easily on their website (English version) and requested a Class C style room as it had the better view and looked to be a little larger than the other rooms. We asked for a floor higher up and were given a great room on the 10th floor.Unlike most hotels the reception of the hotel is on the top floor (ie 13th) and then all the rooms are on the floors underneath. This means you come out of the lift and walk straight into an area that has a fantastic view of the city around Askakusa including the Sensoji Temple and Skytree tower.HINT: If you are getting a taxi to the hotel and they use Google maps to find the hotel it might take them down a side street to the main street the hotel is on…at the intersection if you have a supermarket on your LHS then ask the taxi pull up in the space just past the supermarket and you will be out front of the Gate Hotel. The Hotel is in a building that doesn’t look like a hotel so it can be a little tricky to find at first.We knew there was an additional cost to check in early (clearly explained on the website and in the follow-up emails from the Hotel) so we arrived right on check in time of 2pm. It was one of the best check in experiences we have ever had with all our questions answered and the staff were so helpful.The room was ready so we went straight there. The rooms and hallways are in in a sombre colours with slashes of colour like the beautiful blue door of the lift.The room was modern, clean, and quiet and a very decent size considering Japan standards. We needed to have our suitcases open on the floor as there was limited storage space…however we would prefer to have the little sitting area by the window in preference to extra wardrobes etc. We could sit here (and open the window a little) for a drink and see the Sky Tree Tower light up and hear the local street noises.The bathroom had a separate shower room with a deep bath and there is a window with a view. Plenty of plugs for charging and a Nespresso coffee machine in the room. There was also beer in the vending machine and free ice just down the hall.On the rooftop (above the reception) there was a fantastic view and bar. We were lucky the first night it was warm and happy hour (I think between 3 and 6pm) was still happening. We didn’t need to go to the Skytower to see the view we had it right there in the Hotel.The location is really good to explore this side of Tokyo. When we first arrived in Japan we stayed three nights in Shinjuku and explored the area around there, travelled by train to Kanazawa, Takeyama and Kyoto and then back to Tokyo. We wanted to stay in a totally different area to the very modern Shinjuku and Asakusa (and the Gate Hotel) were perfect. Also from Asakusa you have direct access to both airports Narita and Haneda. We left to Narita airport via the nearby Asakusa station and the Hotel staff directed us to the only entrance that has an elevator. It took us less than an hour to get to the airport including a short walk from Terminal 2 (where the train come in) to Terminal 3 were our flight was. The ticket cost about 1200 yen (approx. AUS$15.00) and therefore was a lot cheaper than the Express Limo we come in on when we arrived in Tokyo.We had full breakfast in the Hotel on the last day as easier since we had to leave early. Not too bad and the views were great.Two other highlights of our stay in the Askakusa area were Kappabashi (kitchen street) which was about 10 mins walk away. We bought some great knives here and a sake bottle. The other was dinner at the Tonkatsu restaurant “Yutaka”. Ask the Hotel staff how to get there …it is only a few minutes’ walk. We found out about it via a review on Trip Adviser “Hidden in one of the smaller streets perpendicular to the road where the famous Kaminarimon Gate to Senso-ji Temple is situated. (We found it crossing the street from The Gate Hotel, walk to 2nd street west direction, then turn right and its past the first intersection on the left...EASY). This tonkatsu house has been operating for over 60 years! (it opened just after WWII) Their tonkatsu are made of tender Yamato pork from Gunma, deep-fried in batter made of homemade flour using high quality cottonseed oil.”We tried both the tenderloin fillet and the pork loin (described on the English menu as fatty cut of pork) and both preferred the less fatty tenderloin. Just note that this place closes at 8.30pm so don’t be late or you will miss out on one of the best eating experiences in Tokyo.The only thing we can suggest to the Hotel as an improvement is to have the air-conditioning instructions in English (Climate Control system is in Japanese only). However a call to reception and a lovely woman was down in no time to show us how it all worked.We will certainly stay at The Gate Hotel again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great rooms, great location, great value. Ticks all the boxes and is right across the road from one of Tokyo's temples which was an amazing sight to see. The big plus is it's next to the train station which has a direct line to Haneda airport. Next time you're in Tokyo, check this hotel out.
user_name:
Alistair D
Boston Spa, United Kingdom

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Spent two nights here plus an early check in ,at extra cost, as our flight arrived early morning.I agree with all the points others have made about location ,service etc.A few extra ones.If you are staying,as we were,in more traditional accommodation later on,you will particularly appreciate the western style beds here which are very comfortable.The breakfast was very good particularly the curry eggs benedict which sounds awful but was delicious.The roof terrace was serving free beer,as part of a promotion and had a completely separate smoking area.This was much welcome as generally smoking outside in Japan is very restricted.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I made a booking direct from their website. Their English website have up to date information unlike most local hotel where only Japanese version up to date. Their booking system is also very simple to use which is the reason that makes me decide to book my stay with them. (I understand Japanese but just hate to download the make booking in Japanese due to systems always allow specific fonts)After the booking was confirmed, I received email from hotel based my requirements over the website. I requested for early check in, so the staff informed me of possible additional costs and choice of depositing baggage over the reception etc.Closer to the date when I should arrive, the hotel follow up with an email to check if there I am bringing children (child below 12 is free if there is no additional bed required) as they need to prepare the room. They also ask if it's for any celebration and provide detailed information about how to go to the hotel. When we arrived, we received cards and gift from the hotel. It was our wedding anniversary and child birthday trip. The staffs were very friendly and the speak good English. The room was very clean and tidy. We had a very comfortable stay. I had been to Tokyo a few times and always like to stay at Asakusa. This is the first time I stayed in The gate Kaminarimon and I think if I'll ever visit Tokyo again, it will be my first choice.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice location, we stay that day is Halloween and lobby area that have provide Halloween pudding to treating us. This is quite surprise for us can get this extra service. And most important is beside hotel have Starbucks,my favorite coffee shop. Also from here asakusa have direct subway go to haneda airport, that is easy for us for not keep changing train. will come to stay again if travel to tokyo. Hope their good service is keeping on =)

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location, very easy access to major subway lines. Lots of restaurants nearby. But mostly, the staff. My husband had a medical problem, and people in the hotel were just unbelivable kind with us. Special thanks to Ayako san, always concerned with us. The restaurant is great, and althought I did not had breakfast there, I had some meals. I thought the price for those meals was fair for this kind of hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel was my first stop when arriving into Japan for the first time.........direct train to Asakusa from Haneda Airport. The subway is just five minutes from hotel and thus a handly base to get around Tokyo. Asakusa neighbourhood was a good introduction to Tokyo as its a little bit more chilled and less frantic than other areas, which is what you need when you've got jet lag! I cannot praise this hotel highly enough - stayed two nights mid week at very reasonable rates. An equivalent hotel in London would easily have been three times the price. Staff were super effecient and always polite and helpful. Our room was very tasteful, well appointed and had helpful extras' like pyjamas, bottled water and every toiletry would could think if. Enjoyed the views with a couple of happy hour drinks on roof top terrace, although the hotel seemed quiet and we were usually the only ones up there, so a bit lacking in atmosphere. Didn't try the food as so many eateries in the area and we wanted to explore. I would definately stay at this hotel if I am every in Tokyo again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is a very lovely small hotel in the Eastern Tokyo district of Askusa, very close to the subway with lots of attractions nearby and many places to eat - including the wonderful Hopi Dori street which I'd thoroughly recommend. The rooms are a reasonable size for Tokyo and very functional and clean, and the staff are absolutely great - very helpful and sweet. The hotel also has a very nice bar and restaurant with one of the best views in that area of Tokyo. I would definitely recommend staying here over the much more expensive districts of Shibuya and Shinjuku, as you'll see more of authentic Tokyo but plan your outings carefully as it does take a good 45 minutes to get to places like the New York Grill etc...

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel location just across the Kaminarimon, and from the Metro station is quite easy to findAlso many shops near the hotel, the hotel staff were kind and courteous, the rooms are very clean and comfortable finishing breakfast general category select few that are delicious, the hotel is worth staying

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate hotel is fairly new with good facilities and is only a 2 minute walk from the subway (Ginza line). Rooms are nicely appointed with a very good restaurant and bar, both having great views of Asakusa. The staff speak good English, are friendly and efficient. A nice hotel to stay for a couple of nights.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great views of the Skytree tower, which is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel, and the temple. Happy hour on the rooftop bar was a relaxed way to watch the sun go down. From nearby Asakusa station, the Asakusa line runs to Narita airport every half hour and to downtown in the other direction every few minutes. The Ginza line runs every few minutes to the Ginza district. We enjoyed the hotel breakfast, but would have appreciated a bit more fruit choices. The room was very comfortable although the wifi connection was weak.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great Hotel, good reception service. Nice and clean rooms. best view from the lobby and the roof terrasse. Nice private bar with big view on the treetower good service an tasty cocktails. Cool and professionnal barmen service.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location is unbeatable!!!!!! We were staying at the Style C room with the view of Tokyo Tower. Spacious room regardless which country to compare. Full amenities with friendly and considerate house keepers. Right in front of our room is vending machine room which can buy drinks and FREE ice. Attach to the hotel is Ozaki supermarket on the right, left side of the hotel is drug store, restaurants and Starbucks. Stone throw away from hotel is the famous more than a thousand years old temple which was burnt 4 times before. Train station is just less than 2minutes walk. 24hours Donki is a 5minutes walk. The hotel is surrounded by all the attractions which is within walking distance. Food and shopping is much cheaper here (Asakusa). Must try the rickshaw ride. Almost everything is great about the hotel.....but it doesn't have concierge service. Took taxi from hotel to Haneda airport cost 7650yen. We have 2 large and 2 medium luggages, luckily can fit into the taxi. Breakfast nothing to shout about, can do without it. If you are going to Shibuya, it takes 40mins with almost 100% seats assurance. Reason is train begin from Asakusa and end at Shibuya. Happy reading!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Can't fault this hotel. Very good size rooms & really comfortable with full bathroom toiletries. We had a view over the temple & the terrace bar was great for a view of the city and Tokyo tower. The buffet breakfast was also very good. Our greatest compliment is for the wonderful staff, in particular the reception ladies as my husband had very bad chest pain during the evening and they organized for him to see a doctor. As it turns out the doctor was a cardiologist & very close by. He was thoroughly checked out & luckily it just turned out to be muscular but the staff were amazing. Thank you so much for such a wonderful introduction to Japan. Highly recommended

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Excellent location! Just opposite Senso-ji. Hotel lobby is located on the top floor and offers a superb view of the city! It is a steal to get a room with such a nice decor and good location at this price. The room is considered quite big in Tokyo compared to other hotels at similar rate. Bathroom is very clean which scores it more points. One downside is that the hotel is located very closed to the next building. So there is no view from my window.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was our second visit here! The location in Asakusa cannot be beat. It is on the main street across the Kaminarimon Gate, a block from the Metro, nearby Kappabashi, Skytree and Ueno. The Asakusa is vibrant, energetic and filled with culture. The Gate Hotel is a wonderful and convenient place to explore this area and beyond. It is also a very clean, comfortable, restful hotel with great service(s). I left an expensive camera attachment in my room and two stop later across Japan, the hotel tracked me (by email) and sent it to my next destination. I cannot fully express my gratitude for their excellent services and communication!! The staff is super! I will return again as it is such a great experience!!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved The Gate Hotel. A fabulous location in Asakusa and an easy walk from the station. A beautifully designed hotel: room, public spaces in in particular the roof top terrace. Food and coffee was amongst the best we had in Japan. Friendly, helpful staff - and good value for Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed for 4 nights in early October. In general the hotel is clean and tidy with a view of Tokyo Skytree. It is also very close to Asakusa station, so it was convenient for taking public transport. However, Asakusa station is very old and some part don't have escalator. Therefore be mindful about carrying your heavy suitcases up and down those stairs. The staff at the front desk spoke good English, but those at the restaurant don't. I had a style C classy king room with the view of the Skystree. The room is modern, clean, spacious and quiet. I found the lighting in the room was inadequate. I had to use my torch to read the display on the control panel of the air conditioner. However it did not bother me too much. In general I really like the room.There was a laundry press in the room but no iron. The laundry press would be good for trousers and suits, but could not be used for delicate dresses. I found this very inconvenient. Therefore, ladies better pack dresses that don't need to be iron with you. I'm not sure if the hotel had laundry service as I could not find any information in the room. The breakfast at the hotel is quite boring. They keep serving me fried potato wedges with breakfast. That didn't make sense. There weren't many choice of food. I think it is a bit disappointing when a Japanese hotel didn't serve Japanese or Asian breakfast. There weren't many choices either. I could no longer eat their breakfast on the last day of my stay (even though it was included in my package) because the food was so boring. I would have given them 5 stars if the food was a bit better.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Having never been back to Tokyo in decades, and for an actual holiday versus work, this trip and hotel was a treat and a pleasure!Very nice hotel, lobby on the 13th floor and what a view!Rooms were very decent, considering Japan standards of size! We will return and make this our base for our next trip, real soon.However, housekeeping standards could be better, the carpets and areas around the bins, tables, etc were looking quite dusty actually - reason I could notice was because i was doing some exercises in the room.And oh yah, the room and corridors are very dim, dark carpets, and cupboards, do make it look crammed and difficult to look for things when you drop a similarly dark object on the floor.Else, a great place to stay.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I love the location! Extremely closed to Subway stations and the famous temple. The bed is very comfortable as well. Breakfast choices are limited but adequate. The lobby on the 13th floor gives beautiful of the city and Tokyo Skytree. Staff are friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is particularly well located for travel to and from Narita--just a couple of blocks from a subway/train line that goes directly there. It's also in Asakusa, a nice older section of Tokyo with numerous restaurants and shops, and a shrine/temple you'd probably want to visit even if you didn't stay here. The hotel itself is at the top of a 13-story building, with the lobby on floor 13, with stunning views across the city to the north and west. Rooms are large, modern, clean, and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. For example, they will happily store your luggage for you even if it's too early to check in. Also, they had a happy hour on the roof deck--a great chance to meet fellow travelers. Unlike every other place we stayed in Japan, we found many fellow Americans here.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Staying at the Gate Hotel was a great experience all round. The location is prefect for access to/from Narita airport and it is very near to the Senso-ji Temple allowing you to visit in the morning or night when visitor numbers are down. The rooms are a good size by Tokyo standards. We had two kids in our room with us and with the twin beds together there was far more bed and floor space than we expected. The bathroom is but and functional; in fact the shower was superb with quality fittings. Everything was clean and tidy and well serviced during our stay. A Nespresso coffee machine in the room was also a pleasant surprise. There is a supermarket downstairs, convenient for drinks and grabbing fruit/snacks for the day. Staff are pleasant and helpful. They provided umbrellas for our day trips. The only negative was a charge if we wanted to check in early. Note also that they fully charge the room to your credit card when you check in, not when you check out – this was a first for us.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our stay at the stylish and elegant Gate Hotel was excellent. The location is perfect, Asakusa beeing a very pleasant and traditional district where you can relax from the more hustling and bustling areas of Tokyo. The oldest temple complex of the city (Sensoji) is situated just in front of the hotel.The nearby subway station (3mn walk) offers direct and fast transportation to both airports and there are connections to most points of interest of the city. The stuff at the reception is very welcoming and helpful. Rooms are large for japanese standards, very clean and modern, breakfast is excellent, but they don't serve japanese breakfast. The absolute highlight were the stunning night views of Tokyo Skytree and surrounding neighborhoods from the rooftop terrace and bar, one of the best views in town, relax and have a cocktail! We really enjoyed our stay at this friendly hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We liked the charming Ikea-like style of the rooms, the pretty lobby and rooftop bar and terrace. Excellent location in the older portion of Tokyo - the Ginza line station and Senso-ji are literally across the street. Service was exceptional, as is usual in Japan. The staff bent over backwards to coordinate our 2 rooms with 2 different methods of payment and 2 different reservation numbers and we had no problems. My only minor complaints - the rooms are very tight - the smallest of our 4 hotels while in Japan. Also, the Climate Control system is in Japanese only and didn't work as well as we'd like (or maybe we couldn't figure out how to use properly) - it was 85 and humid in Tokyo and we weren't as comfortable sleeping as we would've liked. All in all, a very nice stay - we would definitely book again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: An elegant design, amazing views, very polite staff, comfortable beds. Would definitely recommend it. Welcoming lobby area and restaurant with spectacular views also from the terrace on the top floor.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel was clean, provided courteous service and had a few memorable design touches. The location was good for Asakusa and not too distant from 2 metro stations. We might consider staying here again but we might also look into a more centrally situated hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is a new hotel with good location, comfortable room, and excellent service. The hotel staff never hesitate to provide aid with polite manner. We made the hotel reservation via different booking website considering saving money; the hotel staff actively found it and combined the different orders into one room, which make us no need to check-out and check-in repeatedly. We really appreciate this.Besides, a famous spot, 雷門, is just in the opposite of this hotel, a supermarket is nearby, and lots of restaurants are around here. For people who travel with elders, it's also suggested to stay in this hotel for whole vacation.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This could be the best hotel I've ever stayed in Japan. The view from the lobby and the rooftop lounge is breath-taking. The room is spacious and clean. With easy access to all famous spots in Asakusa, I don't even need subway to explore Tokyo. During the trip one of my family got lost and separated from us, and the hotel staff were extremely kind, sincere and helpful to assist with us in every way possible. We can never thank them enough. We would definitely wanna stay at this hotel again when we visit Asakusa next time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location is excellent, it is right across Kaminarimon, Senso-ji and Nakamise… The hustle and bustle is there but not in front of the hotel. There is the Asakusa Station (of 4 different railway companies : Tokyo Metro Ginza Line, Toei Underground Railway Asakusa, Tobu Isesaki Line and the Tsukuba Express Line). If you need assistance, the Asakusa Culture Tourist Information Center is along the way. There are lots of local restaurants in the neighborhood but if you still crave for American food, McDonald’s and Denny’s are nearby. A supermarket and a drugstore are just downstairs (FamilyMart and 7-Eleven are close by.) Shopping is incredible, there are Don Quijote (a 24h discount chain store that provides tax-free shopping of almost anything and everything) and ROX (a department store with a 24h supermarket.) If you like plastic/wax food samples and kitchen utensils, there is Kappabashi Street (Kitchen Town) within walking distance. The hotel itself is exceptional, the reception on the 13th Floor and the rooftop Terrace offer breathtaking view of the city especially the Skytree. The soundproof wall and soaking tub give you the relaxation you need after a long day. Better still, it has rooms with 3 single beds for groups of three. Last but not least, the courteous, friendly and knowledgeable staff make our stay enjoyable and memorable.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for my first three nights in Japan, and was really happy with my choice. Modern hotel with good-sized rooms, coffee machine, no wardrobe though (but I later found out it is the rule in Japan!). Nice and helpful staff, English-speaking. Fair breakfast buffet.The hotel is virtually next to two underground lines, so it is perfect for sightseeing tours, in the sightseeing Sensoji-Temple area. Definitely a nice stay, would recommend.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel was a great choice to stay for us. You have the Sensō-ji Temple at your door step and the view from the Lobby in the 13th floor is magnificent. Also the Asakusa and Ginza line are really just 2 minutes down the road and you are in Shibuya, Harajuku and Ginza within 20 to 30 minutes. Staff is super nice and friendly. We came in early and had decided not to pay extra for early check-in also to force us into the rhythm with jetlag and all. They kept our luggage and we found it ready in our room when we returned at 2pm. So we could already discover the surrounding area like the said shrine, the Asahi building and the walk along the Sumida River. For those who want to still keep fit (not gym at the hotel) there is a 2km /2km running path along the Sumida River when you cross the bridge towards the Asahi Headquarters.Our room was on the 12th floor and the view was amazing. Even for our shower we had a panoramic view on Asakusa. The bed is brilliantly comfortable and it is very calm - at least for our stay it was. The hotel is modern- even though a bit somber - still well furbished. The lobby is on the top floor and the rooms are below. There is a bar which is also the place to get breakfast. We had our breakfast included but I admit we only had it the first day. While we are always willing to fit in and adjust culturally, penne with tomato sauce and mini croissants was not quite my deal for the morning. The hot food you can order (I had a french toast) was very good. But attention: there were two thick slices of pork belly hiding in my French Toast so if you are vegetarian you might want to announce that from the beginning. Not to worry Westerners, there is a lovely Starbucks just down on the corner. But in terms of comfort, surrounding area and ease to reach other parts of the city the Gate Hotel was really the top choice. What we forgot to do was to go up to the roof top terrace. So I cannot comment on that.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our family of 4 found this hotel to be perfect for our 5 night Tokyo stay - we did book 2 adjoining rooms (Essential twin rooms) to accommodate our teens and this was still reasonable in price giving us good space, 2 bathrooms, and comfortable sleeping for the same price as 1 high end room in Tokyo. Ask for a corner room as this had a little extra space to store luggage. Front desk - They are pleasant and helpful though English was just adequate when we were trying to ask for recommendations for local restaurants. They conveniently stored our luggage and kept a package we had delivered safe.Rooms - pretty decent in size and actually bigger than I expected (bigger than some rooms in big cities in the US) with a sitting area, closet, drawers, desk, and plenty of plugs for charging. Beds are firm as are most we had in Japan, but good linens and AC made for a good nights sleep. The bathrooms were immaculate and also plenty big for 2 people (would have been tight had all 4 of us had 1 bathroom). Came with all the toiletries you might need including toothbrush/toothpaste and a hair band.Breakfast - the full breakfast (including buffet) was pretty highly priced($20) and not worth it for us. We were satisfied most days with the buffet alone and if anyone was extra hungry then the half portions were adequate and cheaper. It is not a large buffet but had freshly squeezed orange juice, granola, yogurt, potatoes, vegetables, some local foods, 1 or 2 fruits and bread/butter/jam.Location - it felt very safe, both the neighborhood and the hotel since the elevators are in a nondescript building lobby and you need a room key to get to the room floors. Stairs to the metro are less than a block down the street - we handled our luggage fine on them but there is no escalator. There is an elevator entrance somewhere but we never looked for it. We traveled all over Tokyo from this station and found it very convenient. There is the obligatory Starbucks a few doors down and a small grocery store next door.I booked this based on Tripadvisor reviews and you haven't let me down yet fellow tripadvisors - I highly recommend this hotel. And the views from the lobby and balcony bar are a fantastic bonus!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good service and housekeeping. Attractive landscape on thirteen floor and the hotel location is near the subway and hot spot. Thank you very much to satisfy our needs such as drinking water and keeping luggage . Next time I'll chose again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Breakfast is very tasty and delicious, but too little selectivity , it is recommended to add Chinese meals , vegetarian meals or Japanese-style meals.In the hotel facilities , we recommend drinking fountains can be added to reduce the supply of bottled water.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location is quite close to Metro and convenient no matter which airport you are going or coming. regarding breakfast, though there are not various options, you can enjoy your meal with nice view (TOKYO SKYTREE) and taste all good. I love it !

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice modern hotel with one Michelin Star. Good check in and check out. Close to subway and train to airport. They gave me good directions as to how to get to the hotel from Shinkansen - Shinagawa Station. When I emailed the hotel, they helped me and told us to take the elevator from Subway, thus reducing dragging the heavy luggage up the stairs. Very commendable service via email. Thank you very much.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We appreciate:- the good situation (access to both airport Narita and Haneda, access to Ginza Line)- nice neighborhood - very close to Senso-Ji- very nice view from the Lobby (Tokyo sky tree, Asahi, Kaminarimon- good breakfast

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel was so nice located in Asakusa area, attendance excellent and good price/amenities ratio.When we arrived to the hotel, staff was so owesome and all were helps. In order to find nice location to visit Tokio, this hotel fits properly.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed at the Gate Hotel for three nights in mid August. We stayed in a "Scenic" room on the 10th floor. Staff: The staff at this hotel are first rate. They are friendly, spoke good English and were extremely attentive. I had the impression that they went out of their way to make the customer feel important. Room: We were in room 1004 (Scenic Room) with twin beds. The room faced the Skytree tower and had a nice view of this part of the city. The windows were big and it made the room feel very bright. The room itself was not huge compared to North American standards but quite big compared to most Japanese hotels I have stayed in. It was very clean, had good lighting, a fridge, writing desk and sitting area. We stayed in Tokyo when the temperature hovered near 34C each day. The air conditioning in our room had no trouble keeping the room cool.Food and Drink: We had breakfast included with our room. The breakfast included a choice of four entrees (eggs benedict, french toast), a small buffet and coffee/juices. Although others have indicated the breakfast was not that great I thought it provided the best breakfasts I had in Japan. The food was always hot, the service was friendly and fairly quick and the view was great. There is also a roomtop bar that has a great view and is a pleasant way to end off your day.Location: The hotel is located a couple of blocks from the Asakusa metro station. We basically followed the directions posted on the website and had no trouble getting there (at night) from the Narita airport. It takes just over an hour. The hotel is very close to numerous shrines/temples and a large shopping area. The metro gets you to other areas of Tokyo easily.Overall this was a great hotel with great staff. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room we stayed is cozy and with great view. Location is very good. Few minutes walk to metro station and Kaminarimon. There is a supermarket downstairs and you can get everything there. It has perfect view for sky tree tower. Will definitely visit this hotel again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had the Nice room 1004 with view on skytree tower.The room was Confortable and spacious.Breafast was not worth the value with limited choice of dishes. It is a Mix of japanese and western style which is not out taste

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed in room 303 for 10 days. The hotel is absolutely wonderful. The surroundings is great, the room is spacious and very comfortable. The bed is very cushy and various pillows available. The staff (reception, restaurant, bar, housekeeping) is perfect in every way (friendly, helpful and competently). Big recommendation. Definitely one of the best hotels I ever stayed in Tokyo. I will definitely come back.To be honest, there is nothing to grouse about. But maybe two little hints to improve: The room has a wonderful balcony. It would be great to have a little table and two chairs to enjoy sitting outside. And a wardrobe beside the main door would be great.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed in The Gate hotel for our 15th anniversary. The hotel has excellent service and give us a surprise during our breakfast time. Location is also good. There is a supermarket and drug store near by. It is easy for shopping. We would like to stay at the Gate hotel again for our next trip.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This place saved my day.I happen to book this hotel last minute because the hostel I stayed at was not as I expected. This hotel was flexible and I was able to stay that night. The lobby is located on the 12th floor where you can see the streets view of Taito and tokyo tower. It is also conveniently located across from Asakusa station and Ginza line station, and 2 blocks away from Starbucks and good tempura restaurants. There are lots of tourists walking outside and maybe because temples are nearby. What really AWE me was the excellent service of the staff. After I checked out and got on the train, I realized my portable rented wifi pouch and charger was left in the room, I couldn't go back since I am catching a flight. I called the hotel to just double check if I really left it in the room, which they confirmed I did. So I gave no instructions and I just said I'll call back. Next day, I received an email from the wifi rental company that they will not charge me $54 for the lost item since my hotel shipped it to them, and I am just soooo shocked and really appreciate how the staff of Gate Hotel truly cares about their customers, not just while their checked in, but also when they are no longer a guest. To the Gate Hotel staffs, thank you so much, you are one of a kind. I will definitely come back and recommend your hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Mid-level, modern, pretty luxurious although not 5 star.Convenient location for subway access to the rest of the city and for a twice an hour express train to Narita Airport.Quiet, more local feeling neighborhood while still being in Tokyo city with convenient access to all sites. Nearby covered pedestrian shopping street was fun. Not a lot of late night activities nearby and not a walkable location from late night areas - but Tokyo is large so walk-ability is limited for any hotel.Staff was very helpful for making restaurant reservations and helping to figure other things out, such as where the sumo training center was or pre-booking an early taxi to take us to Tsukiji fish market for the tuna auction.Didn't try the food at the hotel although it looked good. There are plenty of great restaurants nearby.Excellent view from rooftop deck which no one seemed to use.7-Eleven nearby which is always key in Japan for snacks, breakfast, ATM, and wifi.Would stay again and recommend to friends. My wife and I appreciated the less packed area.For the same price or less, you could stay in a Japanese chain hotel in a dead-center location or spend more and be in a nicer place - this place was a good compromise.
user_name:
Adam S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location, two-three minutes walk from Asakusa station and the lovely temple next to it.The spectacular view of Tokyo Skytree and other features of Tokyo's skyline from the lobby, restaurant and the bar upstairs is second to none!The room was lovely, clean and provided the usual goodies one can find in Japanese hotels without the shoes nonsense that can be found occasionally (different shoes for different parts of the house).The breakfast was absolutely fantastic. The cater vegans and vegetarians and advised us which of the huge buffet items are off limit for veggies.A hassle free night in one of the best hotel I've been to!It's that simple.And it wasn't even too expensive...

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: the location is great that it is just a 3 mins walk from asakusa station and there is a supermarket just next to the hotel. hotel staffs are very helpful and can communicate with good english. room is clean and comfortable. and the view of the lobby and terrace is very great!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: it is very well in this hotel.My wife and I are very like it.And we go there to enjoy the fireworks festival.There restaurant 14th floor is very good view.Next time we go to Tokyo we will live again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: What about the Gate?? View? Super nice, from the lobby, the terrace... Sky tree night and day!Room? Nice with the same view...Restaurant? Nice with the same view...I know many place in Tokyo and it was my first stay here.What i miss for a vow?Food quality averagePersonnal quality averageLocation quality averagePersonnaly i miss a piece of saoul! That's it!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Everything is close to this great hotel. Two subway lines, the Sensoji temple, two supermarkets, restaurants, shops and anything else you can need. The room was sizeable, free and fast wifi, also has everything else you might need and the shower head was adjustable and high enough for western sized people. We did not have much of a view in our very quiet room, but the reception area and roof top terrace offer pretty amazing views of the city, the temple and the Skytree. Staff is beyond friendly and helpful and their English is very good. Treat yourself and stay here

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It's located very close to asakusa station and Kaminarimon. The building is very clean and quiet as well as the room itself. It's just so satisfying that you're assured to have a great rest while staying. The bathroom is also neat and clean with an efficient layout and wonderful water pressure from the shower head. Nespresso is another happiness.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed in April 2016, in Modest Small Double for Single Use Non- smoking type room. Solo travel.There are many things different with hotel culture in Japan and there are many rules and do's and dont's. It is good to know and you are expected follow it strictly so you wont be embarrased.1) Check-in and check-out times:- there is strictly NO early check-in and strictly NO late check-out without any surcharge. And do take note that the surcharge is extremely expensive which usually culculated by hourly.2) Room rates are culculated per head. If there is an extra person, you are expected to pay the extra, which in most hotel you have to get another room. Therefore, it is very common in Japan, there are rooms cater exclusively for only one person, like this one I am staying.3) All hotels in Japan do have Smooking rooms on Smoking floors. Therefore, when making a reservation, do ensure (I really meant this!) whether your rooms are smoking room or otherwise. If you are a non-smoker like me, I am sure you dont want to regret over your stupidness to not check your room type.ROOM - As mentioned, this is my first time staying at a room exclusively for one person. All I can say, I am amazed! The room size is pretty decent for a Japan standard with good size of bathroom. There is two type of room of this type, mine is the one with long corridor from the entrance door (see picture of floor plan if you may). The reason I mention this is because this room feels and looks bigger. LOCATION - A short 10 minutes walk from Asakusa subway station. In front of the Asakusa Shrine, major tourist spot in Tokyo. Surrounding with many restaurants, shops, and convenience stores.This hotel is newly built. You can see and feel it is new. I love it so much and will definitely stay here again if I travel alone.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Spent two nights here at the end of a 8 day stay in Japan. We had a very spacious room with a fabulous view of the city. The room was very clean, modern and had everything we could want. It is a bit strange that the lobby is above all the hotel floors so you have to go down to your room instead of up. If you were heading out and wanted some information from the front desk, you'd have to ride up and then back down to street level.The rooftop patio was quite nice to have a drink on and take in the views after a day about town.My only qualm was that it is an area of town that didn't quite suit me. It was nice to spend time in Asakusa but the life around Shinjuku was more the Tokyo experience I liked. If I'm lucky enough to travel to Tokyo again, I would stay only in Shinjuku and take the metro in to Asakusa for the day.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Convenience of location in tourist area when arriving jet lagged from Europe. Easy to visit sites, take boat ride around city staff impeccably polite and helpful . Forwarding of luggage no problem. 14th floor terrace bar great vantage point to view city at night all lit up. How do they keep it all so quiet and relaxed?

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very clean, spacious rooms, the hotelHas a nice modern, luxurious feel. Staff are very helpful. Good location for the sites of old Japan, and very close to the metro station ( use exit 1 ) However the restaurant was average and if like us you want to enjoy the nightlife of GInza, Rappongi and Shibuya this hotel was a little bit far out- as taxis are very expensive. Despite this, I would stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great hotel with friendly and helpful staff, fantastic views of Sensō-ji, the Skytree, and Asahi Building, perfectly situated in my favorite Tokyo neighborhood. I also loved the pajamas - I want my own set for home! Reasonably priced for Tokyo, highly recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Maybe it is our fault that we didn't notice floor level for view of skytree, we chose scenic room for view of skytree but nothing seen; finally we understand 5 floor will not guarantee view of skytree, a little bite disappointed.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Thank you for your serviceThe accommodations are very satisfied with our happyYour staff is very friendly and earnest, we are very grateful to themI am interested in your hotel services very satisfied, but also look forward to the next meeting

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Excellent hotel with a good location. Just three minutes walk to Sensoji Temple. Supermarket and drug store nearby. All staff can spoke good English and friendly. The room was clean and tidy, with a excellent Skytree view.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed for 2 luxurious nights at The Gate Hotel. It is a very funky, gorgeously outfitted establishment - so much so that this is our second visit! The entrance off the street, with the water installations built into the ceiling immediately indicate that you're in for something special. This combined with the lobby being located on the 13th floor reinforces an unorthodox approach and much design flare. The view from the 13th floor lobby & bar, and the additional rooftop bar are fantastic - a wonderfull vista of the whole Asakusa area, with the Skytree taking centre stage. As this was our return visit, we were very generously (and very unexpectedly) upgraded to the premiere “The Gate” suite which was not only beautifully appointed but shared the spectacular views of the 13th floor! From the William Morris wall paper to the signature egg shaped lamps, The Gate exudes sophistication without ever being overstated. The beds were incredibly comfy and the bathroom was spacious with a seperate bath and shower - and also a view! The staff were very welcoming and hospitable. Needless to say, we highly recommend The Gate Hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Gate Hotel Asakusa was my last hotel stay on my one-week trip to Japan. The others have all been amazing, with that special Japanese service, and this one was no different.It started out a little wonky, as I realized I only booked for one person under my name, and I was travelling with my husband. They handled it like pros, and never once gave me the feeling that they were blaming me, or annoyed at my mistake. I only had to pay extra for the extra person's breakfast, which was inclusive with my existing booking.The room is not spectacular, but the view is, especially from their bird's eye view lobby and hotel restaurant. You can check my pictures. The breakfast buffet is yummy, with just enough choices for a long day. Everywhere you go the staff are friendly and eager to help.But what really left an impression on me was what happened after my stay. I left my wedding ring on the countertop when we were hauling all our luggages out, and from my experience in other hotels, if it's gone, it's gone. I only realized it was gone when we were about to board the plane, so I sent a quick email and reminded myself to call later, since emails take longer to reach them. Not Gate Hotel though, by the time I was in Macau, the spectacular Ayako Ishida had replied to me, and sent me a picture of the ring and asked for my address.I offered to pay the cost of shipping, but they wouldn't hear of it and shipped it for free. I received my ring via express mail after a week with a note thanking me for my stay, when I should be thanking them for this service.I will definitely stay at this hotel again during my next Tokyo trip, and I highly recommend it to anyone going to Tokyo.PROS:Amazing view in lobby and restaurant - 10/10Polite, Professional and spectacular staff, who go beyond the usual guest dutiesGreat location - if you're planning to go to the airport via metro, Asakusa is one of the two areas with the direct train. In front of the hotel is the Asakusa Temple, which also happens to be the area to buy all the Japanese souvenirs like mochi. Metro is five minutes walk away. So many food options. Easy Transportation - Gate is five minutes away from the stationCONS:With everything else, the room was actually quite plain. I booked the standard room and it had a small window only.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Visited this hotel for lunch. It has a nice view of Sky Tree and you can also see the local shrine (Senso-ji) which is quite famous. Really nice selection of lunch items such as soups, salads, sandwiches, and more elaborate full entree choices. Bar has many drink choices and quality liquors (Mine was rum and coke with Guatamalean rum and my wife's was mojito). Rooftop lounge is only open to guests, but we were able to look around and it would be a great place at night for viewing the city if you were staying at the hotel. The room rates seem reasonable for a better hotel in the Tokyo area; common areas were nice and clean. There are many shops for souvenirs very close to hotel and the ground level has a grocery store which is helpful. In a city like Tokyo it is good to have a home base that is quiet and this place should work well. Close to the terminal end of the Asakusa line subway and only a couple of stops from Ueno station from where any destination is easily reached.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good Service ,Good Location, Good View ! It's a Modern style Hotel ! I can see the sky tree in the room, It take me so relaxed . The Comfortable bed , We sleep very well ! it is the best choice in Asakusa .

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room is very clean and space is large.Service is very good. My kids was sick and throw up to stainbed on midnight. I called service to replace bed cover and she quickly came to room to help us. She always smile on face.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Superbly finished with a great attention to detail from the lobby and public areas to the rooms. Rooms are very spacious by Tokyo standards and the pyjamas are a nice touch (you can buy them, do it!)The staff are very helpful and made our stay more enjoyable with tips and advice on the local area. Last but not least the roof top bar offers classy cocktails and stunning views to match.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: 1. The room was a bit small , but very clean and comfortable2. The washing machine in the hotel did not make me a little troubled3. The capsule coffee machine in the room , great !4. counter staff good service5. The stay in the room a great view , you can see the mine gate and SKYTREE , very lucky6. conveniently close to exit from the subway station

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Loved everything about our 5 night stay in Asakusa at the Gate Hotel. The hotel staff was very cordial and helpful. Though the room was a little small especially with all our luggage, but didn't pose any problems. (Had a view of the Skytree Tower from our room). The hotel's location couldn't be any better in Asakusa, close to the Temple, Skytree Tower, subway lines and all the interesting shopping areas and restaurants.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed at a triple room and first arrived thinking this is tiny but after talking with friends this is considering big when you are staying in Tokyo! But we were quickly amused by the view-skytree tower, the cleanness, and the bathroom! The bathroom is very well designed with shower and bath separate and the toiletries has everything even includes face wash. Their shampoo, conditioner, body wash and toothbrush is all good to use no need to buy better quality from the shop.Staffs were also very friendly and all spoke English very well so we had no trouble staying here! Very lovely hotel would definitely consider this hotel if we are visiting Tokyo again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel was situated in great location for exploring Asakusa. Amazing views from rooftop outdoor space and bar. Bartender very friendly. Rooms were clean and adequate size for Tokyo. Please note not the best location to make homebase for exploring Tokyo but good for last night before heading to airport. Unreal soba spot coupke blocks away called Namiki Yabusoba.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Love the view and the staff and how understanding they were about gluten avoidance!I was able to get steamed rice with a plain poached egg every morning, which I really appreciated in a country that doesn't have much knowledge of food intolerances.We had asked the hotel staff to call and make a reservation at a tea ceremony for us while we were out for the day, and they took the very considerate extra step of requesting gluten-free snacks for me during the ceremony.
user_name:
Jenny S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: When doing our initial planning for our 2 week stay in Japan, we had factored in some time to return to Tokyo after touring the major cities. As we had stayed in Shinagawa during our first Tokyo stint, we opted for this hotel in Asakusa, due to the many positive reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel is situated roughly 4 minutes by foot from the Senso-ji exit of the Asakusa Metro station, and stands diagonally opposite the entrance to the Nakamise-dori/Kaminarimon. Of particular note is the ease of access to the station, and the proximity to Senso-ji. The area features a whole host of excellent and reasonably priced restaurants and places to explore on the same street as the hotel, as well as in the precinct directly opposite the hotel. Asakusa is a destination in itself, and this hotel is a fantastic location to explore from.The hotel lobby is located on the top floor, so the ground floor consists of just an entrance corridor to the elevators. The reception area is very nice, if not a little understated, with a large lounge overlooking Asakusa and the Skytree. The restaurant is also located on this level, and it is very busy. Whenever we were in the reception area, day or night, the restaurant was always full. On that basis, I would suggest you get reservations if you intend to eat there. Check-in was simple and efficient, and we went to our room on the 6th floor. Having had our luggage sent on by takkyubin previously, it was nice to have our luggage waiting in our room when we arrived. As the hotel fronts on to the main street in Asakusa, I would recommend getting a room to the side of the hotel, which faces a sidestreet and has a nice view of the skytree. As a result, it is very protected from street noise. Complementary wifi access was offered, but as we had a portable router, we did not use the service.Our room was lacking in space in terms of the living area, despite having just one large bed (which was two doubles pushed together). This made getting around the room a little difficult, considering there was not much room for the couch and table and working space at the desk. The room was very dark and appeared to be a mish-mash of various styles, with post-modern, classic and industrial designs all clashing and not really giving coherence to the feeling of the room. On our first day we noted that the room was quite dusty, but was gradually cleaned out as our stay went on. The rooms were well kept, with the staff organising our items we had casually left on the floor in our hurry to leave most mornings. The bathroom size was quite generous, with a separate tub and shower, and the amenities were better than expected. One thing I noticed was significant noise coming from other rooms - to the side and the room above us, with heavy stamping and children running through the corridor.Due to our busy schedule in Tokyo, we were unable to try the restaurant, but we did venture to the sky garden, which has one of the best views in all of Tokyo. There's an intimate restaurant near the sky garden, which also has an immaculate view, but we were unable to score a seat. Service was generally good, and I must thank the staff for allowing us use of a laptop to check in to our flights before we departed.Overall, our stay was quite pleasant, and I would easily recommend this hotel to those seeking a stay in the Asakusa area. In terms of the price point, I would say the hotel just scrapes by on the right side of value for money.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed 4 nights in the Gate hotel. It was by far the best hotel we stayed in in Japan. Rooms are clean and new and larger than the average Japanese hotel room. The hotel is located in a nice, busy area, but the rooms are quiet. There are plenty of restaurants, bakeries, coffee places nearby. The metro is a 3 mins walk - Narita airport can be easily reached and the Ginza line is very helpful when exploring other parts of Tokyo. It is quite far from other areas, such as Shibuya, but in more central locations prices for these type of hotels are at least double. The hotel has a nice skybar with great views of Skytree and Senso-ji. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel Asakusa Kaminarimon is an exceptional hotel providing a truly Japanese-style hospitality and comfort, intimately tailored to every guest. My husband and I are relatively frequent travelers, who have visited at least a couple dozen countries around the World, making four to five international trips per year. I confess that through our quarter of a century experience as travelers we have not seen management services comparable to the ones provided by The Gate Hotel Asakusa.  The hotel is perfectly located in the Tokyo area we have loved the most- Asakusa. The windows of the hotel are overlooking both Tokyo’s oldest Senso-ji temple, founded in the seventh century, and the twenty first century Tokyo Skytree, the tallest tower in Japan and the second tallest building in the world. The location couldn’t be more unique than this, as you can enjoy the view of both from the window of your room. There was one additional consideration about why we selected this particular hotel for our recent stay, mid-May 2016, in Tokyo. The Gate Hotel belongs to the group of Design Hotels, in which we have stayed a few times around the world. We found from our own experience that this group of hotels has a distinct commitment to placing hotels in great locations, providing somewhat ascetic yet very comfortable rather than excessively luxurious experiences, and delivering impeccable and “non-invasive” management services. In particular, we enjoyed our visit to The Louis Hotel in Munich, Germany, and anticipated that the experience of staying at The Gate Hotel, Asakusa will be somewhat similar, or perhaps better, given the environmental conscious and ascetic nature of Japanese culture. We found this expectation to be fully true. In this sense of management’s “non-invasiveness” we found The Gate Hotel Asakusa at the best of this philosophy. Instead of a minibar with overpriced items they provide travelers with a comfortable living environment including a refrigerator, coffee machine, tea and glassware sets and great advice on grocery shops located on ground floor of the hotel, where you can get sushi and wine for $5-10 each, or a small exceptional place where one can leave $500 for two. Whatever you ask The Gate Hotel management, you will get honest advice without any attempts to sell the tourists any services they do not need. In addition to the breath taking views from all our windows, impeccable cleanness, everyday vacuuming and wet wiping of windows, mirrors, etc. there always have been exemplary politeness from the hotel staff. An unfortunate accident happened to us, when we visiting Senso-ji temple; I wanted to touch the “Giant Straw Sandals" there, because of the legend that “they are charms from evil” and if one does touch it, then one will became a tireless walker. My husband lifted me to reach the height of the “giant sandal” and touch it, but when he was putting me back on the ground, I hurt my foot. It was so serious that I could barely walk back to The Gate Hotel – I was sobbing from pain. In a few hours it became clear that I needed professional medical help.  We contacted The Gate Hotel Management and they immediately arranged our transportation to the University of Tokyo Medical Center. Masami Kawagoe took care about all logistics, translations (Japanese to English and back) and hospital emergency room issues. Luckily, no bones were broken in the foot, but a serious torn tendon was detected. We spent hours in the ER of University of Tokyo medical center instead of at a Sumo wrestling match, which we had originally planned for the evening and for which we had bought tickets a much in advance. By about 8pm we were back to The Gate Hotel and it was clear that we had to either terminate our planned remaining week traveling Japan (including Kyoto and Miyajima Island), or find a way to rent a wheelchair in the next eight hours – I at this point couldn’t walk at all. The healing process could be two or three months. Masami Kawagoe discussed this problem with the hotel management and the hotel’s management came with the proposal that they would give us (at no cost) the hotel wheelchair to let us continue our travel in Japan, and later the hotel staff would come to the train station in the Tokyo region to collect the wheelchair when we would be traveling back to the Narita/Tokyo airport on our way back to Los Angeles. This kindest gesture of The Gate Hotel Management saved our travel arrangements and our remaining wonderful visit to Japan. What is most incredible is that all these arrangements to mitigate our unfortunate travel accident were done based on a “gentlemen’s” agreement established on just a word, and on honoring such a word, with no formal signatures or legalities. To conclude, we wanted to thank The Gate hotel management, and particularly Masami Kawagoe for the assistance provided during our troubled travel. We are looking forward for our next visit to Tokyo, and the choice of The Gate Hotel for our stay has been decided. It is one of kind hotel.
user_name:
Lara V V
Los Angeles, California

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great view from the hotel, easy to get anything you want around that location but a bit far to Shinjuku, if you're a big fan of shopping then might need to consider this.Staff in the hotel are quite OK, they will give you the assistance but not take the initiative

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate is a lovely modern boutique hotel in popular Asakusa area. Close to the Sanja-sama, one of the most famous Shinto shrines in Tokyo, it is easy to get around from. The rooms are bigger than usual in Japanese hotels and the view from the13th floor reception and bar is great for sunset drinks.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was our first hotel in Japan, and it was a surprise to have the lobby on the top floor, but after a while it made sense. You take a lift from ground floor to the 10th, and check in there.Our room was comfortable, but small, and with two week's luggage was a bit cramped, but we soon got used to it. We got a good night's sleep, despite being in Tokyo, seemed to be a quiet area away from the centre, even though our room faced onto the street.Breakfast could get crowded before eight, but there was always the fine views of the city to take in whilst you waited for a free table. Food was cooked fresh to order, which was good.Best of all is the rooftop terrace and bar, with great views to the Sky Tree, which once dark is just spectacular.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here 4 nights at the end of our trip to Japan. It is well located close to Asakusa station and temple and also for the train to Haneda.It is a small hotel.The room are nice, big and have kettle, coffee machine and fridge. The rooms have a lovely shower and Japanese bath.There is a supermarket next door.The rooms on the top floors have better views. The staff were very helpful.The only issue was that the choice of European items at breakfast was limited. You have a choice of freshly cooked eggs but there was only one type of fresh fruit. There is fresh orange juice and honey.Overall we would recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed 2 nights here and it was a great and unforgettable experience. It is easy to find just across the Kaminarimon temple. It is a very stylish and modern hotel with the check in counter on the top floor, 13th floor. They also has a roof top for their guests to enjoy the view of skytree and the city. They have a grocery store and a drug store (which sells mostly cosmetic & drugs), a Starbucks on the same block. It is also very convenient to the subway line. The one has an elevator access is exit 1, which you have to across the street. The rest only with stairs access. It is less than 25 mins walk from the hotel to Skytree. The hotel room was very clean and tidy. They have the Nesspresso in the room which is a bonus to me. Reception staffs were very friendly and always willing to help. Don't worry if you don't speak Japanese, they all good speak pretty good English. I have not tried the restaurant but they offer great deal of beer and champagne to their guests. The size of the room is not as tiny as the other in Japan. At least we have 3 28' luggage and we could opened them fully on the floor for packing. I love this hotel so much.
