It does worth for what you are paying for. There are lots of restaurants around!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very helpful staffs, good location, excellent service. Will sure return for future visit.Super market right next to the hotel entrance; and restaurants closed by. Walking distanceto Ginza line subway station (5 mins).

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location of this hotel is great to eplore Tokyo. Near the Asakusa metro station and few steps to Sensoji Temple. We had a great view from the room (Authentic Hollywood Twin style, 11-th floor). Also very clean and well fitted out - all the toletries you need, towels and sheets chage daily, coffee maker and water in the room. The hotel room was quite spacious. The staff was nice, friendly and helpful. The view from the bar and terrace at 14-the floor was amazing. Would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This property is in a great location for exploring Tokyo and the surrounding areas, especially if you're only there for a few days. Rooms are quite small but the ingenious use of space makes up for this. Great bathrooms, typical of Japan and nice, thoughtful touches. Food is good in the restaurant as is the roof top bar which is great for a couple of drinks before heading out.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We started our trip in Japan at this hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Easy to find, exit 2 from the subway right and then left into the main road and approx 3 minute walk. There's a supermarket next door and Starbucks ( where we had breakfast). Rooms are very clean, don't need toiletries as they are all provided. They have drinks on the roof top bar from 3 - 6 for residents, I think a beer was 500 yen. We didn't eat there so can't comment on the food. However, Asakusa has plenty of restaurants. Reception staff were lovely, really helpful and spoke good English. I absolutely loved Asakusa and it's very easy to get to other parts of Tokyo by subway. Fabulous start to our trip.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Modern and clean but with boutique character. Room was small but totally adequate/nothing missing.Great location and easy accessibility to subway (ginza line). Amazing view from top floors and bar/restaurant.Front desk staff helpful and spoke some English. Would absolutely recommend.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Genuine boutique feeling hotel in the Asakusa area of Tokyo. Very hip neighborhood is right across street with numerous small restaurants, shops etc. Great breakfast buffet with solid western options (even eggs Benedict). Rooftop bar. Easy walk to famous, but well touristed, temple. Highly recommend, easy subway access. Asakusa felt authentic. ATM & Starbucks one block.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Couple with a 7 year old. Stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed the location and views. Nespresso machine in the room was a nice touch. No laundry facilities on site but several nearby. Hanging out in the lobby bar and on roof on clear days allows a view of Fuji-San as well.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I had a pretty pleasant stay here in Gate Hotel. It’s my first trip to Tokyo and I wanted to only stay in ONE hotel throughout instead of shuttling to and fro. I think it was a great choice to do so because shuttling around the busy and crowded trains, via stairs to the subway, would not be a very pleasant encounter.Gate Hotel was great for us. We chose a Hollywood Twin room with no breakfast – no breakfast because we wanted to explore the area for options and well, we read mixed reviews about hotel breakfast. We also didn’t have the need to “load up” before going out since we’re trying to cut down on calories (haha) so no buffet for us.NEARBY BREAKFAST OPTIONS – we did find a few really nice cafes around the ‘hood. (1) KOHIKAN served up 100-300yen breakfast sets if you purchased a drink (usually +/-500yen).It’s just across the street to the left (once you walk out of the hotel) after the Family Mart. Barely 5 minutes walk. Served up the best charcoal coffee and crispy & fluffy pancakes. Pancakes were such a hit with my girl we were there 5-6 days out of our 10. (2) E PRONTO is slightly harder to spot unless you’ve come up from this particular Asakusa train exit. It’s on a small road opposite the Kaminarimon. Loads o f choices of pastries or toast sets. Great place to stop by if you’re on the way to the train station. ROOM – The room was adequate for the three of us. We had two super singles which we joined to sleep together. We got our request of a relatively high floor (9th floor) and facing the Tokyo Skytree. It was quite lovely. Room was cleaned everyday with option to change sheets. Pyjamas were also provided – which came in SO USEFUL because in my packing frenzy, I forgot to bring PJs! PJs could also be changed everyday if you wished to but we mostly wore it at least twice since it’d be such a waste.TOILET/BATH – Room came with toilet, and a separate steam-proof area for shower and bathtub. The bath area door kept the warmth in - something really crucial in winter if you were trying to get a warm shower after a day's worth of walking. The bath and toilet was immaculate.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: we stayed here for two nights. we found the hotel rooms quite spacious, clean and very well presented. the beds were comfortable and i could actually fit under the shower (i'm 190cm tall) from the observation deck we could see Mt Fuji and Tokyo tower in one direction and the sky tree in the other the express train takes 1 stop for Tokyo for 180 yen and it 100 meters to the railway station.there is a well priced super market on the ground floor and immediately across the road is a temple and shopping district.if you're on a sight seeing holiday and need somewhere great for your downtime stay here you won't be disapointed.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The staff here are all available to help with hotel related questions and travelers tips. Polite staff from the first greeting, to the housekeeping staff and restaurant! The rooms are very comfy, many comforts not seen in others hotels...for example, pajamas made of soft cotton and very comfy. The bathroom well equipped, toilet seat warmer, self flushing...the tub was deep and bath cubes provided relaxing. The shower was easy to use. We had two nights, left our large suitcases when we traveled around for 10 days. We were allowed as we had another overnight before boarding our cruise ship! Helpful in Every way. If ever in Tokyo again I would make this my first choice...We had breakfast every morning and there were many choices at Buffett or ordering from the menu. We had dinner here twice and enjoyed the food...the server Takuya made it even more enjoyable.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: location is Good! near by subway station, very clean room! low price. Excellent view, crew service also very good and kind.if I visit tokyo, I will select this hotel again. Very satisfied with the hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Had a delightful stay in this hotel for 4 nights. The ensuite i had was compact, well presented and immaculately clean. They give you daily toiletries and comfortable night wear. Don't miss the 13th floor lobby view of the city if there. Nice, friendly and helpful staff and a great location in Asakusa near Sensoji. Brilliant stuff.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: stayed 4 nights in April. Firstly the location is hard to beat. Across the street is the Senso-ji temple. Plenty of delightful eating places near by. A supermarket just at the corner. And the train station nearby. The hotel is new,clean and room spacious.Staff helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Excellent location - only 2 min walk from Asakusa Station. Everythings we close by and next to a supermarket with lots of restaurants around. The Asakusa Shine is just across the road. The hotel is very modern and the room is big to compared with other Japanese hotel. We will definitely come again on our next visit.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I traveled alone and this was my first time to Tokyo. I have mixed feelings about this place. Although the room was clean and decent, it had no views and it was rather dark in feel/tone. If you don't speak Japanese and seek some guidance from the front desk, it will be challenging beyond gathering the most basic info. It did have two bars which were a welcomed site, however, both were empty at night, and of course their fun/lack of depends on who is there at the time. Great location for visiting Asakusa and very quiet once you are inside. It's not a bad option, but, personally I would investigate other options for a future return.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Perfect location, would recommend to anyone staying in Tokyo. It is steps away from the Asakusa station so is extremely convenient, and the Asakusa shrine and gate are right across the street. Not to mention it is right next to the Sky Tree, and the view from the rooftop terrace has got to be one of the best in the city! After spending time in busy/crazy Shibuya and Shinjuku, I would much prefer to stay in Asakusa at the end of the day. Great location, great service, great value.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Loved this place. The level of service is above and beyond anything we have experienced. Our room was prepared 5 mins late and we were treated to lunch as an apology. This on top of numerous other examples of extra special service made us feel like we were very valued. Great location, lovely cosy clean rooms. Great views, food, drink. Just loved it. Thanks so much.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Modern, boutique hotel, excellent location, nice restaurant, high floors. Room size - just OK - but this is Tokyo. Service is good, most staff speaks English well. Near subway service, and fun Asakusa area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is quite near the exit of the subway. And it was also convenient since the supermarket and some convenience stores were just near by. The best part is you can go to the top of the hotel to directly view skytree without always bending your neck . The hotel is recommended. .

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location location ! Staff were fabulous in taking care of us.Rooms are spotless and very comfortable. You'd be hard pushed to make a better choice for your stay in Asakusa Stayed in S scenic room which we highly recommend Fab position for evening wandering Reception ang restaurant on 13 th floor wonderful view

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Arrived here from the UK for four nights and we all loved it. From the amenities in the room to the fantastic breakfasts in the morning to cater to all tastes including proper coffee, it was the perfect start to our Japan experience. The temples of Asakusa were within 200 metres so could explore by foot and adjust to the new experience comfortably.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Not big one but room is clean, comfort and let me have well sleep.Location is good, opposite to KAMINARIMON and there is supermarket in first floor.I am enjoy to stay here this April and will choice it when I visit Tokyo again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved everything about this hotel, the staff at the reception were all friendly, the amenities in the hotel room were plentiful, the hotel has amazing views, and the bar has happy hour. Our only regret is we couldn't stay here more. A side note, the hotel has the best restaurant right next door, don't miss it!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A stylish, clean well appointed hotel with great bed linen and sleep ware. Pipping hot showers with western toilets + washlet (automated bidet). Breakfast bar with great selections mostly western type food with a few Japanese staples thrown in. For travelers with young children they do have connected rooms vs the typical side by side without connection.Helpful staff with decent or better English skills, NekoKuro service (Blackcat luggae forwarding service) which if you don't know what this is make yourself familiar asap before traveling!Street level walking distance to subway 5-10 minutes, loads of shops, nearby shine, Rickshaw runners, and a corner bank with currency exchange make this hotel tops for staying in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Wonderful stay in a clean hotel near public transportation and the temple area that has excellent shopping and sushi. One of my favorite areas of Tokyo. The view from the restaurant is spectacular. PJs were waiting on the bed and a hairbrush and toothbrush in the bath.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It is new, and stylish the room itself. However, the front desk gave me a room on 4th floor facing the street, even though I actually checked in at 5pm -- not very nice. The lobby views the Tokyo sky tree which is impressive. There is a small but nice restaurant and a bar on the terrace.Things I didn't like: they didn't specify the checkout time was 11am. So we went out to talk a walk around at 11 and came back at around 11:30 to check out, where we found a staff member was nervously waiting at our door, telling us we needed to pay 2000 yen as to check out at 12pm-- that just blew us away. Location: a couple of minutes to subway and The Kaminarimon, lots of restaurants around.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is situated on Kaminarimon-dori street, about 50 metres from the Asakusa station(ginza subway line). The reception is on the 13th floor and has great views of the area around Sensoji temple and the Skytower. The hotel is very convenient for sightseeing the Asakusa area.Our room was a good size and very clean. The rooftop garden is worth visiting for sunset drinks as is the restaurant.All of the staff were very welcoming we wIll definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: As the title of the review suggests, I will start off with the great location of this hotel. It's right smack in the centre of Asakusa. The Sensoji Temple is very near to the hotel, with the main gate and Nakamise shopping street less than a minute's walk away. Tokyo Skytree is also in the vicinity. There are lots of eateries and restaurants around the hotel, so you are never short of choices. There is a local supermarket beside the hotel entrance that should be able to serve your daily needs.Granted it's not in Tokyo centre, but given their very reliable and well connected subway system, you are never very far off from any attractions. The subway station, served by 2 different lines, is also a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. If you are traveling to Ginza or Shibuya (or is it Shinjuku), you don't even have to change lines. Having mentioned how great the location is, I would be doing the hotel injustice if the other great things about the hotel is not highlighted. Checkin and checkout was fast and straightforward. The staff speak decent and understandable English. The room itself was clean and well equipped. Sound proofing was good and we hardly heard anything from the corridor. During our stay, there was unfortunately no more non smoking rooms, hence the staff suggested to deodorize the room for us, which we thought was proactive and a nice touch. Even before booking with the hotel, the hotel reservation staff was very prompt and helpful with the enquiries we had. If I have to nitpick, I would say the room though complete, is a bit small.Overall, a great hotel in a peaceful and less hectic area of Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here to visit some tourist spots in Tokyo and reading most reviews about this hotel online I decided to booked a room here only to get disappointed. I guess my expectations were high because it did not meet what some of the reviews I read online when I stayed in this hotel. I want to give honest opinions so here : rooms are overpriced- this hotel is below average business type room with tiny bed, tiny shower room and for the price there was no bath tub. Paid $180.00 for a night. The tv is set or placed on the side of the wall and you can't move it to left or right. It's in one position so you have to deal with it to be in that position if you want to watch tv . Amenities are poor nothing fancy. The breakfast buffet are okay nothing special. The lobby is average and the nice thing is that you can see the sky tree tower in front of you from the glass window. But honestly you can just go outside and you'd still see that view so there's no need to stay in this hotel for that. I don't know what it is but it's really hard to find a nice hotel in Japan especially for the price you pay which is not cheap. The staff of the hotels are annoying at times especially the women in the front desk. The middle aged men who works at night was helpful. But the women sounded arrogant and impatient to answer some of our queries. Sadly, I can't recommend this hotel. Nothing special to be honest. It's like a cheap business hotel with a view of the sky tree tower that's it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: 5 minute walk to Asakusa Temple; near the temple, there are many stalls to buy souvenirs.grocery stores and restaurants with best sushi 2 to 5 min walk;English speaking staff, fast check-in; absolutely clean rooms and toilets - the cleanest I have ever seen.Just a note, if you have a big luggage it maybe difficult to use the Metro because you have to drag your bag through the stairs. No lift or escalator in the nearest Metro.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A nice hotel ....check in was smooth. Staffs are well trained and they can speak English very well.Hotel lobby Is at 13th floor. Room is spacious. Espresso machine and kettle in the room. Nice toiletries, good lavender shampoo , conditioner and body bath. You pay for what you get. Hotel room rate is expensive due to location and their services provided. Location is the best ....it's just about 5mins walk to the famous Asakusa senji-jo temple. The tourist customer center is just across the road from Gate Hotel. Many eatery shops/restaurants around .....7evelen and family mart is next to hotel. On the 14th floor of the hotel there is a terrace where we enjoyed the beautiful views of Asakusa city and sky tree. Asakusa train or metro station is very near hotel....there are also direct train to Haneda or narita airport. I would recommend this hotel if you are planning to explore Asakusa,Taito City !
user_name:
GohPauline1200
Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Happy to say this has been the best stay in our two weeks in Japan. Nothing's perfect, but this hotel was outstanding. The location in Asakusa is great (and I'd recommend Asakusa itself as a great place to visit, vibrant but not noisy or overwhelming). There's a grocery and a Starbucks right on the same block, and you're across the street from the walkway to the beautiful Sensoji shrine. The hotel is modern without being stark, the rooms are tasteful and an ok size, the beds are very comfortable, and the room is absolutely soundproof to the street.To top it off, the staff is genuinely helpful. Including by giving us a very good izakaya recommendation for a special evening, where the cook came personally out of the kitchen to say hello and the waiters were happy to see us (which has not been our universal experience here).And, the price was even slightly lower than at the other Asakusa hotel where we stayed at the start of our tip.You won't be disappointed with the Gate.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: During the time of wishing and dreaming of travelling to Japan, I looked up any good hotels via TripAdvisor's website. I came across one hotel that impressed me - The Gate Hotel. I then of course visited their actual website and was even more impressed with what I saw there.The rooms looked clean and divine. The beds big and fluffy - you know, the ones that make it really hard to get out of because of how comfy they are? The pristine cleanliness and modernity of the toilet and bathroom was impressive - what sold me was the "rain dance shower". I was all like öooooh, fancy".Of course the hotel was shortlisted on my Ïf I ever bloody make it to Japan, these are the places I want to stay in" list.Fast forward to 2015 and I'm spontaneously booking flights to Japan! And of course I haven't forgotten about my shortlist.I was travelling with friends and we agreed that during our stay, we would first live on the cheap aka stay in a hostel and later rent an apartment via AirBnB (both turned out to be swanky af for really cheap prices), and then live in luxury during our last few days in Tokyo, The Gate Hotel being the luxurious choice.Now this is where the review actually starts...sorry about the long winding monologue.The Hotel is located smack dab in the bustling part of Asakusa, right across from Sensoji Temple Gates.You walk into the lobby area which smells so bloody amazing! The ceiling of the lobby is another thing you cannot miss since it looks like you're standing under a glass bottom pool!From here you'll catch the elevator up to the 13th floor since this is where the Reception area is located. As soon as those doors open - BAM - your eyeballs are hit with the view of Asakusa! Your Reception desk and friendly staff are located to the right of you but damn, you'll be in awe of the view. But once you snap out of your trance, head straight to Reception desk and you'll be greeted by a friendly and helpful staff member.Learning from past experience (look out for my review on Hotel Richmond Premier) and to also time it perfectly with catching our flight, I had asked for a late check out at 2pm. After a few minutes (I spent it admiring the view of Asakusa), the staff member was able to allow me to check out at 3 for a small price. After that information exchange he then went on to inform us of the important stuff such as the location of the bar (you have to walk up short flight of stars to the 14th floor), dining was 24hrs and they had breakfast buffet.Once he handed our access cards, we made our way with our heavy as bags and big as winter coats into the elevator and hit button number 10.Once we waddled into our rooms, we did what most travelers do - inspected our room.It was spacious. It was clean. It was impressive. It was comfy. It had everything that we needed.The beds were big AND comfy AND perfect. The bathroom area was spacious and clean and spotless. The shower was huge - to me it was huge and I'm not a skinny person. It did have your traditional Japanese bathtub (the deep kind) but unfortunately I didn't bathe in that. Next time I will though.After braving the cold and exploring Asakusa, we made it back to our hotel and decided to treat ourselves and have dinner at the hotel's restaurant. The pricing is the same amount as when you go out for dinner here in Australia. We treated ourselves which meant ordering entree's, mains and desserts...and alcoholic beverages (Cassis soda my friends, it's like drinking Ribena but for adults).I can't remember the entree that I ordered but it was yummy. The main dish though, now that is something I am impressed by. I ordered the wagyu main which I think cost around 40 or 4500 yen. AMAZING! So delicious and buttery and perfect! I wasn't in love with my dessert - creme brulee - I thought it was bordering more towards custard but meh, I should've ordered the french toast instead since that looked joygasmic.After our meals, we had the smart idea to waddle and make our way to the 14th floor where the bar was located. The inside bar area is small and intimate but you're able to head out onto the rooftop balcony and enjoy your drinks there while gazing out at the awesome views of nighttime Asakusa. They thankfully provide heaters outside since it is quite nippy during winter.After all this we agreed to have breakfast the next day at the hotel and we soon bid each other night night after making our way back to our rooms.Come morning time we are at the breakfast buffet area, having a good looksee at what the hotel had to offer. It's not your traditional breakkie buffet where you get an endless amount of bacon and eggs and sausages and mushrooms. Instead you order a main, the options being eggs bene, french toast or the usual bacon and eggs, I think? And from here, you then make your way to the buffet area where you're able to drink freshly squeezed orange juice, or select some yummy foods such as the cucumber salad that is hella yummy. The first thing that came to mind when I first saw the buffet was "god damn this looks healthy". Once we finished our plates, our main meal was then brought to us. Now I had to step away from our table to attend to some important business and I was gone for a few minutes. When I came back, the gentleman who was looking after us (there's a fancy name for what he does - not a waiter) came over and said that because I was away for a bit, my food would be cold so he'll take it back to the kitchen to heat it up (or maybe make a fresh one, not sure).Like what the hell!? That is service! That is service right there! All of us, all four of us were friggin' impressed by that. Like Mister, that's it. That's it man we're DEFINITELY coming back to this place! Thanks to you Sir!Our last day in Japan and we ended it in The Gate Hotel, Asakusa. Perfect. Absolutely perfect. When you check out right, they give you a paper with your details on it and an eftpost receipt attached to it, yes? Here, they printed the receipt on paper and the gentleman then proceeded to fold it and gently place it in the hotel's envelope. I still have it. The whole thing about this hotel just blows my mind! From the foods, to the staff members and even a frggin' receipt being placed in an envelope. I love it!Located a very short distance from our hotel is the train station. It was a bish to catch a train here because of the many bloody stairs we had to walk down and up to get to our platform. That was torturous with our heavy bags filled with souvenirs but it was entertaining to the locals.Like I mentioned before, the hotel is located across from Sensoji temple. It is a bit eery at night since the temple area is soooooo quiet. Starbucks, 7/11 and a grocery store is also located VERY close by. Like REALLY close by.I would definitely recommend that you add this to your shortlist of hotels to stay in. When I do travel back to Japan, I will be booking The Gate Hotel once again.Thank you for reading this long as review!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Close to the underground. The location was good. Spacious room with a bath. Lovely shower gel. no English tv. The reception is on the top floor so you don't need to walk hrough the reception to enter/leave the hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We travelled with our two young children and hence needed all the help we could get. The staff at reception were very accomodating and attended to our requests graciously.Our room on the 12th floor was spacious, clean and extremely comfortable. Our windows looked out over the Kaminarimon gate and had views of the Skytree. It had all the amenities we needed, the bathroom and toilet were also separate. The King bed was enormous and the baby cot provided ample space for the four of us.The area gets extremely busy during the day and into the evening but is still quite fine to navigate. We did it with two kids and a stroller in tow. What we didn't like was the lack of elevators when exiting Asakusa station but this would only be a problem if you have a stroller.A fantastic stay otherwise and the hotel is highly recommended. To the staff at the Gate Hotel: Thanks for a comfortable and memorable stay.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice and comfortable hotel with a nice view of Skytree. It's just across the road from the temple and metro station. Breakfast was decent with your choice of eggs but a selection of other warm breakfast and juice/ coffee. Staff is friendly, kind and helpful. It is a lot more value for money comparing to hotel in central Tokyo. Ginza is only a 20-30 min metro ride. I will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great hotel and good value. Quiet, well located to train, wide range of eateries and 1 minute walk to Sensoji Temple (a must for any visit) and Kaminarom Gate snd markets (good quality). Spectacular view from Terrace Bar.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A very basic hotel again booked by my Japanese colleague, The entrance didnt even look like a hotel, you need to take a lift to the top floor where the check in is located and they took payment of the 2 nights stay during check in which was a 1st time for me.The top floor also is where the restaurant is located, the menu was limited so didnt bother eating there, they give you a card to access the floor that your room is on, mine was on the 8th floor and furtherest from the lift, there was a small vending machine to get drinks and buy Video On Demand coupon. The room was average size and got two single beds, the TV has NO ENGLISH CHANNELS, no room service, the bathroom was nice and came with an automatic toilet and all the necessary amenities like tooth brush/comb/shaver etcSome nice restaurants outside the hotel and plenty of taxis.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I spent my first two nights in Japan here and it was perfect. Small but beautifully designed room, with the lovely pajamas laid out on my bed. Very 'designy' hotel, restrained but everything so carefully considered. Fantastic location 2 minutes from Senso-Ji temple, what a treat, and a fabulous 'ordinary' sushi bar over the road from the hotel, recommended by the reception staff, where I sat at the counter with wonderful nigiri and green tea and was very reasonably priced. Such a pleasure. Excellent transport links and great views from the bar where you have breakfast. There is also a roof terrace for fine weather. Fantastic introduction to Japan and lovely staff. Thank you!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved this modern hotel in the middle of the bustling shopping and eating streets of Asakusa. Only steps away from iconic Kaminarimon Gate and Senso-ji Temple and close to the train station. I liked the location because it was easy to get to all the popular districts and airport by metro. The reception area on the 13th floor and the rooftop bar has a fantastic night skyline view of the city and Tokyo Skytree.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Easy access from Narita airport via Keisei train and close to Asakusa and Ginza subway line. The Ozeki supermarket is just next to the hotel also 24/7 sushi Zanmai restaurant is just across the street.We stayed in triple room which we could see Tokyo sky tree thru the window.If you miss the hotel's blend coffee, you might regret~ It was good!! At the time we stay was "Hina matsuri" festival. The hotel gave us a touch of Japanese culture. They had matsuri' story card along with complimentary arare snack and sweet sake. Nice!!
user_name:
Kkurowa
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Everything is nice, we stay the room with sky tree view. The metro right across the hotel with elevator exit, perfect. Warm service that hotel help us deliver the parcels which were booked online to our room before we arrive. Roof floor with skyview and lounge bar.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Staff were very helpful with our reservation to make sure that we got what we needed. We brought baby along, so needed a crib, etc.Very nice view from the check-in desk and restaurant of Asakusa area including Tokyo Tower and even Mount Fuji on a clear day. Handy to the local sights, good restaurants and shops.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was our first time in Tokyo, and even though we planned the trip well ahead, we weren't sure if the location of the hotel was a good starting point for our exploration of the city. Turns out that for us, it was perfect. Taito might be described as a calm area, but that is only when compared to the impressive pace of parts like Shinjuku, Shibuya or Akihabara.We stayed in a twin bed (120 cm) Scenic room, on the 10th floor with the most impressive hotelroom-view I've ever experienced. The room had two huge windows where we could see Tokyo Sky Tree, the Kaminarimon gate, the Senso-ji temple, the Asahi HQ (golden flame), and the beautiful culture centre just across.We slept quite comfortably 2 kids and 2 adults in those two beds - something many hotels either didn't allow, or the beds were too narrow (100-110 cm). The staff was very polite and service oriented - as all japanese are.All in all, a fantastic hotel I can highly recommend.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My teenage son and I had a great stay at The Gate. The hotel is close to several metro lines and the train from Narita Airport. The view from the restaurant and bar is fantastic and we loved to live in Asakusa. Wonderful Senso -Ji temple and Kaminarimon (The Gate) is across the street from the hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Our family of four stayed for eleven nights, sharing one room with two king size beds. This hotel was one of few that accepted four people in one room. The room was big enough, and from our window in 10th floor we had a spectacular wiew on the Tokyo Sky Tree and parts of the Senso-ji temple and Kaminarimon gate. And the wiew from the reception/restaurant in 13th floor or the roof terrace on 14th floor are even more amazing. Being our first trip to Tokyo, we were very happy to find out that the hotel is placed in a relatively calm area, especially after visiting the more frenetic parts of town as Shinjuku. In our room there were slippers, pyjamases, and a well equipped bath (the cloth line came well in use). The air condition was a bit to eager at night, but nothing a Buff couldn't handle. The restaurant was excellent (and somewhat expensive), but we rarely used it. No problem finding other places to eat! All in all, a fantastic hotel!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is new and in an excellent location. It's very close to the metro/train stations with lots of F&B outlets within walking distance. The room we had is very spacious and good for our 3-year old child. The amenities are all in great conditions and the bed is very comfortable. We had a small problem with the air conditioning when we entered the room and the staff came to our room very quickly and solved the problem. We wish the lighting in the room could be a bit brighter but other than that everything is great and it's a very good value comparing to hotels in Ginza or Akasaka areas. The rooms are indeed a lot bigger and nicer for the same price.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: What a lovely hotel. We only stayed for one night but it was a welcome treat after a long day of travel to Japan. We walked around in the morning to the beautiful and nearby Senso-ji Temple. There were no restaurants open early in the morning so we ate at the hotel and what a treat this buffet was! Staff spoke enough English to get by and assist our check in. It is close to the train station so we were able to get on our way after breakfast, as we made our way to Kyoto. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed here for six nights on a recent trip to Tokyo. Location was in Asakusa, a nice location near Sensoji and subway stations. Lots of places to eat near hotel, too. The hotel itself was fine. I had the least expensive room, and for one person, it checked all the boxes. Clean, quiet, comfortable. The only thing to be aware of is if you want a room with a view, this is not one of those rooms. I had a view of the neighboring buildings. The other item of concern was the fact that there was no bathtub (ofuro). This was a surprise since every Japanese hotel I have ever stayed in has a lovely, deep bathtub to soak away the day's aches and pains. The price for the room was reasonable for Tokyo, though, and the wifi connection was excellent.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Forgot to review this; stayed in November 2014 and had a blast. Hotel was great, staff very lovely and overall the experience was 5/5. Good location with short walk to nearby attractions, shops and transport. Hotel had happy hour on the balcony which was great, and the breakfast in the morning was exceptional.Make sure you checkout the view from the rooftop.
user_name:
Jax_132
Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Excellent hotel in Asakusa area, close to train from Airport and Subway. Nice and comfortable room for a fair price (especially in Tokyo !). If not included avoid breakfast; very good but totally overpriced ! Staff very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Just a quick review. Stayed here for 3 nights in December with toddler. Good size twin room with great bathroom. Our room faced Tokyo Sky Tree. The reception 13th floor next to a nice bar and restaurant. Great views again. For non japanese speakers the staff are multilingual. We got a good deal through JTB.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: If you want to stay nearby Asakusa and visit Tsukiji market, Skytree, or Tokyo Zoo this is the right place. Nice view of Skytree from terrace or rooftop bar and good quality of food and room. CP value is good!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed two nights at the Gate Hotel. We chose a classy C room with a bath and were on the 12th floor facing Tokyo Skytree. All parts of the experience were lovely. The room was spacious, the beautiful pyjamas provided for guests, the amenities - nespresso machine, high quality body & hair locations, the sheets etc etc etc The breakfast at the hotel was sumptuous - fresh orange juice, eggs benedict, organic veggies Service was exceptional and the location wonderful. the Ginza Metro line is 3 mins away and the Asakusa line (a couple of minutes longer) will take you straight to Narita. The surrounding area is one of the few areas with signs of the old Tokyo so I am told. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located near the train station. The nearest exit is 2 and if you are lugging your luggage, there is an exit which has a lift. The front desk staff can provide you with a map to show you the route which is about 3-5 min walk.The hotel’s restaurant and bar are opened 24 hours so food isn’t an issue during late nights. There are also many CVS (convenience store) such as Lawson, 7-11 and also a 24hr Don Quijote nearby for night shopping which is really convenient.I have stayed in both Style E (essential) and C (Classy) rooms. Style E is 258sqft which is comfortable for 2. If you have a bigger budget, want to enjoy the room or have more than 2 pax, you can consider Style C. Room is very spacious (397sqft) and even has a bar counter. It offers a spectacular view of the Tokyo skytree which you can also see while soaking in the deep bathtub. The toilet has a big window panel which offers daylight good for applying makeup. Bear in mind that nearby buildings may be able to catch a glimpse of the both room and toilet especially at night with your lights on. I checked it from Asakusa culture tourist center’s observation deck. Amenities are sufficient and in Style C, you have both dripped coffee and Nespresso available. Pity coin laundry isn’t available as their laundry service fee is on the higher side.Fabulous view in the restaurant and quality of breakfast is good. One interesting mention is that their honey is not served in jar but rather honeycombs. Really cool! However, their menu offerings are limited and lean more towards an international style; choose a main (egg benedict, French toast etc) and enjoy salad, fruits, yogurt from the buffet line. Being in Japan, I would prefer a Japanese style breakfast so I didn’t opt for breakfast for my next stay.All their staff provides prompt and efficient service; from front desk, restaurant, bar and housekeeping. I have no complains but did wish that they could be a little warmer in attitude and disposition which will be make this hotel 5 stars.With all that it has to offer, The Gate is definitely my first choice of accommodation in Asakusa (having stayed in Asakusa Central and Richmond before). You wouldn’t regret it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very modern, very clean , fantastic views from the Reception, Restraurant and their bar. Great room but small.I would have struggle if my wife was with me. All amenities are very good. My room overlook was the wall of the next building. I had requested higher floor facing the Tokyo Skytree but my request must have been ignored. On a positive note, the hotel is quiet, the beds very comfortable ( I had a queen size bed ) I would stay here again and insist on a bigger room if my wife accompanies me. Value wise it is definitely better than good value for the standard offered.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were not sure where we should stay for our short stopover in Tokyo but are so pleased we chose The Gate. Everything was excellent. The room was beautiful, well furnished, very comfortable and clean. The views from the foyer, bar and restaurant are fantastic, with the Skytree right on the doorstep. With the oldest temple in Tokyo just opposite, many very special restaurants and specialist shops on the same street, this hotel is perfectly located. It was also very easy to get to and from both airports.A very good dinner and excellent breakfast made this a perfect stay. Thank you to the very helpful staff.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stay here!! Perfect location and fantastic hotel! Easy to and from Narita! Wonderful people!! Everything you need. Grocery store next door.... Close to Tokyo metro and connects to all!!! Walking distance to Tokyo Skytree tower!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Part of me does not even want to write this review as I go to Tokyo regularly and often cannot get a booking at The Gate. Do I really want more people to know about it? No! But it really is a special find because it has spectacular views, a solid breakfast, a terrific roof terrace, and modern well-functioning rooms. It also feels a nice mix of Western and Japanese, as opposed to the American chains I have used.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The service, accommodations, and location were excellent. We received exceptional assistance with our train reservations, luggage transport and other travel issues. The reception staff could not have been more helpful. Our room was spacious and had a view of Tokyo Tower. We had a walk in shower and tub. The hotel was quiet and elegant with a dining room and observation deck that provided spectacular views of the Tokyo skyline. There is a large street market and shopping area just across the street. We booked several months in advance and paid $120/night. I would return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone seeking quality and value.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: LocationGreat location across the main gate of Sensoji. You can take beautiful pictures at night with the giant Chochin without jostling with the daytime tourists. Asakusa metro station is a stroll away. Travel throughout Tokyo is easy with proper planning. It was easy for us to locate. Just remember that the lobby is not at the ground floor. Room/StaffThe staff were friendly and their service was Excellent!We booked a double room for 2 nights. The day before our checkin, we wanted to place our 2 big luggage bags at the hotel as we did not want to bring them along to our overnight trip out of Tokyo. The request was accepted without any problem. When we checkin the next day, our bags were already in our room. The room was clean, relatively large for Japanese standard. Nice comfy beds. Beds were super single, big enough to squeeze in an adult and a small kid.We had a great view if the Skytree though you can access the top floor as guest.OverallGreat hotel, great staff, great location. There maybe other hotels with better locations, but with our pleasant stay there, we definitely would not hesitate to put in on our list for our future visits to Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate is a great little hotel - we loved staying here. The best thing is the location in a really interesting part of Tokyo out of the hustle. A lovely place to come back to each eve. The staff are friendly and helpful - Management great to deal with and highly attentive. I particularly liked that the male manager considered our positive feedback about a staff member and later promoted her from trainee - really nice. The hotel is quiet and relaxing and very clean. Superb assistance from front desk staff regarding places to eat in the local area, storage and forwarding of bags etc. The breakfast is satisfactory but perhaps not on par with other hotels we stayed at in Japan - also not enough Japanese food. After 4 nights the breakfast menu felt a little limiting. We were disappointed that the restaurant did not offer Japanese menu for dinner and so we didn't eat there in the evening - the bar upstairs was limited in terms of food offerings. However, overall a great place to stay, plenty of great places to eat in surrounding areas - we felt incredibly welcomed and attended to by the lovely staff - we certainly will return.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice staff, very helpful and cheerfulGreat view and location, just a few minutes walk from the Metro station.Cleaniness can be improved, for example, carpet is a bit dirty.Hotel design is fashionable.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed at The Gate for three nights and we absolutely loved the place! The location is phenomenal giving you the best of old-japan meets frantic nowadays, great neighborhood to explore and get adjusted to the Tokyo ways. The reception is on the 13th floor, we were greeted and checked-in promptly, the room was very large for Japanese standards and extremely well appointed. The cocktail bar/restaurant and the terrace bar are great places for a tipple and also to eat, we had dinner one night and it was great – good selection of wines and spirits. In a nutshell, fabulous location, great service and nice hotel… altogether this is the one you are looking for! Other advantages: You can catch the train directly from Narita and you’ll be at the hotel in one hour – just ask for a ticket to Asakusa; the cultural center (100 metres away from the hotel) offers free tours and free Geisha performances & great restaurants and shops in the neighborhood – not forgetting the impressive Sensoji Temple & the Tokyo Skytree.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location was very good, near subway stations. Staff quite friendly, room spacious, with good facilities. Nice view from our scenic room type. Fast check in/out. Food everywhere , and super supermarket, downstairs very comfy.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is beautiful and the service is amazing. It is close to Asakusa main attractions and easy to get to central Tokyo by tube. There are a lot of shops and restaurants around as well. Would definitely stay at The Gate Hotel again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location to travel around Asakusa, going to the metro station is not to far. There are some supermarkets and convenience stores around this place, Easy to go to Ueno or Tokyo sky tree by Tokyo metro. For 2 or 3 people to stay around asakusa, it is a good recommendation!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great staff and great location.The rooms are rather small but are still very comfortable. The location is great as it is over the road from a market and temple. Recommended as great value for money in good location near to metro.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location almost opposite to Asakusa shrine. And located 5 minutes walk from Asakusa metro stop. Nice views of skytower from the lobby and rooftop. I and my friend went to Tokyo for our 24 hour stop. Not disappointed with the twin room with a view of sky tower. Unfortunately we checked in late night and out early morning. So not able to use any facilities at hotel which I’m sure is good. Both check-in and out were hassle free and staff helpful. Plenty of shops nearby and open till late. If ever visit again Tokyo definitely will stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Conveniently located close to Asakusa Temple. Just on the opposite side. Near subway stations. Surrounded by shops and restaurants. Staff there are very friendly and helpful. Hotel has many types of rooms. Rates are quite high.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I often travel in Japan , This hotel is my best like!! The hotel near subway station, offers nice cozy room, clean, nice staffs, and also there is a nice lobby in 13F, you can see good view when you have meal.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location is hard to beat. 3 minutes from the subway (with a direct train to both airports), a minute to Senji Shrine, and other attractions. Room was very clean, but very small. Very little concierge services, however. Other hotels in the area, which are more expensive, have arrangements with the skytree and the bus to the airport (the subway is convenient, but if you have a very heavy suitcase, because you traveled for long, know that the closest entry to the subway has quite a few steps. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel, so can't comment. Quite a few good restaurants nearby.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The staff were very efficient, professional and friendly. In addition, the hotel offers attractive pricing, comfortable space and good quality (in Tokyo). The area is also near some good tourist attractions such as Sensoji temple and Tokyo Sky Tree. I'm glad I booked my second leg of my trip in the same hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is very near to Sensoji Temple. My room was in 12th floor and we saw the Tokyo Skytree from our room. Our beds were so comfy and the rest were so great. Love the bathtub and all its amenities. At night, we had some drinks to try and the ambience was so fantastic,In the morning, had a delicious breakfast from the hotel. Oh what a lovely stay here! Definitely worth it!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Excellent location. Right opposite to the main shrine attraction. From the 13th floor lobby you could view practically the city. Within walking distance to the subway. If you want to avoid the hustle of the main city area i believe this place serves to be a fantastic choice.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: the moisture in the bathroom is a little heavy. the bed is also a little too soft for me. but overall, the room is clean and comfortable. the breakfast is fantastic, don't miss it! the staff are nice and helpful.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: 1. easy and economy to reach from Narita airport (sky access line)2. the biggest bed that I've ever stayed in Tokyo3. 1st floor is a supermarket ,you can buy fresh fruit in the season4. visiting famous temple just cross the street 5. elevator is quick and good air smelling...Maybe you should go there by yourself !Btw,I have been stayed this hotel every year in the past 3 yrs with my family.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great room. While it was small by western standards, it was well laid out and felt nice. The bathroom only had a walk in shower, but it was much better than the airplane sized/prefab bathrooms I found elsewhere.The view from the lobby is nice, overlooking the Kaminarimon gate, with views of Tokyo Skytree and the Asahi building. There's a nice rooftop deck/bar.It's a couple blocks from multiple train/subway stations, but make sure you know which lines take you where. Asakusa isn't exactly central.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Forewarning: This is a review from an American tourist perspective.A very nice, modern hotel in Asakusa, which is really close to the train station and steps away from one of the best and most popular tourist attractions in Tokyo, Senso-Ji temple. This has so many gorgeous sites including a shrine, gardens and hectic marketplace. If you're planning stuff to do the in the area besides this, Akihabara anime district aka "electric town" is nearby.The rooms are a good size and comfortable, with great attention to detail. The only thing I didn't like was the shower being in a separate room next to the tub. I would rather just shower in the tub or in a stall. Also, we did not care for the breakfast at the hotel restaurant. They have a buffet of salad and pasta (not really breakfast for American standards) plus a selection of 1 of the following 3 options: scrambled eggs, french toast or eggs benedict. My friend and I didn't like any of it, and didn't eat there the second morning. Also, the only English station on the TV is CNN, so be prepared, so American visitors beware. The best part of the stay was the excellent service. They really make you feel welcome. I also loved the convenient location and the beautiful view from the lobby.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: great location and window view, nice service, also very convenience for shopping and dining. I will recommand The Gate to my friends and will definetely choose The Gate hotel next time when visiting Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very nice staff & Very good View & New & Clean Hotel !I love this hotel so much! Every time when I go to Japan , I stay here!The restaurant is also a nice place , you can enjoy breakfast with good view, also the dinner! Their meals is high quality & delicious!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: central to the old part of tokyo, lovely rooms, amazing views of the city from the top bar. Very pleasant staff and most helpful. many eating places all around and can walk to the tower and river. highly recommended

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The boutique style Gate Hotel in Asakusa is one of the best hotels of a recent trip to Japan offering overall excellent quality/price ratio in Tokyo - particularly for its great location, clean relatively spacious well equipped rooms offering and overall professionalism of staff Location: In the lively and interesting area of Asakusa. Two minutes away from the Senseo Jo temple with the Tokyo and Toei subway lines very close by and the Keisei Access Express station with direct trains to Narita (one hour 1130 yen) also a few minutes away. Lots of restaurants and bars in the area and an interesting mix of tourist and Japanese shops.Facilities: From the very nice reception on the 13th floor with a great view of the Skytree Tower, the excellent and Professional front desk, to the well equipped standard rooms with nice bathroom with fanatastic walk in shower.Overall the Gate is a great hotel and recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location in Asakusa (if that's the area you want to be in). Service is sufficiently passable, provides all the tourist information required when requested for, not personalised. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Will certainly be staying here again for my next trip.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Beautifully appointed, updated hotel with large rooms. Very modern and clean. Hotel staff are courteous and eager to help. Great location. The restaurant serves a top-notch breakfast with Western and Eastern choices. Great views of Tokyo Skytree.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hôtel is nicely placed and the room is extremely confortable and of a fairly large size. The breakfast is exceptionnaly good with fresh orange juice. The location in the nice area of Akasuka is very pleasant.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice location, superb service, and a comfortable clean room. A Benedict egg dish in the breakfast is very delicious. I love a beautiful SkyTree view from the guest-only roof terrace of the hotel. I would like to stay at this hotel in the next trip.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Well located boutique-style hotel. Decent rooms and nice restaurant. Very friendly and helpful staff. We only stayed for one night, being the first night of our Japan trip but I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The gate hotel has a spectacular view of Tokyo Skytree from their lobby. The size of room (Twin beds non-smoking) is good for two people and able to arrange your huge luggages. The bathroom is the best! They separate section of bathtub and rain shower from the toilet - very convenience and tidy! Toiletry which provided is good quality - I didn't even use my shampoo that I packed.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: There was just two of us on a vacation trip to Japan. We stayed here on recommendations by family who had stayed here previously. Great location in Asakusa. Very easy access to Tokyo subway. Numerous food/restaurant options within one block of hotel. For instance, we ate fabulous ramen and shabu shabu within five minutes of hotel. The room we stayed in was well appointed, and very clean. Bathroom and shower were excellent, Japanese toilet was a treat. All staff were friendly and extremely helpful and went out of their way to help us. My husband injured his knee and needed medical attention. The front desk staff did all they could do to help. Restaurant food was fine. The view from the terrace/top of the hotel was impressive. We were there on a rainy day but enjoyed it anyway. You choose to stay at this hotel for its location and ease of access to other Tokyo sites and airports. We highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had a very pleasant stay at the gate Hotel on October 2015. The location is perfect to visit Asakusa and Tokyo in general. Service is close to perfect. Our room was very comfortable and had a great view on Tokyo tower. The morning buffet offers a large selection of Japanese and international dishes. In conclusion, we highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: As if the location weren't perfect enough just outside the Kaminarimon Gates, our room was a tiny jewel. The marble tiled bathroom had a huge walk-in shower and deep soaking tub. The tastefully decorated bedroom was tiny with very little storage for luggage and personal items but there was a small table and chairs by the window where the view was great. On a clear day we saw Mr Fuji from the rooftop observing platform. Reception is on the 12th floor, and you need your room key to activate the elevator doors when you return to your room after a day of sightseeing. There is a shortage of English-speaking employees at the reception desk, so trying to get our luggage forwarded to our next destination was a bit of a struggle, but was eventually sorted and sent on it's way. A lovely place to stay, I'd like to re-create that bathroom in my own home!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location location location. Centrally located to food and subway, with bright lights, very safe to walk at night. We had a comfortable stroll to Tokyo tower with our 4 year old at night. Right downstairs a supermarket, with fresh local produce i wished i could cook up if there was a kitchenette. We had a hollywood double, meaning to super single beds put together, what luxury. Bed are comfy, great for a good night's sleep.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My husband and I spent four nights at the Gate Hotel recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. The Hotel is in a great location in a friendly neighbourhood. We had a quiet room on the 9th floor with an impressive view of the Sky Tree and the sculptural Asahi headquarters. Even better from the roof top bar and the reception/lounge!The room was well designed, the beds comfortable and the bathroom luxuriously appointed. Staff were polite and attentive and provided consistently good recommendations on where to eat around the area. After a busy day exploring Tokyo it was a delight to come back to!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The rooms are comfortable, as are the beds. Beautiful bar on the roof. The location is near temples, dining and souvenir shopping. We stayed elsewhere when we returned to Tokyo and I wish we'd come back to this area. I have some mobility problems and being this well located was very helpful.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here in our first visit to Tokyo at the beginning of our Japan trip, I wished we had booked here for our final stay (as it was certainly better than the Asakusa View Hotel), room was small but we expected that, and we were only there to sleep and have breakfast. Staff were friendly and helpful, we had no issues at breakfast (ie didn't have to wait), we were usually eating around 6.30/7am. The location is great, 2 mins walk from the temple and another 2mins to the metro station. We made time to walk through the temple both early morning and at night which was completely different to the crazy masses you have to fight through during the day. We would stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The staff is absolutely fantastic, the hotel has an urban modern style with excellent location in Asakusa next to Kaminarimon Gate. Full of places where to eat for all types of prices. Excellent food and drinks at hotel restaurant. However the choice is limited. Anyway you can try in the restaurants nearby if you want to change for a while. Language skills at the hotel restaurant are limited but it is more than balanced with the staff kindness.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights whilst on business This new hotel ticks many boxes for location comfort and valueIt has a fabulous roof top bar serving champagne at happy hour for 1000 yen and great views across Asakusa Temple and the Tokyo Skytree tower

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is across the street from the Sensoji Temple entrance gate. The restaurant and bar are on an upper floor with a fantastic view of the Tokyo Skytree. The rooms are larger than most Tokyo hotels and have every amenity you need, coffee, tea and those fabulous Japanese toilets. I made the reservation on their website and I think it was cheaper.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel location is very close to the subway, near the hotel has a supermarket to 9 pm, there are a lot of restaurants, very convenient, the lobby has a very beautiful scenery, room space is larger than other hotels, bed is very comfortable

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is located in the Asakusa neighborhood which offers interesting shops, restaurants, and easy train access from airports. It is close to the Kaminarimon Gate which leads to shops, the Sanso-Ji Temple, and small attractive parks. The hotel offers nonsmoking rooms. The rooms are of reasonable size, comfortable, clean, and have all that one needs including wi-fi. We recommend the optional breakfast. The restaurant is open for other meals but is not a choice for Japanese cuisine. The staff is efficient, helpful, and cable to assist English-speaking guests. A bonus is an outdoor roof deck with great views including a glimpse of Mount Fuji on a clear day.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was a lovely hotel. We spent a while deciding on giving it a four or five. Went with four as didn't have any extra facilities like spa and breakfast was too crowded. If you stay here I think you'll be pleased. Overall very good hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were really happy with the quality of this hotel. The room size was good, very clean and the staff were helpful. The room was quiet. The bathroom was a good size and very clean. It was great value and if you don't mind staying in Asakusa (I think it was only a 20 min Metro ride to Ginza or Tokyo stations) this is a great choice. I agree the WiFi was tricky and we didn't try the breakfast. But there was a Starbucks downstairs and all the conveniences nearby. It's close to the Metro station too. After staying at hotels in a similar or more expensive price range in Japan for the previous 10 days, this hotel was definitely the nicest and best value.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: THE GATE HOTEL in Asakusa is our favourite place to stay in Tokyo.We just came back for the third time and were pleased again about the modern and comfortable athmosphere at the Gate Hotel.We'll come again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Excellent location for sightseeing in Asakusa - very close to the Sensoji temple which is amazing to explore especially at night when it's lit up. Great views from hotel reception and breakfast room. The jewel in the crown is the rooftop bar area with views over the Tokyo Skytree - thoroughly enjoyed cocktails with the view! Would definitely stay here againHowever , one downside was the wifi. We had great wifi reception using both the WEP and WAP access points, but could not get any internet connectivity. We only stayed one night and had a mifi device from another provider to give us 4G coverage instead so we didn't bother notifying front desk staff about it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights and visited all the great spots in Tokyo. Very easy from both airports and also well located to discover Tokyo. To Shibuya and Shinjuku it's about 30 mins bij metro. Metro stop is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Breakfast is good. Sit on the nice terrace and enjoy the morning sun. At night you can enjoy a great glass of NewZealand red wine on the roof terrace. The view on the Skytree tower & the city is amazing!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel was in the perfect location for me. I needed to be able to access the Azumabashi area, the Tsukuba Express and the Ginza area. All of these possible from Asakura Station and district.The hotel itself was comfortable, clean, quiet and the staff friendly and extremely helpful. I had a Style E Essential type room. Great views from the breakfast restaurant, I could even see Mt. Fuji in the distance on a clear morning. The showers are superb - large and rainforest style!Will definitely stay again in the future.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good location for accessing subway station, JR station and Sensoji. Room is good enough for relaxing. You will appreciate nice view of Asakusa from the restaurant and rooftop.駅へのアクセスがよい。部屋は充分広く、レストランや屋上から浅草を一望できます。

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Overall, I am very satisfied with the accommodation,Service staff very friendly,Convenient transportation, shopping area and popular attractions nearbyBut the wireless network is not working properly.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was the last hotel we had in our 11-day Japanese trip, and it was somehow good to end it with a bang, and I am glad that we picked this hotel. Our room was quite modern and spacious. It was very visibly clean, and fixtures were new. Lighting was modern.The bed was of good quality with lots of pillows, and it was neither too hot nor too cold while under the sheets. They also provided pajamas. The best was the view at the bar at the very top of the hotel. You can take very good pictures of the Tokyo Skytree. They were also having a promotion to have discounted drinks before 6 p.m. It was good to have sparkling wine with such a good view!Location: In Asakusa - an interesting place with small shops and a shrine just across. It is also near a subway station such that you can easily be anywhere else.What needs improvement is the breakfast. Offering is quite little, and you have to pay extra to get a bit more.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It was our first holiday in Japan and the 5 nights at The Gate Hotel made it extra special. We stayed on the 10th floor with fantastic views of the Skytree tower and surrounding city. The location is perfect; close to the temple and gardens; markets and shops where you can buy souvenirs. There are lots of wonderful places to eat and the train station is just a few minutes walk.The room was a good size and bed very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size too with just about everything you need provided including pajamas.The staff are exceptional; very friendly and helpful and very patient considering my husband and I couldn't speak a word of japanese. A bonus is the top floor open terrace where you can enjoy a drink from the bar and take in the great views.The breakfast buffet was delicious and gave us a good start before our days adventures and dinner in their restaurant was first class.We look forward to going back there again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved the Gate Hotel, small but nice rooms that come with all the things you might've left at home. Great pajamas (seriously, I want to buy them). Location in Asakusa close to temples and two major subway lines. It's a bit of a subway trek to Shibuya (about 45 minutes) but you don't have to switch lines or anything so it's pretty easy. For the price, we were thrilled with this hotel. It was the only "nice" hotel we found in Tokyo that was at least mildly affordable. The service was also excellent, they booked reservations for us at 3 different Michelin-starred restaurants over the course of 5 days with only a week or so notice. Also, a great breakfast and cocktails! They carve ice into a sphere. The roof deck is a nice place to check out the view and relax in the frenetic city that is Tokyo. Would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
BubNYC
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We spent three nights at this hotel and it was wonderful. Rooms were comfortable and immaculate.Service was outstanding. Breakfast buffet and coffee were very nice. The hotel is in an area of small market stall shops which made for a lot of fun eating and shopping. Also close to a metro station.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed in a balcony suite on the 3rd floor, the room was very large, huge seating area, nespresso coffee machine, robes and the best japanese pijamas. The views were amazing, loved Asakusa and loved the local area, highly recommend. Authentic area and amazing hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed with a friend in this hotel and it was perfect. Sometimes with the pictures of the rooms it's hard to tell how big the space actually is but we had plenty of room. We stayed in the room with 2 twin beds and we had lots of room to relax between adventures around Tokyo. I know this is a strange thing to focus on but the free razor that they set by the sink had 3 blades. Not your usual 1 bladed-emergency razor and this was the theme for the rest of the items. The place didn't NEED to have heated toilet seats but it did. It didn't need to have great coffee but it did! The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's a great place to rest after a long day and I can say that some of the hotels in the area do not have this feel at all.The hotel is locate on the main street and super easy to find. It's close to some fabulous restaurants (like right next door!). My only (minor) gripe is that the breakfast was a bit out of my price range but the hotel is so close to a handful of super cute breakfast joints. The view from the lobby (at the top) is super fantastic too.I would recommend this to everyone. Families, couples, Japan first-timers, returning fans...everyone. Great hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Everything was perfect, I will highly recommend this hotel. very good location, incredible service, great bar & restaurant & nice rooms.We had so nice cocktails at the bar at the 13th floor in a so smooth atmosphere.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is very modern, sleek, hip. Excellent service. Rooms were very large for Japan. Staying in Asakusa was great several shops and restaurant close to the hotel including Starbucks. It was easy to stock up on snacks and drinks. A refrigerator is provided. We liked the fact that the Asakusa area was a lot quieter and less crowded than othere areas of Tokyo.We got the "classy" room , which had the skytree view. They were on the 12th floor with great views. There was a bar in the room. Not only robes but PJ's are also provided clean everyday. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning the rooms.The rooftop bar was a nice place to have a drink in the evenings.Front desk staff was professional and extremely helpful. One of the friendliest staffs I've ever encountered. Wifi worked well.There is also a coin laundry a few blocks away, which they found for me. A few jazz clubs in the area for those interested.Highly recommend!!!!!Strongly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: PROS+ Located close to the Asakusa subway Station (Ginza Line). + Asakusa area has more attractions than I expected. A large Don Quixote is a 5-minute walk away (and it is large and without too many customers compared to other branches). The Sensoji shrine is a mere minute away. Seeing the shrine at night (without the large crowd of tourist) is blissful. Starbucks is right next to the hotel. Many restaurants are around the area. In all, I quite enjoyed the more tranquil experience of this area compared to the more bustling areas like Shinjuku. + Hotel is new and has a beautiful entrance and lobby. + Spacious room. I stayed in the Essential room, and compared to the more cramped up business hotels you find in Shinjuku, this is comfortably much larger. The bathroom is literally twice the size of Prince Hotel's and Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku's where i've stayed before in the past. And like i said, the room is new and more beautifully decorated+ For all the positive points i mentioned above, i feel like i received more bang for the buck compared to the hotels in the busier parts of Tokyo. As i booked my room less than 30 days prior to my arrival, i didnt get the best promotion. The longer you reserve your room ahead, the more discounts you'll receive. This applies to most Japanese hotelsCONS- The only issue that stands out to me is the Asakusa location and accessing it by public transportation. The subway station is the terminal station for the Tokyo Ginza line, and to get around to other areas (Shinjuku, Roppongi, Harajuku), you'll likely need to transfer at Ueno Station (especially if you want to get on JR Yamanote, which is the main train line that runs in a circular route around Tokyo). To get to Shibuya, we didn't need to transfer, but it is EIGHTEEN stations away from Asakusa on the Ginza line. Of course, going to Tokyo Skytree is easy because Asakusa is the first station on the Skytree line. But for most destinations within Tokyo, the Ginza line doesn't cut it. For my next trip to Japan, I will explore hotels in the Ueno, Nippori, Shin Nippori station area as i believe it'll provide good value for money (compared to being in Shinjuku) while being located on the Yamanote line. But by no means is this is a discredit to The Gate Hotel. I was thoroughly happy with my stay.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice service, but I do not think it's a good choice for family, if your kids over 4 yrs old, you'll be charged for 1080 yen for each of them to have the breakfast, even the buffet is boring, and your kids can not choose the main dishes they provided, kinda disappointed.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice hotel in the middle of a tourist area in Tokyo.Room was bigger and modern compared to other hotels in Tokyo.My wife and I stayed for 5 nights split into 2 blocks (we travelled to Kyoto in between) and on both occasions the rooms were lovely, staff were really helpful and helped us whenever we asked.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very nice hotel in the middle of traditional Asakusa. Very close to the metro stop, and the nearby attractions.
