We were able to eat breakfast at nearby places and pick up fresh fruit at the grocery store downstairs. The service is impeccable - they were able to give me a room earlier than I requested and sent us a charger when we forgot ours there. I guess thats what makes Japan so famous - amazing customer service!
user_name:
Sashi S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed for two nights in two twins with family the views from lobby and outside terrace on top floor are great, hotel is close to subway to go all over Tokyo ,some nice places to eat down side streets and close to main shrine which does get busy. the rooms are a good size and well laid out and clean .the breakfast staff very helpful and food was served at table as well as a buffet just make sure you have a drink in the bar at the top of the hotel would go back

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is in traditional area and very close to Kaminarimon gate. You can walk to Kaminarimon gate, taste some tradtional foods, buy souvenir along the way to Senso-ji Temple. However, it also has the benefit of modern life. It is close to metro stops of a few metro lines. One supermarket and one pharmacy are just next door. A lot of restaurants are near the hotel. We stay in the room, Style E. Based on the price, the room size is big and so the bathroom is. Moreover, it has shower room and bathtub in the bathroom and seperated from the toilet. The shampoo and conditioner seems good to curly hair. It could help to enhance the curl (probably adds moisture and curl definition. The last, the service of the receptionist is also good.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is right in the centre of Asakusa, a lovely stroll to the famous Sensouji temple and surrounded by shops and restaurants - spoilt for choice for dinner from delicious take away morsels to traditional restaurants (and Starbucks a few doors down if you need it!)The room was spotless, comfy and had a breathtaking view.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Overall speaking, I'm comfortable and satisfied with the Gate Hotel, including excellent location, cleanliness and good service. However, the only one you must be improved is your breakfast, especially for diversity. During five day staying in Hotel, very disappointed with invariable main dishes and similar buffet content. Highly recommend you could do some change on your breakfast. Thanks

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I never do reviews, but this time I'll make an exception. The Gate is really excellent: superb well-outfitted medium-size modern room, comfortable bed & good pillows (not always easy to find even in the best hotels), quiet, well functioning air conditioning (again, not so easy to find), courteous & solicitous staff. The price was right, too---very reasonable for such a high-quality hotel in the big city (I paid $165-170, or so, USD per night.) Also, small but nice restaurant and bar. For my 5-day visit on business, the location was perfect, both in terms of proximity to my business venue in the Skytree (25-min walk), but also in terms of tourist sights. Easy access from Haneda AP (30 min by train). I travel a lot internationally on business, and The Gate is about as good as it gets in terms of value for your money. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about it. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Can be easily reached from the subway (3 minutes walk if you take exit #3 from the Asakusa Station). Our room ('Style essential double') was surprisingly spacious, impeccably clean, with a bathroom that was well furnished with amenities. Also it was quiet, the AC worked well and silently, and also the wifi and cable connections worked well. We were on the 10th floor and had a beautiful view on the Senso-Ji temple. Plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My husband and I stayed here twice. The room was large and very comfortable. There was a very nice, large shower and a Nespresso machine in the room to help wake up in the morning, and a nice sofa to relax on after spending the day walking around Tokyo. The first room we had was on the 12th floor, and we could see the SkyTree tower and the Kaminarimon gate. The second room we had was on the 10th floor, and we could still see the tower, but the gate was more obscured. I would recommend staying in a higher room if available. They also served drinks on the 14th floor roof-deck, which was a great way to relax.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very good location, near the subway, Senso ji temple, and restaurantsNice and modern hotel with a very confortable room. Very clean.The terrace at the top offers a beautiful view.The service is good.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I was looking for a hotel which was not situated in a busy downtown but rather in a more traditional neighborhood. This is a nice new hotel, but still reasonably priced.It was our first time in Japan and we don't speak Japanese, so we were a little concerned about transportation from Narita airport to Asakusa. But it was fairly easy. Narita terminal 1 has a large Railway/metro station, by the entrance there is a counter where you can buy tickets to Asakusa station by Keisei SkyAccess train (orange line, not the Skyliner!), cash only. Seven bank ATM which offers reasonable rates (associated with 7/11 ) is located to the right and beyond from the counter, they can direct you. Cost is ¥1290. Leaves approx every 40 minutes depending on the time of the day, I'm not sure how much it goes after 6:00 PM. Takes about an hour. Railway station is complicated but very good signs and also in English and color coded lines on the floor. I have to say I was very impressed how good the signs are . Also employees everywhere who can direct you. Hotel is probably best accessible from A4 exit to the right and then couple block to the left, you will see it, it's tall and has a convenience store on the ground floor. Reception on the 13th floor. Rooms are reasonably big ( for Tokyo) and well equipped. They have several different room types, we are in Essential, the most common one. Asking for a higher floor in advance might be helpful otherwise you will see back side of the buildings in the side street, like us from the 5 th floor. Most of the essential rooms are facing the side street but I imagine the top floor ones can have nice panoramic views. Otherwise there is a beautiful view from the roof top terrace and 13th floor restaurant. I really enjoy their breakfast. It's ¥ 2100 walk in. Small buffet, but delicious, Choice of three hot dishes toorder from, eggs Benedict or scrambled or French toast. On the buffet are fresh organic vegetables, mixed young salat, tomatoes, some steamed veggies and roasted eggplant etc, pasta, potatoes, delicious little croissants and bread, home made orange preserve, yogurt, granola, honeycomb, fresh fruit and fresh squeezed orange juice made to order. Senjo ji temple is across the street. And there are hundreds little restaurants and shops in the streets around the hotel. Starbucks couple buildings to the left, supermarket in the building and pharmacy next door. We found Backstreet guides and had private tours of Tokyo and Kamakura. Very professional, knowledgeable and pleasant to deal with it. I can really recommend !!! Made our first visit to Tokyo so enjoyable and easy. They customize their tours according to what you want to see or they make suggestions. We are just staying in Japan for a week and we wanted to experience a different city then Tokyo. So we also booked a small group tour of Kyoto with Backstreet guides. Left hotel at 6:00 AM, took bullet train ( Nozomi Shikanzen ) to Kyoto, took a tour, and were back in the hotel at 7:30 PM. Bullet train was fun ( although a little pricey fun, $236 round trip). So overall, this is a great hotel and a good base for exploring Tokyo, if you prefer not to stay downtown or want a reasonable price for a very decent hotel. By the way beds are pretty comfortable with nice duvets and pillows. Hope that if you decide to try The Gate Hotel you will enjoy it as much as we did !

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Reasonable price Nice view Staff can speak English Good location (the temple s just opposite) Rooms are bigger than those in 新宿A gd place for travelers if u plan to go to 台塲The pier s also 5 mins walk from the hotel

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Did not want to stay in the heart of Tokyo and chose this hotel as it was described as being situated in a local area. New hotel but did not have all the services that you normally expect - it did not matter! My husband needed a doctor and being a Sunday this proved to be difficult but the Front Office team found a doctor that spoke English, gave us taxi directions in both English and Japanese. A special thanks to Yuki in the restaurant for her caring and delivering dinner to our room - this was her suggestion as they don't normally do room service, and also coming to say goodbye on checkout. Great location across the road from the Buddhist temple, lots of local restaurants and markets, plus supermarket and chemist close by just in case - a different experience of Tokyo that we treasured and will most definitely return!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: All things in this hotel are wonderful, but the hotel's breakfast is too less to choose. We ate several times in convenient store in those days, like 7-11.Maybe hotel can provide rental washing machine for customers to wash clothes.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is very convenient to us. The room rate is fair. Wifi is very fast. It is close to Metro and no need to take long walking distance to Sation compare with my previous stays in Shinjuku. I really enjoy my silent and comfortable stay here. I will choose this hotel for my next trip in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: If you are looking to stay in Asakusa this is a very well present end and equipt hotel and is possible the best located. For what you get the rates are brilliant. It was two of our cheaper hotel nights but was some of the most comfortable nights. Service is on the lighter side but none the less more genuine then many. It is unlikely to base my self in asakusa again but if I do, definitely would stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A smart modern hotel with the reception and dining area on the 13th floor and a roof top bar with views of Tokyo's SkyTree and the Senso-Ji temple on the 14th floor. The staff were really helpful and welcoming. The hotel is opposite one of the gates to Senso-Ji temple and is very close to the metro station. Breakfast was very well presented. We wish we had stayed here on our first visit to Tokyo as it is far superior to the Asakusa View Hotel. We strongly recommend this hotel to the independent traveller.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very nice visual details like water features and an amazing view. Great location. Breakfast pricey. I highly recommend this hotel. Be sure to go onto the roof at night to enjoy the water feature. Very helpful staff

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The poor rating is solely due to the location. The hotel is far away from several main sights and areas (roppongi, Ginza, Tsukiji, meiji, omotesando, etc) and one has to take the tube long stretches. This is fine but the tube stops around midnight and then taxi is the only option. Very unpractical if you want to have drinks after dinner.In regards to the hotel the rooms are large and modern and the breakfast is wonderfull!! The staff is very helpfull and service minded.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel in Asakusa was our favorite place to stay during our trip to Japan, and we really enjoyed every place we stayed in Tokyo, Takayama and Kyoto, so it means something when I say this. Everything about this place was pretty stellar. I'm a fan of good design, I can stay at a drab hotel and not be too bothered, but a good design aesthetic just makes me that much more comfortable and gives me a general sense of well being. The Gate Hotel has good design in spades. I read some reviews that described this hotel as standard, I don't really get how anyone could say that. Maybe as an American I just haven't seen enough swanky hotels, to me a standard hotel room is: White walls, earth tones, and maybe a landscape painting on the wall. The Gate is completely the opposite, check out the pictures at the end of this review (and everyone else's). It's not just the fact that the walls are dark that make this place different, it's the details, the colorful frame around the mirror in the room, the large illuminated egg in the corner of the hallway, the illuminated glass corner of the bathroom, the beautifully odd "chandelier" in the lobby...trust me, this place is far from typical. I'd describe it as designy and swanky in the best possible way, and the views from the room and the upper deck are fantastic.The hotel lobby is situated high in the building, which is different, and not a problem. You take an elevator up and as the doors open you're greeted with the sight of the aforementioned chandelier and large, nearly floor to ceiling windows with beautiful views of Tokyo. The front desk staff are extremely courteous and professional while still being friendly, they do polite in Japan very well, it's impressive. Checking in was a breeze.The room itself is well arranged and spacious. Even with the good design it was all very comfortable. The bathroom was even spacious, having an area for the toilet (Japanese style, with bidet spray and temperature controls) and the sink as you enter and then a separate chamber for the shower and bath. What I really liked was the traditional Japanese set-up: there's a tiled area with a sort of hand-shower and a stool where you could pre-rinse/post rinse before and after your bath, which just makes you feel a whole lot cleaner.As you enter the room (our room, anyway, we had an "essential double" room) there's a closet on the left, and then a long desk and chair. To the right is the bed with a small table and comfy chairs between it and the outer wall, where a large window offered a spectacular view of Tokyo and Senso-ji temple. Luggage could be placed at the foot of the bed leaving enough room to pass between the door and bathroom to the window and table. The desk had some space where you could stash stuff also, and the closet, although small, could probably accommodate at least one rolling suitcase from what I remember. The bed was very comfortable and of course everything was clean, it's Japan.Beyond the room: I'd read before going to Japan that The Gate had an upper floor bar and viewing deck but people were complaining that there was a cover charge to gain entry, even for hotel guests. This turned out to be false. I don't know if they changed their policy or what, but we'd been informed when checking in that we could just go on up to the deck, and that was true. The view from the deck was nothing short of spectacular, the Sky Tree was prominent and glowing, and you could take in a dazzling slice of Tokyo while sipping a nice drink. As a side note, the hotel bar had a Japanese whisky called Hakushu which was excellent, if you're into that sort of thing.On our last night in Tokyo we ate at the restaurant at The Gate, it was our one expensive dinner in Tokyo and it was worth it, fancy food that tastes fancy, not just looks it. Again, the views from the restaurant were also stellar, being pretty much the same view from the deck.All in all our stay at the Gate Hotel was excellent, it really was the sort of place where you feel like you're experiencing something special. We very much enjoyed our stay and I didn't want to leave, we'd definitely return again on future visits to Tokyo, highly recommended!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I visited the Restaurant and Bar at The Gate Hotel on May 2015. It was our second trip to Tokyo, but I had never heard about this restaurant before, I had just read about it in a local newspaper.And, in my opinion, when you are in Asakusa, you must see this place. They have an outside terrace with really great view. It is rather small, so if you love eating outside as much as I, I recommend to book a table in advance. We were lucky we found not reserved seats. Service is excellent, like always in Japan.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: After a week in Tokyo going back to the hotel every night unable to keep up with any sort of English news I found it quite depressing that didnt know anything going on in the world.YEN 151,000 for a week one would expect at least one channel CNN HAD THE SAME FROZEN picture for a week..FREE coffee and tea available 24hours in their coffee shop on the lobby floor..Location excellent for both transportation and local supermarkets.Good variety of inexpensive eating places of all varities

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I had a difficult time deciding where to base our visit to Tokyo. This hotel ended up being a good choice. We were able to get to the hotel easily via subway from Haneda airport - one transfer. The hotel is fairly new and well-kept. Senjo-ji Shrine is basically right across the street. Tokyo is huge and you will need to find ways to get around no matter where you stay - we ended up using the bus system, the subway system, and the train system. This hotel is right next to a Ginza subway stop. The breakfast buffet was good. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Nice service and great view /suitable for family tripTheir honesty and the spirits of Japan make our trip unfogettable.All in all, the staff at the hotel helped us find out the lost gift after we're back.Really appreciate everything they did fir us.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is at a good location. near to railway station and bus station. Easy to go to Tokyo Sky tree and super market, drugstore behind the hotel. It has a special view for sky tree in day&night.The Hotel is cleanliness and service is very well.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very good hotel : nice situation in a neighborhood sufficiently animated to have a lot of restaurants and sufficiently quiet to sleep well. Very close to metro station, newt to Senso-ji temple and tokyo sky tree. Beautiful vue from the restaurant room (for the breakfeast) and also from rooms. The breakfeast included croissant and hot chocolate for our french daughters but also vegetables and every things for adults. We had plenty of place in the "Classy" bedroom and a nice close room for our 3 children. Very good littery. The staff is very nice, speak english and was very helpfull. Very good value for money.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved our stay in The Gate Hotel. The location is perfect for a first visit in Tokyo. Very easy to find and access from Narita Airport and the view is amazing, not just from the rooftop but also from the rooms. Very comfortable room with some space and great beds! The food both in the restaurant and the breakfast was amazing and the service was impeccable! We highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We spent first 4 nigths of our travel in this hotel. We chose according tripadvisor's commenta and now we can ensure you that it is all real!! Deluxe room is big size with spectacular views to the Senso-ji temple and the Sky Tree. The bed is really comfortable and the shower... The shower is a dream!! It has a big window and you can relax seeing the city while the hot water falls down to your head.The attention is perfect. People are really kind and allways helpful when we needed something (indications, suggestions...). Perfect english, of course.The breakfast is served on the last floor. It is a combination of japanese and continental food. Really good to start the day. 24 h restaurants allows to enjoy a mohito in the tarrace by night while planning next day.Asakusa is perfect located to visit Senso-ji, sky tree, Nikko (direct train) and Odaiba (nice boat trip)They take care of every detail. No noise heard in the whole hotel and it was perfectly clean. In summary, this is the perfect hotel if you want to enjoy Tokyo having an unforgetable experience.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Beautiful hotel with great views from the 13th floor lobby. Well located to the metro, although a bit far out. Rooms are very nice, however a bit small. Great service from the concierge and front desk staff. Overall, highly recommended!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location is near by Metro and counter staff are all very nice and friendly. It's very suitalbe for staying for family or the people who is the first time to Tokyo. I will choose The gate hotel again if I came to Tokyo next time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is in a very good location. The overall CP value is high. People can reach here from the airport directly. The room is beautiful . We enjoyed our stays there and will visit again next time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The GATE hotel is very close to the hustling and bustling Senso-Ji, so it's quite convenient for transportation and dining, with access to the stations of the 2 subway systems in Tokyo. Shuttling to Narita airport is not difficult if you know how to take the advantage of Keisei Tram service. The best part of the stay is the panoramic view at the reception hall. Try to have a breakfast in the restaurant aside the reception. The roof top is an open-air place to have 360-degree city view.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is very new and clean. The location is amazing -close to the metro- and the staff really friendly. It has a beautiful rooftop looking over Asakusa and the Skytree, two main sights close by.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We enjoy the fresh ORANGE juice a lot in the breakfast.Just want to suggest to offer another fresh fruit, like peach and melon (cantaloupe), in the breakfast.In addition, suggest to add more various meal in the breakfast since less choice in the breakfast.Thanks !

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Perhaps it was recommended in many travel books but it is actually just a normal hotel. it does not fit into boutique hotel qualification as the hotel room is just a typical hotel room.Not to mention their wifi did not work 99% of the time. For today's Japan standard and verbal complaint made to the counter, I believe it is not something that can be excused under any circumstances. With the price we paid per night (up to 26000yen for a saturday night), one can definitely get a better hotel in shinjuku or ikebukuro area.The face wash and hand wash provided in a pump were quite disgusting. The bottle has either blood mark or cosmetic leftover on the pumping sides... I dare not to use it at all!! Will not return to this hotel anymore for sure.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is in an excellent location - close to the subway and the train from Narita as well as being within an easy walk of many attractions and great restaurants. The room was not large but then you dont go to Tokyo for a large hotel room. It had everything we needed including a good bathroom with separate shower and bath room. The view from the bar at the top of the hotel is fantastic and it is a great place for a sunset drink. We didn't try the restaurant but the reception staff were great at giving us advice about where to eat locally. There is a Starbucks about three doors down and it is next to a big supermarket and very close to a tourist information place with excellent English speakers. We couldn't have been happier with the location.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed 4 nights at two different room types. Both the single room and the double room with Skytree view didn't meet the expected design hotel standard in terms of interior room design. The air con blew winds just over your head to make you hard to sleep. The hand wash foam bottle had red-like dye (hopefully not blood) stained on its cap. The mattress were deformed to make you hard to sleep. The complimentary Wifi never worked well continuously. The only reason why I don't rate it terrible is the staff are nice.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were a group of 3 and had a large triple room with 3 separate beds, fairly rare in Tokyo. We loved Asakusa. It was easy to get to by direct train from Narita. It had a local feel and we enjoyed the covered shopping arcades and the temple area. We ate in Sushi Zanmai on our first night as it is just opposite.The room was luxurious for the price. There was a generously sized bathroom with a tub and a shower. A Nespresso coffee machine and a fridge were useful for breakfast in our room with provisions from the supermarket downstairs.At night, the views from the terrace were stunning, though order simple drinks and do not expect hand-crafted cocktails.On a Tuesday, the restaurants seemed to be mostly closed at 8pm in this area. We ended up in a branch of Tenya tempura opposite the hotel and along the street.I would certainly stay again in this hotel as it was very comfortable and very well located.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: if you like Skytree and Asakusa, you have to choose here.room not big but ok, a bit high price, the bar at upper level which is romantic place.the view of reception is also good for stay for a night.near supermarket, attraction area...so that is a good place and also better than living in tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed here May 2015.Fab hotel very helpful staff. Buffet Breakfast was of the highest quality was a bit disappointed that there was no japanese style breakfast on buffet (rice & fish). The view from the roof terrace was amazing.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Wow what great customer service! So accommodating for everything. Love it here! Location, staff, subtle elegance! The boutique style is luxurious and personal. I looked at other hotels in the area online. When I saw the hotels up close, definitely no comparison.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel has an excellent location in Asakusa near the Senso-ji Temple. Have a coffee or drink at the bar here. From inside and from the terrace the view of Tokyo Skytree is especially nice at night when the tower is illuminated. Many small restaurants, ramen places, and Japanese style izakaya bars can be found around the hotel. From the nearby Toei Asakusa subway station you can take a train directly to Narita Airport and Haneda Airport. This is a good place to stay for business or sightseeing.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We have 4 people (2 adults 2 children) and stay in the style E Hollywood twin room. The room is big enough for us and the bed is comfortable. And one super market is just next to the hotel. The distance to Kaminarimon is just few minutes walk. I think it's good for the family.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed my two days at The Gate Hotel. The staff was kind and helpful, and the hotel was close to a number of interesting attractions and activities, including the Kaminarimon Gate, the Senso-ji temple, the Tokyo Water Cruise, the Tokyo Kitchen cooking class, the Mokuhankan woodblock printing class and bike rentals. I don't have pictures of the hotel, which is located about 2 blocks from the Kaminarimon Gate, but here are pictures from the area.
user_name:
CountryCrush
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Visit Tokyo regularly for business. First stay at The Gate Hotel in a Modest room. Room was modern and clean. Air con perfect. Particularly liked the privacy of not having to pass through reception upon returning to the hotel each time as lobby is on 13th floor. Supermarket to the left of the hotel, 'bits and pieces' store to the right - both handy. Great restaurants (various cuisines), markets, karaoke, pachinko parlours, trains, the gate (of course) and sensoji all in walking distance. Enjoyed evening meals and breakfasts at the hotels. Laundry service was reliable. Staff all lovely. Drinks vending machine (with beer) on each floor. Stayed for business, will stay again and would stay for leisure too.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel is located 2 blocks from nearest subway station. If you arrive during the peak hours, you will have to struggle a bit with the crowd heading towards Senso-Ji. Rooms are well appointed, excellent use of space and the deep bathtubs are useful after all the walking. There is a rooftop area that overlooks Senso-Ji and of course the Tokyo Skytree.The staff were typical Japanese efficient, no frills.Many restaurants around including some decent sushi joints that are 24 hours across the street.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located near the huge Senso-Ji temple, surrounded by hundreds of great bars and restaurants, walking distance to metro (Ginza and Asakusa line, and direct to Narida airport), and a wonderful supermarket right next door. The hotel itself is really pretty flash for a relatively budget hotel, the rooms are a good size with wonderful bathrooms, plenty of amenities, ice machines near by, and we haven't even mentioned the roof top bar which is the perfect location to rest weary bones with a beer or three before heading back into the wonderful world of Tokyo! Oh, and the staff are divine.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location for the Underground/subway system (Ginza line 150m) and the Asakusa line 250m with a direct link to Haneda Airport. Breakfast either Japanese or Western style was superb. Excellent views over Tokyo. Rooms a fair size - we had a standard twin room which came with all the expected facilities/safe/bath products - bathroom and shower top class . Stayed in many hotels and recommend this with no hesitation. However, if you want to be in a more action/nightlife area go a little more central/south. The bar and bar food is a little expensive but of a high quality.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Travelled to Japan for my 40th Birthday. This hotel really is excellent, the location in Asakusa is brilliant, temples, shops, restaurants, cat cafe. 5 minute walk from the train / Subway station and river where you can sail down the Sumida River. The breakfast was lovely overlooking Asakusa with a roof top bar with amazing views, the staff were lovely and very helpful would stay here again straight away!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is really worth to stay! All the servants there are very nice and kind, and are always with smiles. We are a family travel with a 1-year-old baby girl. We booked a non-smoking room. The room is clean and there is absolutely not a smell of smoke in the room. Very good! The bed and pillow are very comfortable for sleeping. Besides, their breakfast is quite excellent, for adult and also for the baby!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed at Gate Hotel in late May for 6 nights. I was travelling with a friend & it was a first time in Tokyo. I had selected this hotel as I wanted to stay in a 'different' part of Tokyo and Asakusa met the brief. Whilst Asakusa is busy during the day with tourists visiting nearby shrines and shops, during the evening it was quiet but with a wide a array of excellent restaurants frequented by locals.I had booked a 'scenic' twin room for our stay & it exceeded our expectations. The positives were:-Hotel Room- I had booked a 'Scenic Room' We were on the 6th floor and we had a fantastic view of the street below - the people watching was great and we had views of the local landmarks. The room was also a great size. The room easily fitted two king single beds, plus two armchairs and a coffee table (conveniently located next to a big picture window).Location - Asakusa a good location because (a) it was some great restaurants but is a bit quieter at night than some other parts of Tokyo (b) It is home to two subway lines and a JR line so it's very easy to get about (c) it is easily accessible from Narita Airport - there is a direct subway line Hotel - very clean and very pleasant staff. Decor is very nice; there is a great roof top bar for the exclusive use of hotel guests & the restaurant has nice (if a little unimaginative..) food and a fabulous view. There is free wi-fi throughout the hotelNegatives:-None really but in terms of location - if you are looking to go out clubbing every night, Asakusa isn't the area for you. You would be better off staying on the other side of Tokyo near Shibuya or Shinjuku.Recommendations - book the 'Scenic' style room (on the hotel website they provide good details of the different types of rooms - & the room sizes - on offer).

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed only for two nights but I have found the hotel to be a great choice and exceptional value for money. Good sized and well appointed room for Japan standards. Free and fast WiFi, courteous staff. There is no concierge and fronk desk staff might not be as helpful. Great location 5mins from Asakusa station and 20min from TYO Tower. Starbucks and grocery store right outside the hotel. Nice and lively area overall.We had a slight issue with the AC not cooling down the room properly so had to use the air purifier to get the temp down. Didn't bother contacting the staff about it.Had to leave early, went to the restaurant to buy coffee as BFst was not included (Starbucks open at 7) and the staff member comped the two espressos. Nice touch.I would definitely recommend this property.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stay in their deluxe double room with my wife for 2 nights. The room is very very big, nicely design and clean. The hotel lobby is located at the 12F which you could see the Tokyo skytree while you doing the check in. They have an outdoor roof top bar and you must come here for a drink to enjoy the wonderful Asakusa night view. The location of this hotel is excellent, it take less than 10mins walk from Asakusa Station and it is just opposite to the Senso-Ji, which is the most famous temple at Asakusa. There are lots of interesting shops and restaurants near to the hotel, you can spend half day to walk around the district.Hotel staff could speak fluent English, polite and helpful but a bit careless. I gave them my passports to make copy but they forgot to give it back to me after I check in. I didn’t realize that until I get to my room so I rush back to the front desk to take it back. I kept my luggage and backpack at the front desk after I checked out as I want to walk around before I catch the evening flight. One of the staff put my backpack on the luggage and when she turn around, my backpack drop on the floor….. I got a ceramic bowl and a camera inside my backpack and luckily they are in shape. The 2 incident is not a big deal, and I still like this hotel very much, just hoping the staffs could be more careful.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We recently stayed 5 nights in the Gate Hotel Kaminarimon, at the end of our three week trip to Japan. The hotel is member of the Design Hotels and the moment you enter you know why. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. Staff are very helpful.We had a king bedded room on the 12th floor with a view towards the 'sky tree'. Also from the roof top terrace there are wonderful views. The hotel has a very good and well priced restaurant (wonderful views again!). The location is superb, next to the entrance gate (Kaminarimon) to the Senso-Ji temple complex. The Ginza line is around the corner and from there you can easily find your way anywhere in Tokyo.We'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is a very good hotel which has high quality service, clean, quiet, and very convenience location. There are many shops and restaurant around the hotel. This hotel would be my first choice for my next Tokyo trip.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here for nine nights earlier this month,and feel this hotel should be highly. recommemded. It is very stylish, wonderful views and spotlessly clean. I cannot praise this hotel high enough. Position wise in a very interesting older part of Tokyo, and handy location for the Metro. There were however a couple of things that did slighty irritate. Storage for clothed and suitcases is minimal. They did however provide a clothing rack that sorted out this problem. The other thing was The Do Not Disturb sign. I bleary eyed one morning turned the sign around and left for an early morning trip. When I returned, I was amazed to see the room had not been cleaned! I looked at the sign, and this has to be the only hotel in the world that has the same instructions both sides! A mistake not to be repeated. Other than that, great breakfast, wonderful restaurant, the onion soup I particularly recommend. Charming, gentle staff. A real winner!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located in Asakusa which has plenty of metro access. If you book in advance you can get a good rate. The staff are very friendly, speak English, and go out of their way to help. The rooms are comfortable, spacious (for Japan) and have a good bathroom. There is a mini fridge (empty) to store your drinks. There is a supermarket on the ground floor. The breakfast is adequate and most days no waiting was necessary for a table. There is also an outside dining space and a roof terrace. The restaurant was only adequate, but there are many restaurants in the surrounding area. All in all a very good boutique style hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This time is me & my husband honeymoon.The Gate Hotel very sweet! Give our surprised and little gift!We feel very comfortable and happy.If we go back to Tokyo.I think we will choose The Gate Hotel again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is right near the Senso-ji in Asakusa in northern Tokyo, about four miles from the Ginza and near Ueno Park. This is an area with few western tourists and gives a real flavor of Japan. We loved it! It's a great biking neighborhood--all the locals seem to bike and we rented bikes two blocks from the hotel for $2.65 a day. The hotel is quite new and lovely, with great views from its top floor lobby, restaurant, bar and roof deck. Our upgraded room was large and comfortable with a great bath and fine views. Only negative was that they don't have a dedicated concierge, but the front desk people were conscientious and helpful, if not particularly knowledgeable. Wifi worked well.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed in 5 different hotels during a recent trip to Japan, and the Gate was hands down our favorite. Great location on main shopping street and near Temple in Asakusa, and easy to get to from at least 2 different subway lines, including one that goes directly to Haneda Airport. Lobby has floor-to-ceiling wrap-around views of the neighborhood, and a roof deck and lovely bar are a great place to hang out. Breakfast is excellent, including fresh-squeezed orange juice and french toast plus really nice buffet options, including some organic vegetables.Rooms are great with nice touches like crystal glassware, bathrooms are fantastic, and service is excellent. Plus hotel was as quiet as could be - we stayed 2 separate times in 2 different rooms.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: its been good experence staying in this hotel. service is good and its convenient near the subway. lots of food resturtant choices and supermarket just near by. but hope the bath tub can have bigger size. overall, i will stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The employees are very nice. Location is perfect. But cleanness of the room should be improved. The carpet is a litte bit dirty. There are tea filth in the cups. Maybe you can see how the Disney Hotel clean their room. They are perfect in the room clean.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is perfect in every way. Just across the street from the Sensoji Temple Kaminarimon Gate and 2 minutes from the Ginza subway line. Plenty of places to eat and great pedestrian streets to wander any time of day. Asakusa is a wonderful area of Tokyo.The hotel is spotless and the room was large enough with a very comfortable bed. There is a supermarket next door and a Starbucks 25 meters away.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel is located on main road where Kaminarimon gate is, only a few minutes walk from metro station. There is a supermarket just beside the hotel entrance and lots of restaurants and shops nearby. Room is quite spacy and well isolated from the busy street downstairs, bathroom is very clean and well equipped,The downside is no compliment mineral water bottles, and maybe we also missed coin laundry machine which other hotels provided during our trip before Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location is great next to Asakusa subway and in front of temple entrance. Perfect room, spacious and clean, well equipped nice bathroom. Wifi mediocre, breakfast rather poor: no choice of cereals, no cheese, no salmon. Excellent orange juice, good croissants. Japanese breakfast seemed ok, western style should be adjusted.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Most excellent service, great room, quality linens, bathroom spacious, view spectacular! We ate at restaurant on lobby floor for dinner, friendly and lovely staff.Our luggage was handled effectively.All staff very well trained.Only wish the rooftop was open beyond 11pm!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The location is perfect for exploring Asakusa. Right across the street from the shrine, and tonnes of restaurants and shops in the vicinity.The rooms have a fresh and retro design. The rooms are also relatively roomy for Tokyo hotels. The only negative is that the rooms and decorated with dark carpet, wallpaper, etc, so dust really sticks out.The bathroom is quite big and includes a separate room with a bath and a shower. Personally I didn't like the frosted glass over the shower area, that can be seen from the main room. Not a big deal though.The price is a bit steep, but reasonable given the location and quality of the hotel.The views from the lobby and rooftop are spectacular - great for taking photos.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: There's a lot to like about the gate hotel as it's a nice modern hotel with a cracking view and great bar and roof terrace.Only down side is that after staying in a number of hotels during my visit in Japan, this was my least favourite, for the following reasons:1. Location; I would say that this is situated in an old part of Tokyo and therefore lacks restaurants or nightlife....you have to travel quite far to get to the more lively, modern districts of Tokyo. It is well situated if visiting the temple or museums though so depends on what your prefer in a trip.2. Not very personal; It did feel like it lacked a lot of charm and would suite a more business orientated trip.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great Hotel ,with nice shashimi and sushi joints all nearby the hotel .This Hotel is pretty new and the services is good .THERE ARE HORDES OF NICE GREAT FOOD IN THE AREA AND YOU ARE ADVISE not to seek out the cool nice great food that are located in the alleys and on the 2nd level . The ground floor are mostly catering to the tourist and suggest you walk up the flight of steps to join the locals .Do spend a full day exploring this area before you cross over to the Tokyo Tree.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The gate hotel had excellent service - room (twin share) was small but clean - view is excellent - location us great for discovering asakusa - rooftop bar was great a quiet - go for the happy hour Negative : - for a over 200 AUD hotel there was no minibar Definitely a hotel to stay in

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had a very enjoyable stay in this superbly located hotel. We had the E category room which had 2 queen size beds in a fairly spacious room. The sheets were changed every day As well as 2 pairs of clean pyjamas! There was a shower room including a bath and an all singing all dancing Japanese toilet  A choice of 2 bars one on the roof terrace and another on the 13th Floor with the restaurant giving superb views plus 3 hours of happy hours every day

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: There is a direct train from Haneda Airport to Asakusa which is really handy, and The Gate is a short walk from the train station. The room was lovely, and a very reasonable size especially compared to other hotel rooms we stayed in at both Tokyo and Kyoto. Good location to be away from the flashing lights of Shibuya or Shinjuku with a nice local neighborhood feeling. There is a supermarket right next door which is also really convenient. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed at the Gate hotel in November (travelling to Japan for our 4th trip) We hadn't stayed in this area of the city before and the reviews made us pick the Gate Hotel.We arrived a little early for check in (and very tired) but the staff we friendly, welcoming and very accommodating of my tired brain! We had told them on our booking it was our wedding anniversary while we were there and they were really sweet and congratulated us on check in.The lobby was really impressive and we explored the hotel (the roof terrace is fab!) A nice chill spot :)When we did get into our room I was super suprised ast the size of it - big for japanese standards. the bed was huge and super comfy too. The bathroom was really nice - no complaints, and they left us a little welcome note to say again congratulations on our anniversary - really nice. The decor in the room was clean and modern, and suited our tastes. We had loads of room for our huge cases too. The only downside was we could not get the wi-fi to work at all with our windows phones. Not an issue though with a starbucks a couple of doors down for brekkie and day planning.We did not use the restaurant as breakfast was way too pricey (I'm a bowl of yoghurt kinda girl, and didn't want to pay over the odds for that... Starbucks suited us much better)The location in terms of Senso-ji was perfect, and its super easy to get to the sky tree from there. The downside is not being on a JR line - so you cant use your passes on the ginza line. We also found coming back late the ginza line was a little unreliable - obviously that's nothing to do with this fab hotel, but just something we would bear in mind if booking againIt was great value for money too - MUCH cheaper than our favourite hotel we use when in tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very good experience from the very first moment. Friendly, corteous and atentive staff was able to accommodate my various requests. Clean, modern and well equiped room. Rooftop terrace with nice view of Tokyo. Definitely recommend to anyone visiting Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel has a really great location for Asakusa - it's about 2 min from Kaminarimon gate, and minutes from the metro station. It's close to loads of shops and restaurants, and also to the river if you fancy a boat trip! There's a supermarket next door if you need bits and bobs, and despite being in a busy area the room was nice and quiet. The staff are friendly and helpful too.The room itself was a good size - we had plenty of space for our two big suitcases. It has a nice big bathroom and a rain-style shower, and very powerful aircon! The fast WiFi was very useful. The rooftop bar has great views of the Skytree and surrounding area - I would recommend heading up there at night for a drink and to take in the views. This hotel is a great choice for an Asakusa base, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The location is superb! Opposite to the Kaminarimon, there are plenty of restaurants, souvenir shops around the hotel. The subway station for the Ginza line (which is one of the most useful subway line for the tourists IMO) is only few steps away from the hotel. The view from the reception itself is worth the money you pay. Hotel staff is friendly too. If there's one thing that I'm not completely satisfied, it would be the breakfast. Although tasty, it's not Japanese style breakfast - something for the hotel management to think about.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This place is a really good - even though the rooms are small. To compensate there is a comfy lobby, small bar, restaurant and outdoor terrace on the 13th and 14th floors with views of the Temple and the Sky-tree and the infamous Asahi building with its "Golden Turd" if you need to hang out at the hotel - but really there's a lot to do in the area and nearby Ueno and all of Tokyo beckons just beyond!Located right by the Ginza metro line, occupies the 5 to 13th floors of a neat building overlooking the temple gate with a supermarket and chemist at its base. Restaurants surround it and the river is 5 minutes walk.Situated in the Amazuke district it offers a great activity and the local station offers several options for trains to Narita, including a direct service from the metro which get you to terminal 2 in about 50 minutes.Staff are super helpful and the Wi-Fi etc all works well. Décor modern urban without being too luxe or silly. Vending machines with soft drinks etc and ice on each floor.I recommend it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hulic was in a great location with superb service. We went with the Hollywood Twin A Style and the room was large for Japanese standards and well laid out. We ended up in a smoking room (my mistake on the reservation) but we found there was no smoke odor in the room itself (even though there was in the hallways). They provided a room filtration unit which surprised me. The twin size beds were quite large and pushed together it felt like the two of us had a massively large bed. The bed was also very comfortable, being comfortably firm with a little give instead of the overly hard firm other mattresses we experienced in Japan. The bathroom was small (normal for Japan) but exactly what one needed with all the amenities - deep tub, double shower head, lavender bath salts, large fluffy towels, washing towels, etc. Most important is that it is quiet in the rooms and the temperature adjustable to exactly what you want (ask staff about controls if necessary). The location is fantastic being near 3 large subway/train stations and tons of food shops within steps from the hotel, plus superior shopping for everything you can imagine along the lines of shopping stalls only a block away. I see someone else brought up the issue with arriving late. We had a flight delay of an hour which pushed us back to leave on the train around 9:30 pm of which there were no more limited express. This changed our total travel time from an hour to just over an hour and a half, which felt even longer. Make sure you are on a limited express when doing this. It is fast, you stay on the same train, and it is relatively cheap at 1290 yen.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was our final stop in Japan on the way home to NZ and we had been travelling from Hakuba all day lugging ski gear around various stations so... it's not that easy to get to - we had a JR East pass and that wasn't accepted on the lines to get to Asakusa. We could have bought a ticket sure, but it was crazy busy so instead we flagged a taxi. I HIGHLY recommend this option! Get off train at Ueno and grab a taxi, get dropped at door, job done. Beautiful lobby with stunning views of old and new Tokyo. We had a twin room and the beds were big and comfy. The toiletries in the bathroom were really nice, had a nice soak in the bath were their bath tablets. The balcony happy hour was well worth a visit! Had a wine, my son had a hand smashed lemonade! Watched all the business going on, with the markets below and the big sky tower nearby that lit up in the evening. We ate here in the evening with a few shared plates and it was delicious, the breakfast was nice also, liked the honeycomb and the eggs benedict! We caught the taxi to Tokyo station in the morning to catch the narita express. Was about $20 and well worth it, even with this I'd recommend staying here as you get to wander the markets and see the temples next to high rises, women in kimono etc. I bought a beautiful hand printed painting and there are fantastic dining options. We even saw a geisha late at night arriving at the restaurant as we were leaving!! negatives: the air con / heating couldn't be altered. It was hot and we had to sleep with wet towels on our heads as the fan stopped going in the night!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: All the staff were very kind and the linen was clean and comfortable.From the hotel we can access easily to the public transport. The best was we had wonderful breakfast! To us "THE GATE HOTEL " was perfect !

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location: In the Asakusa district. If you are flying from NRT be aware the direct Limited Express train on the Keisei Line does not appear to run at all hours (that is the direct train from NRT to Asakusa). We arrived on a late flight and the airport information desk advised the only available train was the local train, which took almost two hours (not recommended). On our return trip we were able to take the limited express train which, although crowded (no reserve seats) was fairly quick. One other issue with the location, although Asakusa is served by two subway lines, one is the Tokyo Metro (Ginza) the other a Toei Line. If you want to buy a day pass be sure to buy the combined Metro/Toei ticket otherwise you are limited to just the Ginza line from the Asakusa station.Hotel: The lobby is on the 13th floor the rooms below. We had a “classy” room. While large by Tokyo standards, it was very dark and bland. The room was very clean. Not a memorable room. We had a view of the skyline tower from our small window.Service: While I have no complaints service seems impersonal.Summary: More a business hotel than a hotel suited for tourists. Location was OK. Breakfast was $21 (we passed on that).

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I really cannot say enough good things about this hotel! All the staff are super friendly and helpful, the room was amazing (we were in a suite on the 3rd floor with a balcony) and the bar on the 13th floor has fantastic views of the city. I thought the breakfast was excellent as well. Would definitely stay here again when I return to Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: There are cooler areas of Tokyo, but for anyone wanting to step into a more historic area of Tokyo, Asakusa is a pretty good option. The Gate Hotel is handy for Ueno Park, Kappabashi Dori (kitchen equipment shopping street), the new Skytree Tower and river cruises down to Odaiba. Most importantly the Senso Ji Temple is just over the road, a colourful, fun and always busy visitor attraction. The hotel itself has good-sized rooms, is good value and a boutique feel. The staff are helpful and there's a cool terrace bar with great views. Breakfast was only so-so, but perfectly fine really. This is a great base for Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: If you like Asakusa area, you will love this hotel!! Just a few steps from Asakusa Gate, easy to walk around and it's in the middle of everything. I've stay in suites room with the good view ever! You can see all around. The room is so nice ,clean and planty of space that you can enjoy and relax. The bathroom is great , all you want are in there. If you have time, don't miss their breakfast!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was our first ever trip to Japan and what a way to start off. All told we stayed in 12 hotels and Ryoken and this Hotel rated #1 in the hotels for us. Located about 8 mins from the centre of Tokyo by tube it is well positioned and above all quiet.The rooms are a decent size given others we stayed in later on our journey, they are exceptionally quiet, clean and well presented. 2 mins walk away is the Kaminarimon gate and temple, 5 mins is the tube and ferry station as well as various shopping experiences.Anyway, back to the hotel itself. The staff were professional but exceptionally friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them at all. Whilst the breakfast was fairly limited in choice, what they did, they did very well indeed, my wife says the eggs Benedict are the best she has had!If you get chance have an evening meal in the restaurant, but be prepared for it to be a relaxed affair, if you want food in a hurry, dine outside the hotel. However, after a day in Tokyo you will more than appreciate the chance to slow down and catch up with yourself.The rooftop bar is a must visit as it is a quiet haven where you can sit and enjoy a drink as well as a view, this is something that IMHO the hotel undersells and should make more of. The views of Tokyo at night are very good and worth a photo opportunity, we found the bar staff are good with a camera and iPhone.This was an absolutely perfect Hotel for us to start our Japan adventure as it allowed us to recover from the 12 hour flight and 9 hour time difference whilst at the same time being in Tokyo allowing us to explore without too much effort.Would we go back? Absolutely, there is no decision to be made the Gate Hotel ticks all the boxes for us.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I had a 5 nights' stay at this hotel in late March/early April 2015. The location is excellent with less than 5 minutes walk from nearby metro. There are one supermarket and one building with some restaurants right next to the hotel. Room is a bit bigger compared with other business hotels in tokyo (not sure if it is because of we pay for higher price for larger room). Front desk staff are extremely helpful and email response time is short. Upon my request through email, they checked out which exit with elevator access which ease my trouble when carrying baby stroller.One small shortcoming. The conditioner provided is not of good quality !

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great hotel in good location. Lovely rooms (not huge but I've learnt that's not unusual in Japan). Lovely service from everyone. Fantastic views at Lobby level and the bar the floor above. Good value (when we went - although the prices went up significantly over the following weeks as we heading towards Easter/Cherry blossom - unsurprisingly).

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed overnight in this hotel(layover in Tokyo).The hotel is well situated in Asakusa, a few minutes walk from the subway station and almost across the Kamanarimon gate. We had a very nice view of the Tokyo Skytree from the hotel lobby or from the sidewalk outside the hotel. We had a good size room for Tokyo standard with twin beds together, comfortably fitted myself (I'm very petite though), husband and 3 little kids! But four adults should be good too. We only had carry-on luggages so it may be tight for others with large luggages. Bathroom was clean with a good supply of toiletries. I'm glad we booked this hotel. It made our overnight stay very comfortable and will definitely book here again for a longer stay in Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is a truly wonderful hotel. The room was very comfortable, good sized (compared to other Japanese hotels), and the breakfast was the best we had in Japan (though it didn't change from day to day). The staff was very friendly. The bed was very comfortable. The room was quiet. Note: There is no JR station in the walking vicinity of this hotel. You need to take either a local train (which is really close) or a taxi to get here. So if you are planning to use only a JR pass to travel through Japan, this hotel will not be convenient. However, if you don't mind paying a few dollar for the local metro in order to get to the JR station, you will not go wrong with The Gate Hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Just loved this hotel!!!! Did not want to leave. Front desk personnel are very friendly and helpful with area information. Their English is very good. Rooms are very nice...... large size compared to many of the other hotels we stayed at....comfortable beds, great shower. Beautiful views of Tokyo and sky tree. Happy hour on roof top bar is so nice after busy day of sight seeing. Also enjoyed main bar on lobby level. Bartender very personable and fun. Excellent hotel in touristy area.Close to many sights.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: 2 visits in 2 years. Top shelf hotel in great historical location. Good train and subway access for Tokyo travel and airport transport. Spectacular view from lobby bar and breakfast room. Good eating options nearby. English speaking front desk. Polite staff deliver sincere customer service.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Fantastic hotel in a lively quarter near Asakusa temple, with a lot of restaurant around! metro is really near! all staff of the hotel very very efficent and kind!! confortable rooms. restaurant with a fantastic view.
user_name:
Vini S
Castellina In Chianti, Italy

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We spent 4 nights here, the location is excellent, 2 mins walk from Assakusa station (so easy to get to all main sites) and lots of nice restaurants (and cool jazz bar) within 5 mins walk. Also easy to reach airport on tube as it links to airport line. We found the reception staff excellent, very helpful and polite. The roof top bar has great view of sky tree and a good happy hour! We did not eat in the hotel as there are so many options close by. We did find the area more touristy than other Tokyo areas (we spent 4 nights in Shinjuku too) so would recommend staying in another Tokyo location too if you have time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good location, reasonable price and nice clean room with a comfy bed. We just had the basic room which was fine. Breakfast was good. Reception is high up near the top of the hotel with stunning views of the surrounding area. Good base to see the sky tree and temple. A tip from me is you don't really need to splash out on a more expensive room with a view of the sky tree when you can have a fabulous view from reception and take photos.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Upon checking in we were upgraded to a corner room which had a huge corner window overlooking Asakusa. The room was modern, clean and had everything thing you'd expect from a smart hotel.The bar in the daytime or evening was great and offered fantastic 13th floor level views of the Tokyo Skytree and greater Asakusa. If we're ever back in Tokyo it's where we'll stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is right in the centre of Asakusa. This was our favourite area of Tokyo its busy with lots going on but not on the same level as shinjuku. The gate hotel is great it right on the Main Street a little way down from the main temple , very close to a masssive Starbucks. We had a corner room and the view was great overlooking the street. If you aren't lucky enough to get a view you can go up to the reception which looks out over Tokyo. Breakfast here was ok nothing special apart from the freshley squeezed. While you wait, orange juice.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: As soon as we checked in we were offered complimentary rice balls and liquor to celebrate a Japanese holiday, which was very nice. One of the best things about this hotel is the view! It is incredibly breath taking. The rooms are simple but that is just fine. We were given the last room which was a smoking one and although it was not ideal... The smell wasn't too bad. The location of the hotel in asakusa is ideal.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A lovely area of Tokyo to stay- very convenient. This hotel is modern, could be seen as characterless but with a wonderful view and excellent staff. The food is good too.very comfortable too. It has little street presence so you need to know where to go

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It is 3 minutes walk from the best temple and walking distance to the Cruise and Skytree so really excellent location . But this hotel has no ״soul " . Everything is ok but there is nothing special . The breakfast , the rooms , the Lobby .. It has it all and all is very clean but ... I know I won't remember it the minute I leave.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very conveniently positioned, extremely helpful staff, modern rooms with great views, windows that open for fresh air, a luxurious rooftop deck and cosy bar, delicious breakfast buffet (get the French toast and fresh OJ) all at a good value price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel Is an interesting hotel with very little street presence and it's reception on the 13th floor. It also has roof terrace for guests commanding a fantastic view over the neon jungle of Asakusa. Good beds and good bathrooms. And the breakfast was really something special with a view over the roof tops below.Another great PLUS for this hotel is that is perfect for travellers with a jet lag - it's restaurant is open 24 hours! Fortunately we had already adapted to Tokyo time so we didn't need this extra service, it may be handy knowledge when planning our next visit to Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location in the asakusa area. Just steps from the subway. Kaminarimon Gate, and Sensoji Temple. There is a Starbucks next door...I did stick to the local cuisine throughout the day, but I do enjoy a cup of black coffee to start my morningThey have a 24 hour restaurant with a lovely staff and amazing views of the city both day and night.Book early and request a high room. If they are not available don't fret they have a great rooftop patio where you can order drinks and take amazing pics of the skyline. Nice bathroom (large showers) with full size shampoo, conditioner, and liquid soap. There is a nice deep soak tub, I'm 5'9 so I didn't quite fit but they rainfall shower head and great water pressure more than made me forget about it. There is a safe in the room. You only get one English station CNN, which is fine because you’re in Tokyo you do not really need to watch reruns of Friends or Law & Order.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: From Australia my wife and I were booked in for 10 nights. We had a room on the 9th floor with a king sized double bed. The smallish room size coupled with the size of the bed meant access to the bed could not happen from both sides, with one side against the wall, and this also meant no bedside table/cupboard on the non accessible side as well. There were two complimentary bottles of water for the first day only, but this was offset by the offer of a free tea/coffee on the 13th floor lobby area. The room, despite its size, was spotlessly clean, exceptionally quiet, and well appointed. The bathroom was modern, hi tech heated seat and auto flush etc, with a shower room as opposed to a cubicle. TV coverage was fine if you spoke Japanese, otherwise it was CNN or nothing. The view was outstanding from our room and the 13th floor lobby as well as the 14th floor open roof and bar area. The staff were all very friendly, polite, helpful, and impeccably presented. The breakfasts consisted of options of eggs done various ways or a Delicious French Toast, freshly squeezed orange juice, tea/coffee, great breads and baby croissants, honey dripping from the bees' wax, cold pumpkin, eggplant, and other assorted salads, and a lone cereal, with milk and plain yoghurt. The only criticisms I had was the lack of a toaster and only the honey or whizzed up orange skin remnants to put on the bread.....BYO jam or Vegemite... The location was terrific too, close to some great attractions, restaurants. Shopping, the river and transport hubs. I recommend this hotel to you, but I see now some escalation in price too.
user_name:
Ken P
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed 5 nights in late February/early March 2015.The Gate Hotel is a modern hotel located in the heart of Asakusa. Kaminari-mon Gate and the Sensoji Temple, coupled with several streets of shops, markets and restaurants, are located in the immediate area. Ueno Park is three subway stops away. Asakusa station is a short 2-3 minute walk away and serviced by Tokyo's two subway companies, Tokyo Metro Lines (Ginza Line) and Toei Subway Lines (Toei Asakusa Line) and by the Keisei Rail Line (which services Narita airport).We had an Essential Twin Room which was somewhat small, which is typical for Japan, but was quite comfortable, very clean and extremely quiet. Our room faced the Sensoji Temple which looked spectacular at night all lit up. Our room was next door to the elevators, which initially I was not impressed with, but we never heard a sound from the hallways. Room amenities included a flat screen TV, small desk and chair, in-room safe (large enough for iPads, small cameras, passports etc., but would not hold a laptop), adjustable heating/air conditioning and free WiFi (excellent speed).The bathroom, with separate shower and bath, was modern with a full range of toiletries provided. The reception is located on the top floor and along with the roof top bar provides spectacular views of the area. Check-in and check-out was quick and efficient. Reception staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. Hotel security is excellent as your swipe card room key is required to operate the elevators. Ask reception for maps (free) of the Asakusa area and the Tokyo subway system which are in English only (a lot easier to read than maps in Japanese and English).We didn't eat at the hotel only because there are dozens of restaurants in the area, everything from fast food to gourmet dining. If you just want a quick start to the day, there is a Starbucks located in the next block (turn left when exiting the hotel and you will see the Starbucks sign).Overall, a reasonably priced and excellent stay. Highly recommended and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel was the worst during our Japan trip as our room was incredibly dirty - hairs all over the bed, dirt all over, especially in the bathroom - the blinds in the shower haven't been cleaned since the hotel has been opened I guess - huge dirty spots on the carpet (see pictures).On our day of arrival, we informed the reception that our room was dirty and asked for a proper cleaning the next day. Second day, nothing happend. As I complained again the next day, we got an "incredible" compensation of 22€ (!!!) for 2 nights after a discussion of at least an hour. Total failure of cleanliness and customer service. Can't recommend that place at all as Tokyo is full of good and clean hotels f.e. Hotel Okura. One point though for the nice view from the bar on the top floor!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I had a rear view room so nothing great to look at but the room was comfortable. IKEA furniture but I like ikea furniture. It works and it's comfortable. If the same room was appointed with custom furnishings the room would cost twice as much. But the star is the lobby lounge.Have coffee in a corner and enjoy the view. Coffee was $6 usd but completely worth itStationary available in the roomI would return to this hotel

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My daughter and I spent four days in this small but fun hotel. Our entry level room was a little larger than we'd anticipated for a city known for space constrictions. It was very comfortable and the beds were great. The fittings and bathrooms were all perfectly fine but there was nothing particularly interesting or memorable about anything. It was just short of bland but absolutely fine for a few days stay in a city where we were out all day and all evening too. The hotel's position is very important for potential guests to understand well. Askusa is an older part of Tokyo, near an important temple and with lovely older style streets to explore but quite a distance (about 30 mins by subway) from most attractions and shopping and eating areas. We enjoyed the area and did not mind the commute on the impeccable subway system but it may not suit everyone. There are plenty of places to eat nearby but they were not the notable destinations which had been recommended to us for great food or fun restaurants or quirky izakayas. The recommended places required quite a bit of travel. The breakfast in this hotel was fresh and nicely presented but fairly limited in choice for a Western style buffet. The service was great in every respect - welcoming and efficient.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Loved this hotel.Across the road from Sensiji temple and the rows of shops at its doorstep. Next door was a supermarket with everything you could need. Plenty of restaurants around for lunch and dinner.Asakusa station is about 2 mins away on foot - from there you can get just about anywhere.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Staff were all so nice and welcoming to me! I was so pleased especially after my luke-warm reception at the Takayama ouan in Gifu. As soon as I walked to the reception desk they were all smiles and asked me about my trip and where I planned to go - so nice. They spoke to me in both English and Japanese which was great!. They upgraded my room to two double beds! Not really needed but hey, I'm not complaining!No iron or laundry room, but this is not the end of the world. You can request laundry service from the reception. Room was kept immaculately clean everyday!. I really enjoyed returning to the hotel after all that sightseeing and izakaya bar hopping!. I will definitely return to this hotel when I visit Tokyo!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Service was excellent. Staff was very accommodating and spoke very good English.Room was large by Tokyo standards but not big by North American standards. The view from the room was terrific. Had a stunning view of Tokyo Skytree.However, I felt the room was rather dark. It was hard to find things at night when you dropped them on the floor even with all of the lights on in the room (thank goodness for flashlight app on tablet!)Location was great. Right across from the Kaminarimon gate, which leads to Sensoji temple; minutes away from Tokyo Skytree; and close to Ginza, Asakusa, Tobu Skytree, Tsukuba express subway/train lines. Also, convenient access from Narita airport (Keisei Access Express train, although it was pouring rain when we arrived and we got soaked walking 5 minutes from station to hotel, but that's not the hotel's fault. At least they gave us extra towels to wipe everything off with.)Amenities were great. In room safe and fridge. Coffee and tea with electric kettle. HD TV with all major Japanese TV stations. WiFi was easy to connect and fast.Overall, I was pleased and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here five nights and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and able to help us with all our needs and questions. Nice breakfast. The hotel is very clean and modern and we had a great view from our corner room. The area near the hotel has almost everything you need including a historical shrine to explore. Various train stations were only a few blocks away with direct service to both airports.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I recently stayed here on a layover coming back to the States from Bangkok. Great location in Asakusa, close to the Kaminarimon Gate and several metro options. The front desk staff was very friendly and English-speaking. The rooms were quiet and well-appointed. I loved the bath products provided. There was a lovely rooftop bar with a view of the Skytree and the surrounding city. The night we stayed, there was a meteor shower, and the staff provided hot chocolate in the lobby for guests to take up to the roof. Wonderful experience!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
