review_body: Big twin room good view. Excellent bathroom. Staff young friendly, modern style high rise with check in on 13th floor. Good neighborhood.Local tip across the street above JTB office is an excellent massage therapy clinic. Excellent shiatsu deep tissue massage from pro masseurs. No monkey business. 2 minutes away is a jazz club called the Hub with live music doing 3 sets per night huge selection of whiskies great ambience. Happy place not touristy at all. 13 floor restaurant in Gate hotel offers excellent lunch special!!Previous reviewer mentioned hassle walking with luggage from Asakusa station, this is not exagerated.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: this is a nice hotel, great location (nearby station, supermarket, viewpoint), cleanliness, and wonderful service, comfortable room and great bed, free wifi.if visiting Tokyo again, I would like to stay this hotel again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is near the asakusa train station, but if you are not familiar tokyo metro it can be confusing; especially when many locals do not speak English. If you want to get here by train, tell the station master or conductor asaskusa station. Also take note when changing lines there maybe fare adjustments.The staff at this hotel are very nice. The front desk understands and speaks english well. Even the maid service is ok with english. They all go out of their way to help you.The view from the lobby is great and even better from the roof top bar. No windows at the top so you get a clear shot of skytree.The room is large for japanese standards and very modern minimalist style. Bathroom is also very nice.There is the nearby karimon temple and skytree. Across the street there are 24 hour sushi places... so there is plenty of food.I would return to this hotel. Once you know the tokyo metro, it is very convenient to go anywhere within the city.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very friendly staff, good service ! We arrived in Tokyo at 5 ish in the morning and I requested for early check in but due to the hotel renovation the receptionist said its not possible. Therefore we went to the hotel to drop our luggage first and went to sightseeing straight after, we were so tired at around 12 ish and wanted to wait at the hotel, since the staff saw us waiting at the lobby they said they will try their best to give us a room ! After 30 mins they said check in is ready :) we were very surprised and impressed. The room is big and clean, didn't expect the room will be that big in Tokyo since the normal boutique hotel room should be very tiny ! Great stay, will definitely stay here again !

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The best hotel my fiance and I have ever stayed at! The room was had an amazing view of the city and I absolutely love their gadgets in the room! The room was incredibly clean and just perfect! We didn't eat at the restaurant there though, but the service was fantastic. You can ask for this and that and they will try and accommodate for you as best as they can. The staff can speak English which is great. We spent my fiance's bday in Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel is near train station and diagonally opposite Sensoji Temple. Suitated in a lovely, quiet typical neighbourhood, there is no lack of eateries around ranging from ramen to sushi. Diagonally opposite the water bus boarding area to Odaiba. There is a supermarket and pharmacy right downstairs, the supermarket also has ready to eat food and fresh fruits. The only "complain" is it's a pain to lug luggages from the underground station to the street level, there are so many flight of stairs and elevator is not available.Rooms are slightly small for the square area but it's cosy and comfortable. Love the armchair arrangement which you could sit down, enjoy breakfast in the room and see the Tokyo Skytree (if you book the scenic view room). Hot flask is available in the room so you could boil your own water.Shower facilities are good, love the bathtub for a good soak after a day shopping. Love the toiletries that are included especially the shower foam.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We have had several Japan trips and hotel stays in Tokyo...this would definitely be the top candidate for a repeat stay! The double twin room was clean, updated, comfortable, spacious, quiet, well-ventilated, great bathroom/shower/tub, free fast wifi, electronic safe, soft beds/pillows, great 12th floor views! Subway / Narita train (not express) within 5 minute easy walk. Didn't eat in the top-floor restaurant...there are too many great restaurant in the neighborhood, market downstairs, two 7-11s within two to 5 blocks, fast food (McD, Mos, BK) near if you're into that(?).   The Gate Hotel is almost across the street from the start of the market street leading to Sensoji Temple, and the area is comprised of "old Tokyo" style buildings/neighborhood filled with shops and small restaurants that locals queue up for before opening (message me if you'd like the names) !! Rail access to the rest of Tokyo is easy. All this, and significant savings over Shinagawa Prince Hotel and The Gate was a nicer room and more interesting surroundings in this Asakusa area. Can't wait to go back...unless you all keep The Gate full and cause the price to go too high!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: After a week of skiing The Gate Hotel was easily accessible from the Nagano region. Shinkansen to Ueno then only a few stops to Asakusa and a five minute walk to the hotel. Check in and restaurant and bar is on the top floor, fantastic views of Tokyo with the Skytree close by. Western beds were comfortable and a deep bath helped with the stiff ski muscles. Breakfast was delicious and inexpensive and we also had a nice dinner and spent some time in the evening at the busy bar. The area is great to explore with a beautiful temple and gardens across the road and lots of interesting alleys and restaurants. On departure there was a lift down to the train (good with luggage) with direct trains to both. Narita and Haneda airports. Narita about 1 hour away.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Fantastic experience!!So amazing view and service!!SKYTREE is just outside the window!!It is so amazing that I can accompany by the SKYTREE everyday just beside my bed and sleeping.Not only the view,but the service and design in the room are so wonderful and comfortable.Also the manner of the waiters is such excellent.I pretty sure I would come back visiting again!!!!!!!!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Conveniently located near the Asakusa train station and right across from the entrance to the Kaminarimon Gate! We had a pleasant stay in the spacious room with two super single beds. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and the local grocery store next door was a plus! Would definitely recommend this hotel if you're planning to spend time in this neighborhood.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great service provided by staff in a hotel in the centre of a tourist area...near Sensoji temple and the shopping street Nakamise where there are oodles of souvenirs. The rooms were modern, clean and the bedding luxurious. We had booked an Essential twin room for our boys and a Scenic twin room for ourselves. The view from our room of the temple and the Skytower were brilliant and the location to metro and JR lines was great. Breakfast was provided with our room and fantastic...organic vegetables and freshly squeezed orange juice served by friendly wait-staff. Overall I would definitely stay here again as it was superb!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: friendly staff and asakusa's slow living style are the key reason that makes me consider the gate hotel once again. Also, lobby locate in 13 floor for me will be an another consider reason to choose this hotel. That makes me feel free to enter this hotel anytime because usually japan's hotel's staff will bow to you every time when they see you and that is really annoying . Anyway, i will recommend those people who emphasize on people-oriented,and slow travel to stay in this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is our first time in Tokyo and I love this area!The hotel is next to temple, quiet, slow pace and not so buzz like shibuya or shinjuku. Room space is enough to fit two persons. The pillow is so soft while the bathroom is totally separated from wet and dry area.Currency exchange and ATM are at the corner of the hotel. Easy access to/from airport with only one hop by airport express from NaritaWhat I personally impress the most are - View of Sky Tree tower from the roof top- A walking distance to Airport Express Station- Never dry up of Shampoo and Shower Gel Up:- Great location near tourist spot, about 200 meter from Asakusa metro station.- Brilliant view to sky tree tower- Bird eye view to Sensoji temple form my room (902)- Quiet even though it reside next to street- Room is modern style and well function oriented.- Variety choice of TV program and internet music radio with good quality- Plenty of amenities; big bottles of shower gel and shampoo, tooth brush with different color which avoid mixed with your roommate- Free sleeping dress- Auto Flushing Toilet Seat with controller on the wall- Prompt service- Reception on top floor (some time I feel awkward when I bought many stuff from convenient store and walk through the reception desk)- Staff speak well English- Free WiFi but not great speed.Down:- No lotion, why not I am not sure, lotion is necessary for dry weather like Japan- No free drinking water- Breakfast is not variety and too expensive for this price may be the price including the view from roof top- Not much English channel for TV
user_name:
Paul H
Riyadh, Ar Riyad, Saudi Arabia

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Located right in front of the famous Asakusa Gate .... lots of foods around ... on the 13th floor you can see the Sky Tree tower ... the highest tower in the World ... easy to access to everywhere as subways are located nearby ... very recommended place to stay when you are in Tokyo ...

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The designers of this place have gone to a bit more trouble than most; it's got a really pleasant decor and feels a little more comfortable than your typical hotel. Oddly, the bed in our room was far bigger than a king (two beds pushed together), which made for great sleeping, albeit at the expense of floor space – my side of the bed had no room for a bedside table. As a drinker I valued the vending machines (there's one on each floor). You could get a 500mL can of beer for 400 Yen ($4 AUD) – so much more civilised than paying minibar prices. It's in a beautiful part of town too, across the road from the shrine, markets and river. The Sky Tree is 20 minutes walk away.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed here for two nights before we had to move hotels due to lack of holiday availability. Our trip went downhill as soon as we left The Gate, because the Gate and its location were so fantastic. First, it was super easy to find coming straight from Narita (one train, maybe 2 blocks of walking). Second, Asakusa is one of my favorite parts of Tokyo. You have to see Shinjuku, Ginza and Roppongi, but how nice is it to come back to a little swank in slower, old-world Asakusa? We spent a couple days just wandering the alleyways here, finding friendly restaurants, bars, coffeehouses and shrines. The aforementioned train stop connects you with Ginza & Tsukiji fish market in 10 minutes. The bar at the top is a little jewelbox and the view was gorgeous. We had a Hollywood twin and the size of the room was fine compared to other Tokyo hotels. Go!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location, service and comfort. Staff efficient. Food great.  Close to restaurants trains shopping and shrine.  Staff efficient. Restaurant was able to meet special dietary requirements.  Staff understood and spoke good English. Very comfortable stay

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: It's a modern hotel located close to Asakusa subway station (5 min walk). The rooms are clean and comfortable, big enough (according with Tokyo standards) and well equipped, while the staff is attentive and friendly.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel was a wonderful place to base our Tokyo visit. Asakasu is a charming neighborhood and the hotel is just steps from the Senso-ji shrine and lots of shops and restaurants. The view from the lobby is fantastic. The rooms were lovely, the beds super comfortable and the hotel staff very friendly. The food and service in the restaurant was excellent. We would definitely come back and would recommend this hotel to others!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I felt I had to give this a 3 star review due to cost performance - for the prices asked for this place a customer should expect much more. Good PointsLocation, location, location - outstanding. Within a stones throw of Sensoji Temple (one of Tokyo's main sites) and the whole traditional area surrounding it with all the little bars and restaurants. Also, on the Ginza subway line to Ginza - Omotesando - Shibuya and the water bus down the river to Odaiba. Quiet - we heard no noise the whole of our stay and we were on the 4th floor overlooking the main road. Clean, comfortable, modern rooms with big beds. CommentExpensive for the total lack of facilities - there is a great view and a bar with a great view. Nothing else in the whole hotel. Breakfast - for ¥2,100 it should be an awesome breakfast. I wouldn't know because that is more than you would normally spend on dinner as a tourist. The is a Starbucks (left from the entrance) and a Denny's (right from the entrance). Free Wi-fi - does not seem to cope well with the demand - my iPhone 4G was much faster.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I chose the "Essential" Room. It was surprisingly large for a Tokyo Hotel Room without being expensive. The bathroom was huge, with a walk-in shower and soaking tube. The Hotel Staff are welcoming and always helpful. The Balcony Bar on the top floor has an incredible view of the Tokyo Skytree. Within a few minutes walk of Kaminarmon / Sensoji Temple, Kappabashi-dori, great Restaurants of all types and two Subway Lines; the Gate Hotel will be my place to stay whenever I am in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Enter the lobby of the Gate Hotel and you can't help but exclaim, "Wow." The view--from the futuristic towers and ancient shrines--to the sleek 24/7 bar would not be out of place for a hotel at twice the price. And while visitors often swarm to the newer, Western part of Tokyo, we absolutely loved the eastern, older part of the city--close to "Sumo town," where we saw a sumo wrestling practice and the older, wooden structures that hearken back to a pre-war city. Breakfast at the hotel was terrific, too--not cheap, but again, worth it for the fabulous view. We had a "classy," room which came with a split of Champagne and chocolate every night--it felt like a honeymoon all over again. Gorgeous bathroom (again, views from the shower) with the requisite high tech Japanese toilet. This hotel is a bit of a splurge, but totally worth it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is centrally located in the Asakusa area and close to many attractions. The restaurant had a nice fresh salad but was pricey. The room was very clean, quiet but somewhat small. There was too much furniture In the room that made it feel more cramped. The staff was very helpful and polite. Loved the pajamas and the bed was comfortable!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate is conveniently located - supermarket next door (which we went to everyday to stock-up on snacks and drinks), subway (Ginza & Asakusa) lines just 3 mins walk away, Senso-ji Temple diagonally opposite, many eateries (local, chinese, western) in the area. It's about 70-mins away from Narita Airport if you catch the Keisei-line's Sky Direct Access on designated timings bound for the airports (yes, even Haneda Airport) - the fare is reasonably-priced at JPY1290 per adult. Deposited our 3 big luggage in the airport (as was stopping-over from USA) for JPY9300 for 5 days - it's a wise choice as the subways have a lot of staircases which made carrying luggage a big challenge). Found a tax-free shop nearby on our day of departure, so many things (food, toiletries, cosmetics) to buy there yet not enough time. Very importantly, The Gate is the only hotel that I've come across so far with a generous supply of toiletries - face wash, hand wash and big bottles of hair shampoo, conditioner and body wash - I wouldn't have carried my heavy toiletries bag if I had known about this. The room is decently-sized for our family of 2 adults and 2 children, with a standing shower and a bath tub. (If only the door to the bathroom is tinted so that the basin and toilet seat area is free for my family members to use even if there's someone in the shower). Free Wi-Fi even in the hotel room as I know there are many hotels which grant access only in the lobby. We stayed on the 12th floor (the reception is on the 13th floor) and our hotel room has an awesome view of the Tokyo Skytree - day and night. I would love to stay in this hotel again definitely.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Me and hubby stayed at The Gate Hotel Asakusa for three nights. The hotel is easy accessible. The room size is acceptable and is well maintined. The staff is very helpful in answering enquires. Though the hotel price does not include breakfast it is easy to find a caffe which provides breakfast at a reasonable price. We went to Shinjuku to do some shopping and it took abourt 45 min there by train.It is a good experence staying in this hotel, will certainly consider this hotel again for our next trip.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is located in Asakusa which can be reached from Narita Airport on the Keisei Acess Express train. Exit at A4 and walk down the street upon reaching the junction, turn left and walk on for about 3 minutes and you'll reach the hotel. The tokyo metro subway station is also very close to the hotel which will get you to Ginza, Shibuya and Ueno, where you can change to the JR lines or catch the Shinkansen.The rooms are not very large but big enough for 2 adults. Wifi is complimentary. The bathroom is well equipped with all the amenities you need. Breakfast is great with 3 selections for mains and an organic salad buffet and the freshly squeezed orange juice is a favorite of mine. The hotel lobby and rooftop bar has beautiful views of the Tokyo sky tree and Senso ji temple.I really love the neighborhood of Asakusa, it's not as crowded as Shinjuku or Shibuya and you can take leisurely strolls. There are lots of good grilled eel and tempura restaurants around the hotel and a great red bean pastry snack shop one block away from the hotel. Best part of all, if you don't like the day crowd at Senso ji (which is diagonally across the hotel) you can visit it at night and take photos of it and your pictures will be like those on the postcards (as in without people).Another plus point of the hotel is the supermarket right next door where you can get lovely japanese grown strawberries, persimmons, apples and mandarins and your supply of drinking water. I cannot complement the hotel anymore with its friendly staff and atmosphere. It's definitely value for money and worth every yen. If I'm force to make a complaint, it would be that there is no free English channel on TV.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room is quite nice,clean and beautiful! We can see Tokyo Sky Tree from our living room and bathroom.The location is very good,you can walk to Sensoji temple,shopping mall,etc.The subway is not far from the hotel.You should visit their "Terrace" It has a very nice view.I would recommend this hotel to everyone.Oh one bad thing I don't like is the smell of the entrance...It's a strong smell of some cleaning agent they use.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We enjoyed our stay a lot. We only visited the area and then left to narita so it was very convenient. The subway and train station is very close by. We had a view of Sensoji temple. Staff was very efficient and attentive. The room was nice and big considering the others we stayed in at Tokyo. Bathtub was great and amenities very relaxing.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is set in Asakusa which is a pretty, 'old' Tokyo - no skyscrapers, no big businesses, no overwhelming traffic. Many amazing sights are just a short walk away including several temples and the Skytree. There's a train coming to Asakusa straight from Narita which is a lot cheaper than taking NEX to Tokyo Station and then underground/taxi.Hotel room is cozy with a luxurious bathroom, many free goodies (cosmetics, razors, shampoo, combs, pyjamas, coffee, tea, you name it!), good room service, amazing staff. Hotel has a beautiful bar terrace with amazing night views which we visited as the hotel informed us about asteroid showers on the night we arrived! We thought this was very thoughtful and charming and we even got free hot chocolate. I'd definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great sky tree view from Hotel lobby, very helpful English-speaking staff. Super market just down floor and a lot of great restaurant nearby until midnight. We had a great experience to enjoy the traditional Japan culture in Asakusa and THE GATE HOTEL is the best choice for stay.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great hotel in every aspect except its location. We recieved kind service from the staff and our room had comfortable beds, great standard and the view was great. The breakfast was of top quality. Not as big in variety as you sometimes meet but the quality in what they had succeeded our expectations. The restaurant seemed popular however we only tried dessert. Amazing view from the lobby and restaurant. On the top floor there is a terrace and a bar exclusively for guests with company. It was really great. Unfortunately we felt that the location was a bit off. But if you wont spend much time around Shinjuku/Shibuya it is definitively a good choice and a great value.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved everything! The view, the staff, the beds, the size of the rooms was amazing for Japan, and the bar upstairs compares to nothing else around! Have stayed twice and would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very excellent hotel to asakusa, may be the best one.Very good price for tokyo, the break fast was excellent too. Very good view from the lobby. Nice and very confortable room. Excellent location, just 2' from the subway

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel was clean, modern, and comfortable! We enjoyed the window-side chaise and large bathroom in our Hollywood Twin. Only one of the beds had a side table though, so one of us had to store our book and glasses on the floor under the bed at night.The staff was really friendly and helpful. The location was really good too - 5 minute walk from the subway and from the Senso-Ji shrine. The restaurant in the hotel is expensive (and, based on the one slice of cake I tried, not worth the price) but there are tons of restaurants around, plus there was a small supermarket on one side of the hotel and Starbucks on the other.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is a find for your vacation in Tokyo: in walking distance to the Skytree, Asakusa station and train station to Haneda. Kaminarimon gate is just on the other side of the street and leads you directly to Sensoji temple. From the roof terrace we were lucky not only to see Tokyo's skyline but also Mt. Fuji clearly which is about 100km away.You will find modern furnished rooms, not that big, but spotless clean and all amenities you expect incl. separated toilette and shower. Staff at the desk as in the bar/restaurant was attentive, supportive and very friendly. Bar and lobby come with a stylish interior and spectacular views to the Skytree tower especially at night. However, during the peak times at breakfast/dinner it was obvious that the number of tables is not sufficient to cope the demand of the hotel guests. Also considering that this is only a 3,5 star hotel the breakfast choice is limited and offer does not change.Nevertheless for Tokyo and its expensive hotels this is a very good alternative. If coming to Tokyo again we would return.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Took our very first trip to Tokyo, and while we fumbled around the city for a week struggling with the language barrier and a complete inability to find things, the one thing that we NAILED was our choice of hotel. We decided to spend a little more so that our base would be comfortable, and it was terrific. OK, so I wish there were staff members more fluent in English, and yes, I couldn't figure out the Japanese toilet (so many buttons, really?). But we were so happy with the room itself with its amazing view from the 12th floor. Fantastic shower and bath, bed was comfortable, and plenty of room to move around (which was important to us). The in-room espresso maker was great. The location of this hotel could not have been better. Such amazing little local restaurants surrounding the hotel, right on key subway lines, and that ever important 7-11 a block away. Loved morning runs along the river a few blocks away. Even did a day trip to Nikko with the Tobu train leaving from the station a few blocks away. The market and shrine at Senjo-ji is right there, which always gave us some quick entertainment if we wanted to get out of the hotel for a little bit. For the Americans reading this -- it's a great choice. It's 100% manageable without feeling like you're in an American hotel, and you get an area of Tokyo with character AND convenience. You get to Ginza and Shibuya on one subway line (easy). Ueno is walking distance or three subway stops away. The hotel bar and the restaurant were super easy each morning and evening for us, before and after our tourist adventures. Internet was dependable and robust. We never heard another guest. LGBT cordial (no problems at all).

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Apart from its great location the hotel is great to stay at. The rooms are large (compared to other Japanese hotels) and very quiet. The rooftop terrace is great for an evening drink even on a cool Autumn night. The breakfast is very well presented and not your normal buffet fare and the service is excellent.I will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The best thing about this hotel is the staff and their keenness to help. The receptionists ALWAYS went out of their way to provide any information or help we needed. When we checked out of the hotel, the receptionist ran down to the outside pavement to ensure that our taxi driver would leave us at the correct part of the humongous Tokyo station for the bullet train. Another receptionist tried tirelessly to get us a last minute booking at some top Michelin star restaurants. She had the patience of a saint and was very courteous when we changed our mind at the last minute about a restaurant for which she had taken great pains and several phone calls to find us a tableWhen we would go up to enjoy the lovely terrace on the top floor of the hotel with its stunning view, the waiter would offer us blankets against the slight night chill. Without being asked he would provide us with linen and cutlery to eat the fruit we had brought along us.The common areas like the aforementioned terrace, the restaurant and the reception were chic and trendy. The bedrooms' styling was a little less successful. We had rented two rooms- a larger twin and a doubled bedded room. Both were a little small, but i suppose that just reflects the lack of space in crowded Tokyo. What I also cared less for was the dark colour of the rooms which made already smallish rooms feel a bit cramped. Having said that, the beds were very comfortable and I liked the thick cotton pyjamas provided. I also found the toiletries of high quality and chic like the hotel. They were certainly much better than the mass market shampoos, lotions and soaps we found at the far more expensive Imperial Hotel we stayed at on our return to Tokyo after a trip elsewhere in the country.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Paid an outrageous price to stay here because it had gotten excellent reviews and all other hotels in Tokyo were booked. Expected a luxurious stay to match the price. Maybe it's because I'm from San Francisco that I didn't find the hotel "cool" (which they were obviously trying to be). Sleeping in an all-black room didn't excite me. First of all, maybe it was my fault but when I arrived at 5:50, I was told that I should hurry and register as there was only 10 minutes left for the happy hour. The staff person pointed to a paper that said there was wine and non-alcoholic drinks during happy hour on the terrace. And the drinks had a "value" of approximately $5. In the U.S., when something says there's a "value" of some amount, that means you're getting a bargain and not paying the full "value" amount. So, as he instructed, I rushed up to the terrace. Since I don't drink, I asked for a non-alcoholic drink and what they had (and what I was served) was a half glass of orange juice (from concentrate, not fresh). In Japan, apparently "value" means something different because I was handed a bill for approximately $5. Again, maybe my fault.Second (and more importantly), aLthough I had been too warm in many of the small rooms in Japan hotels, I was SO cold in this one. Called the front desk to ask for help with the A/C controls and a woman came up with wool blankets (apparently I wasn't the first to complain). She looked at the A/C controls and said "apparently this hotel doesn't have heat". The problem was that even in th "off" position, the A/C was continuing to run. Could only get warm enough by getting into bed with the wool blankets.The next morning I asked to stay 2 extra hours ( there's a roughly $20 charge to stay 2 hours past the 11:00 check out time) at no charge because it had been so cold the night before. The front desk women apparently thought that was the funniest thing they'd ever heard because each one explained (in Japanese) to the one beside her what my request was while laughing hysterically. Fortunately, someone said they'd ask the manager and within minutes, returned to tell me that was fine.It was a bad experience all around and I will never stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We resided in the Scenic Twin (9th floor) and the view is great! You may see how the Skytree turns off its light in 23:00. In addition, there is a supermarket and a drug store just in its 1st floor and there are various restaurants in nearby area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. From the heated bathroom tiles and toilet seat, to the amazing views over breakfast and the great staff. A classy hotel with tasteful design clearly a major consideration. My room was very spacious, comfy bed, very clean and I could have spent hours in the bathroom. There's free wifi, a rooftop bar and breakfast is delicious, especially the homemade marmalade. Asakusa station is across the road, as is Sensoji Temple and Nakamise-dori street (for all sorts of souvenirs). Kappabashi (kitchen street) is a short stroll away. Despite being on a major road, you can't hear a sound from the bedrooms. The train to Nikko leaves from here so it's convenient. The Flying Tiger Gyoza Hall is a short walk on the same side of the street, which is a cheap and nice place to eat dumplings in Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Individual visitors is very convenient,Convenient transportation,Near attractions,Service cordial.Great room space and widePenthouse may lookout distance, counter communication convenience.The whole is worth recommending and again stay hotel is located in downtown Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Had a very pleasant 4 night stay here. The hotel is very modern. The reception and restaurant are on the 13th floor with beautiful views across Tokyo - there is also a bar with an outside terrace on the 14th - again with spectacular view. The rooms are on the the 3rd to 12th floors and are very well equipped (especially the bathroom) and are large by Japanese standards. Service was very good and friendly. Breakfast is a buffet with a choice of 3 cooked dishes. The buffet is excellent but the cooked plates disappointing - scrambled eggs very dry and bacon tasteless. The hotel is well located for public transport - easy access from Narita and subway station 50 metres away. The one downside is the choice of restaurants in Asakusa - ended up going to Ginza, Roppongi etc to eat in the evening. However overall a very good hotel which I fully recommend.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed one night. Great location in asakusa and great hotel. Bar and restaurant were nice but so many excellent places to eat within walking distance. Subway access also very convenient. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We spent 2 nights here at the tail end of our trip to Japan, before flying out of Haneda airport. We were impressed by the lobby which has stunning views and by the roof top bar. We took advantage of the happy hour and dusk light to take photos of the quirky skyline including the sky tree.The bedroom was large and modern, very clean with nice touches like pyjamas. The bed was incredibly comfy. The bathroom was the largest one we experienced in Japan and came with lots of high end toiletries and the obligatory multi-functional toilet seat. Tea & coffee making facilities were good. I'm glad we slept in Japanese style rooms the rest of the trip as although very nice it didn't feel very different to some places I've stayed elsewhere. However we slept well and enjoyed the view. The location is good - being further out of town stops it being prohibitively expensive but the metro was very close. There are lots of good bars within walking distance and a cat café at the end of the street! You are also near Tokyo's most notable shrine with a fantastic street for souvenirs. It was easy to get the Airport express direct from the nearby metro to Haneda airport, it didn't take long so it felt like a good base for that reason.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good quiet location. Modern hotel. Close to subway and some attraction. Breakfast was excellent. Room small but really new. Good service. We stayed at another hotel in Tokyo and prefer this one. Not only tourist...

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Positives - location great (for old town), room , bed, bathroom great. (stayed on 10th floor) Breakfast buffet limited - mainly salad buffet with choice of eggs - scrambled or Benedict. Main bar/restaurant needs work, food menu disasterous, like properly disasterous, cocktail list dated circa 1980.Worst part of this hotel for me, 'exclusive' bar on 14th floor (exclusive as in only for guests) with views of Asahi tower and skytree, looks nice, small but nice, but a cover charge of 1000yen per person/hr! For hotel guests? Just for the view?Last week we went to Park Hyatt bar and restaurant, few drinks in their bar fantastic city views, jazz bar, big beautiful bar, cover charge sure from 7 or 8pm.. but for NON GUESTS (with all the entertainment and venue worth the cover charge) People staying in the Hyatt however - FOC as you would expect.Frankly disgusted by this, spoilt our 3 night stay in this hotel, essentially with cover charge and poor restaurant menu you will not want to hang out in hotel of an evening, even before going in search of food (after flicking through dodgy restaurant menu)

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location 3 blocks fm. the Asakusa station, Ginza Line a little past the Kaminari Gate in the center of the destination of Asakusa. Great restaurant choices go on for blocks and blocks with an excellent variety of cuisines. All sort of shopping in the area, a good grocery store under a corner of the hotel, Nakamise and Shin-Nakamise arcades/streets cater to tourists and locals across the street; many small interesting shops throughout this area so there appears to be something for everyone.The hotel is has very stylish contemporary decorated rooms, comfortable mattresses, pillows, and a great bathroom. Best part is the registration is on the top floor (14th I believe) and a stairway leads up to a small bar and outdoor terrace that overlooks the Temple and the Skytree across the river.I enjoyed my stay in a very comfortable superior double room

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I, my son and my niece arrived with a humungous amount of luggage, only to find that there was no bell boy and that reception was on the thirteenth floor. We hauled everything into the lift and I was beginning to think I had made a big mistake. This is not what you want after a long flight with no sleep.However, Reception was modern, with amazing views and very nice staff. We were taken to our rooms and helped with the luggage. We had interconnecting rooms which was a nice touch. The rooms were a good size for Tokyo hotels and well-equipped, if a little shabby in places. We were confronted with our first sight of all-singing, all-dancing Japanese loos. Actually, they probably did sing and dance for all we knew. Didn't have a clue what most of the features were but lived in terror of the fountain! We had a super lunch on the outside terrace of the hotel restaurant. Excellent food and ridiculously cheap. Five pounds a head. Very elegant setting, great service. An amazing price. Dinner for the three of us the next night, when we ate ourselves to a stanstill, was only 45 pounds. I would certainly recommend the restaurant, even if you are not staying in the hotel. Plus, for the smokers among you, you can smoke. And for the non-smokers, like my son and niece, that is not a problem. They must have very efficient air-filtering.The roof terrace is super. Blankets were provided at night, just in case it were a little chilly. Views of both modern Tokyo and old. The Kaminarimon, Shinto shrine is just a minute or so from the hotel. I had coffee in the early mornings on the terrace. On one occasion, it was a present from the maitre de of the restaurant. So kind.The hotel is in a slightly older part of Tokyo, which we had wanted. It is very close to the metro and there is an excellent supermarket nearby. Also Starbucks next door.Each room cost us just over a hundred pounds a night. That's the sort of price you might pay for a hostel. Believe me, this is not that. It is five star luxury and service. Save for the arrival point and tiny details in the room that needed refurbishing. I will certainly go back there.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We only had one night in Tokyo and this was the best way to spend it. Great location close to good food and markets. Only a 3 minute walk from the Asakusa metro station. Loved the rooftop patio and bar with the view of the sky tree tower. The rooms were very nice and the bathroom had a nice rainshower. They even supplied pajamas. The staff there were very knowledgeable and friendly. Specifically the hotel clerk Shiori was extremely helpful she even carried are overweight backpacks.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room is very good for our family trip.It is also very convenient for us with a baby travelling from Narita airport to the hotel.There are supermarket, drug store and starbucks nearby the hotel.In addition, you can enjoy the view with skytree during your stay in Tokyo.I will recommend this hotel and it will be my top choice to stay!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Slept three nights here. Dark smart designed twin room at L10 with Nespresso machine. Beds firm. Small deep bath, good rainshower. Nice view of Sky Tree tower. Opening a window is not possible. Bummer that MacBook Air didn't fit in the safebox.Splendid rooftopbar and terrace with great view and happy hour starting at 3 PM! Great cocktails in the bar near the restaurant. Here terrace too.Asakusa nice area. Senso Ji shrine with market leading to it. Subway entrance close for exploring Tokyo-south and midtown. Awesome tempura restaurant across the street. Supermarket next door. Staff is young and kind. Quick check-in. One of the best hotels during a 4 week visit (9 hotels) to Japan. Recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Two amenities in each were very good, but the bathroom in thr two rooms two single guests First night twin share too small. Great for single travellerWe decided to stay extra night, and only suite available, about ¥5000 for extra night each, but worth it for the spacious design.  The amenities in each were very good, but the bathroom in the twin rooms was so well set out. Wanted one in my house. First night twin share too small. Great for single traveller. Second night suite room with balcony on the 3rd floor. Excellent. I'd only stay here in a suite of travelling with someone else in future due to the pokey twin bedroom. Having separate lounge and lobby area was a treat in the suite. Each room had beautiful décor and the most comfortable beds I loved staying at the gate. If you don't have a breakfast inclusive rate, the buffet, quirky and tasty at ¥1100 was a bargain. Second night suite room with balcony 3rd floor. Excellent. I'd only stay here in a suite in future due to the pokey bedroom. the twin was so well set out. Having separate lounge and lobby area was a treat. I loved staying at the gate. If you don't have a breakfast inclusive rate, the buffet, quirky and tasty at ¥1100 was a bargain. The snebit

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very nice and convenient hotel. Everything you need, but no unnecessary luxury. The location is super. Lovely roof top bar.The room was comfortable, but a bit dark. Mine (712) had a boring view. x01-x10 would have been much better. I really liked to get a comfy pyjamas. Breakfast had high quality but nota lot of choices and the french toast was strange.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and I am writing this review at the end of a more than 3 week Japan trip, where we stayed in 10 different hotels.This hotel is modern and pleasant. Very good views (we could see Mt. Fuji beautifully on clear days) and excellently located for one of the best Temple districts in Tokyo. Absolutely loads of eating places ranging from tourist focussed to those suitable for locals that our Japanese friends took us too. Excellent Iron Grill steak house (Wagyu beef) just up the road too. Subways are a right at hand and it is only 20 minutes to the incredible fish market (a must see). Within 7 minutes walk is the district that sells kitchen knives - so for those hunting for high end Japanese cutlery this is the other place to go apart from the fish market. Reverting to the hotel itself, the rooms are modestly sized, but comfortable, quite, have great views and good bathrooms (not the dreaded plastic shower curtains that some western style hotels have - an instant sign of low quality!). Tokyo is massive so and wherever you are located you will need to use either subway or taxi. Having stayed in various locations in Tokyo, we would certainly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Love this hotel. It's in the heart of Asakusa. We have a Hollywood Twin but quite big and very comfortable. Superb views over Tokyo and lots of great places to see and eat very close by. Staff speak excellent English. Buffet breakfast means continental and only $10 for fresh orange juice, cereal, assorted organic vegetable dishes, fruit bread and croissants and unlimited tea (even earl grey!) or good coffee with very helpful friendly staff and that view! Having a great time exploring nearby....and will venture further afield in next few days...staying 5 nights. Hope it will be enough! Easy access to other areas as station is close by. We were a little nervous about catching the train from Narita and changing at Aota at night as direct train only goes until 4 but it was very easy and we found the hotel without difficulty. Directions on website are good. Asakusa is a lovely safe area near the Sumida River. It is a tourist area but mainly Japanese people everywhere. Delicious food in unique tiny restaurants...very friendly pele.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: A very modern and cosy hotel very quite in this busy city.Just next to the subway and just across the very nice neighberhood of Asakusa.Beautiful view from the rooftopbar.We definitly would recommand it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is very close to Sensō-ji and subway station with hourly direct train to Narita Airport. It's also close to Tobu line Asakusa station. We used this hotel as a base for our 2D1N trip to Nikko.Staff are also very friendly and helpful. Definitely a great choice to stay in this district.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We checked in late to this hotel and unexpectantly received a complimentary upgrade. They were friendly and welcoming. We ate in he restaurant hotel which was delicious food. The room itself was large and had an amazing view of the telecoms tower both during the day and night. The breakfast is served in the restaurant area and you have the option of sitting on the balcony with great views of Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. We booked a "scenic" room and had a lovely view of the Tokyo Sky Tree. The room was very clean and modern. Not only did it come with every toiletry imaginable but there were also clean pajamas laid out for us every night. We really enjoyed the daily happy hour on the 14th floor. It had an amazing view and 500¥ glasses of sparkling wine, wine and beer. The hotel front desk staff were extremely helpful in answering our questions about transportation and booking restaurant reservations for us. The service was first rate! The hotel is located 1.5 blocks away from the Sensoji temple and 3-5 min walk to the Asakusa stations on the Ginza and Asakusa lines. It is very convenient getting around Tokyo from here. I do not hesitate to recommend this hotel at all.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel was chosen by my travel agent and so I hadn't a clue about it or where in Tokyo it is.But it's a great find and I would really recommend it - very stylish,modern room and a great restaurant and bar on the 13th floor. The area is low rise and interesting with lots of restaurants and good transport links.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I booked in here based on its high ranking here on TripAdvisor. I was expecting to be blown away. But I really wasn't. Sure, the views are nice, but the very top floor with the bar which is "for guests only" included a cover charge of 1000yen. I thought this was a bit cheeky. The room was nice and comfortable and check out was 11am which is a big plus in Japan! Usually it is 10am, so the lie on was appreciated. However, I couldn't help but feel miffed at that cover charge! It was an ok hotel, I don't think it deserves such a high ranking. If you get a good deal and want to visit this area, it is a good choice for a night. I wouldn't base myself here much longer though. I was also given a card as I stood a the lift to leave to ask if I had enjoyed my stay if I could review on TripAdvisor. I always review anyway, I just felt this was a little pushy...maybe this is how they get so many great reviews.Don't get me wrong, the hotel is fine. I just didn't see that 5-circle quality). It just didn't blow me away. Get rid of that cover charge and I'd give it 4. I would have also spent more in the hotel on drinks up on the rooftop bar. As it was, we left the hotel and went elsewhere for our food and beer.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were lucky enough to stay here on our recent trip to Tokyo and loved this hotel. We emailed them in advance to let them know we were travelling for our honeymoon and they emailed us and offered us an upgrade and left a few welcome presents in our room. The staff is wonderful and highly accommodating to guests. The hotel is a 1-2 minute walk from Asakusa station which is connected to 2 subway lines and you can easily travel to Shibuya station in about 35 minutes. The Asakusa area itself is not centrally located but has lots of shops and restaurants to keep one entertained and occupied! I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: All the staffs were all very nice and can speak English. The room is clean and cozy. The love the most is the location of the hotel. You definitely need to go to the rooftop!! The view is great! Can take photos with sky tree easily! Metro station is near, next door is pharmacy and supermarket is at the ground floor.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: You couldnt ask for a better location. Its right next to the subways, and a 15 min walk away to tokyo skytree. Its also right next to senogi temple, which is a bid tourist site. Their are plenty of shops and restarunts nearby so you cant go wrong. The Ueno train station is also walking distance, and you can literally get a breathtaking view from the 13th floor of the hotel. The rooms are very nice, bathroom and showers emaculate and clean. The rooms have nice design, and are excellent for city travellers. The staff are excellent, good at english and very helpful. You are in good hands at the gate hotel. Defenitly reccomended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Located in the not that touristy Asakusa area, with convenient access to the Narita airport. Lobby and bar have a great view over the city including the Senso-ji temple and the rather out of place Sky Tree. Hotel is priced above average, but rooms are impeccable. So you wouldn't expect a trainee receptionist to just laugh and make a copy of your passport anyway when you say that that's illegal in your resident country. Unfortunately that did happen (unlike other hotels in Japan). Pity. Other than that recomended if you are willing to spend a bit more.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very good modern hotel with reception on the 13th floor. One floor above you can enjoy the views of the city on the outside terrace. Rooms are well decorated and the bathroom is very nice; not the typical plastic cube you'll find in many business hotels but a spacious bathroom with nice modern tiles. I likes Asakusa (pronounce Asaksa) very much; it's a real city neighborhood with many restaurants, shops etc. around. The hotel is opposite the Senso-ji temple which is very touristic but the nice part is you can stroll around a beautiful lit temple in the evening when it gets quiet again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This Ultra modern hotel in the heart of asakusa is highly recommended both in terms of design & quality along with its central location in one of Tokyo's most popular tourist destinations. The roof terrace provides breathtaking views of the Tokyo skyline and the bedrooms are extremely spacious & comfortable, the only negative is the dozen or so light switches in the room! An excellent base for those who want to explore this truly amazing City.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room is clean and big enough for our family of four. The bathroom is great and very spacious with a door separating the bath area from the toilet. The front desk employees are very helpful and will even escort you to your room after check in. The area is very convenient and safe to walk around even at night. There's subway stations just a few minutes walk from the hotel and the popular Sensoji Temple is just across the street. In addition, there's a supermarket on the ground floor of the building. The price is really worth it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We spent four nights here during our recent trip to Japan. It was generally a good choice both in terms of the hotel itself and its location in Tokyo, although it couldn't be described as luxurious - however it represents good value in a very expensive city!The hotel is located just across the road from Kaminarimon Gate in the Asakusa region of Tokyo, and a few minutes walk from the nearest train and underground stations. Nowhere is truly "central" in Tokyo and this is as a good a place as any to base yourself in - this was our first time in Japan and we found it to be quite convenient. Reception is at the top of the building, which is quirky but works quite well. The lobby has a great area for sitting and admiring the view, and there's an outdoor rooftop area for doing the same. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but there are some shops and a Starbucks within a minute's walk. Our room (an "authentic Hollywood twin") was adequate for our needs albeit there wasn't a huge amount of room beyond the beds and other furniture in the room. The bathroom had a toilet and adjoining "wet room" with small bath and shower. See photos for a better idea. Overall this hotel was fine as a base within Tokyo, and it's a reasonable choice for a short, first-time trip or a quick business trip.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Loved staying at the Gate Hotel. Staff were welcoming and helpful. The room was great - great view, clean and comfortable - plenty of room even when the lounge was folded out to be a bed for our son. The restaurant has a good breakfast. The location is great - close to the station and among many restaurants etc. I would recommend this as a good base to stay in during your visit to Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed 3 nights with 2 children. The hotel was new, with modern and stylish design, and roof terrace, bar and restaurant with great views of Tokyo Sky Tree. Corner room was large by Tokyo standards (we were upgraded at check-in) with views of Kaminarimon, with a very smart bathroom including full bath. Service was excellent, with staff making restaurant bookings, looking up train schedules etc. Location is almost opposite Kaminarimon at Senso Ji, with supermarket downstairs, 711 (for ATM withdrawals with international cards), Starbucks and many restaurant options very close by. Asakusa and Ginza line train stations within 2 minutes walk (direct train service to Narita every 40 minutes from Asakusa station takes 1 hour). River ferry stop is 5 minutes walk away.We stayed in Ginza for 2 nights earlier in our trip, and enjoyed the low rise, neighbourhood feel of Asakusa. While it is far from areas like Shibuya and Shinjuku there is easy access by train and a completely different feel, with local residents as well as tourists. Great value for money. Recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed in corner room - fantastic view, nice designed , spacy, quiet. Great service reception-desk, fantastic breakfast - health-food & juice. Affordable dinner in great ambiente. And the best: Roof Top Bar - very romantic (and smokers paradise outside). Will come back soon.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved this comfortable place in the temple district Asakusa with the amazing view and canabsolutely recommend it! Its clean, cozyand offers a very good breakfast.Also the Rooftop Bar is a highlight.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We managed to get a direct train here from the airport. Think they were every 30mins otherwise you have to change. Good location, close to the metro, but also with enough to see in the area. The view from the terrace was amazing. Great amenities and included: hairbands, brushes, cotton buds, cotton pads, shaving kits and toothbrushes (I think from memory). The only quibbles would be that we had a smoking room and the smell was really obvious despite them assuring us it would be taken care of. That and the fact we couldn't check in any earlier than 1pm after arriving at 11am. However, these didn't detract too much from the experience. We liked this hotel! The service was good and they even gave us hotel branded bags when we needed them (nothing special just paper/card)!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great views, our room on the 10th floor had a view straight over to the Tokyo Skytree and over looking the Kaminimon Gate.The breakfast is limited but prepared with great care and service is superb. There is an excellent roof top terrace for drinks.Our room was modern, spacious and comfortable with a great shower room, can't think there could be a better hotel to stay in in Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location, views, room size (Japan standards are tiny for Americans), store, decor (it's boutique hotel no doubt), quietness (we were on the street side and could not hear a thing). Close to Metro, 12 minutes from the Skytree. TV has very few English channels, but who goes to Japan to watch tv? A bit pricey but worth it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Lovely hotel, great location in a very touristy part of Tokyo (if you are ok with touristy then it's great!). Close to a supermarket, pharmacy, Starbucks etc if you are not into a hotel breakfast (as a family of 5, breakfast from the supermarket and a Starbucks coffee is much cheaper and more practical than a hotel buffet)Cons are no laundry facilities, however, we got adjoining rooms so had access to 2 bathrooms; one of which became a mini laundry for 24 hours - we washed clothes in the bathtub and they dried on the line in the bathroom. Pros are the bed sizes - single beds are long enough for Western height!!!Very nice experience - would gladly recommend to families.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: PLACE/TIME: My partner and I had decided to seek accommodation the last 5 days in Japan in The Gate Hulic Hotel during September 2014, Summer time in Japan. The hotel is conveniently located, only being 2-3 minutes from the Asakusa line and 5-10 minutes to the Ginza and Keisei line to Narita airport. The tour spot of Sensoji also 2-3 minutes away and 5-10 minutes walk to the shopping strip. AMBIANCE: The actual building is very low profile. The exterior is in suave black and when you enter there is no one or nothing other than a ceiling of streaming water and 3 elevators. If I remember correctly, the check-in lobby is located on the 17th floor, where upon entry you are greeted into a simple yet opulent lobby complemented with a panoramic view of the Tokyo Tower. SERVICE: Upon check-in, it was standard and courteous. They requested payment before check-in, as informed on the email exchanges. When we arrived in our room I immediately found an anniversary greeting from the hotel which was unexpected. Both the room and the view was a complementing contrast, with an undisturbed view of the historical Sensoji temple and the chic bold modern interiors of the room. One notable interaction with the hotel staff was when I contacted front desk and requested for an ironing board and iron, in a matter of 5 to 10 minutes one of the ladies from the front desk arrived with the items. As this was towards the end of our Japan trip, I was still impressed with the consistency of efficient customer service. Service was pretty much seamless and placid in all the facets of services I encountered with the hotel. ROOM: If I recall correctly our room was on the 7th floor (Style E, Essential). Entering the room what I noticed foremost was the chlorine markings on the floor. At first, my immediate reaction was to request for a different room, then I noticed the welcoming anniversary letter and the beautiful view they have given us of the Sensoji temple and pagoda, and decided not to be a diva about it. The room is designed with dark wallpaper, juxtaposed with the colourful accented furniture and fixtures. Though not my personal preference, I found the room to fit its intended boutique modern feel. Please note they do not serve room service in the room and encourage people to go to their Bar & Restaurant upstairs. FOOD: As previously mentioned room service is not available in the rooms, they encourage guests to dine in the Bar & Restaurant upstairs. In the contemporary Gate Hulic Bar & Restaurant we chanced upon having breakfast the following day. Our arrival was warmly welcomed, from who I assume was the Supervisor or Manager, even if we had arrived close to the cut off time for breakfast. I also requested Matcha tea to which they did not usually serve according to the Supervisor/Manager, but found a way to realise my request.My partner and I also saw Starbucks situated beside the hotel, also there is a supermarket 2 minutes away, a family mart past the hotel, a burger place and several Japanese restaurants around, so you will not go hungry. Occasion: Ideal for business accommodation, couples, honeymooners, friends or groups that would like to experience boutique accommodation in a convenient location. UPSIDE:- You get what you paid for- View of Tokyo tower, Sensoji temple and pagoda- Location, close to 3 train stations (Asakusa line, Ginza line, and Keisei line to Narita airport) - Walking distance to shopping (specialty kitchen accessories)- Quiet locationDOWNSIDE:- If you have heavy luggages going by Keisei line to Narita airport it is not ideal as there are lots of stairs to the actual train. Catch a taxi if you can- it'll make your life easier. PRICING: For 5 night, for 2 adults we spent JPY95,287. That is approximately AU$994.608 in total, making that AU$198.92 per night. After booking Gate Hulic, I also came across the information that this hotel is recommended in the the Michelin guide. So I had very high expectations. After coming from the immaculate Shiraume also mentioned in the Michelin Guide, the chlorine marking on the carpet which I saw every time I came in and out the room was the deal breaker for me, I couldn't simply ignore it. Though for the price, the beautiful view they have given us and the convenient location they were situated in, it evened it out. I definitely wouldn't mind staying here again given the chance, the hotel is an ideal place to stay if you are celebrating a special occasion, don’t mind a smudge on the floor and want a fabulous boutique experience.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is my 5th trip to Tokyo and since I never had been to Asakusa before, I followed the Tripadvisor recommendations and book the Gate Hotel. Easy, direct access from Narita, Perfect location and great facilities. But what really stroke me was the service upon arrival. One month before this trip I had mentioned in an email to the hotel that I wanted to visit a local spa bath (onsen). When I checked in, I received a set of maps and precise descriptions of two Onsens, one basic, one high end, within 500m from the hotel. All material prepared beforehand - all accurate. Thumbs up!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Great location in the calmer area of Tokyo. Asakusa is a nice place, hotel is close to a local supermakert and also the Metro lines taking you anywhere you want to go. Direct line from Haneda Airport to Asakusa Station and than a couple fo minutes walk to the hotel. Nice view, verry clean.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel is approximately 2-3 years old. The entrance is narrow and unassuming, the elevators open up to a 13th floor reception area with glass walls and great views of the skytree and surrounding areas,in addition to a restaurant 24/7 with a semi enclosed terrace dining area and a 14th floor open roof lounge with views open to guests only. The reception personnel are very well mannered,respectful,helpful,friendly and speak English. I stayed solo in a room approximately 140 sq ft modern tasteful décor and for myself very functional. The bed was comfortable with quality bed sheets and covers,good HW temperature and pressure,the A/C worked fine,many electrical outlets,good lighting,free in room wifi which worked well and a free safe and mini fridge came in handy.The room was quiet I did not hear noise from adjoining rooms or public hall.Be advised the room did not have draws for clothes or a closet,only hangers with hooks on the wall.The housekeeping was on its "A" game ! The "Gate" is located approximately 2-3 blocks from the Ginza and Asakusa subway line.There is a supermarket on street level in addition to a starbucks and seven eleven 1-2 blocks away plus many sushi restaurants and eateries,senso ji temple and good shopping for high to low end goods are 2-3 blocks away,otherwise this area is quiet at night. This property is spot on,well run,very clean and modern with 5 star service.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed here for the final night of our honeymoon and were very kindly upgraded to a fantastic room with a brilliant view of the area. The staff left a lovely note and a handwritten fan in the room which was a thoughtful touch. The hotel is very modern and sleek and the pillows were incredibly comfortable- great sleep! There is a 500Y happy hour in the bar which also is glass fronted and provides city views. The rooftop terrace looked great but sadly we didnt have chance to make the most of it. I would recommend this lovely hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed 2 nights for our honeymoon. We were very kindly upgraded to a suite. The hotel has a really great location, very convenient with super nice little streets, shops, restaurants and temple. The design is very modern with a nice rooftop and the room are beautiful with very nice furnitures. The staff was really kind and helpful.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Excellent hotel in the quaint old school neighbourhood of Asakusa. Two blocks away from metro and JR stations. Superb views from Tokyo Skytree tower from its glorious rooftop bar. Stone throw distance from Kaminamiron gate and Senso-Ji beautiful temple. Great friendly service and unbeatable prices. I've stayed in three different hotels in Tokyo and this place cannot be beaten. If you can afford, get a room with a view of the Tokyo Skytree. It will definitely be worth it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Firstly I stayed here and this hotel very big and clean, attentive staff with good experiences. Amazing location and very comfort in the room. Dislike, can't forgot this place very much. Definitelly we will come back to good amazing tip top super hotel

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This Hotel was fantastic. Within walking distance with luggage from Asakusa train station. Right in the center of one of the "must see" sightseeing areas. The Sensoji Temple and Gate are one block away. The Sumida River Cruise commences here. Hotel Reception is onthe 13the floor which offers fantastic views. The terrace on the 14th floor offers Happy Hour from 3-5pm with drinks from $5 each. The dining room is open 24hrs. We had breakfast and dinner there most days. The Menu is small but the food presentation and quality was very good. Price for full breakfast Yen 21,000 and well worth it. Loved this Hotel!!!! We were able to visit most areas of interest by using the Asakusa Line or the Ginza Line trains.The Information Center is close by and can organize anything from sightseeing tours to advising the cost of taxi fares to various places of interest.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I very much enjoyed this hotel. The room was great. The location by temples, street markets, and shops was really good. It is right on the direct train line to both airports and very close to the stop. There are a great views of Tokyo from the roof and the restaurant.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I booked this hotel as it was one of only a very few in Tokyo I could see that could accomodate 3 people to a room. I am so glad we found it, as it was a fantastic place to stay. Staff were very helpful, when i asked for the location of a restaurant i thought may be nearby, they googled it, and printed a map for me with extra notes drawn on to make it extra simple for us to find.I was initially concerned that it was a bit out of the way from many of the places we planned on visiting, but it turned out to be a really great location. We visited Shinjuku, Shibuya, Imperial Palace and Hakone, all without feeling that we had too far to return in the evening.Best of all, there is a train direct from the airport to the station a couple of blocks from the hotel - even travelling with an elderly parent, it was easy to get around using just the regular metro system.Design and finish of the hotel is beautiful - a real oasis to return to in the evening, it had a very high quality boutique feel considering the price in such a great location.Very good value - i'd absolutely stay here again and recommend the same to others.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here in April with my husband on the final leg of a mini two week tour of Korea and Japan and this was the best hotel. The location (the main reason for my choosing) is perfect, the district is quite quiet for Japan but still with that buzz, right opposite the thunder god gate temple, two min walk to the subway and a direct train to the airport (don't bother with the express, you have to change and it's not that much quicker). The hotel is modern, quite new, with friendly and helpful staff, amazing views and the gorgeous breakfast is all home made (even the marmalade) with good choice and local produce. The room was large for Japan and very clean and comfortable. Great installations about the hotel too.
user_name:
Sharon_Chris_P
Welwyn Garden City, United Kingdom

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the gate hotel. The staff we're very friendly and helpful, the location was excellent foresight seeing and was moments away from the metro which was really handy. The view from the hotel is lovely as well especially when enjoying on glass of wine on their early bird special on the roof top terrace.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were in this hotel only one night ... not enough! The hotel is very nice and clean and the staff is fantastic. A very nice view is given from the top if the hotel. My room was large enough and the bath i fantastic with a nice view. Location is great.Only the wifi connections is not good enough.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room is super clean and the location is very convinient, easy to locate and near the subway station. A supermarket is just beside the hotel and many convinience shops around i.e. 7-11, Family Mart and etc. Skytree Tokyo can be reach within walking distance although it take quite some time for us to walk there but you may enjoy the beautiful scenery along the way. If you are lucky enough, your room view will be facing the skytree. It's an amazing staying experience for me.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I liked the quiet location of this hotel, you wont believe you are in a huge city. The subway is close by to get around the city. Try to get on a train to/from the airport that does not require changing. The bed had the most comfortable pillow I've ever slept on, in hotel or otherwise. The bathroom had a small stool and pail for a Japanese style wash. Nice bath products.The only major negative was that I asked the reception desk for suggestions for restaurants but they did not listen what I was looking for just gave me a map pre marked with restaurants across the street. Nothing wrong with these restaurants but nothing extra either.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. The hotel is in a great spot and close to the Tokyo subway. To get on the NARITA express you'll need 2 transfers though. The beds were very comfortable in this hotel and the showers are amazing. We had a nice view of the skytree from our room. Reception was nice and the view from the - overpriced- rooftop bar is excellent. The room itself was dusty. There was an air freshener in the room but every morning we'd wake up with an extremely dry mouth, nose and eyes. Very uncomfortable. That was the only downside of the hotel though.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed one night in June with my nephew. We needed an early check-in after a red-eye flight and the hotel could offer a room from 12 o'clock. There's also a direct train connection (Keisei Access) from Narita. I love Asakusa as a neighbourhood - laid back, easy to find awesome food, the temple, sky tree, so different from Shibuya. The hotel couldn't really be any better located, it's smack in the middle of Asakusa right across the street from the Temple gate and close to train and metro stations. There's also a good super market right next door, should you need one.Since breakfast is not included, you just might. Rooms are not big, but I guess normal in Tokyo standards. Everything was very clean and the service impeccable. Wifi worked just fine for web browsing.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: night view is very beautiful, the front lobby in the top of hotel is another experience, room security system is kindly friendly for hospice but the wifi stability is not good enough to transfer datas.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed at this hotel as the final one of my trip to Japan, which ended in Tokyo. We stayed here for three nights. The selling point was its great location, near a lively Asakusa area, which is the more cultural (and touristy) neighborhood of Tokyo. Also nice is that it is located near the Ginza and Asakusa subway lines, which will take you all the way to Shibuya, Shinjuku and also Narita airport if needed. We opted for the faster Narita express from Ueno, which is just a few stops from this location.The view of the hotel at the reception and also the roof terrace is amazing.The room was nice and clean, the beds are firm but comfortable. For Japanese standards the room is quite big. I did not hear any noise from other visitors of the hotel. After rearranging some of the furniture I had more than enough space to open up the suitcase. Especially the bathroom was really nice, with a separate walk/in shower. Furthermore, the staff at the hotel was very friendly, helpful and in good command of the English language. The internet at this hotel works just fine. Any reviewers which had not been able to get it to work, probably did not try their browser which takes you to the website with use policy that you have to accept. After this it worked perfectly, although at very busy hours it may reach the maximum number of devices allowed. This was no bother to me, as I usually used it late at night to upload my (gigabytes of) pictures.Overall I would highly recommend it and stay again whenever I return to Tokyo, even if it is not a low-priced hotel.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Rooms are nice and clean. Bed comfortable and free WiFi is offered. The restaurant is open 24-hours and there is also a roof top bar where you can enjoy views of the Skytree or any other attractions in Asakusa. The subway station is about a 5 minute walk away. Service is excellent. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as a stopover on the way to Australia and we were very pleased with our choice. As a brief introduction to Tokyo, the area around the hotel is fantastic with a huge selection of bars, restaurants, fast food joints, shopping opportunities, pachinko parlours and general Japanese city life on your doorstep. The hotel is spotlessly clean and very modern in design and the room we had was perfectly adequate for a short stay. The view from reception is hard to beat, especially at night and the 14th floor residents bar was anther highlight. All in all we had a fantastic stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.
user_name:
Tonydundee
Stoke sub Hamdon, United Kingdom

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: In addition to the very lovely room and friendly staff at réception, the location is great and the service in the restaurant is excellent. I was telling the restaurant manager how this expérience was nice. Not only for the good food but also because the différent members who served me were very friendly and welcoming. This kind and professionnel service can make your day. A great and positive stay!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We booked a last minute trip to Tokyo during cherry blossom season and were really worried by the limited availability of hotels.
