Thankfully The Gate Hotel was available and we were thrilled by it. From the moment you check in, the process is smooth and pleasing. The views from the reception are stunning. The rooms are surprisingly large for Tokyo and comfortably equipped. The breakfast was fresh and tasty and the views from the bar were breathtaking. We found the location good, although it is a short walk to the metro. In all, we were very happy with our stay here and will definitely try to stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel was a nice gem! We really enjoyed it. When making the reservation on Expedia I was promised a 3 person room, but when checking in they did not have it available and made me take two rooms, they gave me a single rate for one room which made it doable but that was a bummer. The hotel is literally near almost all the subway and train stations in Asakusa. It's such a great location, you can walk to food, tons of shopping and all the Asakusa sights. It's also easy to get to the Tokyo Skytree or any other place in Tokyo because of convenient access to trains. The hotel is modern and nicely decorated. I've been traveling for weeks in Asia for work and this hotel was good. We had a corner room which had a great view. The bathroom also is split in two so the shower and toilet area are somewhat separate and large. The staff was also very friendly and helpful with directions. There's also a rooftop bar with GREAT views of the Skytree Tower and this part of Tokyo. The hotel claimed free WiFi but we couldn't get any of our phones to connect even with the password. The LAN connection was what we used instead. Enjoy!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were in Tokyo 9 days and tried to stay in experience areas. This hotel is in a (super) great location on Asakusa dori across from the Kaminarimon Gate. Its about 4 blocks from the Asakusa station, and actually one block from one of the metro entries. Across the street is the Nakamise Arcade shopping areas with blocks of interesting shops and restaurants. The Shrine is immediately adjacent as is the Sumida River and its cruises. The Asakusa station can take you one stop to Skytree or the Metro (3 stops) to Ueno Station/Park (or anyplace). The hotel lobby sits next to the Oseki Supermarket and leads to the 13th floor lobby. The hotel is new, clean, modern average sized comfortable rooms. The lobby has a super view of the area and the cafe/bar is really a great spot for just relaxing! The staff was very helpful and friendly. Communication was no issue. Also great was that the Asakusa line went directly (45 minutes) to Haneda airport (I believe it was less than $10USD). Overall super location, nice accommodations, easy access to anywhere, great cafe/bar and great value!!! This is the place for Asakusa and maybe anywhere in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at The Gate. The location is excellent -- very close to the Senjo-ji temple and the metro. The room was good-sized and comfortable, the Western breakfast filling and, perhaps most important, the price remarkably affordable (for Tokyo). We stayed for five nights for a little more than ¥100,000, including breakfast. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. It was an Ok experience. My room style was a Essential Twin, which was smallish in size. But the room is well organised, everything had its space. The room was not specially clean. Everywhere dust and round corners! Breakfast was Ok.This hotel has a reservation department problem. I needed to extend my stay and was told that they were fully booked on the weekend. I asked if they could have a look out for us in case something gets available, but was told that they don't do that. Later I made a search on Booking.com and found a room!!! The room rates are very variable. Saturday night's rate was almost double of Sunday night's rate and then I was challenged if breakfast should be included or not by an other receptionist! Very confusing! On the whole I would return for its location but not for the service.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Loved this hotel especially the decor with the giant egg lights. Staff were really helpful and the room had a view of Tokyo Skytree. The room had all the amenities that I needed. Will stay again soon for sure.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I have visited Tokyo many times before and also stayed in Asakusa but this was our first stay at the Gate Hotel. Even though it was April and cherry blossom season with loads of tourists we still got two adjoining rooms for a very reasonable rate considering the time of year. It was a late booking on my behalf, and we had to switch rooms once but the staff were very helpful. The rooms were very nice and quite spacious, yes, it is a new hotel so that helps. The upstairs bar and view is great for an adult nightcap and the location in the older part of town was perfect for children (mine are 12 and 16) to have a wander around safely. Access to the rest of the city is quite easy on the subway. I would definitely stay there again either as a couple or as a family. We visited Disneyland, Harajuku, Shinjuku and other places with not a lot of hassle at all. It was always nice to come back to The Gate after a long day out!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel room is the biggest I have seen in Tokyo. The bathroom was not of those capsule size and there is actually space to open 2 luggage even with an extra bed in the room. Our room on the 12 floor has great view of the Skytree and the main gate to the Senso-ji. I would say the room was worth the price given that hotel rooms are actually not cheap in Tokyo. There is a supermarket next door to grab some snacks and drinks and the subway is just a short walk away. The tour guide recommended that we take a walk to Senso-ji at night when it is lighted up, but we were too tired to stay up after the long flight on the night before.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We loved the Gate Hotel. We just returned from a family trip to Tokyo and Kyoto (us plus our three 20-something kids). The hotel is in Asakusa, a wonderful older part of town. It is steps from a subway station that will get you to all other parts of Tokyo. It is across the street from Sensoji, the huge temple in Asakusa. The hotel is located in a modern building - take the elevator up to the lobby on the 15th floor with a beautiful view over Tokyo towards the Tokyo Skytree.The hotel staff is welcoming and helpful. They gave us suggestions on local ramen shops and happily lent us large umbrellas (5 of them) to counter the rain we had not anticipated.Our rooms were beautifully decorated, cool and spare with colorful, contemporary art highlights and comfortable. We got one room for all 3 kids (relatively inexpensive, tight but fine) and the Balcony Suite (so that everyone could have a place to hangout together). Beds were very comfortable.We ate at the restaurant for breakfast 2 mornings (the others we breakfasted at Tsukiji Market). Very nice small buffet (included orange juice squeezed in front of you) and honey dripping from a ~12"x 15" honeycomb. The french toast from the menu was particularly delicious.We will definitely return.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The room is considered to be of very decent size by Japan standard and the location is just super and there is a supermarket right next door to it - since the hotel doesn't even provide a kettle in the room (or at least I couldn't find one in my room), it's just great that you can grab some bottled water on the way back to hotel. I would have given them 5 star if not for the very poor service I received from the staff during my two night stay…First, I wanted to go to a nice teppanyaki restaurant in Ginza area, so I went to the staff to ask for recommendations. What did I get? "Oh, all the teppanyaki restaurants there are nice." and he didn't bothered to give me any recommendation at all!Next, I asked about transportation to the airport and I told the staff that I will be leaving tomorrow night. He gave me two options - to take a taxi somewhere (I can't remember the name of the two places now) for about 1,000yen and I can then take the airport limousine bus (I told him that because I have a very heavy luggage so I don't want to take the train). He said the whole journey takes less than an hour.When I checked out the next night at around 8.30pm (my flight was close to mid-night), I was shocked when the staff told me that the last airport limousine bus has already left at 8.30pm and the other will be leaving at 8.45pm! To make matter worst, this female staff (I didn't see her name) was extremely rude and unhelpful and she gave me that look like I was an idiot that I didn't know the timing of the last bus! She was hitting the keyboard so hard when I asked her to help me check on the timing for the train and she was also quite impatient when I confirmed with her again on the direction to go to the train station where there is an elevator. I must say she is the RUDEST hotel staff I have ever met.Since I told the first male staff the day before that I will be leaving at night, he could have at least asked me what time I was leaving or tell me about the timing for the last bus.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Good location, close to subway, restaurants and cafes. Shops and Culture all around. Nothing negative worth mentioning. Highly recommended. Temples on the doorstep.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is a great hotel for first trip to Japan. Stayed a total on 8 nights. Loved the first 6 nights, so re-booked on way back. Rooms clean and perfect size. Staff great. Breakfast with a view to die for.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My group is scheduled to visit Tokyo on 30 October 2014 and have reserved The Gate Hotel. We will be on a package tour and will be visiting Mt. Fuji, Tokyo Disneyland, Tokyo’s Akihabara Electric Town and other places. May I know if this hotel is one of the pick-up points for our tour?

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We started our 10 day Japan tour in Asakusa and were amazed by the hotel and the environment. perfect breakfast on the balcony, wonderful views, short stroll to tube, jogging along the river, were well located. We liked the service and the rooms as well with their nice views.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I enjoyed my stay here as I am a sucker for good views. I had a twin room on the 9th floor with a good view of the skytree and senso ji temple (as well as the asahi building with what is meant to be a horizontal golden flame but actually looks like a golden- something- your- dog- produces.....sorry).The views are even better from the 13 floor lobby and restaurant as well as the 14 floor residents only terrace.The room was nice with a kettle with tea and coffee. Bathroom had a nice view too. Decent amenities and good laundry service. The hotel also sorted out a baggage transfer to Hakone for me. I generally found the staff friendly, helpful and most could speak good English which helped me a lot - something that is not guaranteed even in top hotels in Japan. Sometimes service at the bar was a bit slow but that's a minor gripe.The restaurant was good - I had breakfast included and also had dinner one night. There are little or no Japanese options but if you are in need of a break from rice and miso soup, you'll be fine. Location was perfect for me. You can get 4 lines (subway and others) from 3 different asakusa stations. There are buses outside. The area itself is older and calmer than the likes of Shinjuku or Shibuya with lots of little local restaurants to try out. However if you need to escape and have a chai latte, I spotted 2 Starbucks within 4 minutes walk. A supermarket is in the same building and a convenience store is nearby. Shinjo ji temple is across the road and the skytree is handy too.It's not cheap but if you don't mind a splurge, then this is a good place to base yourself in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: japan is the best place on earth n gate hotel is finest hotel,breakfast is yummy,staff is wonderfullnice place,opposite there is a very good massage parlour,i m vegeterian so they cooked for me veg curry every da

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Actually this can be for vacation as well, hence the room was not so big, interior was comfort and modern feel, the bathroom was very good and surprisingly not so small. It's also good in location, metro station was nearby and also Kaminarimon just at the opposite. Of course anyhow cannot compare with the location such as Shinjuku or Ginza. By the way, they do very Egg Benedict breakfast.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Very helpful staff pre-arrival and other reviewers are right, a stunning reception. Close to the station, a supermarket right next door and plenty of places to eat across the road. I did stuff up the room and ended up with two king singles but they didn't seem to mind when we pushed them together to make a jumbo double! :-)Hard to fault the place.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I recently stayed here for 4 nights. The experience was perfect. Yes, I expected a single room to be small but it did have all the amenities. The location was excellent, close to Senso-ji temple and close to lots of restaurants and supermarkets. Aoi-Marushin is just across from the hotel and is an excellent place for tempura. The hotel is also close to Akasusa subway line and you can just take the train directly from/to the Haneda airport. My package included breakfast and I highly recommend it. They have freshly orange juice and egg benedict. The price I got from booking.com was very reasonable.Overall, the experience was wonderful and I would definitely come back again when I visit Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: If you like your hotels a la Mr & Mrs Smith style - small, boutique feel with quirky designer touches then this one is for you. The lobby on the 13th floor is beautiful with floor to ceiling views that look out over Tokyo but if that's not enough for you, the restaurant has an outdoor terrace and there's a roof terrace bar on the next floor. Rooms are small but comfortable, beds are wonderful, breakfast is good and location is excellent for a bit of olden days Tokyo with plenty of narrow lanes filled with locals socialising in buzzy bars and restaurants. A great alternative to the big brand name hotels in glitzy Shibuya and Shinjuku.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: May be it's not the most centered hotel, but it combines big enough rooms, friendly staff and it's 100 m. away from a 2 underground lines station, directly linked to the airports and to downtown as well. You reach in two stations the Yamanote line, and there the JR ring surrounding Tokyo. Price/quality ratio is OK. The only point to improve is breakfast variety, especially in fruits.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I used to stay at this hotel several nights last year and planned to stay there again for 10 nights this month b'cause the location is quite centralized. However, when I contacted them, they quoted me an extremely high rate for a very small room, and refused to offer me any special discount or complimentary upgrade despite the fact that I am a repeated guest and will stay for 10 consecutive nights. Now their rates are far too high compared to the size and quality of their rooms and they seem not to care for their repeated guests at all. I finally stayed there, pay at very high rates and got very small rooms. It's not good value for money anymore and I strongly do not recommend anybody to stay at this hotel if they are charging at the prices they are selling on their website now!!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed at The Gate Hotel for 4 nights....came out more than i expected! great location & great rooms! the view at the reception was superb!only not flexible with late checkout....overall ......... highly recommended !!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel was very swanky, after staying in ryokans and business hotels, this was very similar to hotels I find in NYC. The check in is on the 13th floor which is a perfect entrance so you can see the amazing view that is offered. Pros:1) All guests should make use of the outdoor roof deck, it is only accessible if you are a guest. Don’t worry if it there is a slight chill, they also provide heat lamps.2) The location of the hotel is perfect for the Sensoji Temple, souvenir shopping and delicious eats. There are plenty of booths for multiple flavors of soft serve ice cream, mochi, red bean filled pastries, fresh breads and other delicious bites. You can spend several hours just wandering the souvenir booths and eat your way through as well. 3) They have a Mister Donut near by, not sure if others are a big fan like me but those glazed little munchkin rings are the best. I bought half a dozen.Cons: 1) The hotel said it would only take 45 mins to the airport. It took well into an hour or hour and half. The directions weren’t as clear as they could have been, or there must’ve been a train delay because we were stuck on what seemed like a local train for the better part of the commute. It was so hot and crowded I almost felt faint. I would much rather of taken the shuttle bus options or a train from Tokyo. The hotel should provide a small card that guests can show when they reach the train station in order to be directed on the correct train. 2) The train station was close by walking wise, but carrying luggage through that train station as not fun. It is a few levels transfer, so if you can find an elevator, take it. 3) If you stay an time beyond checkout they charge you. But I think this may be standard in Japan.
user_name:
travelingbug95
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Found the girl that did our check-in (Yuki) extremely rude. Room is nice - hope things improve fromhere. Other than an unfortunate first imoression, the lobby is breathtaking and the room is extremely comfortable.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed for five nights in a Hollywood twin room (two king singles made up separately but pushed together.) The room was stylish and comfortable with some thoughtful touches such as both wooden and padded coat hangers and nifty 'freshly brewed' coffee bags. The bathroom was also a good size (for Japan) with a useful selection of amenities. Asakusa is a great area to stay in, plenty to see with a huge variety of restaurants, and the hotel is very close to the station and easy to find. We had breakfast included in our room rate and it was a real highlight every morning with exceptional service and a constant supply of fresh hand-squeezed orange juice. For a treat I would also recommend a drink in the guest bar one night, just add it to your room bill and you won't notice the cost!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We sadly left The Gate this morning where we have spent the last four nights. We were on the 12th floor and had amazing views over the city. Our room was spacious and immaculately clean. There was a fridge, kettle and coffee maker in our room.The staff were incredibly helpful and there was not a problem in transferring our luggage for us to Kyoto at a cost of approx £12.Breakfast was buffet style with a cooked choice of eggs Benedict or scrambled .The hotel is ideally placed for the metro station, a river cruise and a visit to the temple area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is the first time I felt compelled to submit a review. This is an amazing place in a great location especially for foreigners. It was also hard to find a place for more than 2 people, and we had our 10 year old. Their triple is an incredible value adding an American twin to their two larger twin beds. We could have potentially squeezed onto the two larger twins. You sacrifice room floor space for the extra bed though so that's why you could consider just the two oversized twins. The bathroom was big and very clean. The restaurant is open 24 hours which is particularly helpful for jet lagged travelers. Great location and views, and we got anywhere else we wanted with subway as well as to airport easily. Most of all, I have to thank the staff (thanks, Erika!) who found and mailed a well-loved stuffed animal to us with cute follow up emails and a final note in his package, "I'm home." How can you beat that service?

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The gate hotelFor many years I have stayed in Ginza and at a hotel I have fallen out of love with. The trouble with Tokyo is its so huge and slightly intimidating its tempting to just stay in the same place over and over because it's at least familiar and you know how to get from A to B - so booking this hotel was a risk. The area is actually fantastic. Its full of authentic restaurants and bars and the hotel is almost opposite one of the main tourist attractions in Tokyo. The Kaminarimon Gate and Senso-ji temple. This does mean it also has a mix of touristy places but it's all fun, fab, interesting things that make you smile. The hotel itself is new, has a slightly incongruous entrance on the ground floor with a lift that takes you to the 10th floor to check in. The lobby has a mouth droppingly awesome view. If you can get over the impressive chandelier in the lobby itself you have an uninterrupted view of the Sky Tree tower and the Asahi HQ. Look the other way and you get a birds eye view of the nearby temples. Next to the reception desk (which is superbly staffed by lovely people with excellent English) is a restaurant/bar where breakfast, lunch and dinner is available plus 24hr food should you need it. There is also an outside terrace with tables for the summer. Head up a few more floors and there's a small but perfect bar with the same amazing views but only space for about 10 at the bar. You feel like you're in a New York speakeasy but it annoyingly closes at midnight. Outside is an even large terrace with chairs for the summer months. The rooms themselves are also really spacious, modern, non smoky and with huge bathrooms. I had a bath tub and a walk in shower separate to my toilet and sink. All of this is very unusual for Japanese hotels. I can't recommend this hotel enough. The staff really were fabulous with a. Few annoying issue I had outside of the hotel. I have a new very favourite hotel in Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate is one of the best hotels we have stayed because of the staff. The staff at the Gate are amazing nothing is to much trouble. Stunning scenery from reception, bar and room. Will stay there again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is located 5 mins walk from Asakusa station and right in front of tourist attraction Sensoji Shrine. The view at hotel lobby was fantastic a bird eye view of the city and tokyo sky tree. Staff speaks English which is harder to find in Japan's hotel. This is a new hotel with modern design. The room are big if compare to other hotel in Japan.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Having just arrived in a very snowy Tokyo, it was a very warm welcome we received on the 13th floor at Reception at The Gate Hotel, and offering us our first stunning view of the city.Our check in was efficient, courteous and all completed very speedily and in a short time we were making our way down to our room on the 10th floor, which was spotless. Complimentary nightwear was placed on our beds and bathrobes and slippers were placed in the bathroom,with all the usual free facilities. This is a stylish boutique hotel, with an excellent restaurant and bar,and also a roof top bar for that night cap sampling the Japanese whiskey!Having spent our first 3 nights, we were then continuing our holiday to Kyoto and beyond, returning to The Gate for our final night 5 days later. The hotel kindly looked after our suitcases as we were travelling with holdalls, and on return our cases were already waiting in our room, and when went down to the restaurant and bar later that evening, Yuta Hahami, Assistant Manager, welcomed us back and even remembered we had been to Kyoto!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights and have no complaints. My room was well appointed, modern, clean and spacious. The location was excellent - two minutes walk from the nearest metro station and right by Tokyo's biggest and best temple. The hotel is great value for money and I would stay again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The Gate Hotel Asakusa is in a delightful Tokyo neighborhood. It's convenient and easy to reach (one block from Asakusa Station on the Asakusa line and Ginza Subway lines) .Proximity to the Sensoji Temple was great and otherwise the locality was a relatively peaceful residential area. At the same time restaurants and cafes were plentiful to your left and right. And I loved the bar on the roof of the hotel with views of the Temple, the Skytree and a wide swathe of the local area.The hotel staff are friendly, speak english and are very helpful.Another feature shared by every hotel we saw in Japan was the excellent bathroom facilities. They feature a deep and wide hip bath and shower in a wet room and the usual very fancy toilet with all the whistles and spray features you could want!Finally a good tip is to make this your exiting Tokyo from Narita Airport hotel as we did. It is a five minute walk from the hotel to the elevator entrance that leads almost directly to the Asakusa platform where the Keisei line Narita Express trains goes to the airport in 50 minutes (beware not during peak hour!!) for one third the price of the Limousine Bus (¥1200). Ask about this a couple of doors away at the Asakusa Cultural Information Centre opposite the Sensoji Gate.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is right opposite to the Asakusa Kaminarimon, and 3 minutes' walk from Asakusa station for Asakusa line and Ginza line. It's easy to go to city center, and also to the Narita Airport as Asakusa line sometimes have express line direct to the airport. Around the hotel, there are many small Japanese restaurants and shops. The Asakusa cultural and information center is also just 2 minutes' walk, so if you have any question, just go there.We stayed 1 night at Scenic room and 2 nights at Essential, the later is cheaper and of better value. The terrace view from this hotel is definitely a highlight, and there's a mini bar on the terrace too where you may enjoy a sip with the breathtaking view in the front

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Asakusa Station on the Ginza line. From Haneda Airport, take the Keikyu Line to Asakusa Station; you will not even need to change trains (no stress for non-Japanese speakers). The easy access to the Ginza and Asakusa metro lines makes it simple for tourists to get around the city. Senso-ji Temple is right across the street and is even busy at night, which makes the area feel quite safe. For little souvenirs to bring back to friends, this is what I consider the jackpot of Tokyo. In the same block is a Starbucks and a grocery store.View: The rooftop terrace overlooks Tokyo and Tokyo Skytree. With blankets and heaters, it’s even pleasant during the cooler months. Room: The amenities include: blow dryer, headband, toothbrush, comb, pajamas, facial wash, razor, and an in-room thermostat. On the 5th floor, I found the room to be silent at night. English Speakers: Even though the staff is extraordinarily pleasant during check-in, check-out, and an explanation of what the hotel has to offer, I would not recommend asking for general tourist information. You might get sent off on an unexpected adventure. On my next trip to Tokyo, I will make every effort to stay here again.
user_name:
Colorado_Traveler_98
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I've just spent 9 nights in this hotel. It is very luxuous and confortable. People are extremely kind.Fantastic view on the town and Fuji from the restaurant and the upper terrasse.Very good location near temples, shops, restaurant and station.And all this for a very reasonnable price.I can just recommend it.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Based on the review and the Skytree, we decided to stay at this hotel during the new year season. The view was awersome as expected....very close to the skytree area which had a great mall. Located almost opposite to the temple, it was so close to many tiny food stalls and snack places and restaurants. The location is good if you just travel to close neighbourhood. We found that it is quite far if you need to travel to areas like Shinjuku or Sibuya etc (over 40 mins ride). In terms of the room, I was a little bit disappointed....probably because I had a high expectation as a design hotel. There is honestly not really designer decor except the "egg" (you will know what I mean when you stay there). Not much details put into the "design" of the room. The quality of the amenities in room was just so so. Even the furniture was not really high quality. And also the hotel has no other facilities such as gym, spa etc. But overall the stay was very comfortable. Staffs were very helpful and nice. Service was great. So if you are not a design junkie like me, then you will find this hotel perfect.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We had a double room, 10th floor. The room was big enough, very clean as well as the bathroom. The breakfast was very good, not an huge variation, but tasty and you can order an espresso or a cappuccino made perfect. Many restaurants just next to the Hotel, as well as a 24 hrs open Sushi restaurant. The Tokyo Metro is just a few meters away. We enjoyed our stay in the Hotel and would go back there.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights. Very well located in Asakusa, the rooms are clean and very large, even for western standards. Fantastic view on the upper floors. Bed was confortable, bathroom was neat and clean, with separate wc. One english speaking channel on tv.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Location of this hotel is really great !!! it's right in Asakusa and the view is impeccable!!! you can see the tokyo sky tree right in the comfort of your room and at night, the view is beautiful,,, don't miss the roof deck of the hotel as the view from the top is even more captivating,staff are great and speaks english.dining outside the hotel is better as many ramen shops are just located either in front or on he sides of the hotel... if ever you are in Asakusa, try out the Gate Hotel.. it's the perfect choice !!!

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Fabulous location - lots going on outside. Rooms are good - I had a small one but just fine for me alone. Bed was comfy. Housekeepers were very good. Don't eat here though, Breakfast is a mad assemble of partially continental and dinner - there were roast potatoes and pasta! And the bread isn't toasted - which seemed to cause huge confusion (there's a Starbucks next door). Had dinner one night - it was bland & tasteless. Had to go to the supermarket next door to get ice-cream to make life a bit more exciting. It was a silly mistake there are loads of good restaurants right outside - I was on my own and thought this would be easier.Go up to the terrace for the views - and go on the smokers deck - you can see Mount Fuji.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This was our final hotel in our 10 day travel around Tokyo and Kawaguchiko. I think this was the best of the 3 hotels.Space utilisation is very good. We had 3 very comfortable beds in the room and one cannot complain about the location. 3 minutes from the Ginza line and the Sensoji temple entrance.If I want to stay in Asakusa I will seriously consider staying here.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed in The Gate Hotel from 1-5th Dec 2013, love the conveniences, and wonderful view from the our room (Tokyo Sky Tree view). I'd left my Camera charger in the room after check out. I wrote an email to the hotel after home. They replied me within 2 hours, and help me to Sent my charger back to Kuala Lumpur. I was really impressed by the services offered by The Gate Hotel, and would like to recommended this hotel to every traveler to Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: One of the latest hotels to dot the Tokyo skyline, The Gate Hotel is brand new and possesses all the trappings of a modern hotel. Location is another advantage with this hotel as it is close to Asakusa station. Likewise, the Kaminari-mon Gate, Hanayashiki Theme Park and Senso-ji Temple are close by. Other centers are easily reached by a short subway ride. If you get a good room, you could sight the Tokyo Ski Tree. The bar and restaurant is styled on French Cuisine. You can opt for the breakfast plan to partake of the sumptuous western breakfast buffet. Service is great and staff courteous. If you want to dine at the hotel I recommend a reservation early to get a good table on the terrace.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Modern and stylish hotel. Lobby located at the 13th floor just below the rooftop which has a nice terrace overlooking the area (notably the Sky Tree Tower) and a cozy bar for guests hotel only.Rooms are neat, clean and well maintained. We stayed in the Style S Scenic twin room at 10th floor which had a good view. Very decent size, corner with coffee table and 2 comfortable chairs. Bathroom equipped with little shower and bathtub. Nice and helpful staff (not all English fluent, surprising for such type of hotel but well not really a problem). Do not forget to ask for the wifi password as you will not find it written in the room (don't know why) and receptionist forgot to give it to us.Hotel is well located near metro stations with express train to/from the airport. You can also find all the souvenirs you need in this area (at the market next to the hotel or in the many small streets around) such as Japanese knifes, kimonos, tea pots... Walking distance to the Sky Tree Tower.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The modest room was big enough. I love the location. I booked the hotel direct from website and got a reasonable rate. Using the ginza line n asakusa line is convenient. The environment cannot b safer. Lots of food nearby too. I travelled out of tokyo after I checked out but the hotel agreed to keep luggage for me because I will return to Tokyo. The frontdesk service was great. The room was clean and modern and everything works well. I will want to stay here again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I just want to confirm all the previous positive comments on this hôtel. Great location especially for eating, many local restaurants with the traditionnel japanese atmosphere, home cooking style etc... as opposed to the more modern Tokyo building style restaurants. Do note that restaurants close early, last seating sometime 8:30 pm. This can be surprising for européens who eat late. The only thing that surprised me in négative way about this hotel is how small the room feels, the announced 24sqm for the standard room and 32sqm for the scenic room seems exagerated. I was in tokyo for 8 days for business and picked this hotel because of the seemingly bigger room size in its price category compared to other hotel. I could not work confortably at all in the room and had to go to lobby to work. Also, the closet was really tiny! The staff was Nice and professionnal but i would not say overly friendly or went out of their way, maybe because of language barrier. During my 8 days stay, not once was i asked How is everything? Good wifi all over, great shower. I just regret no good functioning work Space and smaller than expected room. But to end on postive note, very good hotel for wonderful asakusa area.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Stayed at this hotel while on a small group tour with Inside Japan Tours. The rooms are very comfortable with a great view of the Skytree and a short walk to the Gate and Tourist office. They aren't large rooms but perfect for tourists. Big tub and shower, with a nice bathroom. Breakfast was included and very good with a number of local and western choices. Starbucks right next door as is a 7-11. Easy to walk to shopping or station to grab a train.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: stylish new hotel ,100 metres from the Kaminarimon gate . Loads of restaurants in the area to suit any taste or budget if you dont fancy hotel offering.Loved the live jazz in the bar - champagne around £10 a glass , beer £5 and views from the guests only top floor balcony are stunning especially at night.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I was told by someone who lives in Asakusa that this hotel is one of the newest hotels (maybe the newest hotel in the area). The hotel is quite stylish from walking in off the street level with the water-lights in the ceiling. The lobby and check-in are on the top floor and the staff are very helpful, and they make a good effort to speak English. The elevator has room-key security so people coming in off the street cannot go to the room floors, only the lobby or the ground floor.I booked the room with Agoda.com and got a reduced rate for the modest size room. The room is small, but not small for Tokyo. It did not come with a bath, only a shower. The room was in perfect condition, very well cleaned and maintained. There were absolutely no issues with the room.The wireless internet worked without any problems at all and was encrypted. The password was provided by the front desk.I went to the bar one night as well and the view is quite nice. The staff at the bar are excellent. It was obvious to me that they work very hard to take care of their guests.The breakfast was really great. I had the eggs Benedict and it was delicious. It has been a long time since I had this dish, and I have never had it in Japan. They cooked it very well and the sauce was quite exceptional. I was very impressed actually with the quality of the food. The vegetables and fruit in the buffet in the morning were advertised organic, farm to table, produce. They squeezed the orange juice right at the buffet table as well, though, this makes it a bit strong.Finally, check-out was great because there was no need to go to the lobby on the top floor. Just call and let them know you are leaving, put the key on the desk, and leave.Overall, this was an amazing stay. I was really impressed with the quality here and would recommend it to everyone. I loved the rate I got, and that is part of the reason I loved it so much. For the price I paid, the quality doesn't compare.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is the first time I ever write a review of something. I hope this helps whoever in need of a perfect stay.I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend on her birthday, and the service was the best both of us have ever had. The staffs were eager to support my secret plan to surprise my partner, and indeed, they successfully satisfied even more than what I had asked for. We could experience one of the most unforgettable moments in our lives, and nobody else could have ever been more helpful. The room we stayed was also very clean and spacious, and we could see the whole Asakusa area, including the famous Tokyo Skytree, from our bedroom. If you're seeking for a clean, stylish, mid-priced hotel around Asakusa, I strongly recommend you staying here. You're a couple? Then there possibly is no better choice.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Literally 1 minute walk from the station. Our room (and bathroom) had views of Kaminarimon and Tokyo Sky Tree. Reception floor and outdoor balcony also have great views. Healthy breakfast buffet was healthy, but not extensive.Modern, clean design. Expected the rooms to be smaller but they were surprisingly spacious.Nice choice if you want to explore this part of Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is situated just right in front of the gate to Sensoji temple in Asakusa. It is in the heart of the Asakusa area but the hotel is still very private and quiet. Hotel is new and deco is very chic. Staff was super helpful and nice. I couldn't work out the air-conditioning system because the instructions are in Japanese. The staff came into my room and managed the aircon for me plus translated the instructions on the remote control into English for reference! I would definitely stay in this hotel again when I am in the area next time.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Breathtaking city views, clean and upscale rooms with attention to all details taken care of (toiletries, slippers, pajamas) and amazing service from all staff!Well priced, you get much more value than what you pay for! Great location too, a short walk from temples and marketplace!
user_name:
Philippe T
Los Angeles, California, Usa

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. This hotel only opened in Apr 2011 so the room is still new and fresh. The size of the room is also bigger than the average Tokyo hotel room. Mini bar, sitting area, separated bathroom and toilet, and you can actually see the Kaminarimon gate from here.The building itself was not that outstanding and the reception is at the 3rd floor. If you can't find it (although its just 5-10 mins walk from the station), just pop in the information centre right in front the Kaminarimon gate, the staff there will kindly give you the direction. It was next to a small supermarket. There are also plenty of restaurants around open till late. If you want to feel the Edo era of Japan, please stay here. Sensoji (built in the 7th century, is very popular even for Japanese) is right inside the famous Nakamise Shopping Street. You are not allow to smoke or having hot drink while you are walking on the street.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Good service and very good location. Asakusa is only a minute walk and many stations/lines that will let you get around Tokyo easily. The hotel put its front desk on the highest floor - a splendid idea, allowing every guest to enjoy great view. Then, it also has an upper floor (outdoor) to take in the sights.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I had a really nice experience when staying in The Gate Hotel. The staff in friendly and helpful, environment in it is really comfortable. A nice view in lobby and location is convenient. Will definitely visit again

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I stayed at The Gate Hotel with a friend. The location was very convenient, close to Asakusa subway station, very close to Sensoji Temple (you can see it from the hotel too, it's great that it's so close because it's so pretty at night when there's no one around!), as well as Skytree (just a few stations away). The view from the top is absolutely amazing too. The rooms were quite spacious, compared to a few other hotels I've stayed at in Tokyo. There's also wi-fi in my room which is very convenient since finding wi-fi in Japan can be a task sometimes. The staff was also very nice. I had to reserve a space on the night bus but I wasn't feeling too confident about my Japanese, so the front desk staff helped me do it! The breakfast was also very delicious, it was a great way to start the day off.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: The hotel is excellent. No real faults, clean, tidy, well designed and friendly welcoming staff and a great breakfast. The only downside is location. We previously stayed in Shibuya which is much better connected by train and subway, whereas being at the end of the Ginza subway and a walk to a JR station means those with a JR pass will find it awkward to travel away from Asakusa.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: Modern hotel, conveniently located near Asakusa line (tip: take the Kaminarimon Exit from Asakusa or you'll end up climbing a bunch of stairs from a different exit and walk further to the hotel which is exactly what we did by mistake the first time we got to the station!); walking distance to Sensoji Temple and with a convenient supermarket on the ground floor with fresh produce (plump grapes, juicy Fuji apples, etc). Room: We stayed in the Double Essential Room which was very comfortable for 2 by Japan standards; loved the rain shower especially after a long and hot day of walking around Japan. Location: Great if you're planning to visit the northern bit of Tokyo - Tokyo Sky Tree, Ueno and Akihabara are all a few short stops away. Might be a bit trickier if you wanted to spend most of your time in Shinjuku / Shibuya and Harajuku though but I switched hotels by that part of my trip. There's also plenty of food options within a 5-10 minute walk around the area - sushi, ramen and even fast food options for those craving something more familiar - though most Japanese restaurants seem to close at around 9PM on a weekday. Staff service / English language: Staff was very accommodating and patient, though communicating in English was at times a bit difficult and required repetition and written instructions. Was a bit disappointed when one staff advised that there was no Hakone cable car when I later found out from Odakyu travel centre that there indeed was such a service...Improvements: 1) Staff could be better trained at providing travel advice to tourists... 2) Would be great if the hotel could provide bottled water in the room, particularly as it was the absolute height of summer when we visited...

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We recently stayed at the Gate Hotel in Tokyo. The location close to the Tokyo Skytree. The location close to two subway stations, grocery stores and Starbucks is a big plus. The rooms are small by American standards but, we have to remember this is Tokyo.When we had problems with our assigned room, the Reception personnel were not able to help and we requested to see the manager. Yoshio (spelling?), the manager was very courteous and efficient. He was able to solve our issues with aplomb. The restaurant is small but breakfast served was decent.We have no complaints re this hotel and will stay at this place again next time we visit Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: There is direct train service from the Haneda airport and the station is short walk to the hotel and famed Sensoji Temple. The are many restaurants and stores nearby. The hotel is new and rooms are comfortable. The in-room WIFI works really well. It will be really ideal if more variety of food can be offered at breakfast.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed in the Gate for two nights in July 2013 as part of a longer trip.We were impressed by the styling and the service, though it doesn't offer a full range of services (no room service, for instance).Staff were efficient and happy to help us organise restaurant and bar bookings.We would stay at the Gate again.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My wife and I stayed at The Gate Hotel on our recent trip to Tokyo and were amazed by the excellent service at the hotel. The hotel staff helped us find our way around the city and even upgraded us to a beautiful suite in honor of our recent wedding! The room was stunning! The restaurant and rooftop at The Gate are both amazing and it's very well located. We had a great time here.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel is very fresh and new! the rooms are larger than anticipated and very comfortable. The Staff is excellent! Restaurant is very good quality and open 24 hours albeit with a somewhat limited range. However, you can walk to many food options and Asakusa station just 2 blocks away. Breakfast on the 13th floor outside deck was a treat. The lobby is also on 13 with a nice lounge area and excellent views.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This hotel opened last year and everything is first class. A shower to die for,a very comfortable bed,a large room and a host of electrical outlets for all my chargers. The service staff was very friendly; we had one problem with the TV (CNN with Japanese voice over) and it was fixed quickly. The hotel is located in one of the oldest section of Edo a fair distance from the city center but there is an underground station a few blocks away. There are a number of good restaurants across the street from the hotel and a well stocked grocery store next door. One half mile away is a street with a wide selection of kitchenware stores.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We were pleasantly surprised with the level of service at the Gate Hotel Kaminarimon. The staff is very friendly and the level of service is great. The hotel is located in Asakusa district, close to many sights, like Kaminarimon, SkyTree, etc. The hotel is just 3 minutes walk from the metro station " Asakusa" which is on a Ginza line which makes it very easy and convenient to navigate in the city. There are a lot of restaurants around and by the Gate there is a souvenir market.Now more about hotel. The rooms are great and they have a modern design. The bathroom is great. The lobby of the hotel is fantastic ,it's located on the top floor and offers a great skyline view on Tokyo. The restaurant is also good, they have a very good breakfast. Myabe it's not the breakfast we are used to, but everything is extremely deliciouse, so tht's great start of the day to have a breakfast on a top of the hotel and enjoy the panoramic view. The restaurnat is perfect for dinner as well, and they have a great life music ( don't worry, just piano and a singer).We were extremely pleased with the Gate Hotel nd will definetely recommend it to both business travellers and tourists.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This is an excellent hotel, one of the best in Tokyo. Great location, close to Asakusa Subway, train station from Haneda Airport, and Tobu Train Station. Next to convenient stores, Starbucks, shopping streets, souvenir shops and many famous restaurants. Opposite Asakusa Temple and Sensoji Temple, Room size is very large compared to the average Japanese guest rooms. I stayed in the Scenic Room (no 904), marvellous view, very spacious, very well-equipped, and comfortable indeed! Staff are very friendly, service-minded, and helpful, esp at the front desk. I would like to highly recommend this hotel to all travelers and will definitely stay there again whenever I go back to Tokyo.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel just across the road from the Thunder Gate. The service is excellent and the breakfast very good. The hotel has an amazing roof terrace with outdoor heaters and a small bar. This is only open to hotel residents so doesn't get too crowded. if it is chilly the staff provide blankets to keep you warm whilst you admire the view of the Skytree.In a vibrant area of Tokyo with lots of interesting shops and restaurants. Also very convenient for the metro and river cruises. The rooms are slightly small with very little space between the end of the bed and the wall. However the bathroom was excellent and had a bath with a view.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: This a great hotel. The rooms have a nice decor. My favorite part was the rain shower head. The people at the front desk are really helpful. There's a convenient grocery store on the first floor and a 7/11 just one block away. The subway is also just one block away. Great location and great view from the lobby and rooftop bar!
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Ayesha H
New York, New York, United States

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: the gate hotel was brand new, very comfortable and pleasant. the room and bathroom had a great layout. the breakfast was good and abundant and the servers were very coordial. the location is easy in relation to the subway -across the street and at the end of the ginza line. there is plenty to see, eat and explore within walking distance too.
user_name:
Galia-14
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My family and I just returned from a one week stay at the Gate. This is a terrific new hotel with a helpful english-speaking manager, a beautiful rooftop lobby, terrace and restaurant, and a nice staff. The location is perfect, in historic Asakusa, with excellent restaurants and shopping, and transit close by. Highly recommended...
user_name:
mandv10011
New York City, New York

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Gate Hotel Kaminarimon for one night, and we were both very impressed with the room, the amenities, the service, the food, and the amazing views.This hotel seems to have been built and designed by people who care about what they are doing. Everything has thought behind it, from the 13th-floor lobby with floor-to-ceiling windows showing off Asakusa and Skytree, to the magnificent "rain dance" shower.I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Tokyo for business or pleasure, and I recommend the bar/restaurant for anyone wanting a great backdrop for a date or special occasion. My girlfriend loved the creme brulee, and she can be a bit of a dessert-snob if things are not done right.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: There's something very wonderful and unique about the Gate Hotel. My experience started with the friendly and professional reception at the front desk upon arrival after a long overseas trip. The Balcony Suite is well-appponted with many amenities and extras. The service is the among the best I have ever experienced. I had several special requests including an extra desk chair, luggage rack and clothes rack, and within minutes this was taken care of.... with a smile. I was asked what time I would like Housekeeping to clean the room, and they come each day precisely at that time. Someone really thought about how to offer a traveler an excellent hotel experience, and the Gate Hotel absolutely does, right down to every little detail. it's convenient to shops, restaurants, rail stations, grocery stores and a Starbucks. I wish every hotel was half this good.

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I'm not a person of many words but let me just say that my stay at this particular hotel was in a word MAGNIFICENT! The rooms are clean spacious and comfortable. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable & courteous even in the face of grand misunderstandings ::)The food in the 13th floor restaurant is amazing as is the service. The Bar; Legendary! (there are TWO!)There is a grand view from the hotel lobby strangely located on the top floor and one of the biggest treats is the roof top lounge (which I'll leave as a surprise to future guests!)If you visit Asakusa, Japan stay at THE GATE HOTEL KAMINARIMON by HULIC, period.I will miss my friends on the staff:(

hotel_name: THE GATE HOTEL Asakusa Kaminarimon by HULIC
review_body: I come to Tokyo for biz trip every other month, and I tried this new hotel for change. I just love it. There was nothing like this hotel in Tokyo (as far as I know). The best thing about this hotel is that the restaurant on 13th floor is open for 24 hours for the staying guests. The restaurant can serve anything on the menue!!!! I don't have to walk around for mid night snack.　　The room was well designed and sexy but at the same time very comfortable. Location is very convenient for people who uses Asakusa line. I could stay here for leisure since this is right in front of Asakusa temple and Sky Tree. I totally recommend this place for everyone who visit Tokyo.
